title: Excellent hotel--well-appointed, comfortable, quiet, and great location!
text: Our stay was excellent!  We're already planning a return trip to NYC and to stay at The Gotham.  The Hotel is clean, nicely appointed, with spacious, comfortable rooms, a lovely restaurant/bar, and very nice and helpful staff (special thanks to Ilda for your kindness and help).  And the hotel and room was quiet, which was so nice after a long day out and about in the City.  Lastly, location, location, location--can't beat the location for access to restaurants, shopping and the theater.

title: Great place for a long term stay with an amazing staff.
text:
stayed here for a week on business and it felt like a home away from home. the room was super comfy, the shower had both a rain shower head and a hand held sprayer, and the staff was amazingly accommodating. 

I was helped by Farzana, Surban and Ilda multiple times, and they were always incredibly friendly and helpful, never making me feel like my requests were too big or troublesome. They even went the extra mile and arranged to have a fan sent to my room for extra white noise! Every single person I interacted with was great. 

The hotel was also smaller, with I think only 3/4 rooms per floor making it feel more intimate and private. 

Definitely recommend for a long term NYC stay! I’ll miss the staff at Gotham Hotel!

title: Great hotel
text:
Hotel very well located. We were upgraded for our anniversary, the room was spacious and very clean.
A big thank you to the entire receptionist team, always ready to help..ENA, Hilda and all the others👍

title: Excellent service from Ena and Ilda
text: great service ! Ena and Ilda were excellent and nothing was too much trouble. Thanks to you both. Excellent location, large rooms for NY and nice balconies usable by all guests. There is a restaurant too and the breakfast is great. if they could improve one thing it would be a bigger more comfortable chair and larger desk in the room. Overall, an excellent boutique hotel.

title: Boutique Hotel - Manhattan - Amazing !!
text:
I stayed at the Gotham for 4 days and it was excellent.
The location is incredible, in that you are walking distance to Park Ave, Bryant Park, Times Square, Grand Central, yet the hotel is in a quiet street - you don't hear the hustle/bustle of NYC.
Rooms - extremely large, and not just for NYC standards = my room had a large balcony which was great in the evening/morning.  Coffee/tea and mini bar, fridge in the room, sitting area and desk area!  Very safe, very clean, great service. Special thanks to Ilda, Ena and Dante. Very attentive and helpful. Great boutique hotel. I definitely will return to the Gotham.

title: A jewel in east 46th street
text: Loved the room, the service, the staff and the location.  Ilda welcomed us warmly and everything fell into place. The room was thoughtfully appointed and very comfortable. Our private balcony was charming and room light filled with a very comfortable bed and pillows. The location is beautifully central to shopping and culture. The staff so welcoming and helpful. Ilda set the tone. We will definitely return!

title: Great hotel even better staff!
text: The staff was amazing and very friendly! We stayed in the Midtown king rooms which were very spacious and relaxing. ILDA, Nick  and Ena were such a help and made us feel welcome. Also convenient walking distance from Times Square, Rockefeller center and Empire Stare building. Great food and bars nearby as well. We will definitely be back.

title: Incredible New York
text:
Just an honest review of the hotel, we are still here when writing this and are due to check out in the next 5 hours.
Overall it was a great find and fantastic value for money, we paid around £700 for 4 nights.
So many positives to this place with the main one being the location! Times Square, Summit one, Central Park, rockafella centre, broadway to name a few that are right on your doorstep! 
The staff are so friendly too! Had a problem with the safe and within a couple of mins a guy was up to fix, that is what you want!
Room itself was very spacious, very comfy bed and pillows were really really good!
Shower was the best I have ever experienced in a hotel bar none! 
Had a small wardrobe with only 5 hangers but I’m sure the hotel would have provided more if required.
Tiny balcony but enough to see times square in the distance!
Importantly there is no ‘resort fee’ which apparently is a thing here in nyc, where you can get stung once arriving! We paid a deposit of 100 dollars on arrival to be returned once the room is checked..
Gym not on site but a five minute walk to New York sports club where you can work out for free as a guest of Gotham.
Another nice little extra was you get a room credit of 40 dollars for the drinks and snacks left in your room/fridge for you to enjoy, anything over 40 dollars you eat/drink you are charged for..
Cleanliness was great and house keeping was spot on!
Restaurant/bar downstairs I cannot review as we didn’t use this.
Some small negatives, no main light in the room meaning it was a little dark( had lots of lamps in room instead) plug sockets were flimsy and phone charger kept popping out whilst charging which was annoying, also bedside sockets are inside the cabinet making it hard to get too which was a little strange, these need moving, the heater isn’t great, and there are no instructions on how to use this in the room, it looks straightforward and I had it on max heat it was just about warm enough although it should have been roasting on 88f, first couple of nights it was really cold!
Unfortunately it was quite noisy outside which is beyond the hotels control, first night roadworks all the way up to around 4am! There was also for the first 3 nights another loud noise outside which we couldn’t figure out what it was which went on all night, even with windows closed was fairly loud, however as you do a lot of walking in nyc once your head hits the pillow you kind of don’t notice because you are tired! 
overall would totally recommend this place to stay and would definitely come back if I was to visit again, thanks guys and girls great job!

title: Great location.  Big rooms
text: The Gotham hotel is in a great location. It is .5 miles from time square and has nice big, remodeled rooms with an excellent restaurant downstairs. I loved the coffee shop and food and snack store next door. There is also access to a nice big gym just down the road so you can get a great workout in

title: THE Best!
text: I absolute love this Hotel and will be back many more times! Amazing location and wonderful staff- seriously friendly and warm welcoming from the front desk staff- Ilda at the front desk is the best!  I’m already looking forward to returning! ❤️❤️❤️

title: Hidden Gem in Midtown Manhattan - outstanding!
text: For my frequent visits to NYC for business and pleasure, The Gotham Hotel NYC is my main stay location and highly recommended. I've stayed in many different rooms on several floors. Hotel has great location, perfectly outfitted, exceptionally clean and modern, and a very friendly helpful staff. I recently stayed on the full-floor Gotham Suite, which takes up the entire 25th floor, with private elevator lobby, and two private balconies. This is easily the finest hotel room in Midtown! Well worth the added cost. That said, every room I've stayed in was super nice. I especially like to wood floors in each room, and full room amenities. Treat yourself to room service from The Reading Room in-room dining, makes breakfast especially nice and it's a great value.

title: Super comfy, great location & ideal for couples visiting friends & family in NYC
text: Excellent stay, super comfy rooms and a convenient location within walking distance of Times Square but far enough from the hustle and brightness of it all. Super friendly staff, fabulous rooms, nice bathrooms and a cute little balcony to go with it.... thank you to Ena Besnik & team :)

title: You have found your ideal NYC hotel
text: The NICEST people in the planet. Location is PERFECTION. And the rooms were ideal for a quiet night in. I love EVERYTHING about this hotel. Stop looking and boom. I broke a wine glass late in the evening. The sweetest gentleman was in my room within minutes to clean it up. I offered to do it for him (I broke the glass), but he insisted. Everyone we encountered went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed.

title: Excellent
text:
Excellent hotel.
Our very special stay was made perfect by Ilda & Alex, the upgrade to a suite was amazing. 
Friendly staff, excellent location & a beautiful room. Absolutely fabulous stay with no flaws at all. Thank you all, it made us very happy 😊

title: Conveniently Located in Manhattan
text: Conveniently located.  Good sized rooms.  Tight spaces, including reception, but overall normal for Manhattan.  Friendly desk service.  No room service. Food products in room pricey and limited so getting a meal limited to restaurant downstairs.  Good breakfast at the restaurant but separately paid.

title: Marisa is the best!
text: So…. last minute booking. I made it bc I stayed here a year ago with family. This time I brought my fiancé, we needed a place in the city for the remainder of the week. MARISA, is amazing, she made me feel comfortable and reassured. I didn’t know what our plans were, this trip was very impromptu but it all fell into place and Marisa made it all happen. Our room was comfy and clean and spacious, great pricing for the location, pls go to the bar when you have a chance, the door guys are welcoming, it’s a cute spot! Please you are doing yourself a favor by staying in this hotel! Great views too

title: Unforgettable
text:
Vacanza meravigliosa grazie anche al Gotham Hotel e al suo staff meraviglioso.
Stanza spettacolare di dimensioni enormi (cosa rarissima per NY) con anche un balconcino che nonostante le fredde temperature mi ha permesso di fumare qualche piacevole sigaretta!
Macchina Nespresso Vertuo ed ottima selezione al minibar e a sorpresa al momento del check-in ci hanno comunicato che avevamo un credito di $60 da spendere!
Colazione molto buona e molto carina la location.
Posizione dell' hotel fantastica (tra la 5th e la 46)
Tutto il personale molto gentile, dal primo all'ultimo ma un ringraziamento particolare va a Adel, Marisa e Brandon, veramente fantastici!
Un grande abbraccio e speriamo di rivederci presto!

title: Comfort, convenience and great location- wonderful staff!! Ena, Ilda and Marissa were great.
text: The most comfortable bed and pillows we have ever slept on at a hotel. The staff Ena, Ilda and Marissa were so accommodating and professional with rescheduling my stay.  Sweet gestures were also made while I celebrated my birthday with the Gotham Hotel. The location is excellent to grab a cab and explore as well as convenient to have a restaurant and bar within the hotel. We stayed in room 171 and loved it!!

title: 5 star customer service experience!
text: This is a 3 to 4 star hotel with 5 star customer service. It is a small boutique hotel that cares about every customer. It was apparent in the way every member of the staff we encountered treated us and all the other guests. They were personable, asking if there was anything they could do for us, offering dining and other suggestions (all excellent ones too) and we couldn't get over how wonderful everyone was from the dining room staff (absolutely wonderful service) to Mattias, Marisa, Matlie and Kristina. How do I know their names? We asked for this review. They deserve to be recognized. As for the hotel restaurant...their breakfast and dinner was better than any of the other restaurants we ate at in the city and we ate at nice places. I usually stay at the Michelangleo but this is where I'm laying my head on a NYC vacation from now on.

title: Best Birthday Vacay to date
text: I cannot describe how much I love my stay at this hotel. The staff was very accommodating. Shout out to Farzana / Ena! The rooms were beautiful & the $10 on the mini bar per day was more than accommodating. We could see TS from our room 10/10 stay!

title: Great room for great price
text: We checked into the balcony suite with a beautiful view and we were extremely happy with the room. Unfortunately it rained pretty hard the first night and water came in the room so we had to move. This was such a bummer and the night staff was not very helpful at all. LUCKILY, the next morning the manager Ilda saved the day and was super courteous and apologetic and ended up putting us in the best room they had. She single handedly saved the trip and I cant thank her enough!!

title: Inner city gem
text: A great boutique hotel in NYC in a fantastic location- right off 5th which makes it an easy walk to times square, shopping and other sought after spots. Great staff from check in to check out- Marisa was so helpful with any requests and contributed to such a warm feeling at the hotel- thank you!

title: חוויה סופר טובה אנחנו בטוח נחזור שוב
text:
המלון ממוקם באזור מרכזי ומהמם
מלון נעים עם מרפסות שוות בקומות העליונות שצופות לבניינים מהממים ולטיימס סקוואר
הצוות מאוד אדיב חם ושירותי 
לא הייתה לנו תלונה אחת 
הם סייעו לנו בכל מידע שביקשנו ותמיד בחיוך לשלום 
תודה רבה על חוויה סופר מהנה במחיר שווה

title: Fantastic!
text: This place had amazing service and has an excellent  location! Close enough to walk to all the major sites. The front desk woman named  Ilda was so kind and helpful! She went above and beyond to make our stay amazing!! I would recommend staying here. The patios are great and the restaurant and bar were fabulous!

title: Gem boutique hotel in fantastic location
text: What an adorable gem of a boutique hotel perfectly located for Christmas time in NYC! Across the street from Grand Central made it super convenient to catch my train. Walking distance to Rock Center, the tree etc. Spacious and clean rooms with a balcony (though I didn’t use mine because 17 floors up was too high for me!) Friendly staff. There’s a lovely bar/restaurant located in the back of the lobby, the Reading Room. Loved it for cocktails but needed more staff for breakfast.  Would definitely stay on my next NYC visit.

title: Wonderful Hotel!!!
text: We had an absolutely wonderful stay!!!  From the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out both Ilda and Alex were so very pleasant, helpful and extremely professional.  They both represented The Gotham Hotel impressively well by providing a truly unsurpassable level of customer service.  We also could not have chosen a better location for an extremely busy holiday season.  Thank you all for a job sincerely well done!!!

title: Great Place
text: We had a great stay at The Gotham. The location is perfect. The staff were so helpful and kind, especially Ena. The hotel is small and cozy, the rooms are very clean and even the small balcony was nice. We will be back.

title: Holiday Getaway
text: We had a wonderful experience at The Gotham Hotel!  The metro King room was spacious and very clean and comfortable. We were greeted by Ilda early afternoon. She quickly handled our checkin with the utmost hospitality. When we arrived later in the evening after a fantastic day exploring NYC our room was ready with our bag’s already there.

title: Perfect for NYC stay
text:
We had and excellent experience with Gotham hotel. It is positioned perfectly to explore NYC, there is a small restaurant in the lobby with delicious food and excellent amenities in the room. The bed was comfortable and the room is HUGE compared to usual NYC hotel rooms. It had a small balcony, which is excellent for smokers :)
But, particularly, I want to thank the wonderful staff - Ilda, Aleksandra, Ena and Nick, who made our stay wonderful. We will definitely return here whenever we come back to NYC!

title: Little gem in Manhattan
text: Big rooms for NY and with balconys. This is a little gem with perfect location. The shared balconys has great views. The service from the staff were outstanding. They made sure we had a lovely stay. We will book again for sure and will recommend this hotel

title: Must try! Awesome location!
text: I only have good words for this hotel, we read a lot of positive reviews before going and were not disappointed. The location is awesome, walking distance from all major attractions. The staff is great. The room was clean and spacious, bed was comfortable. We had a room on the third floor with little balcony on the street which was a great feature. We tried a couple dishes from the restaurant and everything was delicious. Parking was also available in the building right in front, very convenient. We will definitely be back :)

title: Everything perfect
text:
The position is just perfect, rooms are large clean and towels are renewed every day, personal is extremely kind (Ena and Farzana at the reception and Nick at the door). Wi-Fi is free (not obvious for NY) and there is no mandatory hotel expenses. 
Would recommend 100%

title: Perfect location and great hotel
text: The Gotham is a welcoming and friendly place to stay. Perfect place to stay with shops, theatre and sites all close by. The Reading Room Restaurant is good for breakfast and dinner. Our room was spacious and modern with everything you need. Bathroom was a little small but not a problem for us. Most importantly it was a comfortable bed & quiet being on one of the higher floors 19 plus is recommended.

title: Excellent service lovely friendly staff
text:
We had a fantastic stay at Gotham hotel, staff were very friendly and took that extra step to make sure we were happy , great advice always to hand , with a smile and ready to help , excellent service 
Especially Farzana , Ena and Ilda 🌷🌷⭐️⭐️

We loved Ellen’s Stardust Diner , just round the corner too

title: Just Ok
text:
First time i stayed and was pretty underwhelmed - even accounting for the nyc premium.

The pictures online are not super realistic. Hotel and rooms are showing some wear and tear.

I reserved through Amex but when I checked in I was told that I booked through Expedia which is usually code for we’re giving you the worst room in the hotel which turned out to be true.

My 3rd floor room looked right out on the office building across
the street. The shades on the windows have gaps so the lights on the office building across the street (which are on all night) shine through and right in your eyes - suppose that is the case for all the rooms facing 46th.

The attached picture of the shades is not from sunrise, it’s from the middle of the night.

They should at least provide sleep masks.

The HVAC unit made a loud vibrating noise about every 30 minutes just to make sure I was still awake.

title: Exceptional stay.
text: I was incredibly happy with my stay here. Location, cleanliness, attentiveness from staff, restaurant were all above par. Ena at the front desk was very nice and helpful with all of our needs during our stay. 10/10 would stay again and recommend to friends and family.

title: Marissa and Srdan
text:
I had a great time at the Gotham. Marisa at the front desk was my personal guide to the city and she brought joy to the building. I must say, her energy was the best part of The Gotham. Ask for her! Srdan greeted us with his professional and charm at any time of the day or late night. 
A great team, a cool building and great for travelers. 

mr stuckey

title: Gotham NYC
text: Excellent hotel in a superb position on the east side of NYC. Gotham supplied All we want in a city hotel room, Big Bed Great shower and fresh air with the balcony. Clean with excellent polite efficient staff particularly Farzana and Ena at reception and the lads who open the door when coming in and out always so polite.

title: This hotel has everything you need for your stay in NYC
text: I don’t usually write reviews for hotels as most are middle of the road and not particularly noteworthy. However, this was our first time in NYC and as you can imagine, finding a place is difficult due to so many options. If you are like this, reading this review; book your stay at The Gotham Hotel. Fantastic location close to the square but not too close. It’s also right next to Grand Central allowing you to go wherever you want easily. Not just the location, but the rooms are also immaculate and cozy and surprisingly quiet with the location. But most important, the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. Shout out to our girl Farzana, for making our stay incredible. Thank you The Gotham Hotel for our wonderful stay.

title: Perfektes Hotel mitten in Manhattan...besonders für Raucher!
text: Das Gotham Hotel liegt ca. 100 m von der 5th Avenue und 50 m von Madison Avenue entfernt in einer Seitenstraße. Fast alle Sehenswürdigkeiten sind zu Fuß zu erreichen. z.B. zum Times Square/Broadway 7 Minuten zu Fuß. Gleiche Entfernung etwa zum Rockefeller Center. Alle Zimmer haben einen Balkon auf dem geraucht werde darf, auch wenn keine Aschenbecher dort stehen. Also: an einen eigenen Ascher denken ;-). Betten sehr breit und bequem. Unser Zimmer/Balkon lag zum Innenhof und war daher sehr ruhig, aber es war kein schöner Ausblick! Alle Bereiche des Hotels und des Zimmers inkl. Bad waren sehr sauber. Schränke sind ausreichend vorhanden. Im Zimmer gibt es eine Minibar mit moderaten Preisen (für Manhattan), zudem sind 30 Dollar schon inkludiert! Auch eine Kaffeemaschine (Kapseln) ist vorhanden, der Verbrauch der Kaffee-Kapseln wurde uns nicht berechnet. Wir haben auf das teure Frühstück im Hotel verzichtet (50 $ pro Person), kein Problem, in direkter Nähe liegen drei Frühstückslokale. Besonders gut hat es uns im "Gregory´s" gefallen (übernächster Hauseingang). Dort haben wir etwa 25 Dollar für zwei Personen bezahlt. ALLE Mitarbeiter waren sehr, sehr nett und hilfsbereit, dennoch möchte ich Marissa, Farzaria und Nick besonders erwähnen! Wir würden jederzeit dieses Hotel wieder buchen!!!

title: Weekend get away
text: Loved the stay. Was looking for something in Manhattan with a balcony and The Gotham did not disappoint. Our room shared a floor with one other room. (Small back balcony off our room and shared balcony on the floor with a view) Felt very intimate and relaxing.  Thank you Ilda, Ena and Srdjah for being so welcoming. Look forward to my next trip to NYC

title: Fabulous stay
text: We had a great stay at the Gotham, great location. Very comfortable, staff are excellent in particular Ena and Farzana, on the front desk they couldn’t have been more helpful or friendly. I would highly recommend.

title: Luxury without the price
text:
This hotel was amazing!  It was quiet and elegant. Close in proximity to EVERYTHING! I have stayed at some posh hotels in NYC, including, Park Lane, One hotel etc. 
although those are beautiful and very nice, Gotham just hit the same mark. 

I was on the 21st floor and I shared it with on other room. I had a small personal balcony and another larger balcony that my room and the other room could share. 

Also, the young ladies at the front desk, Marisa and Ena, were so kind and helpful! I had the pleasure to meet them my last night there. Thank you for everything you’ve done. I will be back.

title: GREAT ROOMS, GREAT LOCATION, GREAT STAFF!
text: My daughter and I came to NYC for a mother/daughter trip.  We loved our stay at The Gotham - great location and the staff was so helpful and friendly.  Ilda Koljenovic was so accommodating when we asked to switch our room from the back-facing (we found the air ducts noisy) to a street-facing room.  The rooms were so modern and clean and comfortable, and plenty big - just loved them!  Very nice showers too.  The restaurant downstairs, The Reading Room, was delicious which was a nice perk as well.  But best of all was the friendly staff who saw us off with a smile each day and greeted us with a smile each evening.  It felt like they knew who we were and were looking out for us which was such a nice feeling in such an intense city!  Loved this hotel and thank you, Ilda!

title: Small, Independent Hotel with Big Offerings
text: A gem of a hotel. Close to everything but far enough to have some peace and quiet. Love the balconies. The staff is excellent  - responsive and accommodating.  Many thanks to Farzana, Ilda, Nick and many others for your friendliness and professionalism. Breakfast was excellent!

title: Excellent hotel
text: Excellent hotel. Perfect location and clean, well appointed rooms. I was most impressed by the staff. Extremely helpful and courteous. Namely, Maddie, zena, Ilda and Marisa.  We will definitely stay there again next time in NYC.

title: Amazing
text: First I’d like to sincerely apologize to Miss. Ena, she was the main representative we worked with upon our stay at The Gotham Hotel. It was immaculate upon arrival we were given our room early. We plan to be back for the holiday season and I’ll be needing Ena’s help again! I must say, while Ena obviously stood out as we worked with her mainly, EVERYONE from the front desk attendants to the concierge staff were tremendous and accommodating. Our room was beautiful with a great view of the lights NY had to offer. Gotham is the way to go for affordable luxury and getting the best of NYC. I plan to make myself a household name of this hotel with my stays to come. Thank you ENA & THE GOTHAM HOTEL!

title: Wonderful hotel, great location and amazing staff!
text: The bed is super comfortable. Pillows a little soft but still comfortable. The room is spacious and we received an upgrade so we could all be on the same floor.  Ilda, Nick, and Bobby were excellent and went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and all our needs met. Thank you to the wonderful staff.

title: Great hotel and people
text:
Hotel was amazing. Great location , room and staff. From
The moment you enter the entrance you are greeted with smiles and help. I can’t wait to stay again. Ilda nick and Bobby helped us with all our needs in our room as well as our bags.

title: Spacious and Luxurious in the center of it all
text:
We had a fantastic time at the Gotham. We stayed in a skyline Queen on the 17th floor - which had a huge balcony, small couch, and workspace enough to make use of the excellent wifi for some meetings and emails. The bed was firm and comfortable, and we celebrated every evening with Prosecco on the balcony looking down 46th towards Times Square. Noise was pretty good (street noise was negligible, the A/C unit was somewhat loud). The bathroom had a waterfall shower and plenty of counter space. Both privacy shades and blackout curtains can be lowered across the floor-to-ceiling windows. We were minutes from Grand Central, and a cool 30 minute walk from Penn Station.

Many thanks to Ilda, Farziq, Nick, Marissa, and all the staff at the Gotham for making our anniversary trip to New York City a special one.

title: Hotel Discovery in N.Y.C.
text:
From: Margret Pankov: 
I spent five nights at this very cozy and comfortable boutique hotel in midtown Manhattan.  Lovely staff at the reception, attentive and helpful.  Kudos go to Ilda, Alex, Marissa, Srdjan and all reception staff and bellmen for their professionalism and positive attitudes.  I will definitely stay again at the Gotham Hotel.
P.S. There is  a very nice restaurant called The Reading Room on the ground floor. They serve a very good breakfast and the staff is friendly and efficient.

title: Perfecta ubicación, magnífico trato del personal
text:
Ubicación perfecta en Midtown, habitación grande, muy cómoda y con una maravillosa terraza. 

Destacar el buen trato de todo el personal y en especial de Adel, siempre pendiente de cualquier necesidad y ayudándonos a gestionar los traslados desde y hacia el JFK. 

Tener como servicio de habitaciones a The Reading Room es perfecto para poder cenar muy bien después de un agotador día por NYC 

Definitivamente The Gotham es el hotel para alojarse si quieres estar en Midtown, cerca de todo y rodeado de un personal que te hace sentir como si estuvieras en casa

Volveremos con toda seguridad a The Gotham

title: Lone traveller made welcome
text: Came for a solo adventure from Liverpool, UK. The rooms are large in size. I got a balcony room and while the view wasn’t the best there is a communal balcony to make up for this. I was checked in by Marisa and she would always speak to me on my way in or way out through my stay. Giving me recommendations since she is a local and eager to hear what I did in the day. The rest of the staff were amazing and friendly and approachable. Lovely young lad working on the door always up for a conversation. Next time I’m in the city I would like to go to a different hotel but these guys made the stay so good why wouldn’t I come back! Bar staff always happy for a conversation as well, which is very helpful when you’re on your own.

title: Won’t stay there again
text: The pictures of the rooms on the website are deceptively nice. My room was a “suite” but I would hardly call it that. It just meant that the tv was farther from the bed. The room was dilapidated - peeling paint, dirty carpet, etc. The bed was uncomfortable. I got one hour of sleep because it was so noisy and I was on a high floor. It lacks the amenities of other hotels and doesn’t make up for it in any other way. I will not be staying there again.

title: Very nice boutique hotel
text:
Husband and I stayed in a Balcony King room on here for a week, and we really liked the hotel.  It is an interesting configuration - the building is narrow, so the first (ground) floor has reception and the restaurant, and then the remaining floors have just a few rooms per floor. As I recall, floors 2 through 7 are smaller rooms with 4 rooms per floor, floors 8 through 23 have only 2 larger rooms small suites, and then the top floor has just the single Penthouse Suite. This is great, as the small number of rooms on each floor makes it very quiet. Our room was on the 23rd floor, so it was especially quiet being so far from the street noise. We could occasionally hear sirens, but that was about it.

Our room was quite spacious (especially by Manhattan NYC standards) and nicely decorated, with an extremely comfortable bed. There is a relatively large undercounter mini-bar fridge with available space to store personal beverage/food items as well as the hotel mini-bar beverages that are available at a cost (though we didn't need to do that), and there are wine glasses, a corkscrew, and, at least in the larger rooms and suites, a Nespresso coffee machine. The balcony wasn't huge but had enough room to comfortably hold two chairs with a small table between them. The view isn't great (the balcony is on the back of the building with a view of the back of another building), but it is nice have private outdoor space. On the higher floors, there is also a larger shared balcony on each floor, with a better view as it was on the front of the building. Sadly, it rained for most of our stay, so we didn't use either balcony as much as we'd have liked. Our room's balcony was covered, but with heavy rain and wind, it wasn't really practical to use during the storms. 

All of the staff at the Gotham Hotel was very welcoming, helpful and friendly. The front desk staff and doorman greeted us every time we left the hotel and returned to the hotel, they lent us large umbrellas during the storms, and overall were terrific. While we didn't interact with the housekeeping staff, the room was always cleaned promptly and to a high standard whenever we left the room with the "Refresh" sign on the door. We tended to go in and out of the room several times a day, but we never came back to find the room hadn't been cleaned yet, whether we were gone an hour or 5 hours.

We only ate at the hotel's restaurant, the Reading Room, once, for dinner on the night we arrived, but we enjoyed the food and the cocktails.

I only have a couple of suggestions for the Gotham Hotel. First is that the hotel have a blow dryer in each room. I am so used to every nice hotel having blow dryers in rooms that it has become an expectation and so I don't pack a blow dryer. It may be that there are blow dryers in the room and I just didn't see it on our room, or that I could have gotten one if I requested it from the front desk. But I didn't ask the front desk about it as, due to the rain, most of the time I wouldn't have bothered blow drying my hair anyway.

The second suggestion is related to the Nespresso machine. First, they only leave 2 Nespresso pods. So, for a couple, each person could only have a single cup of coffee. I need more coffee than that to get myself together in the morning! It would be nice if they included four pods. Worse, though, is that though there is a good number of individual containers of "creamer," they are all CoffeeMate, which I cannot use due to the high sugar content. I know that some people love this type of creamer, but others like me do not. It would be nice is if they included individual containers of both real half and half AND CoffeeMate, so there is something for everyone. Anyway, as a result, we didn't even use the Nespresso machine, and every morning I had to throw on my yoga pants and hoodie and walk a couple of blocks to Starbucks to get a Venti Latte to wake me up :). Again, if I had asked the front desk, they might have been able to get me some half and half or milk from the restaurant or something, but to be honest, I just never bothered to ask.

All in all, we highly enjoyed staying at the Gotham Hotel, and we would certainly stay there again if we are in the city again (we are from California, so whether or not we will ever get back to NYC is questionable).

title: Great Stay !
text: Great place! The staff was excellent. Ilda, Beshik, and Alex took great care of us! Location was superb and parking is right across the street, very convenient and easy to access when you’re exhausted the next day !

title: Great stay
text:
Lovely room & friendly service in a fabulous location.
Good value for money in an expensive town!
Settling down for the night in a comfy bed with the craziness of NYC happening on the streets below was very nice.

title: The Gotham Hotel is a lovely boutique hotel walking distance to major New York City sites!  Great staff and location!
text: The Gotham Hotel in NYC is a lovely boutique hotel with an amazing location walking distance to major NYC sites. The hotel includes small personal room balconies, and additional spacious shared terraces on 5 of the upper levels with amazing views of the NYC skyline. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Ilda was particularly courteous and made every effort to pay attention to detail and make my stay as comfortable as possible. The rooms are nicely decorated and kept very tidy and clean. A great hotel for your NYC visit!

title: Exceptional Hotel with great staff
text: The Gotham is a remarkable hotel that stands out from the crowd. The best hotel we had ever visited in NYC. The rooms are large, clean and well equipped. The suites are exceptional with their large balconies and generous space. The quality of service from all employees is outstanding, from the front desk to the bellmen and room service. Ilda was particularly helpful and friendly at the front desk. Next time we are in NYC we will definitely come back.

title: My favourite NYC hotel that never disappoints
text:
I simply love this hotel. The location is great, service and staff are outstanding, amenities are excellent. The understated restaurant provides N excellent breakfast and I think they have the best coffee in NY.  I am a return traveller and wouldn’t stay anywhere else. The balcony is such a rare find. 
A special mention to Ilda at reception who made check and checkout a breeze, she is wonderfully helpful and polite - staff like this make a real and positive difference. 
Thank you Gotham

title: Excellent
text: My wife and I booked a room with a balcony. Originally was not pleased with the view we got. ‘Em at the front desk was very helpful and ended up in a very nice room. Excellent customer support.  Highly recommend.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Hotel is lovely, modern. They have the largest rooms I have ever stayed in NYC. Balcony. Big bathroom. Very clean .  Staff very helpful. Resto is good. Close to Theatres, shopping, etc. parking right in front of hotel, thank you for your excellent service Ena & Alex

title: Weekend NY Trip at the Gotham
text:
Our stay at the Gotham was overall a good experience. I'll break it down: 

Positives: Central location. You are steps away from Rockefeller Center and Times Square. The coffee shop next door is phenomenal. 

Great views. There's a balcony in your room and then another with more spectacular views in the hallway. The views at night and at sunrise were great. 

Service: Ilda and Diangelo went out of their way to make our stay a memorable one. They were both very kind and helped us with our bags, our parking and any questions we had. 

The shower was incredible. I took 4 showers and I only stayed 2 nights. 

Negatives: We asked for silverware, ice and water and we were brought 1 plastic silverware set and a glass bottle of water. No ice. 

No bathroom night light 
No light over bar area 
Only 1 lock on door

I would be happy to stay here again, especially after learning that it is a family business. The positives greatly outweighed the negatives.

title: Soggiorno ottimo
text:
Posizione ottima per raggiungere qualsiasi tipo di attrazione di Midtown. Camera pulita e staff sempre pronto ad aiutarti! 
La camera era al 9° piano e aveva un mini terrazzo. Vista suggestiva!
Camera spaziosa, doccia ben funzionante e grande. Soggiorno molto confortevole.

title: Modern Spacious Room in NYC with great location, Clean and Comfortable, friendly Staff
text:
I had a great stay on a business trip at Gotham Hotel on Aug. 23. I was impressed with the hotel and its hospitality. The Room is modern and Spacious in NYC with a great location, It's clean and comfortable. 

I am most impressed with their front desk agent Ena Jahdadic, She is very professional and friendly, she welcomed us with a warm smile and went out of her way to assist us with our needs. I am coming back for another business trip in Oct, and because of her exceptional service, I decided to stay here again and booked with her directly for my October business trip. I recommend my co-worker to stay here and book with her as well.

title: Comfortable and Clean-High Ens Hotel
text: Very comfortable and clean hotel. ILDA and Mattie, at the front desk, greeted us with a warm and friendly welcome. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. Very good service and I would definitely return.

title: Great location with friendly staff
text: I had a great time staying at this hotel.  I was there 5 nights. It is an excellent location. Lovely little balcony, the beds were super comfy and had good space and the staff were so friendly and helpful I would highly recommend it and definitely stay here again. A special thanks to Ena, Ilda, Di Angelo and Mattie amongst others who were always so helpful and welcomed me everyday with a smile.

title: Best value and quality
text: The rooms are by far one of the biggest and cleanest in NYC even without considering the price. They also have great service and nice public balcony views on the upper floors. As a comparison, 20 minutes away are rooms in Times Square at the same price but half the size. You’re really getting good value here

title: Excellent
text:
Really good experience, very convenient location, close to the train stations, very clean and huge rooms. 

The staff was particularly helpful and understanding. Special shout out to Ena who assisted me for checking-in, she answered any questions in detail, in a profesional way and with much clarity, without being overwhelming of giving unneccessary information. 

The pillows are great, bed is huge, there is a small balcony so it was really nice. Also there are common balconies on the top floors which are great.

title: Book this hotel!
text: This was my first time visiting NYC and I saw this hotel on Tik Tok and it did not disappoint! It’s the cutest hotel right down the street from Times Square. The staff was very friendly,  welcoming and helpful when we were looking for a taxi and looking for meeting points for our tours. Ena helped check us into our hotel and was so amazing. She gave us directions to certain places we were looking for and was very helpful. Highly recommend this hotel. Literally down the street from Times Square and Broadway plays but yet still on a quieter side of the street. Many cute little restaurants and a market all right next door to the hotel. We will definitely be back when we visit again. Looking forward to it.

title: Great Location, Awesome Team
text:
We recently stayed at The Gotham Hotel for 14 nights. The hotel far exceeded our expectations, we had a very modern spacious room with a private balcony as well as a shared balcony. Nice big shower and modern ammenities. Location is very convenient to everything, in-between 5th and Maddison Avenue. An easy ten minute walk to Times Square, Grand Central Station, Empire State. Less to Rockefeller Center and Broadway Shows.
The hotel staff are extremely welcoming and happy to help in any way. 
A very special Thank you to  Ena from the front desk team, who was always happy to help with any enquires and hear about our day.  As well as Di Angelo the hotel Doorman who was always so friendly and helpful each night.
Would recommend The Gotham Hotel for anyone wanting a convenient, comfortable, cosy hotel in New York.

title: Great location!
text: The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Ida & Besnik made sure everything was great 😊 with our stay. The room was clean, in the perfect location, and the balconies had excellent views. Differently my new go to hotel in NYC. Love it ❤️ I typically don’t do reviews they earn it

title: Perfect for Broadway shows and mid Town attractions
text: I've been to New York city many times and stayed in multiple hotels ranging from different prices. Some are very expensive and you get nothing but a room. This hotel is amazing. One of the best hotels I've stayed at in New York city. The service and friendliness of the staff was Amazing. The room was the biggest room in NYC lol and the balcony was so great and had great views of the city. I recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to go to times Square and see Broadway shows. title: Huge room with a balcony in a great location
text:
I stayed at the Gotham for 10 nights for business in NYC. As a frequent traveler to the city it was a wonderful surprise to have such a great room with a balcony in midtown manhattan’s center. The entire staff of the hotel was extremely hospitable, always nice and welcoming and assisted with any request I had. I must mention especially Ilda who seem to always be at the front desk smiling and ready to help with anything. I’ll definitely return to future visits. 
The only issue I had was the fact I had to request refreshing the coffee station (wonderful coffee btw!) every time I finished the capsules as I drink a lot of it.

title: Solid Hotel-  FANTASTIC Employees
text:
The staff at this hotel is fantastic. This is the second time I've stayed here - both for trips to Weill- Cornell for Surgerical consultations which is pretty stressful business. The first time we came we got in so late we barely interacted with anyone and were zombies - but this time I had the pleasure of meeting Ena, Alex, and Maddie at checkin and they were so great! They answered all of my questions (there were lots) and were super helpful in offering solutions to a couple of small problems I had (created by me) and were just upbeat and pleasant and personable. This trip also included a visit to my MIL in Oncology @ dloan Kettering, so double whammy of medical unpleasantness- and these ladies really turned my day around. 10/10 would chit chat again. 

Also our room is great, the view is dope, and the foldout couch has clean sheets and extra pillows exactly as I requested - which reminds me that I emailed prior to arriving with these requests, and Ilda was also fantastic! Super quick to reply and she delivered on requests. 

Whatever these ladies are being paid, it isn't enough ❤️

title: Coney Island/Show/Explore
text: CLEAN. I can't express that enough. Service was as it should be.  HARD TO FIND. The location is everything! As are Mattie Ilda and Besnick 🌞 friendly, immediate attention 😻 be sure to tip, show appreciation 🤩

text: Ilda and DiAngelo were super helpful during our stay. DiAngelo helped us bring down few heavy boxes and it was breeze. Would recommend to future individuals who would like to stay here. Would also give it 5 out of 5.

title: great Hotel _ perfect location

title: Nothing short of stellar
text:
🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 The Gotham Hotel is an absolute gem in Manhattan! From the moment we arrived until the day we departed, we were blown away by the exceptional service and hospitality of every single employee. Each interaction left us with a smile on our faces and a feeling of being truly cared for.

The location of the hotel is simply unbeatable. Being within walking distance to so many places and close to the subway made exploring the city a breeze. Even with a broken ankle on our New York trip, the staff  (Donte, Anna, Adel, Ilda…to name a few, I’m sure I’m missing some), went above and beyond to make sure I had ice every day when we returned to the hotel. They even anticipated my needs and offered to send ice to the room based on my routine – talk about attentiveness!

On our final night, when we encountered a room lockout situation, the staff's response was outstanding. Instead of making us wait while they resolved the issue, they upgraded us to a better room and generously allowed us to enjoy anything we wanted from the bar. It's these thoughtful gestures that truly set The Gotham Hotel apart from the rest.

If you're planning a trip to Manhattan, look no further than The Gotham Hotel. The level of service, the prime location, and the genuine care they show for their guests make it the ultimate place to stay. Highly recommended! 🏙️🏨🗽

title: Green light for the Gotham!
text: Great location, especially for Broadway enthusiasts—an easy walk to the theaters. A terrace suite is the way to go—great views for a reasonable rate. Warm, friendly staff—Ena at the front desk was delightful! We definitely plan to stay there any time we’re in town for a show or three.

title: Great hotel and service
text: Location is fantastic. Right in the central location of 5th Av. Staff is very very kind and supportive. All in a hotel are great. For sure each guest will have same experience. Special thanks to Ilda and Aleksandra!🙏Definitely hotel to be chosen if you stay in NY.

title: You can do better.
text:
We booked on hotels.com, its meant to be a VIP hotel on their platform.  The room was listed as a balcony room.  Not once in the description does it say INTERIOR balcony room.  The balcony looks at a brick wall and with the air conditioners sounds it feels like you're standing on a runway at a busy airport.  

The room was fine, the balcony a depressing mess of a disappointment.  

Additionally the VIP "Perk" for this property is 2 Drinks (1 per person).  We were quickly informed that these drinks are from the mini bar, not the restaurant bar.  It was not actually 2 drinks it was $10 credit.  That is not even one drink (one nip of vodka $8, one can of soda $4) 

They also include a $10 mini bar credit to offset their exorbitant "resort" fee.  Which is basically just a fee to use the wifi.  

It's a BIG city, there are much better options with actual balconies and VIP perks.

title: Lovely Stay in NYC!
text: This was probably the best hotel I’ve stayed in NYC so far. Really nice & clean, rooms are too. The balcony in the room was a nice touch. They also have public balconies on the higher floors & the views are amazing! Me & my boyfriend stayed there for his birthday weekend. The staff were really nice & accommodating, they gave us complimentary Prosecco in the room for his birthday & wrote a really nice note. I can’t remember the name of the young man who checked me in but he was very very nice! & Thank you to Ilda as well! She checked me out & was very lovely.

title: 10/10 - 1,000% recommend.
text:
This was our first time in NYC and The Gotham Hotel was a haven from the bustle and heat of the city.  In boutique hotels like this, I expect the spaces to be nice (they were) so the employees and location tend to make or break the experience. 

The Gotham could have had a horrid location (it does not) because the employees are impeccably trained and amazingly kind. All of them were lovely and helpful, but Ena and Besnik were particularly wonderful and were there both when we checked in and out.  They were kind, efficient, and anticipated our needs virtually before we asked.  

The Gotham is perfectly located.  And I do mean perfectly located; you are steps from 5th avenue, three blocks from Grand Central Station, five blocks from the New York Public Library and Bryant Park, 15 walking minutes from Times Square and from a corner entrance to Central Park, two blocks from Rockefeller Center and St. Patricks Cathedral.  Excellent foods from a variety of cultures are easily within a four block walk.  Other than hearing the sound of an ambulance once, we heard no street sounds at all.  

The rooms have an understated elegance (loved the woods floors in ours) and include lovely ammenities.  Given the downpour we experienced twice while here, the umbrella was an appreciated touch.  There were slippers,  and Nespresso in additional the hotel standard refrigerator, hair dryer, and extra blankets.  I loved the art in the room and the touch of stacks of books on the nightstand.  This boutique hotel is a remodeled bookstore. 

We never ate in the physcial restaurant (it looked beautiful) but treated ourselves to room service and the food was stellar.  They had the wonderful hanger steak chimichurri and a ricotta gnocchi that rivals clouds for pillowy softness.  All of the food was perfectly seasoned. 

I recommend booking through their website.  They offer a 20% discount if you book at least 7 days in advance regardless of length of stay.  

Kind, thoughtful, friendly employees (Ena and Besnik were particularly wonderful), a stellar location, elegant rooms, stunning service, and a lovely restaurant.

title: Amazing experience!
text: The best hotel experience I ever had. Safe, clean, comfortable, welcoming and classy. I could not have picked a better hotel, the location was absolutely perfect for myself as a tourist. David at the front was extremely friendly and welcoming and the door staff. The balconies were soothing and a great way to start and end each day. The bed and pillows were comfortable, the huge mirror, rain shower and nespresso machine were the icing on top! Each floor only has 3 room, so low levels of traffic and noise, the cleaning staff were friendly! I would absolutely stay here again and recommend this hotel.

title: Fantastic hotel.
text: A fantastic hotel in every way. Just a couple of minutes walking distance to Times Square. Professional treatment at the reception by the staff. We had a Queen room with a terrace that had a view of the city (46th street). The room was clean and tidy. In general, the hotel seems very well maintained.

title: Will Repeat!
text: Excellent find. The hotel was well appointed, clean and crisp. Adel, at the front desk, was professional, friendly, clear and made our stay even nicer. Room with a balcony!?...we could not recommend it any more. Very cool experience with view of the city.

title: Anniversary Weekend at Great Location and Amazing Staff
text: This is amazing boutique hotel and hidden gem located in Midtown East, my wife and I discovered this location about two years ago and it is now our go to location whenever we travel to NYC. I can’t say enough about the friendly and accommodating staff. Starting with the doorman (Nick) to the wonderful staff of Adel, Ilda, Ena, Alex and Jaden(hope I got his name correct) they were all extremely pleasant to work with and I can honestly say in all of our travels of late this staff sets the bar for customer service. On our most recent trip there was a mix up with the reserved room but it was quickly sorted by Adel/Jaden. While we didn’t get our much desired room (the Skyline Studio Suite 😊. ) The staff quickly placed us in an upgrade.  We’re definitely planning to visit again in the fall and have already booked for New Year’s Eve. I HIGHLY recommend booking this property, you will not be disappointed.

title: Delightful hotel experience
text: We were greeted by three people at the desk when we arrive, as well as a doorman opening the door for us and our luggage. The room was spotless, very streamlined and minimalist, very comfortable and has a cute little balcony. We brought our lunch so we went up to the top balcony and sat out on the 23rd floor and had a picnic lunch which was delightful. Ilda, at the front desk, made our stay delightful and make sure we had enough coffee in our room and greeted us when we left. The bathroom looks to be newly renovated and spotless. I am a stickler for feeling dirty in a hotel room, and there wasn't a moment I felt that way. We will definitely come back here again as we come to New York very often and are always looking for nice hotel rooms at reasonable prices at good locations. Thank you again, Ilde.

title: Great location and great hotel! Highly recommended!
text: One of the best location at NYC! Hotel is very close to all important sightseeing locations, there is a supermarket immediately next to the hotel and the subway station is as well super close. I loved it because the shopping street, time square and central park was super close and max 10 minutes walking distance. Other than that, hotel is super modern, great rooms with lots of light, also each floor has a nice balcony with the city view - perfect for morning coffee. I would also compliment super staff working at the hotel. Ena was our host and she was always ready with any recommendations, also if we had any questions she was there for us, as well as any help with taxi to the airport etc. She definitely has a hospitality talent! Loved her, her smiling personality and hotel as well! Would always recommend it and I am happy to come back next time i’m in NYC!

title: Great Hotel
text: The Penthouse was fabulous.  The bed was very comfortable and the view from both balconies were magnificent. Ilda was very nice and courteous. Wonderful representative for The Gotham Hotel. The location was within walking distance of Broadway. The food was delicious and the service was fast.

title: The Reading Room restaurant/bar is EVERYTHING!
text:
The Reading Room is a must for locals and travelers alike! Brian graciously accommodated our large group and Vinnie, behind the bar is a masterful mixologist, crafting cocktails nothing short of art!

Ilda and another woman at the front desk warmly greeted us with friendly smiles and  helpful information for our stay at the hotel. The room was clean, and simply appointed, perfect for our needs. The bed was comfy and the soap smelled great!

Will be back!!

title: Exceptionnel
text: Nous avons passé 10 jours de rêve dans cet hôtel qui coche toutes les cases, l emplacement, la taille et la propreté des chambres , le personnel, merci à Adel à Dante  à Dino à Ena à Adam à Jaden, et à ceux qu on oublie, vous avez fait de notre séjour un rêve et on se revoit en juin 2024, meme chambre. Vous nous manquez déjà.

title: Clean, Comfy, Good Views and Location
text: We had a wonderful stay, the staff was friendly and Hilda and Dino at the front desk helped to make our stay special. The room was clean and comfy, and the public balcony views on the upper floors were stunning!

title: Just go for it. It’s the best. I promise!
text:
It took a week and a half to write a review. That’s not because I had a bad experience, it’s because I had a great one! Traveling back from the US + having small kids means there is little time left to write (or think ;)). So; the Gotham Hotel…what an amazing place! Making you feel like home (if that home was tidy and fancy all the time ;)) is a gift. The beautiful building and gorgeous, spacious rooms could do the trick but to be honest it’s all about the people. All staff was great but Ena really made us feel welcome. She was the first and last face we saw and I wish that level of hospitality for everyone. She made us smile and feel seen, at every encounter. Dear Ena, thank you!! 

Back to the hotel itself. It’s just the best in NYC. Spacious rooms WITH balconies (really…? Really!!) at the perfect spot in Manhattan. Just go and book The Gotham Hotel. Stop scrolling and do yourself a pleasure. You won’t regret it. I promise!

title: Great deal with an even better staff!
text: This hotel is seeming to get better with every trip I take here. They have the greatest staff up front to assist. Idla and Ena were a tremendous help in assisting me to check in and out swiftly. The have added a door man to assist in coming in and out which adds a lovely touch to an already inviting experience. Rooms are nice, clean, and thermostat/ac control rounds it out to make sure you’re comfortable. Overall a great experience!

title: Cozy friendly boutique hotel
text: Nice clean room with balcony.   We had a king sized bed.  Staff were very friendly and accommodating especially Ena.  Great location near Times Square, restaurants, subway system and shows. Friendly doormen. Helped with restaurant suggestions also. Balconies on higher floors that you can sit with a drink and enjoy the view.

title: Best boutique hotel

Je reviendrai ds cet hôtel sans soucis

title: Favorite stay in NYC!
text: The comfiest pillows. Beautiful nighttime view from our balcony to chat and enjoy a glass of wine. Hands-down Delvin and Ilola were warm, welcoming, and gracious hosts! A boutique hotel that was quaint and quiet, yet close to EVERYTHING. Thank YOU!

title: Wonderful experience! Outstanding staff!
text:
We traveled with a group of 16 students and 4 chaperones, and stayed here for 2 nights. The staff at this hotel were incredibly kind, accommodating , helpful & encouraging! 

The rooms were comfy and very clean! Love the boutique feel with just 4 rooms per floor- many with a small balcony.  Before bed we enjoyed a lovely chance to visit on a larger,  high story balcony, enjoying the night skyline. 

Hotel is in a perfect location!! Easy walk to Times Square, Broadway  and 5th Avenue shops.
Special thanks to Ilda and Delvis and the entire staff for being amazingly helpful with our group.

title: Incredible service!!
text: The Gotham did a great job hosting us for our small wedding. The staff was incredible (thank you Ilda and coworkers!), the rooms clean and bright,  and they have a restaurant/bar area that has a great breakfast.

title: Very positive hotel experience
text: Very nice midtown hotel with excellent checkin by Ilda.  Friendly and helpful doormen.  Each floor has a balcony either shared with another room or private.  Great location with walking access to many points.

title: Modern and convenient
text: This place is modern and the location is great, only 3 blocks from Times Square. Nice mini-bar assortment. Bed was comfortable but shower was lacking in design, but plenty of hot water. The Reading Room served a great breakfast. Superior customer service.

title: The Gotham Hotel exceeded all our expectations. Excellent location, the staff is super helpful and has a great value for money.
text: Me and my mother stayed at the Gotham Hotel for 5 nights, and we loved the experience. The room was big, clean and the furniture was new. The location is excellent, and it's an easy ride to most of the touristic attractions. All the staff was super helpful and attentive, but we have to leave a special thanks to Ena. She was so lovely with my mother and made our trip that much better since the moment we checked in. I'd for sure stay in The Gotham Hotel if I ever get back to NYC.

title: Brilliant Hotel!!
text: This is a great hotel!! , well positioned to explore the city , great service , the manger Dante was very helpful , as were all the staff, good size room  with a good shower and bathroom, comfortable bed, nice to have a balcony as well, we will definitely be recommending this hotel to anyone we know visiting New York

title: Great experience!
text: We spent 2 nights at the Gotham Hotel and we’re very impressed. The room was immaculate and the largest hotel room & bathroom I’ve stayed in compared to other hotels in Manhattan. Our room was very quiet as it was in the back so we sacrificed a view for a peaceful nights rest. The balcony was a nice touch though we didn’t spend much time there. The location is convenient to everything we needed and the staff was friendly and accommodating. I would definitely return and I’m picky!

title: Perfect Location
text: Perfect location.  Close to dining, shopping, NYC Public Library, Times Square, Carnegie Hall.  Good drinks at the bar.  Loved that there were only four rooms per floor so no long walks to the room.  There were several great breakfast options just next door.  Very quick access to and from LaGuardia.

title: Blood on duvet
text:
Two stars = just okay. But I would put 1.5 if I could. One seemed too harsh. 

It was challenging to pick a rating because one star is poor and three stars is good. Our stay was definitely not good, but I'm not sure it was poor either.

Basic facts: we paid about $380 for the room and I believe a $27 resort fee so overall a little over $400 for a one night stay. We stayed the Saturday after thanksgiving. 

Let's start with the good. Staff was incredibly friendly. We arrived at the hotel around 12 pm on Saturday and planned to just leave our luggage since check in isn't until 4. Luckily they let us check in early so that was a great start. Location was perfect. Right off fifth so you could easily walk to stores, food places, and Central Park. Our room had a patio which is great for air. No view but the patio was still nice. Because it was a one night stay they also gave us a $10 credit for their mini bar/snacks. 

The not so great. The room was very dusty. We ended up wearing our shoes in the room because our feet were black from the dust if we went barefoot. This honestly didn't bother us that much since they have wood floors and we understand dust is normal. The room itself was okay. Nothing fancy, nothing great. There were a little things here and there, for example, the shower wasn't the cleanest, but we were fine, not worth a complaint. When we came back around 10:30 pm the doorman and concierge were watching a game, we're guessing basketball, so they didn't greet us. Again not bad and we're sports fanatics so we get it but since I'm writing this review I thought I'd point it out.  

The REALLY BAD was when we got into bed and there was dried blood stains on our comforter and yellow stains (If I can attach photos I will). So dust is not bad, yellow stains are gross but not that bad, but blood stains is unsanitary and calls for a potential health inspection. Diseases can be transferred through blood so this obviously freaked us out. We called the front desk, told them, and asked for a new comforter. They did apologize and came up quickly, but they came with a thin grey blanket. It's end of November so it's pretty chilly and we thought this was odd. The room has heat so we just turned the heat up but the blanket was also stained. Again if I can post photos I will. It was stained in the sense that maybe bleach was previously used and changed the grey fabric to yellow. Also, they did not take the blood blanket and just left it in our room. 

I tried to find someone on their website to contact about this but the only thing they have is their front desk email which didn't seem appropriate. We previously also emailed their front desk and they didn't timely respond, we had to email them twice to finally get a response. 

They were obviously aware that we had blood on our bed sheets and still nothing was done to apologize to us for the blood issues and it just seemed like a lot of issues for $400/night. 

We fly to New York multiple times a year to visit family and we like to try hotels to find favorites in different areas. We won't be back to the Gotham. New York is filled with hotels, so if you can stay elsewhere, I'd recommend doing just that.

title: Lovely hotel, good location, would stay again.
text:
Lovely hotel, friendly helpful staff.  Room clean and practical with fridge, decent hairdryer, coffee machine, balcony and complimentary safe.
Location was great, no noise but close enough to attractions.
We had a rear room so the view was not great but you had access down the hallway to a front balcony, which had a fab street view.
Restaurant on ground floor which we used for breakfast a couple of times (once as room service!), lovely food.
Would definitely stay here again.

title: Better than expected
text: I was a bit skeptical about staying here due to the few bad reviews. Actually I booked & unbooked it twice because I was very unsure of condition of hotel. Thank goodness to my surprise it was better than expected. Pay little attention to the negative reviews. The staff was more than helpful & we were greeted with a smile, welcome back every time we returned to hotel. My family & I only stayed 2 days  in king room with balcony. The balcony was small & faced a brick bldg but it served it purpose.Our room was cleaned from start to finish every day. The only issue is there is no microwave in the rooms. If you can provide a fridge & minibar, you can very well provide a microwave. There is space for one. Other than the microwave, it was a very nice hotel, actually my new favorite hotel. My family & I will be staying here again in near future.

title: Central boutique hotel
text:
UNAIDS delegation to the 77th UN General Assembly was housed last September 2022 at The Gotham Hotel.
The general opinion of all the colleagues staying in this central boutique hotel was about its excellency. From the welcome at the check-in to the quality of service and facilities, everything runed smoothly.
Special thank you to Dominique Lahens, CMP, Director of Sales, for her professionalism and understanding of all disruptions around the UNGA Sept’22.
Dominique immediate responses to our last-minute requests and additional rooms needed has been exceptional.
UNAIDS office in New York plans to continue our collaboration with The Gotham Hotel for all the events to come.

title: Great Stay
text: We had a great two-night mother/daughter stay. Our room was on a top floor and facing the back, so we didn't use the small balcony, but the floor had a good sized street side balcony with a fun view over to Times Square. Staff were pleasant and attentive. Our room was spotless and comfortable, with good quality linens and a  nice bed.

title: Great staff and location, but the room was terrible.
text: The only reason this review gets two stars instead of one is because the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the location was perfect for my needs. Unfortunately, the room was terrible. The shower in the morning had no hot water, even after running for 10 minutes. The room does not come with water bottles, and there was a very sparse drink selection in the refrigerator. The freezer section was completely iced over and unusable. And on top of the bed spread in two places were what looked like pubic hairs. It was disgusting.

title: Grosse Zimmer, tolle Lage aber zu teuer...
text:
Positives:
-freundliches Personal
-grosse Zimmer
-schöne Aussicht
-sauber
-tolle Lage

Negatives:
-Klimaanlage ist sehr laut innen wie aussen, auf dem Balkon kann man sich kaum unterhalten
-Bar wurde nicht aufgefüllt
-sehr sehr teuer für ein eher älteres Zimmer

title: No attention to details
text:
I stayed two nights in the penthouse last weekend. Let's start with the good things:
1) location is excellent!. 2) staff were very friendly and professional. 3) had a nice patio which was the whole reason we booked the room.
The not so good:
1) felt very run down. things that could easily add value were completely ignored...especially for the room rate they charged me for the penthouse.

These include: An orange size hole in robe in the armpit. (no quality checks)
2) the safe is on the floor of the closet. you have to sit or lie on the floor to put anything in it. 
3) no drawer space for clothes except bedside table. 
4) no hooks or anywhere to hang towel after shower in bathroom. 
5) a Murphy bed!!! who knows why the penthouse has a flimsy bed, but it killed my back. again, simple investments to make this a real hotel.  
6) the room was advertised as having two balconies. one is off the room, the other is across the elevator and public. we had to endure a group of people hanging out and having drinks etc on the patio which made it feel like they were basically in our room as sound travels. 

Overall it just felt run down. Like no one cared and they made a decision no to put even a few dollars into fixing it up. It's a real shame since, good location, good staff, and could be a real gold mine in mid-town.

title: Au coeur de Manhattan
text: Tout était parfait dans la chambre (18e étage), le balcon donnant sur la cour arrière n'est pas très joyeux, mais il était possible d'aller "relaxer" sur les balcons avant publics du 19e au 23e étage. Excellent déjeuner au resto de l'hôtel. Il n'y a que quelques chambres par étage (3 chambres au 18e).

title: Surprisingly Wonderful Hotel
text:
We didn’t know much about this hotel, but we were pleasantly surprised. The lobby is pretty small so we didn’t have high expectations. The customer service was very friendly, the rooms were a good size for NYC, and the location is great. 

There were three rooms on our floor, and our room faced the street. Be ready for floor to ceiling windows looking into a glass office building across the street!  But the room had a big balcony that was nice to hang out on. The bed was comfy, and the restroom was a good size.  During the winter be sure and leave the bathroom door open because it gets cold in there. 

The location was great - right off 5th Ave with the shopping and close to Grand Central. 

I definitely recommend this place!

title: Staff -Great! Rooms a huge disappointment
text: The best thing about this hotel is a wonderful staff. The hotel rooms are by no means posh or warmly furnished. When I turn the cold water on in a bathroom I expect to get cold water from the faucet, but got hit water here. The toilet paper cup falling off the holder because it was not properly secure d to the wall. The advertised mini bar consisted of 5 small airline bottles of liquor and 2 small bottles of wine. The snacks consisted primarily of small chocolate bars. The TV reception frequently cut out on the local stations. At $400 per night, I expected a little more from this place. Again, I will say that the staff were incredibly nice and accommodating.

title: Birthday weekend was perfect
text:
We mainly picked this hotel because of the location and balcony views.  I am leaving this review because the employees here are what made our experience a great one … mainly I’d like to say A big thank you to Shaun at the front desk.  He went above and beyond to fix a mix up with our room and made sure the rest of our stay went effortlessly perfect … always greeting everyone with such a positive friendly vibe. 

Besides that, our bed was super comfortable and the hotel was kept clean.  Some things could be updated here and there,  but I think all in all everything was pretty awesome … Housekeeping was super sweet and made sure we had fresh towels without us even having to ask.  I definitely recommend staying in a skyline suite or the penthouse if an amazing view is what you are going for. 

We will definitely be staying here again on our future visits.

title: Great location, great people, disappointing facility and followup
text:
Loved the location - in the middle of everything.  And the staff was very friendly and caring.
The facilities, on the other hand, left a lot to be desired.  We had a problem with no cold water in our room - only hot, hot.  We communicated with the front desk.  It was "fixed".  When we came back that night, no cold water.  We were moved to another room 2 floors down, but right below the original room.  This room had a shower wand that didn't work, a clock that didn't work, and a telephone headset that didn't work.  We informed the front desk.  They offered to move us again (down another floor, but still right below the original room).  We declined due to the hour.  Next morning, no cold water again, so no shower again (didn't want to be scalded).  The problem was someone immediately above us who was turning the shower off wrong, and the hot water was flowing into the cold water pipes for any room under that one (which was our original room, our second room as well as the other room we were offered).
In terms of compensation due to the problems with the rooms, we were told by the manager to enjoy the minibar for free.  Guess what....we were charged for it.  The manager also offered to "take care of us" next time we were in town.  Yea - given this experience - not happening.  There are too many other hotels in NY for this price point that provide the basics.
Really disappointed in the stay and in their ability to "take care of us" during THIS stay.
PS - there was an ongoing pervasive sewer smell.

title: Disappointing
text: A pricey hotel, done on the cheap. I thought my cab driver pulled up to the wrong hotel. He didn’t. Shabby exterior, tiny nondescript lobby that belonged in a Super 8 motel, no valet assistance, elevator with marks and scratches, plain hallway. The room is just ok, with tiny bathroom. Towels are rough and hairdryer is old. Coffee station not refilled by housekeeping. The balcony is a sad joke. The lack of attention to detail was surprisingly in a $400+\night hotel.  The owners are milking the location. Save your money and stay elsewhere.

title: NYC
text: Our stay was amazing from beginning to end. The room was spacious and we had a great terrace facing the city. Housekeeping was incredible with everything we needed arriving within minutes. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly especially , Daniel. Our anniversary trip to NYC was incredible ♥️♥️♥️ Thank you to everyone at the GOTHAM HOTEL!

title: My favourite NYC hotel
text:
I have stayed at The Gotham twice now when in NYC, the location is perfect, the staff are super helpful and the rooms are spot on, we even had a small balcony on our second stay.  

The terrace at the top has great views and is just lovely.  Both times I have stayed it has been December so cold but dry, making this a lovely spot.

You can get to all the major sights from the location, there is a coffee shop on the same row and also a lovely Deli.

title: My new favorite hotel in NYC
text: What a unique find in the middle of NYC. Close to everything. Extremely friendly staff.  Gabby at the front desk is the best!!! Boutique hotel with nice privacy and great balcony views of the city. I found my new favorite hotel in NYC. A++++ experience.

title: Gotham Hotel Suite and Afternoon Tea!
text:
It’s rare I write reviews but the experience I had at Gotham hotel was AMAZING!!! The reception staff last night  , ground floor/the 6th and bar staff was superb, very helpful and approachable ! 

The evening spent in the suite is a MUST as was lovely and then the afternoon tea was perfect and all the staff was more than helpful ! Lasma in particular went that extra mile the waitress and ended our experience wanting to come back.. 

We will be seeing you soon! Thank you! 💙

title: ホームページは誇大広告
text: ニューヨークにあるだけで成り立っているホテルです。合計2週間宿泊しましたが、暖房はきかない、うるさい、部屋は風景ゼロ、フロントの対応は最悪。ホームページの表記とは全く異なりました。苦情を入れてやっと部屋が変わりました。予約する際は旅行者の写真やコメントをよく見て予約してください。This is the very poor hotel in New York, only good features is the location is New York. We booked for 14 days, but air conditioner didnt work well, noisy and no NY views and the reception was bad. Finally I made the claim and they changed it. Do you think that we are Asian people cant speak in English?  please check photos and comments by travelers.

title: Amazing Stay!
text: We stayed here during our trip for five days. This was our first time in New York City and it was exceptional. Since it was the first time visiting, I spent weeks researching hotels looking at neighborhoods, reviews, room types, everything! I’m so happy we decided on The Gotham! From the front desk to the restaurant there were no issues. Everyone was very helpful, attentive, and kind. The pictures are exactly like the rooms. We stayed in the king balcony room on the back side of the building which was really cool and quiet. We also stayed in the queen balcony room because we didn’t do our dates correctly lol and thankfully they had a room open. Looking out on the balcony in the queen room was awesome. We are returning over Christmas and have rebooked the queen balcony room and I can’t wait! This room is noisier but it’s not to the point of not being able to sleep. My husband and I live in the country surrounded by cow fields so if I can sleep with the noise level anyone can!

title: Honeymoon
text: The staff were fantastic, and nothing was to much for them. Hotel was clean and in a fantastic location. My new wife and I were on our honeymoon, and arrived on our second day of marriage! The hotel is in a fantastic location for all the essential tourist needs. 5th Avenue on the door step, time square 3 blocks up. Rockefeller 4 blocks down. All in easy walking distance. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and I have a couple times!!! We had the best honeymoon and they hotel made this possible also. Thank you and we will see you again

title: ニューヨークのホテル
text: 2週間、家族3人で宿泊しました。立地はすばらしいです。フロントに無料の水があり、地味にうれしいです。受け付けはチェックイン時間の予定にならないと手続きできないらしく、日本から半日時差でフラフラの中、近くの喫茶店で時間をつぶしました。眺めがいい、ベランダ付きとの紹介でしたが、実際はベランダなし、ながめなし、暖房きかない、寒さに家族はふるえてました。立地だけで勝負している、その他はまったく努力しない最悪のホテルでした。予約した時と部屋が違いすぎるため不満を伝えてやっと部屋を変えてもらいましたが、非常に残念です。2週間滞在なのでそれなりの額を支払っています。不満を言わなければよいサービスを受けられないのでしょうか？高齢アジア人家族で英語が話せないと思いましたか？ニューヨークで非常に残念な経験をしました。

title: Très belle vue
text:
Nous avons été à New York en octobre 2019. Nous avons choisi le Gotham Hôtel pour son rapport qualité/prix. Le penthouse que nous avons réservé était situé au dernier étage de l’hôtel, celui-ci devait avoir deux terrasses une avec vue sur la ville et une autre plus intimiste de l’autre côté. 
Finalement la terrasse avec vue sur la ville était situé non pas dans la chambre mais de l’autre côté du couloir... 
Même si le responsable de l’hôtel nous a confirmé que l’étage n’était que pour nous. Nous avons pu constater que plusieurs personnes s’installaient sur la terrasse pour avoir la plus belle vue.
Faites attention ⚠️ car le site internet de l’hôtel ne prévient pas !!
Payer un penthouse pour avoir dans la chambre une seule terrasse sur le mur du building d’en face.. alors que l’annonce faite est de deux terrasses cela peut être considéré comme de la publicité mensongère. 

À part ça l’hôtel est très bien situé et la vue était très bonne. Je peux donc vous conseiller cet hôtel mais prenez une chambre classique.

title: Enjoyed our stay!
