text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Gotham and would definitely stay here again.  This is a small Hotel (only about 2 rooms wide) in a great central location to attractions.  There is a coffee shop right next door as well as restaurants.  We booked the Skyline room to have a bit more space and it was perfect for the 2 of us--private terrace, small sofa, comfortable bed.  The staff was very friendly and helpful and having Wolfgang's Steak House on site was a bonus on Valentine's Day.  Overall, this was a great Hotel for our stay and a reasonable cost (we've stayed in Hotels that cost twice as much).

title: Excellent Stay
text: The staff was very helpful and would help us in any way possible. The room was clean and we enjoyed the balconies. Parking was actually a breeze as their is a parking garage right across the street, it is a bit expensive but for NYC parking, it's probably right on point. The effortlessness made the cost worth it to park there and it was easy to check in and check out.

title: It’s alright
text: This was an okay experience. We booked the “Penthouse” junior suite, and it isn’t exactly what the pictures advertised it to be. Of course the photos are taken with a professional camera and lighting but note that it looks more upscale than it really is. The wood on the furniture was worn and scratched and scuffed. The floors seriously need to be redone. The balcony views are nice but the glass ledge is very low and flimsy, it hardly feels safe being on the 25th floor. This suite is on the roof and is the only room on that floor, but when we checked into our room there were construction workers upstairs most of the day. They were up there earlier than 9am working and making noise, which sucks because check out is noon and we were hoping to sleep in. The major pro about this hotel is really only the location, you are walking distance from grand central which is why the price is so high.

title: Great location in mid town
text:
Excellent hotel, clean rooms.
Tina at the front desk was extremely helpful and courteous   Also want to thank Shaun for his advise on restaurants nearby which were excellent!  Both of these people definitely made our stay great! 
Would definitely recommend this hotel, the mid town location was perfect.

title: Friendly, efficient service
text: After arriving into NYC on the red eye from the west coast, I was told my room would not be available until 3:00 p.m. (six hours later). However, Tina at the front desk was able to get a room made up quickly and in less than an hour I was in a room (upgraded too - thank you Tina!). The room was great, the staff was friendly, and the midtown location was perfect. I will definitely be back. Thank you Gotham Hotel!

title: Right in the middle of everything
text: Last minute decision to stay overnight in town.  Easy check-in and very nice staff. Rooms were spacious and with a terrace.  Price was right too with Winter special going on. Clean bathroom and easy mid town location. Near GCT, Wolfgang's steakhouse downstairs is not to be missed, but that meal can cost more than the room

title: Hidden gem in the city
text: Clean and modern room with a balcony! Love outdoor space. Staff are friendly and accommodating. The big plus, a Nespresso machine in the room with great coffee. Good location and restaurant. The water takes a long time to get warm in the bathroom so start the shower early otherwise it was a great stay.

title: Great Hotel and Perfect Location
text: From the minute I booked this hotel everything was perfect. I spoke with the Manager Julian who was very professional and extremely helpful. I called the property and spoke with Anna who was also great. The room was lovely and the view was amazing.

title: Great location and loved having the terrace!
text: Weekend getaway.  The hotel is walking distance to so many great restaurants, theaters and tourist attractions.  Although we did not eat at the hotel’s restaurant, it seemed to be extremely busy.  We will definitely be returning to this hotel for our next NYC trip!

title: Excellent overall
text: We spent a week over the holidays at The Gotham Hotel and really enjoyed our stay! The rooms were fairly large and comfortable, especially the king bed! The staff was awesome and the location second to none! We will definitely be back!!!

title: A Wonderful 48 Hours in The City
text: The hotel staff were very welcoming.  Our room was spacious with modern furniture. The bef was comfortable. The hotel is located within easy walks to MoMa, Broadway, Fifth Avenue stores, Rockefeller Plaza and many eating establishments.  I will stay at The Gotham Hotel again.

title: Fantastic staff. Will stay again.
text: This hotel has a great location.  We walked from Grand Central and were able to easily walk to Radio City, Bryant Park, Central Park, and St. Patrick’s Cathedral.   We had a suite facing the street which had a spacious balcony with several love seats on it.   The staff is helpful and attentive.  They allowed us to store our luggage prior to check in and after check out.  Not all NYC hotels are that accommodating. Towels were a little rough and the sofa bed did not have linens in the room.   However rooms were spotless and fairly spacious for NYC.   We did not try the restaurant but heard good things and will on a future visit.   You are required to have a deposit of $10 for the mini bar which seemed a little strange.  All in all I would recommend.

title: Super location with spacious accommodations
text:
This boutique hotel is in a great location. Centrally located to Rockefeller Center, Diamond District, Time Square, Bryant Park and the Theater District.. We had a 
king size bed with fresh white linens. The room was clean and simple. Everything you needed including complimentary umbrella’s for you to use during your stay. The bathroom was sizable with a very nice shower. Small refrigerator is handy and stocked with beverages should you want to purchase. Will stay again for certain.

title: Awesome!
text:
Great boutique hotel in the perfect location.  The rooms are very spacious (especially for NYC).  Amazing and helpful staff!  Housekeeping was very responsive.  The beds are very comfortable. 
Amazing overall experience and would definitely stay here again!

title: O.K.A.Y
text: It’s ok. Not near a four star. The restaurant downstairs is excellent though. The service is mediocre and inconsistent.... you have to request cleaning for the service to happen.... some room service staff did a great job but very inconsistent

title: Very good location
text: We stayed here for our recent New York trip. Just off 5th Avenue and very near to Times Square, The Rockerfella, Bryant Park etc. The hotel were also very helpful in booking our taxi back to the airport, which is usually a flat rate of $80 inc tip.

title: Girls weekend
text: Very small boutique hotel in a good location for shopping. Nice room with a great shower. However, there are all wood floors everywhere. It could have used just one area rug to add some warmth underfoot. 👍🏻

title: The Gotham Hotel
text: Travel to New York every year around Christmas. This by far is the best hotel we have stayed at. We had a King Balcony room  but upgraded to a suite. Very spacious and clean. Staff were super friendly. About to book for next Dec.

title: Great with a few drawbacks
text:
It almost goes without saying that the location is ideal. Not only is it just a few blocks from Grand Central Terminal but there's also a small but excellent grocery store next door - yes, actually next door. Additionally, there are excellent coffee places a few doors down.

I've stayed in two rooms, both the type that do not face the street. Very clean and, either the walls and floors are well designed or other guests were just mellow, but the rooms were very quiet which is a huge plus. If you are staying in one of the rooms that do not face the street, there's very little natural light entering the rooms which is a bit disappointing but understandable.

The wifi was excellent and TV's higher than average quality for hotels. The beds in which I slept were showing some age and I assume the hotel has replacement plans sometime in the future. Linens were excellent.

The staff with whom I interacted were friendly and helpful.

Overall, a really good hotel.

title: Great!
text: The location is unbeatable, just 5 min walk to Rockefeller Center. Rooms are large and comfortable, and have Nespresso coffee machines. The service was excellent, a package was sent after I left and they returned it for me!

title: delightful stay
text:
Great little boutique hotel, great location.  Lots of windows and great rainshower heads!
Breakfast was delicious! Reasonably priced and would definitely stay here again if I were to travel to New York city!

title: Pristine boutique hotel in NYC!
text: Welcomed with chocolate and wine. Beautiful hotel! Comfy bed. Suite had a balcony with great city views. Good proximity to Times Square and Rockefeller Center.  Easy access to metro as well.  Check in/out was a breeze.

title: Great Stay
text: Front desk agents were very kind. We arrived at the hotel at 11 am due to our flight arrival. I expected them to just store our luggage until check in time that afternoon, but to my surprise they allowed us to check in early simply because I had checked in online the day prior.  Room was spacious for NYC. Service in the Wolfgang restaurant was superb. Three nights granted a very useful $30 credit toward the mini bar items. They even delivered a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates because it was my mother’s birthday! Next time I travel to the city I’ll definitely stay at the Gotham again.

title: Great stay
text: Hotel was nice and accommodating to my needs. In a central location close to Times Square and Rockefeller so it was convenient to walk around. Great amenities in the room and would definitely return here in the future.

title: Penthouse? Really?
text:
thought I’d surprise my daughter for a trip to NYC and stay in a penthouse with our own balcony. This is A JOKE! Seriously, this hotel is in a wonderful location, but beware, the website is very misleading. It states there is a service pickup from the airport - not from them though, it is a paid individual service. It says they have room service from the restaurant downstairs, the waitstaff acted like they had never even heard of it but I could order to go if I wanted? 
The past 3 days housekeeping has failed to give us towels and washcloths and when I call front desk we have had to wait anywhere from 30 mins to one hour. And penthouse? This 500 square foot room with a cute apple picture and a balcony to fit 3 people looks straight into brick wall - sounds like the views of their “regular” rooms are better. Bathroom overall looks clean except for the floors and shower floor as well. Beds are comfy but constant banging noise of elevator you hear ALL day AND night long. For over $2500 I would NOT ever recommend this place to anyone. Very, disappointed!

title: Great Location!
text: We stayed in a metro king room on the 6th floor facing 46th Street.  The room was pretty large for NYC although just a little noisy from trash trucks.  The hotel staff were very helpful and super nice.  I will definitely stay here again and highly recommend as you can walk to everything!

title: Great if it wasn’t for the misleading website & Rude GM
text: After hours of looking for a room that had a decent sized balcony in NY, and a couch in the room, I booked a Skyline Queen Terrace room for 3 nights. The pictures online not only showed a bigger balcony/terrace with more furniture than we had, but also a couch in the room. When we got there, the balcony was smaller than it seemed online and there was no couch in the room with just one bed. After I asked to speak to the general manager to see if we can get a bigger room with a couch and perhaps a bigger balcony as we booked. After I spoke with the general manager and she said that she couldn’t do anything except book me in a different room with a worse view and still no couch. I told her the pictures were misleading and her response was that not every room online will have the same pictures of the room booked. Then she began question the website that I saw the pictures on with doubt, only to prove to her that the pictures were from the official Gotham hotel website .... Once I asked her if there was anything she can do to reimburse me at all, she said there’s nothing that she could do and everything was fixed. I felt like I was treated unfairly and that the general manager should’ve gave me a little bit more respect. The front and workers were great and very polite and much more helpful than the general manager was. She was very rude and extremely condescending. I almost couldn’t believe she was the GM. I stay at a hotel almost once a month, and for this being one of my most expensive bookings, I’m so shocked how unprofessional she was and disrespectful. Fire her ... you guys can do much better. And update your website’s room pictures, it is almost 2020 and probably 99% of bookings are done online !

title: Off the Charts Cool!!
text: We had a great time at the Gotham! Great staff and excellent location. The room was comfortable, the shower was very nice and the front balcony was inviting and relaxing. You get a real taste of NYC with the view of the city and surrounding skyline. I would highly recommend the Gotham for your visit to the Big Apple for sure!!

title: Spoiled in the penthouse!
text: This is a funky, modern NYC hotel. Well located and extremely hospitable front desk staff. When I arrived I was upgraded because it was my birthday. I know they probably can’t do for everyone but what a great touch and attention to detail.

title: Good location, decent price, some pitfalls for sure.
text:
This hotel is in a great spot.  Makes for easy access to all of the city.  The lobby is fairly small, stark and discreet.  Reception was very nice, and it was quick to check in.  There are two elevators.  entering the room, the door is right in the middle of the room.  There is no corridor.  The room, exclusive of the bathroom, was a perfect rectangle, about 30x11 with the bed to the right and a narrow desk on the wall to the left, with a desk chair and a couch set back about 6ft from the TV on that same wall.  The wall opposite from the entry was all glass.    The bathroom was small but adequate.  

The glass wall was nice, but in mid-town, you were just looking right into another building.  Also, the glass was not soundproof, so at night, you would hear a lot of street noise.  The bed was pretty comfortable.  The room itself was very stark, with no real interest at all.  The couch was old, and saggy.  Not particularly comfortable.  A few times during the stay, housekeeping did not finish the entire room, or just did not come to the room at all.   The thermostat in the room seemed to adjust itself.  If I adjusted it to a position, during the night, it would automatically self-adjust to a different setting.  that was odd, could have been something i misunderstood.  

Overall, It was just ok.  Mainly, it was lacking any type of style or interest in the room.  It was basically 4-white walls and an attached bathroom.  Nothing in the room was comfortable, luxurious or thoughtful.  For the price paid, that was not adequate.

title: Great location
text: Clean, small hotel, friendly staff, and spacious rooms.  Just 2 blocks from Saks 5th ave Christmas display. 3 blocks from time square.  1 1/2 blocks from the beautiful Grand Central station. Can’t ask for more.  Highly recommended this hotel.

title: Great hotel
text: Cool place. Great staff, very helpful & friendly. Fantastic location, right in the center of midtown. A terrace in every room. Very comfy beds, big rooms, awesome experience. Good price, and excellent value for the money. We’ll certainly be back. The Gotham is now our “go-to” place in NYC!!

title: Nice visit to NYC
text: Location great, staff friendly and helpful.  Room was nice size, clean.  A bit tired in some aspects but acceptable for sure.  Bagel shop next door was good. Wolfgang’s restaurant (inside hotel but not part of the hotel) for dinner and drinks a bit pricey but very good. I would stay again.

title: amazing
text: I need to first start off by saying i was very nervous before getting here because of some negative reviews that i had read about the hotel. now let me tell you the TRUTH ! this hotel is AMAZING ! and EVERY single person that works here from the doorman to the front desk and housekeeping were just so nice and so friendly ! the room was just as nice as the pics i saw online. we had booked the room for 7 nights but we were driving back to chicago and because of a bad winter storm we had to extend our stay a couple of extra days and the manager was so nice and  made it possible for us to stay in the same room we had for the extra 2 days that were a last minute decision because of the bad weather. AGAIN I WANT TO MAKE IT CLEAR, DO NOT BELIEVE THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS YOU MAY SEE ON HERE ! THIS IS A GREAT HOTEL AND A AMAZING STAFF !

title: LOVE everything about this hotel
text: The location was perfect, both for my work assignment and leisure activities.  The facility was beautiful and the balcony was an added bonus!  The staff went above and beyond to ensure my visit was enjoyable.

title: would definitely stay again
text: I really liked this hotel. Great location, easy check-in, very clean room. Only four rooms per floor meant much less hallway noise than other NY hotels. 24-hour grocery store next door was convenient.

title: Great location
text:
The service was fantastic!
The gentleman that brought me many diet cokes and a hot water kettle was amazing, and deserves a raise! (Sorry can’t remember your name)
Front desk kind and helpful!
Our room was clean and great having a balcony! 
The bed was very comfortable!
Two thumbs up

title: Eh
text: Room was clean, bed was very comfortable and the location was right in the middle of everything. However we were not thrilled that there was a huge window 5 feet next to our balcony and looked into an office building. Its seems like we had the only room with giant windows next to it. Also our TV didnt work which was fine but when I brought it up the next morning to the front desk they seemed very defensive about it telling us we could have notified the front desk at anytime. Overall good hotel but would not come back for the price.

title: very clean and comfortable
text: The hotel room was very modern, clean and minimal design. I really enjoyed not having carpeting and thought the little balcony was an added bonus. The staff was very responsive. the hotel is a great location and has a quiet lobby.

title: Love this boutique hotel
text:
The location can not be beat. The staff- all of them- were exceptional and friendly. The room had everything we needed and was quite comfortable. The beds were great. But what we appreciated the most was the little balcony! It's nice to actually be able to walk out of your room for air (and a quick cig). 
Loved everything about it.
Tip- the Milk N Honey bagel shop two doors down is STELLAR. And there is a convenience store/ market next door for wine and munchies.

title: Good Simple Accommodation
text:
A reasonably priced well-situated hotel near the train station and theatre district.  The area, however, is not great for restaurants. 

The rooms are modern and well-appointed. The staff are VERY friendly.  No gym or bar area to congregate.

title: Great Room, Great Balcony & Great Location
text: I recently stayed at the Gotham for a girl's trip weekend. The room was a great size, we had a balcony (in NYC which is crazy) and everything was immaculate. I would highly recommend staying at the Gotham Hotel!

title: Worst hotel experience.... EVER!
text: I came into a hotel room where the furniture was in very bad shape, and the balcony door would not close. The night was very cold and the balcony door opened 3 times and the room got extremely cold. I have video showing that the door does not work. After bringing this issue to the front desk manager, insted of getting an appology she began to argue with me telling me that it was my fault that I had a bad night, that all I needed to do was to call the front desk???? All I have to say is that I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: A gem near everything
text:
My wife and I were in town for the Global Citizens festival and wanted a boutique property near all the attractions.  I found the Gotham hotel, just off 5th avenue and jumped on it because it had rooms with private balconies.

This is an awesome boutique hotel near virtually everything.  It was a short walk to Times Square, Central Park, 5th Ave, etc.  There were shops and restaurants everywhere you turned.  The staff was very friendly and helpful. 

Most hotel mini bars will charge you absurd prices for a bag of chips or a soda, however, the rooms at the Gotham come with a $3.00 a day mini bar credit and believe it or not that $3.00 can actually buy you a soft drink and a snack.  The mini bar prices are very reasonable.

The balcony is the selling point.  it gives you a private outdoor space to sit and read, relax etc.  I can't say enough about this property, if you want to be close to the action, but away from the crowd’s book at the Gotham.

title: Very Courtesy, out of their way to accomodate
text: Staff was excellent, held our bags for a whole day after checkout, room was clean and has private balcony. 12/10 would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the city. Close to Train station, and was only a 10 minute ride to Canal st

title: Great location but terrible cleaning
text:
I think the Gotham hotel was located in a great spot and is a lovely hotel. However I had an issue with the cleaning! The same trash and empty bottles were left on the floor for the 3 days we stayed there.
Not a good standard in cleaning given the hotel standard...

title: All's Well That Ends Well
text: As we were staying for two weeks we were disappointed on arrival to discover the private room terrace that had attracted us was infact a very dull space at the back of the hotel completely surrounded by high walls of neighbouring tall buildings that shut out most of the light to both the terrace and the room however ……… we complained and were moved within a day to a room at the front of hotel which was might brighter - although it only had a Juliet balcony we could stand but not sit on.  - Having no terrace but light seemed a much better option than having a brick-wall facing terrace so dull we would definitely never have used it. Having moved, I'd have to say the rest of our 2-week stay was delightful.  The staff in this hotel are exceptional. From cleaning staff to hotel manager they could not have been more helpful and welcoming - well above and beyond the normal. It was a joy to stay there and we did enjoy the very generous credit attached to our mini-bar and many other little touches not normally found in NY hotels!

title: Comfortable!
text: Room is a great size and very comfortable.  Having a balcony was a plus! Location is perfect for midtown with access to Broadway and great restaurants. Having a refrigerator where you can store your own perishables is also an added plus. Very quiet!

title: Not a smoke free hotel
text: Hotel is advertised as rooms being smoke free however, the first night, while lying in bed we discovered that people are permitted smoke on their balcony. I smelled smoke while trying to go to sleep so contacted reception and was informed guests are permitted to smoke on their balcony regardless of being advertised on their own website as a smoke free hotel. This would not be a huge issue but our AC was broken and the room at over 80 degrees f so we had to keep the balcony door open or boil. With tobacco and cannabis smoke triggering migraines for one of use, this became an issue. Reception did not care. This was an issue all nights and days of our stay. Housekeeping was great the first two days but the second two days nothing. No bed made and no fresh towels. No one came. No trash taken out. I asked front desk for fresh towels and someone brought them up as I was told housekeeping had gone home for the day. No apology. The facility itself is quite nice. Great location, spacious rooms, clean lines and clean rooms, great showers and space. I would recommend for those who smoke but for others beware.

title: Great experience!
text:
I really loved this hotel.  The location is great, walking distance to a few big attractions as well as easy access to public transit.  There was also pubs, coffee shops and other places for food and drinks within walking distance.  
Each person that worked there greeted us with a smile and seemed genuinely happy to be working there.  
Our room was wonderful!  We stayed in a junior suite with terrace and we were very pleased!  The room was spacious and clean.  The terrace was great and we enjoyed having coffee each morning and ending our nights with a drink while enjoying the sights and sounds of the city.  
We were pleased to have full size umbrellas available to us as it was raining the day we arrived.  The wi-fi was great and worked well throughout the stay.  
We were even pleased with their responsiveness to a billing issue after we returned home.  We got our credit card bill and noticed we’d been double charged for our room.  We called and spoke to a pleasant woman who tried to address our issue and when she couldn’t, took our info to pass on to her manager who would be in the next morning.  We received a call back right away the next morning and they were able to quickly resolve the issue!  
If and when we return to New York City, this hotel will be at the top of the list to stay at again!!

title: Super pour une virée dans la big Apple !
text:
On commence par le négatif pour terminer avec le positif 🤩
2 petits points négatifs : La climatisation faisait pas mal de bruit et nous étions un peu à l'étroit dans la salle de douche..

Voilà ! Passons au positif ! 😁
• Hôtel très sympa et très bien localisé (proche de la 5e Avenue et de Time square) ! 🤩
• La chambre est spacieuse avec un lit très confortable😴 
• Nous avons aimé l'idée de recevoir une petite carte tous les jours afin de nous indiquer la météo du lendemain, ainsi que les petits chocolats qui l'accompagné 😊
• J'adore la déco de l'accueil et des ascenseurs 🤩
• Je terminerai avec un très gros point positif pour le personnel de l'hôtel qui est accueillant, à l'écoute, très souriant, ... un plaisir de les retrouver chaque matin, ainsi qu'a chaque fin de journée ! 

Merci beaucoup pour ce séjour ! 👍🏻

title: Bridal week
text: I loved the Gotham Hotel!  I was there for work and I loved sitting out on my patio after walking all over the city.  I highly recommend them.  Its a small boutique hotel, and they treated us amazingly during our 4 night stay.  FYI the restaurant was pricey but that porterhouse steak was well worth it!

title: Very Noisey
text:
Well good location, staff were very pleasant (except after hrs) restaurant on site was nice but not run by hotel.  Rooms well appointed, clean and great location to 5th ave. Thats where it ends.  First room was at the back and looked out to other buildings, thats fine, but what was obviously a problem here is there are major extractor fans on the ground level (restaurant and hotels)and the noise was like being next to a airplane on a run way, probably exagerated by the noise funnelling up between the buildings. Thinking they would turn off at a certain time, they didn't. In room air con also very noisey and had to be turned off.
Impossible to sleep, when contacted reception at about midnight, they said couldnt do anything except offer ear plugs.
Next morning front desk assisted by excellent bell boy showed us around other rooms which we took(this being first time ever). From the reaction of staff and comments made this is no doubt a problem here.  There was also construction out side the next room facing front of hotel but that started at 6.30am so we could live with that.

title: Not Up to Snuff
text:
We were disappointed in our stay at the Gotham Hotel. Although once we called attention to the deficiencies in our room, the staff brought us what was missing or what was not right, but we thought we should not have had these issues in the first place. To be specific, when we got in our room which was "ready", the shade on the window was twisted so did not go all the way down, the coffeemaker had the last guest's used coffee pods in it and the canister was half-filled with the last guest's water, we only had one hand towel in the bathroom, and there was no shower soap. There were also no paper cups for the coffee and only one caffienated coffee pod for the coffee maker, no decaf.  Upon calling housekeeping, these things were rectified in short order but was interrupting.
The lobby is very small and commercial and to use the restroom on the ground floor, one must go down a floor on the elevator and walk through a long hallway of dirty cleaning equipment, rags, etc. to reach the unisex bathroom. Otherwise the desk clerks at the hotel were friendly and the doorman was helpful with directions and putting luggage in the car.

title: Great service!
text: My mom and I shared a room. Room was clean, safe and very convenient. But the real plus here was the hospitality! A diamond in the rough!! All front desk personnel were super helpful and friendly. Housekeeping and maintenance attended to our needs quickly. And all doormen were extremely cordial and greeted us every time. Artan was extremely knowledgeable about NYC, very upbeat with an infectious personality. Forget about cranky New Yorkers, Artan was wonderful!

title: What a find !!!
text: My wife and I love this hotel.  It is a short block walk to an entrance to Grand Central Station for Subway access.  It is between Madison and 5th Ave for great shopping.  The community balcony and the private balconies are great for those who enjoy being outdoors.  Can't imagine staying anywhere else when we visit Manhattan.

title: Good location but some Cleaning Issues
text: The hotel is well located close to the business district and also close to many restaurants. I had two bad experiences with some cleaning experiences, the person in charge of cleaning left cleaning supplies in the room, and also forgot to leave the towel for the floor outside of the shower, and when the floor got wet I slipped and almost fell. The floor in the room was very dusty all 5 days during my stay. The hotel doesn't have any commitment with the environment and my towel was changed 4 times on a 5 day stay even though I left the towel hung in the wall.

title: Exactly what we wanted!
text: The room was perfect, exactly what we had hoped for on our wedding night. We loved all of the amenities, and the staff even gave us a few surprise gifts which was wonderful. The privacy of the penthouse being on its own floor was amazing, and having the private balconies was incredible! Also special shoutout to Artan for being an amazing help both checking in and out!

title: Great location
text: We had a great stay at the Gotham. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was spacious and we enjoyed the balcony. The location was great for getting around the city. Would recommend this place

title: Great hotel
text: The Gotham hotel was just perfect for us we stayed there for 5 nights. The staff were so nice and friendly and our room was lovely, I picked a room with a balcony and it was lovely to sit out on at night and have a drink, the view was just of a office block but this really didn’t bother us as by that time we  were just glad to sit down and chill out. The location was perfect.not right in the madness but within walking distance to everything. I would highly recommend staying at the Gotham hotel.

title: Gotham Greatness
text:
We just got back from our stay at the Gotham
Hotel and we loved it! The room was huge by New York City standards. The staff was so friendly and accommodating! They upgraded us to a King Balcony on the 17th floor and even though it wasn’t on the midtown side- we saw the backside facade of buildings, we had great snippets from our windows and the corner of our balcony. It was still stunning!
Standouts:
-Space to move around
-Comfortable King Size Bed
-Blackout Shades were clutch if you like a dark room to sleep in
-Clean
-Heavenly Shower with rainfall head and detachable wand
-You’re able to use the terraces on any floor 19th-roof. We bought stuff to make a charcuterie board and just watched a glimpse of the lights from Times Square on our last night. It was perfect and magical!
-Wolfgang’s Steakhouse in the Lobby was phenomenal! The Ribeye can be split between two and was so tender and delicious!
-The hotel is close to a coffee shop- The Gregory and lots of good food/restaurants.

Minor issues:
-Balcony Door kept popping open, but later found you have to lift the handle up in order to lock it properly
-None if the tv channels work- including the local free ones. But let’s be honest, you’re not in NYC to watch TV!
-We weren’t as close to subway stops, but Grand Central was a 7-10 minute walk away

Overall, we loved our experience at the Gotham! We will definitely stay here again!!

title: Location location location
text: As good as you can get location wise.  The hotel is modern, clean, recently renovated.  Great steakhouse in the lobby.  Whether business or pleasure, it’s always my first choice. Located leas than a block away from Grand Central, a 10 minute walk to Rockefeller Center. Excellent

title: The Best!
text: Should you ever visit NYC...I highly recommend The Gotham Hotel!! As a New Yorker I booked a stay for my birthday! Clean, comfortable, roomy and stylish! Super friendly amazing and professional staff! Balcony!!! Delicious food from Wolfgang Puck's steakhouse (conveniently located on the lobby level). Smack in the middle of tourist attractions. Resonable rates!!!

title: Disappointing
text: Having stayed here many times will not be staying again. They put me in a taxi to some hole in Times Square because they screwed up the booking despite me calling four times to make sure they wouldn't

title: Convenient mid town
text:
Unfortunately, my stay at the Gotham was during the UN General Assembly so the hotel rate was jacked WAY up!  I (my company) paid well over $600 for the night I spent there.  Certainly not worth that.  The room was nice, functional, but not overly comfortable or well-kept.  The bath towels, for example, were rough and ragged -  they should have been donated to an animal shelter.  I had no hot water in the sink and it did not drain well. The clock radio displayed the wrong time and I couldn't figure out how to adjust it.  The AC was LOUD!

On the plus side, the balcony was a cool feature, although I did not use it.  The bed was comfortable and the TV worked fine. The desk was nice and the desk chair was very good. The shower was pretty excellent and the overall look is sleek and modern. 

The good news for me was that my co-worker stayed at the Lotte Palace for the same price but was subjected to luggage searches, Secret Service presence, and general inability to move freely in the hotel because of the UN meetings.  No such issue at The Gotham!  

This hotel is very convenient to my company's NYC office (two blocks away), so I may very well stay here again as long as the price is right.

title: Rob and Shelley
text:
Our first night was a little problematic with toilet and patio door problems, not to mention that the room we were given was not the room in the photo. That being said we were moved the next night to room 101.
Alfredo was the best to meet all your needs in an extremely prompt and professional service. I compensated him well for all my demands. 
Will definitely be returning for future visits.
My best to the chef at Wolfgang's and all the staff at Gotham that made our stay very comfortable.

title: Great hotel
text: We were looking for a hotel at the last minute, so we booked The Gotham Hotel. We were very satisfied with the service and the reasonable price. Our room was great, very clean, comfy and quiet, with a small balcony. Only minor drawback: It is a few blocks from Time square, and that's why Uber and taxi exists.

title: Birthday weekend for spouse in NYC
text: Great location; good size room for NYC hotel; good service;  Wolfgangs Steakhouse  restaurant in lobby is delicious;  parking garage directly across street.  Dunkin Donuts and another nice gourmet coffee shop right next store.   Convenient location to Rockefellar  Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Saks 5th Ave, etc.

title: Disappointed Honeymooners - Overcharged and underwhelmed.
text: Just days after getting married, we arrived in the city for our honeymoon and checked into the Gotham Hotel to be disappointed from the very start by the deceiving photos presented online that alluded to a much more grand and welcoming hotel. Our AC broke in the night resulting in horrible sleep and the bed was not comfortable at all. The room size was the only plus about our stay. We clearly stated that we were on our honeymoon and asked for a room with a view and were then placed in a room facing the concrete wall in the back. We would not recommend this hotel to others as we were not only disappointed by the hotel but also the customer service, or lack there of, from the staff members. We were also charged to check out of the hotel early, when the AC didn't even work - the management made us feel as though it was our fault that their hotel rooms were inadequate.

title: NYFW
text:
This boutique hotel is situated in an ideal location! There’s a mini-market a couple of doors down and close to 5th Ave/Madison for an amazing shopping experience.

My room (Midtown King) was very large for NY standards and there was a small balcony with a table and chairs. There was not much of a view but it’s NYC and you’re lucky to even have an outdoor area. 

The staff on the front desk were always very kind and accommodating! 

There’s a small restaurant connected to the hotel. It was always quiet there and great service.

Overall, I recommend this hotel if you’re interested in staying near Midtown while in NYC. While it is a boutique and does not have many amenities, their location and large style rooms make up for it!

title: Clean, Great Location
text:
The location of the hotel is great, and the room itself was very clean, if somewhat small. The people at the door and front desk seemed nice. The street noise at night was very manageable by my standards, even though we weren't on one of the higher floors (floor 8).

Only complaints are that the shower took a curiously long time to warm up (~5-10 minutes), though once it did the water pressure was good. There's also only one trashcan to share between the room/bathroom, which is a little inconvenient.

Overall a good stay - would stay again for work!

title: Great accommodations
text:
We really enjoyed our stay at Gotham.
The entire staff including the manager were above and beyond, pleasant, helpful and accommodating. 
Our room was beautiful. The private balcony and terrace were great. 
We will most definitely be back to stay again. Whenever we are in NYC, Gotham will be our hotel of choice. 
Thank you for making our stay so pleasant.

title: Très bien et parfaitement situé
text: Cet hôtel est très beau, très propore et parfaitement situé. Nous n'avions pas l'impression d'être au coeur de la ville, car c'est très bien insonorisé. Tout est à proximité et vous pourrez faire plusieurs visites à pied. Je vous le recommande.

title: nice stay
text: everything was great, we were offered a different room immediately as the first was not according to our booking - room was big, clean and nicely decorated (only thing that could be enhanced is lightning, it was cosy but sometimes too dark). Staff is always friendly and helping whenever needed.

title: Nothing like what it advertised
text:
The horribly decrepited, run-down, beat up, dirty with moths flying in the room, horrific state of this hotel made me leave right away. It had brown painted wooden bedframe and desk instead of real furnitures and the paint had been chipping for a long time... the bed had pieces of wood missing. The ac was crammed with dust and dirt and the balcony overlooking a brickwall in construction. The hotel looked NOTHING like the stylish pictures it advertised. It looked like a backpacking student Hostel. No gym. The phone was not even working and the closet couldnt open because of the stained fridge.
The clerk screamed at me « that its my fault i get rooms like this because I book with the cheapest hotel-booking sites » and that this is whats i get.
They refused to refund me, even the general manager and we had to open an investiguation and major complain w the reservation site, who of course reimbursed me when they saw the pictures and agreed this was unlivable conditions. 
The worst experience of my life. 
It looked so cute online... its the MOST AWEFUL hostel i ever seen. Do not take a chance

title: Perfect Little Hotel
text: Friendly check-in and staff were very helpful with information. Our room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. Loved the blackout shades. And the Minibar/fridge. There was a nice note welcoming us to the hotel along with a small bottle of Merlot and chocolate bar which was a nice touch.  We had also reserved a room with a balcony.  Unfortunately, ours did not have a nice view so you might inquire about that before reserving if that is important to you.  Too, it was very noisy out there.  Great location. Nice restaurant and bar on location, although did not eat here, the bar staff was attentive and knew exactly how to prepare my cocktail.  Would definitely consider staying here again when in the city.

title: Modern & Clean
text: I love love love the “no rug” in the rooms. It felt so clean. The bed was extremely comfortable and the staff was very sweet. All the rooms had books on the nightstand and I stated reading one and they told me to take it! It’s the little touches that mean a lot. The little bar/restaurant was delicious too. Excellent price! I’ll be back soon!

title: Excellent location
text: Excelente location. Very good Service. Close to. 5th ave and Time square. Definitely an incredible option for couples vacation. The size of the suite it’s perfect for two. Clean and modern. The restaurant it’s very good specially  The  rib eye steak.

title: Don’t Book this place
text: Currently staying here in a Junior Suite, it’s dirty, tired, noisy, & definitely not what the photos or hotel description states. The housekeeping is shocking, the noise levels outside are constant & we are unable to sleep because of it 😢, asked if we could move to another room & told they are full & only have suites on the 14,15 & 16 floors the noise level will not be any better housekeeping did come and clean the dust from the wall rail above the bed & the units but the sofa & carpet are just as bad it’s definitely not Boutique & modern, the website pictures are totally false, the room balcony  looks nothing like the one attached to the suite gallery which was what we were most looking forward too using, the bathroom is tired stained & definitely not welcoming, it’s really heartbreaking & completely ruined out once in lifetime treat , we are here to celebrate our wedding anniversary 50th birthday’s & time on our own totally gutted 😢.

title: Great Location with a boutique feel
text: Right near the Theatre district. Walking distance to so much. Wonderful staff. Bright, renovated and clean. Soft bed. Rain shower. We couldn't have asked for more. Gregory's delicious coffee next door for me and Dunkin for my husband two doors down. I highly recommend the Gotham Hotel

title: Feels like family
text: I stayed at here while going to school in the diamond distric and after stressful days it was so nice to come “home” to the Gotham. The staff was all so friendly, wishing you a good day and opening the door for you coming in and out. Everyone was so wonderful and made you feel like part of their family. The room was clean and plenty of towels and such. The bed and pillows were so comfortable, with my bad back it was nice to sleep well and wake up feeling good. The location was just outside all the craziness so it was the perfect place to relax!

title: Excellent staff and a great location
text: I stayed here 2 nights for business trip. Spacious rooms, private balcony and amazing staff.. especially Shaun who always had a smile on his face. Made my day on both days when leaving to office. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Manhattan area..

title: Gotham Midtown NYC Very Good
text: Well run 4 to 4.5 star lodging.  Good restaurant in building. Everything clean, decoration pretty new. Not ultra luxury, but good space, well kept, and a fair value for NYC. It's small, so elevators are fast, it's extremely quiet, too.

title: Very Nice Stay
text: Room was fairly large for NYC.  Very clean.  The front dest staff was very friendly.  The small balcony was a unique feature.  Great location for seeing the city.  Only minor complaint is the AC unit is a little loud.

title: Gotham Hotel - NYC
text: Excellent service, comfortable and clean accommodations, and perfect location for walking to Times Square and/or catching subway. Front desk staff friendly and always helpful. We will definitely stay here next time!

title: Thank You Gotham
text: Spent this last week at the Gotham and i have to say it was the perfect discreet hotel right in the center of midtown, and i could not be more pleased with the wonderful staff. My room was always cleaned when i returned from daily meetings, and Alex was always at the door to greet me. The front desk agent Aditya and Julissa if i'm not mistaken were very great conversationalist and always gave great recommendations on where to grab a bite to eat. They also have a nice restaurant in the hotel, however the lobby does get pretty noisy. Other than that If your looking to stay for a few days in around midtown, look no further than the Gotham

title: Room with a view
text: Great balcony with table for outdoor coffee relaxing watching the city come alive . Great room layout with couch and a desk for working as well as light from Times Square . Only downside is No twin beds .

title: High Hopes for a Nice Stay, But We Were Very Much Mistaken
text: Room was large but dimly lit. A/C unit was very loud making it difficult to sleep. Small, well lit bathroom was ok, but in need of TLC. Balcony was dark and dingy with a view of the adjacent brick building, very noisy a/c units and vents and trash bags below.  Phone did not work for internal or external calls.  Nespresso coffee machine did not function properly so we were unable to make coffee.  Reported these issues, but as far as we could tell nothing was done to fix the problems.  1st morning we left room and arrived back at 3pm. Room was not cleaned. Went to front desk and asked that the room be serviced as we needed towels.  Said she would have this done.  2-1/2 hours later we returned to the hotel and the room still was not cleaned.  Once again went down to front desk and asked that it be cleaned. Was told that they had until 8pm to clean the rooms.  Said ok, but we had asked 2-1/2 hours ago to please have this done.  Waited additional 1/2 hour in lobby for them to go to service room.  Upon returning to room we found we had no cold water.  Tried to shower and scalding hot water streamed through the shower head.  Called the front desk on my cell and she told me someone would be right up.  Waited 45 minutes and no one came to room.  Once again called front desk and was told that the engineer left at 8pm and he said to continue to run the water and that may work.  He did  not know what was wrong.  No one was coming to address this problem.  I asked if we could be moved to another room and was told that no rooms were available and there was nothing she could do.  She told us she was sorry we were having such a bad stay and was sending an email to the hotel manager to tell her of this and the other problems we were experiencing at this hotel.  2nd morning the water was fine.  That evening no hot water.  The low battery warning beep was sounding off on our room smoke detector.  I called the front desk from my cell and was told someone would be right up to fix the problem.  Waited 20 minutes and no one came to the room.  We went by the front desk and told her we were going to dinner and asked that this be fixed before we returned.  When we returned to our room the beeping had ceased.  Morning of check out, we had just enough lukewarm water to take quick showers.  We were going to wait for the hotel manager to arrive so we could speak to her but had to leave to catch our transportation home.  We never heard from the manager during or after our stay!

title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!
text:
So I wanted to advise all future visitors of NYC, or people just looking for a getaway or a place to park to STAY AWAY from SP Plus Corporation on 38 West 46th Street, and the Gotham Hotel 16 East 46th Street.  
  I decided to book a weekend getaway for my girlfriend for her birthday. I went to Hotels.com and found the Gotham Hotel, they advertise in room couples massages, and a room with a balcony and a view of NYC. The pictures are MISLEADING to say the least. Within the hour we checked in, we were on the phone with Hotels.com trying to check out. Our view was a brick wall, the walls are so thin you can hear the people next door taking out the trash, wall fixings and furniture are dirty and falling apart, and the customer service is AWFUL!! Nevermind, the in room couples massages are at some random apartment in the city not even the hotel. We had the representative of hotels.com contact the hotel manager and the hotel manager said “SORRY WE WILL NOT REINBURST YOUR MONEY FOR YOUR HOTEL VISIT, WE WILL NOT CHANGE YOUR ROOM they are “ALL FULL” , WE ARE SORRY YOU CANT CONNECT TO THE WIFI YOUR THE FIRST THIS HAS HAPPENED TOO, GOOD LUCK.” Thank god Hotels.com was so accommodating and got us into a different room , in a different hotel with a credit so we didn’t have to pay much for a much better hotel. We were also handed a voucher for free parking up too 24 hours by the Gotham Hotel. We got to SP Plus parking garage by 2pm and HAD TO PAY 40 DOLLARS.My girlfriend and I were utterly baffled by the fact we had to pay for parking after being told we had free parking. This changed the whole course of our trip.. I am now out about 240 for the hotel, 22 for the resort fees we didn’t use, and 40 for the parking totaling to a whopping 302 DOLLAR TOTAL. We went back to the Gotham Hotel and asked why we didn’t receive the free parking they promised with the voucher and they recanted there previous statements of free parking and said we got a “discount”. When in all reality there was no discount. Moral of this story is that I would steer clear of The Gotham Hotel and SP Parking Plus Corporation because they are both scamming visitors and are rather misleading!!!!!

title: The most comfortable bed and uniquely designed rooms
text:
Thank you Kristine! She was very helpful, friendly, and informative. 

Every room has a terrace. The bed was like sinking into a cloud. The room was incredibly spacious and had very rich books scattered throughout the room. They had a Nespresso machine too. 

Do not let the exterior of hotel fool you. I assure you, the rooms make this place worth every cent. Blows some of the nearby hotels for the equivalent price right out of the water.

title: More Pros than Con
text: We spent two nights.. PROS: The hotel was in a very good location. The rooms were clean and the balcony is nice to have. The City was 98 degrees while we were there and we were able to get the room down to 75, so that made the stay more enjoyable. CON: Security. There is no room key required for the elevator and the lobby isn't always staffed. Someone pounded on our door  and woke us at 12:45AM on our second night, asking if we wanted ice!

title: we had issues
text:
negatives: hotel under construction; room air conditioner had to run during heat wave but was so loud, we could not sleep well; only one chair in room for sitting; we didn't receive parking voucher in time to avoid high parking charges at garage hotel had recommended
positives: front desk was able to give me bandaid when asked; bellhop assisted with directions to taxi driver

title: Great Hotel
text: We came during the heat wave and so the only bad thing about the stay was that the air conditioner wasn’t great — not their fault. Location, food, etc. was perfect. Pretty comfortable bed. Good views.

title: A good hotel but a few issues
text:
We stayed at the Gotham for 2 nights and overall found it a good property, but experienced a few minor issues that individually were ok, but combined were frustrating.

Pro’s
- good location, near Times Square and 5th Avenue
- friendly and attentive staff
- large modern room
- clean 
- fast Wi-Fi 

Con’s
- toilet kept running - we didn’t report it so not the hotels fault as they didn’t know about it
- the in room phone stopped working and then started beeping. When we mentioned to the front desk they said several guests had reported the same issue. Despite asking for someone to fix it twice, no one did. We had to pull the battery out of the handset to make it stop. 
- we were out of our room from 0930-1630 and came back and the room had not yet been serviced. We spoke with the front desk who advised they had 40 rooms to be serviced for customers checking out which were given priority. I asked if we could have our room serviced and mini bar restocked at 1930 when we were going out and was told the latest they could do was 1900 as the staff finished at 1900. We decided to just go without the room being serviced. The minibar was later restocked but they missed replacing certain items.
- room lighting was minimal and the room was dark despite large windows

Would we stay her again? Probably yes, the issues we experienced were minor, it was more about how they did or didn’t follow up that was the issue for us. They gave us a 1 hour later checkout which really didn’t make that much difference. Nice hotel, friendly staff who generally tried to be helpful, just need to work on following up and their service recovery.

title: Amazing Hotel!
text: This hotel is AWESOME! It's not often you can find a hotel in manhattan with a decent size room AND balcony! It's got everything you need and conveniently located for easy access to all parts of the city.

title: Fabulously placed for all you want on a trip tp NYC
text:
The Gotham is a quirky little place on E 46th just off Madison avenue and about 5 mins walk from Times Square. It genuinely couldnt be in  better place to get all your sightseeing done and have a great base to stay as well. We had a Jr Skyline suite which was spacious and clean and tidy. the only reason i didnt give the review the full 5 stars was that the decor was tired in places and plasterwork was bubbling off along the window, there was also a nasty chip taken out of the shower cubicle door that left a sharp edge that could cut. The aircon unit was pretty noisy as well. That all said the bed was suprmemly comfortable and the room well appointed. You also had a private balcony which we sadly didnt use that much as we were out sight seeing for 18 hours a day. Its pretty noisy out there but hey, youre in New York, its noisy everywhere!! deal with it!
The staff were all beyond helpful, anything we asked for we recievced and nothing was too much trouble. The bed was turned down everyday and the room cleaned.
We wouldnt hesitate in returning to the Gotham - Also, like a lot of NYC hotels, you dont get breakfast, but next door is Gregorys Coffee who do the most amazing Banana Poundcake!, next door again is a small deli selling the most amazing serve yourself breakfasts as well - but agsin, Its NYC - you'll never go hungry!

title: Great overnight getaway!
text: Had tickets to see Eric Roberson on a Sunday night and didn’t feel like driving home so we decided to stay in the city. Gotham Hotel was comfortable, roomy (especially by NYC standards) with beautiful modern decor. The minibar was great with nice snacks, top shelf alcohol and a Cabernet Sauvignon that was delicious. My only complaint is the bathroom is pretty small but how much time are you really going to spend in there anyway. We booked the room via website and got a great rate. We stayed in a king room with balcony which was quite nice. I’d stay here again for a quick getaway or an extended stay. It’s a really nice place.

title: Dark and depressing
text:
Last time that I stayed at this hotel, they put me up on a high floor facing the back.  This time they gave me #22, on the second floor facing the street.  Even though it was sunny out, there was barely any sunlight, so the pictures posted by the hotel were deceptive.

In terms of location, I liked the fact that it was 3 blocks away from GCS, easily accessible by MetroNorth and subways.

Hotel has no gym, but there’s a NYSC in the GCS terminal.

Room was spacious, albeit dark, as previously mentioned.  There’s a half size fridge.  The Nespresso machine was a joke, can’t put any water in the tanks without causing any flooding.  While the furnishing was contemporary, there were some dents on the doors and could use some updates.

title: 3 nights in NY
text: Hotel was great, clean, all you need for a room and a great balcony to sit on and enjoy the sounds and view of the city, very close walking distance to the theatres. Reasonably priced for the location.

title: Large Room but some Water Problem
text:
Water temperature in the room was not stable -- got really hot even when it was meant to be cold.
Otherwise, this hotel always has been a good place to stay because of the large space for the price.  The location is good, too.  We hope the water issue will be resolved before we return.

title: The Gotham: not up to snuff
text: Overall, this hotel was a letdown. There was no safe for valuables in the room nor a minibar. The level of quality fell far short of the room rate. The one good thing about this place is its central location, but there are other, better hotels in the area that also have this feature.

title: Convenient location between Grand Central & Rockefeller Center
text: We were pleased to be just 3 blocks from each landmark.  The hotel staff was friendly and helpful.  Our room faced 46th St; had a mini- balcony.  The bathroom was well lit, but short of shelf space for 2 people.  The nearby blocks had stores for every need, including a Barnes & Noble.  Our sole complaint was the noisy room air conditioner.

title: Cool penthouse with balcony
text:
We stayed four nights at the penthouse with balcony on both sides. Location is great for central Manhattan. Staff was friendly and provided us with more coffee for the room upon request. Room had very modern interior. Housekeeping came very late every day. 
Hairdryer level 2 out of 5...

title: Girls getaway
text:
Great location!! Great staff!!! Highly recommend this hotel!! All the staff there were extremely accommodating- treating you like family. 
About a 6 minute walk to Time Square, 15 minute walk to the park. When booking, ask for a balcony as opposed to a Juliet Balcony. Much more room with a table and 2 chairs Parking garage is 2 blocks away. Overall, an amazing stay.

title: Simple, efficient, convenient
text: Nice food at the steakhouse; good breakfasts, convenient location. Employees were considerate, and assisted in several ways including finding a phone charger for me.  It is a no frills place, with the exception that the bar and restaurant have elegance and good food and drink.

title: מלון מרווח ומרכזי
text: מלון בוטיק ממוקם בין השדרה החמישית למדיסון ברח' 46 - מקום מרכזי מאד קרוב לרוקפלר סנטר, לטיימס סקוואר ולאמצעי תחבורה ציבורית. החדר גדול מאד ומרווח עם מקרר משקאות ומכונת קפה. בקומות גבוהות יש מרפסת לכל חדר וקיימות מרפסות לכל האורחים בקומות 19-23 שצופות על העיר. אנשי הקבלה מאד קשובים לבקשות האורחים. יש ליקויים קלים בסידור החדר כגון מילוי המשקאות החסרים במקרר, ניקויון החדר ואספקת מגבות וכד'

title: I cannot say enough good things!
text: To begin with, Tina who was working the front desk was simply amazing! She went out of her way to make us feel welcome. She gave us good advice on how things work in NY, which was extremely helpful since this was our first time. The hotel was located in the perfect place and we walked almost everywhere we went. The room was larger than I expected and very clean, and well appointed. The room had a Nespresso coffee maker, much better than the one you commonly find in hotels. The entire staff was friendly and helpful, but it seemed like Tina was always there to greet us with a smile. I don't write reviews often, but I had to let the world know about this jewel the middle of Midtown Manhattan.

title: Hospedagem férias
text: A localização e os quartos são ótimos. Mas definitivamente não conte com a eficácia dos funcionários para nada. Decepcionante. Por 3 noites seguidas pedimos refrigerantes e água porém no primeiro dia nos disseram que não tinham (?), e nas demais nos servirão as bebidas quentes (alegaram que eles não tem geladeira...). Não repuseram nosso frigobar nem uma vez durante a estadia mesmo pedindo com antecedência na recepção. Teve um dia que simplesmente não haviam arrumado o quarto mesmo com a plaquinha na porta pedindo para isso. Chegamos cansados depois dos passeios e tivemos que sair do quarto para que fosse arrumado. Não há serviço de quarto (comidas) para aqueles que chegam cansados da viagem pela noite/madrugada. Enfim.... com certeza não me hospedaria novamente neste hotel. Serviço nota zero.

title: Fantastic Property with Amazing Staff
text: My 13 year old really wanted to see the Statue of Liberty so we took the train up from Philly and booked a room at the Gotham Hotel.  We weren’t disappointed!  The location was excellent, in a very walkable neighborhood with excellent food and drink options close by.  The room was very clean, and tastefully decorated with a modern feel.  They even had a small bottle of wine and the most amazing red velvet chocolate bar!  We were already very impressed with the location, but when my son realized he had forgotten his favorite hat in the room when we were halfway to Philly, the hotel staff had already put it aside and returned it to us FedEx on the same day!  Can’t say enough about this place and we will definitely be staying again!!

title: We would stay again!
text: We loved our visit! The hotel was in a great location and the rooms were the perfect size.  The staff was great and Shaun, the door man, went above and beyond to help us during our stay. We would recommend to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Stared at a huge, dirty brick wall?
text:
I purchased a higher level room w/ 'Terrace' for my son and I for Father's Day.  
The "Terrace" was in the back of the building, All I could see is a huge brick wall with millions of air conditioners buzzing loud, and dripping down from higher floors.
It was horrible.  The hotel was obviously not booked at capacity and I guarantee they could have put us to the front of the building where we could have a city view.  What a dump, will never stay there again for 300 a night (Not a bad price for the city, but not for this shole)

title: Best NY Boutique hotel -Balcony’s and loft feel
text:
This property is AMAZING! Super cool location, cozy beds, large loft rooms, killer staff, delicious coffee in room! We loved it
Very rare to have the cool balconies to relax at night.  One of our new favorites ❣️

title: Luxe with added glamour
text: The evening we spent at the Gotham was the perfect way to end our holiday. The staff were exceptional, the room was immaculately clean and superbly decorated. We didn't experience a hitch - from the moment we checked in with 7 pieces of luggage to the time we departed. Ideally located in the central Manchester precinct we enjoyed visiting nearby museums and art galleries. A meal at Honey is a must do - perhaps the only less than 5 star experience was the breakfast service - no chef that morning.

title: Location ideale e massimo confort
text: Hotel ubicato direi nella location ideale per stare a due passi dalle maggiori attrazioni di Manhattan ma tuttavia leggermente spostati rispetto al caos e al frastuono di Times Square che comunque stà a poco più di 5 m a piedi. Hotel non molto appariscente, entrata quasi anonima, senza grandi saloni e sfarzi ma pulito, efficiente con camere spaziose, moderne e ben arredate e ciliegina sulla torta, ogni camera ha una veranda/terrazza dove volendo è anche consentito fumare. Complimenti allo staff e alla direzione, tutto prefetto.

title: Customer service is incredible!
text: I came in for meetings in Midtown and stayed 2 nights. The first night, I checked in super late and was given what was the very last room available, which was horrible. 2nd floor, scaffolding right outside the window, dark, noisy.  I didn't sleep at all, went downstairs and told them I'd need a different room or would have to cancel my 2nd night. They told me I should get my bags ready to go and they'd switch me to a higher floor the minute it became available . I wasn't confident.  I went back to my room composing in my head the flaming review I'd give the hotel on tripadvisor. Nonetheless, I told them my bags were packed and I'd be back at 3:30 hoping to be given a different room.  Came back at 3:00, they greeted me by name and gave me the key to a room on the 17th floor, back of the building, WITH a balcony! I had the best night's sleep of my life that second night. I'll stay there again for sure, but will request a high level room in the back.

title: Exceptional Hotel and Staff
text: I can’t say enough about the staff here. We loved, loved our 4 night stay. Front desk staff and doormen were so friendly and attentive. They went out of their way to help with directions and subway navigation. No matter what we needed, it arrived within minutes. Our cleaning staff was fabulous and the room was meticulously cleaned everyday. We were within walking distance of everything and absolutely loved the location. We’d definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. We also loved the 10$ mini bar credit which we received each day. I hated to leave this place. Thank you for making our first trip to NYC a simply amazing vacation. Lynn and Marcel Halifax NS Canada

title: Gotham Hotel
text: Excellent stay. Room is very conveniently located to Grand Central, which was perfect as I had meetings on 14th street and could easily be on the subway. Staff was friendly, room clean. I would stay there again for sure.

title: Would not return......
text: What can I say? Not enough room for me to say it all on here. Had problem after problem since arriving here. It was meant to be a celebration and holiday of a lifetime but I wish I had started somewhere else.

title: Excellent Boutique Hotel- Highly Recommend
text: We stayed at the Gotham Hotel for a week during a family trip. The hotel is located on 46th street near 5th Avenue. Walking distance to Times Square, NY Public Library, 5th Avenue Shopping, Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, etc. We booked a Jr Suite on the 15th floor. The terrace was amazing, the view was magnificent. Room was large, impeccably clean and very comfortable. The staff was great and helped us with everything. We are at Wolfgang’s and the food was amazing. I would definitely stay here again and again! What a great boutique hotel! ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️

title: The Gotham hotel
text: The hotel was superb, location was fabulous short walking distances to many tourist attractions, ie Grand central Station ,Central Park, Bryant park St Patrick's Cathedral and many more. The rooms were very spacious and clean with daily cleaning services , beds comfortable. All staff were very curtious, professional, helpful and friendly at all times nothing too much for them to do for you. Would highly recommend this hotel will return to this hotel on my next visit.

title: Nice surprise
text:
Great location. Room, bed and bathroom is bigger than you would expect in NYC.

 I will consider staying there again. One of the nicer hotels in NYC. Good bang for your buck especially in mid town. About a 3-5 minute walk to GCT

title: Great hotel
text: Hotel was great, will definitely stay here again. This is the second time that I have been to New York and I wish I stayed here the first time. Hotel in a great location, service was great, everyone was nice.

title: Cómodo y bien ubicado.
text: El hotel esta bien ubicado, si se quiere estar en el centro de Manhattan, a tres cuadras de Times Square. La habitación muy cómoda y limpia. La atención en el front desk excelente, con muy buena predisposición. Sin dudas volvería.

title: Excellent Hotel, highly recommended
text: I stayed here May 18th and I highly recommend this hotel! Christina couldn't have been nicer. Stored our luggage before check-in and after check out so that we could continue to enjoy the city. The hotel is a about 3blocks or a short 10 minute walk from Time Square. We had a Grand king balcony room, and it was beyond nice. Huge walk in shower, and private balcony with a comfy outdoor couch and lots of privacy. Just steps from our door was another outside balcony overlooking the city. It felt like our own private floor as there were just 2 rooms to a floor. We will definitely book this hotel when we go back and I will recommend it to anyone I know looking to stay in NYC.

title: Clean Room Perfect for Sleeping
text: The Gotham is a small, quiet, boutique hotel The sleeping rooms are modern and minimal with complimentary Nespresso pods in the room, hard wood floors and small balconies.  Don't expect grand views of New York City, but if you need a midtown hotel room for sleeping after a long day at the office, this is the perfect spot.

title: Great Spot!
text: I stayed at the Gotham Hotel for 4 nights for a business trip last week and really liked this hotel. It's conveniently located, the room was really spacious for NYC and it had a balcony!. The only thing I didn't care for was they didn't have room services however there is a really healthy market/eatery right next door that was perfect for breakfast. Overall it was a nice experience and I would recommend it.

title: Gotham stay
text: My fave place to stay in NYC. 10 mins walk from Times Square. Great open room layout with windows overlooking the street and a mini balcony. Warm, attentive staff. Comfy bed. We received a dinner chocolate everyday on our beds around 5pm. Part-complimentary mini bar. Will stay here again !

title: Regular Visitor To NYC
text: I have been traveling to NYC at least twice a month for several years, and prior that , at least 10 times a year for the last 30 years. Finally found a great boutique hotel, where the staff remembers me, and several actually call me by name. This isn't a large, glamorous hotel chain, so for discriminating travelers looking for a reasonably priced room, this is the place to go in mid town.

title: Fantastic Find
text: We love the Gotham Hotel.  The rooms are spacious, the staff are superb and the location is perfect for midtown (46th between 5th and 6th).  Wolfgang's Restaurant downstairs is really good.  You can't bring a glass of wine up to your room (two different owners), but there is a nearby liquor store.

A very good clean and modern hotel. In a very good location  near little brazil and nearby time square. Very friendly people. Our room was very noisy and we asked to change a room and they gave us one great with a message where they apologized for the noise which was due to a public construction. Not only they gave us a better room but also they gave us some snacks like nuts. Excellent move i recommend it!

title: Good Location Poo Room Service at the Gotham Hotel
text:
My boyfriend and I booked the Gotham hotel for four nights in May 2019. The location was excellent, right off of 5th ave with all of the stores we wanted to visit within walking distance. There are several subway stations within a ten minute walk. The hotel room was nice, larger than I was expecting for NYC. The bathroom was also large but just had a stand-in shower, no bathtub. There was a little balcony but no view so we did not spend any time on it. Overall we were happy with what we saw when we showed up. 

That being said, the room service was very poor, one of the worst of any hotel I have visited. Our bed was never made, even after asking twice in one day they still never did it. And on once occasion a dirty washcloth was left on the bed. 

There were lots of snacks and drinks in the room, all for an enormous price, even the coffee which is usually complimentary was an additional charge. 

Also, we paid for the room in full when it was booked, and when we checked out the receptionist didn't mention anything about additional charges, but when we looked at our credit card there was an additional $200 charge which we are still trying to get in touch with the hotel to determine what it was for since we didn't order any room services etc. If you visit the hotel make sure to ask about additional charges upon checkout. 

So, overall happy with our stay because of the location and the size of the room, but disappointed with the room service.

title: good experience
text: me and my boyfriend have been in this hotel for around 5 days and we were overall satisfied with the bedroom, the cleaning of the bedroom and of the hotel and breakfast. it also is in an amazing location that allows you to visit most of the most interesting places in new york. we highly recommend it

title: Excelente estadía en the Gotham
text: Ubicación excelente, el trato del personal es muy bueno y las habitaciones son cómodas y modernas. Vinimos varias vecesa NY  y es de lo mejor en relación precio/producto. Definitivamente volveremos.saludos

title: Destacado Hotel
text: excelente ubicación,  habitaciones espaciosas con lindo balcón, personal muy amable con gran preocupación por los huéspedes, muy buena limpieza restaurant de primer nivel  y un precio acorde al nivel de servicio

title: Wow!!
text: Overall a great visit!!  Exactly what we needed - extremely clean room, great location, friendly front desk and they hold your luggage without making you feel like you're being a hindrance to them!  The shower was really great - rain shower and wand!!  AC was cold and could be loud, but hey - besides that I would highly recommend staying here!!

title: Weekend in NYC
text: The overall hotel was nice; however, their shower was not the cleanest I have seen. Also, the water temperature regulation was an issue- water was either scalding or cold, little in between. The staff was outstanding. The balcony was a pleasant surprise.

title: All that I wanted!
text:
It is not my first time to be in NYC, but it was in the Gotham Hotel, and for sure they will have one more regular costumer! I stayed in this hotel for 4 days, and everything was just perfect from the very begining! I had fast check in and this lovely lady Kristina, gave me all information about the hotel as well as  for the sorounding area. She was definitely at the height of the task!!! The room was very clean, bright and spacious! Location is just perfect! 
If you are looking for a place where you can rest and have a beautiful sleep, this is the one!
I will see you guys again, hopefully very soon!

title: Absolutely Not a 4 star !!
text:
Asked for a upper floor, quiet and nice city view room (as described on website) and got absolutely none of these, to the contrary: lower floor with view on an office and .... huge and unbearable street noise all night. We could not sleep at all - at all. construction was going on right down our window which could not even be closed completely and was absolutely not isolated. No sleep at all. 
This ruined our stay and visits the following days. 

Hallway really small and in need of a refresh- restrooms on the C level for guests have you pass through loads of garbages and recycling, at the back store of the restaurant, water in the room unsteady and no bottles of water available ... clearly not a 4 stars. 

Unfortunately, we cannot recommend this hotel

title: Not so great
text: This hotel is centrally located - within walking distance to a plethora of stores, restaurants, Timesquare and Grand Central station. Room is clean, decent and of reasonably spacious. I got a room facing the commercial building directly opposite the hotel - and boy, it was noisy as hell from the moving trucks and honking horns outside: windows definitely aren’t sound proof. In fact, the walls are so thin, you could literally hear noise from the room next door. I got yelled at by the guest next door because they could hear the music playing from my room - not like I was having a party. I wouldn’t come back here again; it’s not ideal for privacy and a quiet night’s rest - I don’t sleep with ear plugs and I also don’t want to hear the sounds from my neighbor’s room.

title: Check-in sucks
text: 40 mins late for check-in and not even an apology. Very disappointed in the customer service especially considering I just paid several hundred for a suite. Will not stay here again. Wouldn't recommend it.b

title: Great location with spacious rooms
text: Great stay and central to everything. The lobby is a bit small with a small restaurant in the back of the first floor. However the rooms are quite large compared to many other hotels for the same cost. I’d stay here again

title: Great location and hotel
text: Stayed in this hotel with my husband and we couldn't have faulted it if we tried.  The hotel is very central, 5 minutes from Times Square and seconds from 5th Avenue.  Our hotel room was clean and spacious. The staff were always friendly and helpful with directions.  Our balcony didn't have a great view but we weren't in our room enough for this to bother us.

title: Great hotel & location
text: Very close to Times Square and easy to get all around the city on foot, cab or subway. Hotel was clean, the staff were friendly. We upgraded to the Skyline Suite, which was huge and had a balcony. Would stay again.

title: Great service and location!
text: Booked this hotel for a business trip. The location was top notch, walkable to everything from meetings to restaurants. What sealed the deal was the attention to service. Taking a red eye from CA, I requested an early check-in. Some hotels will want you to pay the evening before to guarantee the room. I called the hotel and explained the situation, and I even mentioned that I was willing to pay to have a guaranteed early check-in but I didn't want to pay for the night before because I was arriving in the morning. Nicole, the staff person at the front desk, said she didn't have authority to make that decision and gave me the email address of her manager. It was Saturday and the manager's day off but Nicole said that I would get a reply. Within an hour or 2, the manager replied and we worked something out. Early check-in crisis (what to do when you have a morning meeting) averted!

title: Excellent location
text:
