The hotel is in a super location, just a short walk to Times Square, literally 20 seconds to 5th Ave and only a 10 min or so walk to The Rockefeller Centre. The modest front entrance which is currently surrounded by scaffolding doesn’t do the hotel itself justice. 
We were given one of the rooms on the 20th floor, a Grand King Room. The room itself was very nice. Spacious, but with such a large room, we’d have thought the bathroom may have been bigger, although the double shower was very pleasant. 
Disappointingly, the balcony we had just had views of other buildings... can’t win them all I guess. 
The majority of the staff were all very friendly and helpful. 
Although WiFi is provided for free, during our stay, it appeared that it was only good enough for the basics. It wouldn’t allow us to upload photos to Facebook or send them via WhatsApp. A minor issue though seeing as our home network allowed us to use our inclusive data etc from home. 
All in all, a great hotel that we would certainly consider using again when we get around to visiting New York the next time.

title: My favorite business hotel
text: Always smiles and good service - I will always come back. From doorman, reception to housekeeping, splendid service. Also a great central spot in NYC and close to Penn, Grand Central and just a short walk to the Park.

title: NYC city break
text: Perfect boutique hotel close to everything I needed. Staff were friendly and helpful. Shops and Theater District walking distance. Spacious room. Balcony areas were clean and accessible. Only downside was it was a bit noisy.

title: Always Choose The Gotham
text: The Gotham Hotel is the perfect hotel for NYC, centrally located, beautiful atmosphere and spacious rooms.  Julian Emanuel, manager, is truly one of the most amazing people you will ever meet.  He went way above and beyond for us and made our stay the best we have ever had in New York.  The rest of the Hotel team are equally as wonderful.  Everyone was highly customer focused, friendly, and helpful.  They too went out of there way for us.  The rooms are spacious and really beautifully appointed.  I cannot recommend this beautiful boutique hotel enough. I will never stay anywhere else in NYC!

title: Great location and nice rooms.
text:
I read some of the negative reviews, so I didn't know what to expect, but it was a great stay. The room was good size by New York standards and nicely furnished with everything I needed: King-sized comfortable bed, large flat-screen TV with hundreds of channels, sleek bathroom, bright with windows on two sides as it was a corner (I think all of the rooms are like this. There is a large shared balcony with a table and chairs and a view over 46th street below. There was only one other guestroom on my floor and I never saw anyone else, so it was like having a large balcony to myself in addition to the small private balcony in the room (This one faced the dark inner courtyard of other towers behind so there wasn't much to look at, but it was nice to have it). It was very quiet in terms of other guests, but the large fans from the buildings behind are quite noisy and midtown rumbles as you would expect from dawn to dusk. 

The location is awesome, possibly too much in the heart of midtown. A half block from 5th ave and a couple of blocks from Grand Central station it is a great spot if you want to be in the heart of the action. Times Square is a short 5 minute walk away. Some staff were indifferent, others friendly, but they were helpful when needed. The only real cons were that it might not be a good place for younger kids because of the easily accessible balconies. With light chairs that could easily be pushed and climbed on, there is a 20 or whatever storey drop and the door to the outside could be opened by a small child. Otherwise it was a clean, and secure hotel. Its is not 5 star and you will notice little things like the toilet does not flush right away (you have to hold the handle for 5 seconds), they didn't have those little complementary extras like bottled water, and the temp control on the water was finicky, but overall I was very happy with my visit. Also, there is a fantastic deli/lunch/breakfast bar right next door.  

I would stay again.

title: The Gotham Hotel was Great!
text:
We really liked our recent 5-night stay at this hotel.  The Hotel staff, from Reception to Doormen to Housekeeping were all excellent.  Tina, at the front desk, was a real standout and went our of her way to help us enjoy our visit.  Our room was large (by NY standards) and fairly priced.  Breakfast is not included.
The hotel's location was perfect for us.  It is away from the tourist crowds and noise of Times Square but not a difficult walk to quickly go there.  It is within steps of the shopping on 5th Avenue.  Grand Central Station is a 10-minute walk where you can find great food and convenient connections to the subway.  We would definitely go back to The Gotham on our next visit.

title: Teuer und mehr als bescheidener Kundenservice
text: 10 Tage direkt ggü. einer Baustelle gewohnt, die ab 5:30 bis teilweise 23:30h aktiv war. Deutliche Lärmbelästigung. Schlaf ohne Ohrenstöpsel unmöglich; selbst mit noch deutlich hörbar. Personal null kulant. Kein Preisnachlass auf Zinmef ohne Frühstück, kein Angebot anderweitiger Kompensation. Personal oft desinteressiert und nicht in der Lage zu beraten (zB zu NY Sightseeing Pässen). Kundenservice eher Nebensache. Nie wieder.

title: Pee stains and blood stains on comforter
text: PSA!!! IF ANYONE IS THINKING ABOUT VISITING NYC NEVER STAY AT THE GOTHAM HOTEL!!! Last week on Monday, March 4, 2019, my friend and i stayed at the Gotham hotel for a week. We checked reviews and pictures online beforehand and nothing gave us a bad feeling about booking our stay with them. We arrive at the hotel to check in early and they tell us our room won’t be ready until 3pm (standard procedure not the issue). After we return to the hotel we get ready to sleep and pull the comforters back to find urine and blood stains everywhere on the blanket!!! We took our complaints to the assistant manager (the general manager avoided us during our entire visit) and they moved us into a higher room the next day but we were still forced to sleep in the same room until they could get the second room ready. We told the staff we appreciate being moved but even that room wasn’t clean. Well we finally come into contact with the general manager this morning ,March 14th, almost a full week later and she basically goes on record to call us a liar and insisted on not compensating us for the horrible and gruesome experience on the first night. The view is also not what they promote online!

title: Amazing!
text: This is a wonderful place I'm so happy me and my husband chose to stay here. Check in process was very fast and friendly. The front desk lady Cynthia that attended us was very helpful, and very sweet. It was my first time in the city and everything was perfect. The rooms were clean and spacious. Beautiful design. Everything was close by, and very convenient. I will be back to stay here again.

title: Perfect location/ amazing staff
text: I travel for work frequently and have stayed at various hotel properties in NYC, but nothing like the Gotham Hotel. Tina and James are amazing and very accommodating.  The location is perfectly located within walking distance to some many attractions.  The Gotham hotel is the first place I check for awavilablity when coming to NYC.

title: Great Hotel, amazing location
text:
I was staying in this hotel on a business trio. The rooms are huge for NY city, modern and clean. I loved everything apart from a couple of minor things. Considering this was a work trip, I was shocked at the 1000 dollar deposit asked for, the room was paid upfront. Second, the restaurant situated in the hotel is awful with a limited menu ( its NY though so there's plenty on offer outside) third, my hotel room only seemed to have hot water at night time and not in the morning , slightly inconvenient. 

The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and had loads of tips on where I could find alternatives to eat, especially as I was working bizarre hours, they were very knowledgable and sweet. 

It NY city hopefully your not spending too much time in your room, if you visit this hotel as a tourist, make sure you get a room at the front and not the back of the hotel, as the views are great.

title: Christmas break
text:
We stayed for 2 nights at the Gotham as a couple,great view from the balcony,room was fantastic,very spacious,there was a bit of an issue checking in which was resolved. Very close to Time square but far away enough so we didn't have all the hustle and bustle,The hotel has it's own restaurant from what we saw looked amazing but we didn't have time to eat there due to lots of activities planned,overall good hotel majority of friendly staff,close to plenty of sights.
Fantastic time had.

title: Many pluses, few minuses
text: Three big pluses for the Gotham Hotel: Very clean with parquet wood floor (not carpeted), a great idea! Excellent sympathetic, smiling and efficient staff, that goes for everyone, especially Louise. Location is absolutely ideal, one long block plus one short block to Grand Central, same distance to Rockefeller Center and 6th Av., 2 long blocks to Times Square. Two minuses: very intermittent wi-fi and shower water takes a long time about 10 minutes to go from lukewarm to hot. Other notable mentions are we (a couple) stayed on the fourth floor and the room was adequate for us, quite large for NY, balcony very small though, good noise insulation by combination of window and A/C unit but delivery noises typical of midtown beginning at 5:15 overcame them, but we did not mind because we are early risers.

title: Super emplacement
text: Super localisation !! Proche de Time square , de la 5th avenue et de Grand Central Terminal ( métro et train). Chambre spacieuse avec balcon et mini bar. Personnel à l’écoute et disponible. Parfait !!

title: Great Location/Excellent Staff
text: I stayed here for two nights in February with my daughter.  I was worried about location and safety while traveling to the city for my first, alone with my daughter.  The location was perfect for a mid-town Manhattan location.  The room and the hotel were clean and exactly what we needed, with the perfect location to the subway and the sights of the city.  The staff helped me arrange transportation to the airport for an early morning flight.  Everything about our stay was great.  I would definitely stay here again!

title: Hôtel bien situé
text:
L’hôtel se trouve à environ 40 m de la 5ème avenue et à environ 800m de Times
Square. Et également à proximité de Grand central station.
Nous avions réservé une suite assez spacieuse et bien équipée. Pas de chaîne tv en français malgré les centaines de chaînes disponibles.
Chambre propre même si le ménage a été un peu succinct le premier jour.
Le lit est grand et confortable.
Belle vue sur la ville avec un balcon.
Le restaurant dans le hall de l’hôtel propose des petits déjeuner qui sont très bons mais très très chers. L’idéal est de descendre acheter son petit déjeuner dans le magasin juste à côté (une sorte de supermarché du petit déjeuner on trouve de tout à prix raisonnable) 
Chambre un peu bruyante à cause du mini bar et de la clim qui font beaucoup de bruit.
Le personnel est gentil et serviable.
Il manque cependant une table de nuit d’un côté du lit... rien pour poser ses affaires.
Bref un bon hôtel, bien placé pour visiter New York.

title: Great location and great staff
text: While the Gotham Hotel may be a small boutique hotel the location is great for the Manhattan location (Times Square, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Center, Broadway, etc.) and the staff are very friendly and courteous. Will definitely stay here again!

title: What an amazing hotel!
text: Being a native New Yorker my husband and I decided to spend the night in the city for his birthday. This place is a hidden gem!!!! From service, to the cleanliness of rooms everything was perfect. Would highly recommend this place!! We are already planning our next time here!

title: A highlight!
text:
Couldn't fault our stay here in November. We stayed for 5 nights over Thanksgiving and after travelling for 4 weeks throughout the country, it was just perfect to finish our trip!
Only thing, would be to restock the mini bar daily as I did have to call down for sparkling water each day but that is very minimal. The linen and bed was lovely, lighting in bathroom was good and a private balcony was great in the middle of the city!
Thank you so much for making our time so memorable!

title: Never Again!!
text:
After reading positive reviews and the fact this hotel had balconies prompted me to book.
 On arrival the surly receptionist requested $1000 deposit despite room being fully paid. I explained it was a bit excessive so she settled on$500 which I assumed was for room service etc.
After a long journey we just wanted to get to our room. The room allocated was a disgrace considering the amount of money paid I expected it to be clean & bright.
Instead it was worn& in much need of a revamp.The T.V was hanging lopsided on the wall. Balcony was flooded with water from the a/c cigarettes & paper cups strewn. The window sills were wet with condensation, the blind mouldy in this dark dingy supposed suite
Back to see The surly receptionist no apologies but the offer of a room change 
The next room was a improvement with a decent size wet room but still in need of  TLC! The view was of a building site but at least I didn’t need wellies to stand on it unlike previous room!
I thought we’d have room service bring breakfast,what a palaver nobody answered phone from the restaurant despite many attempts eventually a not so surly receptionist walked to the restaurant and asked them to call me. 
Happily order placed and delivered. I request to charge it to my room. Only to be told it’s nothing to do with the hotel!!
The safe holding my money had crashed which meant I didn’t have available cash until the engineer turned up to reset it
Additionally the fridge didn’t work, maintenance tried his best to no avail
At this point I was tired of complaining, so I just put up with it.
All in all a big let down the rooms on website are rather different in reality safe to say never again! 
Must mention a couple of positives, location good though many hotels in the vicinity. Kenny the doorman is a charming young man & Nathoo in housekeeping is a star.

title: EVP
text:
Ive stayed at the Gothem multiple times. The location is perfect. The staff is always courteous and very helpful. The rooms are clean and laid out very well, with plenty of outlets. I stay there whenever I can.

Lonny

title: Great Location, Average Rooms
text: Only stayed for one night and left without a strong feeling one way or another about the property. Some positives: the front desk staff was helpful, and friendly. The location is perfect, close enough that we walked the theater, a jazz club and the next morning to Grand Central Station and towards the East River/ UN. Also, parking w validation was $40, which is fair for 24 hours in Midtown. The shower was very nice, with excellent pressure and temperature. The Nespresso machine made excellent coffee. The room was super quiet, but also we faced a very dark interior courtyard, as is the case in many Manhattan buildings. We booked on Hotwire and were assigned a room. If it's important to you, you could book directly with the hotel to ensure a streetside room. The bed was only average, which includes the mattress and bedding. There was no decoration (ie art) on the wall, which left the room looking a bit stark. We didn't eat in the restaurant (not affiliated with the hotel), but would have tried it if they had an informal option at the bar, or a happy hour.

title: Best hotel in NYC!
text: We spent five days at the Gotham July 2018.  Because it is a boutique hotel, it was very intimate and cozy.  Two rooms per floor!  We were the only ones on our floor and we had TWO balconies all to ourselves.  One overlooked 5th Avenue.  The hotel staff felt like family.  Very accommodating and we were close to so many NYC attractions.  We will definitely be back to the Gotham.  It was perfect.

title: God beliggenhet
text:
Positivt:
- sentralt beliggenhet.
- Personalet var hyggelig, spesielt vaskedamene som gjorde rent hver dag. Vi fikk gratis snack fra minibaren da de hadde glemt noe småtteri til oss.
- God seng og stort rom

Det som trekker ned er:
- kaldt.
Vi var i desember, og så kaldt som det var de første dagene hadde det vist ikke vært på lenge. Det blåste rett igjennom terrassedøren (men ikke vinduet..).
- badet hadde ikke varmekabler i gulv. Mulig det er luksus, men igjen det var kaldt
- balkongen kan ikke kalles balkong 😜

title: Great Hotel
text: Stayed here from 26th Dec to 2nd Jan cant fault the hotel. The staff was amazing who went out there way to help you. Just a couple of blocks away from times sq and 5th avenue was the next block down. We stay in a jr suite and was very happy with bathrobe and slippers to use on our stay. We did have a couple of wet day but that was ok as the hotel provided us with umbrella's as well. A big plus was there is no resort fees which I personally think is a rip off in NYC. Keep up the good work Gotham Hotel and will defo return on our next visit to NYC

title: Muy buena ubicación
text: Lo mejor de este hotel es la ubicación, a metros de la Quinta Avenida y de varias estaciones de metro. La atención en la recepción bastante regular, la habitación cómoda pero sin secador de pelo, con poca iluminación y con reposición irregular de amenities. Me gustó que haya balcones disponibles para todos en los pisos elevados. Buena opción para estadías cortas.

title: Buena opción en el Midtown
text: El hotel está muy bien ubicado, media cuadra de la Quinta Avenida, tiene varias líneas de subtes a unas cuadras a pie y muchos atractivos cerca para ir caminando. La atención en recepción fue lo más flojo, el hotel no es muy grande, por lo que no hay demora en los ascensores. Nos tocó una habitación al frente, a la calle, con un balconcito pequeño pero con una hermosa vista. Igualmente en los pisos superiores hay balcones más amplios con mesa y sillas para ir a visitar a cualquier hora ya que son comunales. La habitación era amplia, moderna, con minibar y cafetera, cómoda pero faltaba iluminación para mi gusto resultó oscura. Internet funcionaba muy bien, en cuanto a ruidos, no me pareció ruidoso el hotel ni la habitación.

title: Hotel in ottima posizione
text: l'hotel si trova in posizione strategica a pochi  passi dalla zona centrale. Personale accogliente, stanze per New York ampie e pulite. Qualità del sonno buona. Il costo della stanza acquistato nel pacchetto con il volo è ampiamente adeguato a quanto offerto. da ritornate per una eventuale nuova visita

title: Exceptional!
text:
Great proximity to Times Square & Park Avenue.
Diana & Artan are very friendly & helpful - they really get customer service... Thanks!

Only drawback is a lack of nearby parking, wound up parking at Quik Park on 46th St between Lexington & 3rd Aves.

title: Excelente atendimento/ bem localizado
text: É um excelente hotel, com um ótimo restaurante. O atendimento é muito bom, quartos limpos e funcionários sempre dispostos. Localizado em um lugar muito bom, perto da “Rua Brasil” onde ficava a Berta Brasil Butique, com ótimos restaurantes e lugares para compras.

title: Visita di 5 giorni a New York
text: Hotel molto carino personale gentile e premuroso camere spaziose e molto pulite buono il ristorante personale della reception educato e simpatico posizione strategica tra la 5av e la Madison a due passi dalla metropolitana merita una visita .

title: Yearly Holiday City Stay
text: Our drive in the city just to get to parking and hotel was a disaster. Finally got to the hotel at 9:00!! Not hotels fault it was the holidays and it was total gridlock. I kindly asked Tina if they were able to give us an upgrade after a horrible drive in and she totally hooked us up with a room with balcony on the 14th floor facing 46th St. Room was amazing. You cant go wrong with the location. You can walk EVERYWHERE. We decided this will be the hotel we will be using every year from now on.

title: Great!
text: Would definitely recommend this hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful. Accommodation  is clean and comfortable. Well located. Restaurant - in same building but not connected to hotel- provides a good breakfast.

title: Pas mal
text: Hôtel très bien situé chambre grande pour New York salle de douche bien équipée. Pour le balcon ce n est pas très glamour le nôtre donnait sur l arrière ds la cour donc pas de vue mais pas de bruit sauf celui de la climatisation. Pdj ds le restaurant du rez-de-chaussée mais il ne fait pas parti de l hôtel on ne peut pas charger sur la chambre donc ne pas oublier sa carte bleue en descendant. Pour l accueil il est super et on peut attendre sur la grande terrasse avt de partir qd l avion est tard. J y retournerai peut être si les tarifs sont corrects mais qd je regarde pour mon prochain voyage en mai je vois du 600$la nuit ce n’est pas envisageable et ça ne les vaut pas !

title: Aconchegante e bem localizado
text:
Hotel renovado, quartos grandes, cama super confortável, limpo, bem localizado, próximo a Grand central Station, e na esquina com a Quinta avenida! Recomendo super!
Recepção com otimo atendimento, e ganhamos um kit boas vindas com produtos Dean e Delucca!

title: Nice Hotel in a good location
text: Me and my partner stayed here for 7 nights in November and really enjoyed our stay. We stayed on the 22nd floor which had a big balcony on the front that would be nice during the summer and the room was a decent size for New York. There was quite a lot of noise from Air conditioning units outside the room but there is nothing the hotel can do about that. Any problems we had with the room were sorted quickly. One thing i did not like was the safe on our room didn't work as it was not attached to anything, it was just sitting in the cupboard.

title: Great stay
text: My husband and I stayed here for three days. Location is PERFECT! We were never farther than a ten minute walk from anywhere we wanted to go. The rooms were clean and it was great to have a terrace and minibar in the room. The staff was amazing and very helpful. Especially Anton, he went above and beyond for us. The restraunt, wolfgang, also served great food. When we come back to NYC we will be planning our stay here.

title: Very pleased
text: The hotel is great and the rooms are a good size for NYC standards. The decor is also great and I loved the fact that there is also a cute little balcony. Aside from the hotel itself, the staff has been wonderful. Especially the doorman Artan who was super helpful and accomidating. The service has been great and we will definitely return.

title: Great Hotel, Wonderful Staff
text: Stayed in the Gotham Hotel for a few days while in New York and i must say i wasn't expecting to have my own private Balcony on the 21st floor with another balcony right across overlooking 46th street. They also have a great restaurant downstairs, i believe it was a steakhouse. Just wished they let me in my room with my wine.Kudos to the Gotham for also hiring a wonderful staff who always kept a smile on their faces. Special thanks to Christina and Alex who helped me navigate through the city map and assisted me in getting to my destinations safely. The only thing that i feel needs improvement would be the lighting in certain parts of the room, and they were also working on a building across the street which i'm pretty sure once completed shouldn't be a problem

title: Incredible hotel in NYC
text: This has become my favorite hotel in Manhattan after an incredible stay this week. The rooms were well decorated, extremely clean, and had a great Nespresso machine for coffee in the mornings. Making the stay even more memorable was Tina at the front desk,!who in all my travels was clearly the most friendly hotel employee i’ve come across. Manning the front of the hotel was Kenny, who was equally as friendly and quick with great local recommendations & directions. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it.

title: Good location and nice staff, but don't get a room facing the back of the hotel
text: We stayed this past weekend in NYC and enjoyed all of the holiday experiences the city has to offer. The hotel was well located and the staff assisted whenever needed, but the room we paid for which featured a Grand Balcony turned out to be a concrete pad that you could seat 2 people facing the back of 4 other buildings and as we were on the 11th floor we also shared that with a large and noisy air conditioning unit.  If you stay there for what they charge make sure you get a room in the front.

title: Great Hotel!
text: We stayed here over Thanksgiving with our son and daughter-in-law, 2 rooms.  We didn't know what to expect as we booked off the internet with no recommendations other than reviews.  Great location in the heart of everything.  Very small boutique hotel with 4 rooms on each floor.  Very clean and modern.  Had a problem with out TV and when we let the front desk know someone was up in our room within 5 minutes.  Problem did persist and as we were on our way out for the evening they asked if it was OK.  When we said no, they said they were changing our tv immediately.  Amazing service!  Very friendly and accommodating staff.  Wolfgang's Steakhouse in the lobby was a great meal.  Would definitely stay here again!

title: Kleines sauberes Hotel in der Nähe der 5 Ave.
text: Viele Jahre schon besuchen wir das Hotel. Es weist einen guten gleichbleibenden Standard auf. Die Baustelle gegenüber ist auch mittlerweile fast fertig. Es ist für New Yorker Verhältnisse ruhig. Freundlicher Service ist auch gegeben.

title: Perfect location, nice hotel
text: Perfect location for exploring the City. Very nice hotel, private and quiet. Good value for the money. Friendly employees. Big room, nice view from the public terrasses. Nice coffee shop next door. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Would we return?
text:
We did like the room after we were booked on to the17th floor. Yet at that point fidnot realize the huge turbines making a horrible noice as the windows are not really noise aproved. The Hotel could do much there. I admit:  I did get used to it. The room was clean and spacious. The reason why I had chosen the Gohham Hotel. There is a famous SteakHouse WOLFGANG in the Lobby although it has nothing to do with the Hotel or it velongs to another group. We  food highly recommend the food and Service.

There is no service through the Hotel. Except that Max, Alex, Kenny or Daniel would always try to help out with Cups or Nespresso capsules that were not replaced by room service or the refill of the minibar. And staying there 9 nights we got to meet the lovely Ladies at Reception TINA and CHRISTINA who made our stay so very special. It was their smile and friendlyness that wellcomed us day by day. 
KaTed

title: Gotham Hotel is amazing!
text: We stayed here for our anniversary this year, and the Gotham Hotel made sure that we had the best vacation! Very friendly and helpful. If anyone is every looking for a great hotel with great service and price, the Gotham Hotel is definitely the right choice.

title: Modern, clean line decorhelpful staff; no resort fee
text:
I loved my stay in this hotel. In particular:

1. The rooms are new and spectacularly renovated, with modern, clean-line decor and lots of light. They give you a selection of books to read, too.

2. The staff here are very friendly compared to other midtown hotels (e.g., the Roosevelt or Shelburne) and clearly enjoy working here. When something goes wrong, they have clearly been empowered to solve the problem. I had an issue opening my door (I believe there was a battery issue in the electronic lock). The front desk staff went out of the way to solve the problem and comped me some minibar selections as a way of acknowledging the inconvenience.

3. This hotel, unlike many in midtown Manhattan, does not charge a ludicrous "resort fee." That alone makes it the Gotham one of my first choices in this area of town.

title: Non alloggiatebal gotham
text: Stanza pessima sembra di essere nel tunnel del vento .scrivo questa recensione mentre aspetto insonne che venga mattino,per potere andare nuovamente alla reception.La manager con la quale ho,parlato nel pomeriggio deve essere conscia che nn è possibile pagare 400 dollari per notte in una stanza al terzo piano che guarda in un cavedio con macchinari rumorosi senza considerare che su qualsiasi motore di ricerca la stessa notte è venduta a 212 euro.chiaramente non posso scrivere la parola adatta  in termini legali a specifica di tale situazione ma credo risulti chiara.

title: Nuvens
text:
Adorei o hotel , a cama era uma nuvem de penas de ganso. Extremamente confortável.
Sem contar a localização, encostado na Fifth Ave.
Próximo de muitos pontos turísticos , restaurantes  ,
Enfim tudo de bom.

title: Cancelled our stay 3 weeks before arrival
text: After booking in February and confirming our booking with them in July they sent me a brief email 3 weeks before arrival to cancel due to ‘overbooking’. They ignored my email trying to confirm the cancellation and 2 messages on Facebook, hotels.com also tried calling them directly to ask them to find us a new room which got ‘passed on to management’ and then ignored. Luckily hotels.com offered much better customer service and found a better hotel and honoured our original price. Otherwise I’d be stuck trying to find a hotel 3 weeks before thanksgiving and Christmas season at a reasonable price! Avoid unless you want to risk losing your booking close to your arrival!

title: 40th birthday stay
text: My husband and I stayed at the Gotham for my 40th birthday last January, and had a great stay! Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were spotless and comfortable. We had an amazing steak dinner at Wolfgang’s  Steakhouse which is connected to the hotel.  The location was perfect and within walking distance to everything we needed. We were able to walk to the Richard Rodgers Theatre to see Hamilton from the hotel. Overall excellent stay!

title: Last minute reservation
text:
Newly discovered Boutique Gotham hotel.
Must say that although it was for only one night, it was
worthy.
Superb service, clean and very attentive specially when Diana has responded to my request immediately.
Highly recomendet.
Good choice.
H.A

title: Nice Hotel and Attentive staff
text:
Stayed here for a week in October. The Hotel is in a great position for easy access to Subway, Trains and Grand Central is only a few streets away.
The rooms at the Hotel are very nice and are kept very clean. The only downside for me is that we got a room at the back of the Hotel which looks out to massive brick walls( I can understand this as this is NY for you) The noise from the giant extractor vent, which stops at about the 5th floor is horrendous. Even though we were out from early morning till late at night you couldn’t get to sleep. What made up for that though was the staff, they were excellent. We just got on with it. Of course, if you get a room at the front then there will be no problems.
Also, they have a lovely Steakhouse called Wolfgang’s on the ground floor. It is quite expensive but for me you can’t put a price on quality and good service.
All round, we would stay there again as long as we weren’t in a room at the back of the Hotel.

title: Good hotel with attractive location
text: The hotel is located within 10 minutes of Times Square in a fairly quiet street. Our room was on the seventh floor, quiet but with a horrible view. We looked right into a brick wall, and there were almost no daylight coming in to our room. Because of that we felt the room was very dark and needed more lamps. Beside from that the room and the bathroom was very comfy and spacious. I only wished they would refill the coffee capsules for the in-room coffee machine. We stayed five nights and only had coffeemugs and capsules the first day. Will stay again if I get the chance.

title: Empfehlenswert !
text:
Hotel liegt sehr zentral.
Zimmer sehr groß. Sauber...!Ordentlich...!
Es gibt Zimmer mit Balkon ( für Raucher 😊)sehr selten in New York.
Personal sehr nett und hilfsbereit.
Preis/Leistung für New York sehr gut 👍🏻

title: You deserve 5 stars!
text: Pleasant and helpful staff.We were given information about all we asked for.Room cleaned excellent every day.Great room and balcony with amazing view!We hope we could find a hotel like this everywhere in the world! Thank you for making our trip even better!

title: MUY BUEN ALOJAMIENTO EJECUTIVO EN EN MIDTOWN, CON EXCELENTE UBICACIÓN , UN MUY BUEN PRECIO Y EXCELENTE CAFE
text:
Si usted es como yo, quizás extrañe algunas cosas que no tiene este excelente hotel en New York. No va a encontrar un Loby gigante, ni un centro de negocios con 5 computadoras y secretaria....pero si usted va a pasear a New York eso no le va a hacer falta. En cambio va a quedar encantado con la habitación sencilla pero practica  y muy limpia , con una maquina netpreso expectacular y sobre todo con una ubicación   a 20 metros de la 5ta Avenida  que le va a permitir moverse en Manhattan tan tarde o tan temprano como le de la gana.. La atención de Sanela, Kenny y Artoun  en la recepción es inmejorable.  Kristina con K habla un muy aceptable Español si el ingles no es su fuerte, ademas es muy atenta  y siempre sonríe. El restaurante de Carnes que esta en el hotel es muy bueno.
Si usted es como yo , pero quiere mantener el presupuesto de hospedaje controlado, estar muy bien ubicado , tener buen café en la habitación a cualquier hora  y conversar con Kristina de vez en cuando. este es el sitio,
Recomendado

title: Central Location Great Staff
text:
We went as a couple and paid the extra for a junior skyline suite as we were staying 6 days.
When we arrived we were welcomed by pleasant staff, no map of new York given and no information about nearby attractions or restaurants etc.  Nothing informative in the room about new York or the surrounding area, which I found surprising.  Most places have something for tourists to read and refer to throughout there stay.
The room is a reasonable size (always look bigger in the pictures) the balcony is tiny but a nice space.  I suspect it would be more relaxing if there wasn't a building site right opposite, so you get noise and workmen (again perhaps to be expected in New York, but a bit of advance notice would have been nice). However it is nice to have an outside space, just watch out for the puddle from the air conditioning unit which drains onto the balcony floor.
There is a coffee machine but you are restricted to one coffee pod, per person per day only, the rest you have to buy.  In my opinion they would be better just supplying a kettle and tea and coffee sachets.  There is nothing posh or upmarket about having a coffee machine and restricting the amount guests can use it.
The air conditioning unit was very noisy though it didn't affect us as we hardly used it.
The room in general could do with some refurbishment the dark wood and plain walls just seems rather outdated as do the curtains, it's a pretty uninspiring room.  They have a huge mirror but no light any where near it for putting on make up or getting ready and no plug socket any where near it for doing hair.  I know these sound like silly things but you do have to wonder who plans these rooms.  The room safe is nice but it isn't secured to the floor so if someone wanted they could just lift the entire safe and it's contents.
The bed was very big and very comfortable and the hotel was quiet at night, though as with anywhere in new York you do hear outside noise and this is to be expected.  I think the building site across the road adds to the noise.  The bathroom was very big and the wet room was nice though there were some holes in the ceiling where I presume there had been a leak from upstairs .
The rooms were clean and the maid service was good.
There is no separate bar in the hotel, though if you wanted I believe you could sit for a drink at the Bar in Wolfgangs steak restaurant which is located within the hotel.  We ate there once $180 dollars for 2 steaks 2 sides and chips to share, a wine and couple of beers!!!! Though to be fair we were prepared for the price and the food was lovely.
The staff are very friendly and helpful, Tina Alex and Kenny all chatted away with us and helped us when we needed it.
The location of the hotel is FANTASTIC it is within walking distance to many of the attractions and is a great location for subways to the other destinations in New York, grand central, empire state, times square, macys and rockefeller to name a few are all within walking distance.  There is a coffee shop next door for when you have used up your coffee pod allowance! and  are in abundance!!!
The hotel is fine but with a bit of effort it could be fantastic especially given the location, a boutique hotel....... it is nearly there.  I wouldn't class the rooms as stylish perhaps a bit out dated dark wood, plain walls, plain bedding, but it is a small central hotel with great staff, who are extremely helpful and pleasant.
This review might seem very negative, but I have tried to be informative and these are the facts!
I would stay again if the price was represented in the design and style of the rooms.
Once again the staff were fantastic and it is a very central hotel in a bust central area right of 5th avenue. We had a great time in New York

title: Prima, centraal gelegen hotel
text:
Modern, centraal gelegen, met 5 minuten lopen sta je op Time Square, ben je bij Grand Central Station of bij Top of the Rock. 
De kamer die wij hadden was aan de achterzijde en had een balkon. Op het balkon wel veel lawaai van de airco’s en geen uitzicht. De kamer was voldoende ruim, had een uitstekend bed en een complete badkamer. De kamer was voorzien van een kluisje en de wifi was gratis en werkte uitstekend. Op de bovenste 3 verdiepingen zijn aan de voorzijde balkons met zitje die voor iedereen toegankelijk zijn. Beneden bij de lobby zit een restaurant waar je ook kan ontbijten, redelijk prijzig, maar naast het hotel en in de directe omgeving zitten genoeg gelegenheden waar je prima kan ontbijten voor een redelijke prijs. Het hotel heeft 2 liften en dat is voldoende voor het aantal kamers.

title: Lovely midtown hotel
text: We really enjoyed our stay, the staff were great and very helpful. The room was clean and had a safe and a fridge. It was situated close to a lot of the places that we wanted to visit and wasn't far from the subway at Grand Central Station. The area felt safe. Situated just off 5th Avenue. Not far from the MOMA, Rockafeller, Central Park, Empire State Building, Grand Central Station and Times Square.

title: Hyggelig hotell med sentral beliggenhet.
text: The Gotham er et hotell med fin beliggenhet. Spesielt hotell med bare 2 rom i hver etasje. Balkongen mot bakgården var ikke så hyggelig, men vi disponerte også stor balkong ut mot gaten som vi hadde stor glede av. Personalet i lobbyen var veldig hyggelige og hjelpsomme, spesielt Kristina! Serviceinnstilt til 1000! Rommene store med kjøleskap, espressomaskin og sengene var veldig gode. Aircondition bråkte veldig, måtte stenge det om natten. Rent på rommet og badet! En gjeng på 7 personer var veldig fornøyd med 7 netter på dette sentrale hotellet!

title: Well located hotel offering comfortable rooms
text:
I recently spent a few days in New York and stayed at the Gotham. Rooms are comfortable, service is very friendly and location is super convenient as it’s a short walk from Grand Central Station.
If you have a car, the hotel is partnering with a nearby garage but it’s a valet only parking meaning that it takes a while to get in and out.
Also, take the time to enjoy the view from the highest floors (all guests get access to the balconnets)

title: Fantastic location
text: We spent 8 nights at The Gotham in a Junior Suite. We loved the balcony looking down 46th and it was wonderful for viewing the Pulaski and Columbus Day parades. It was great having the separate seating area to give extra space. While all staff were friendly and helpful Kristina on front desk and Shaun on the door were especially so. Wolfgang’s restaurant on the ground floor is also definitely worth a visit if staying here.

title: Central and nice
text:
Nice hotel in midtown, not far from Time Square.
Smiling and service minded employees. Noisy Air-conditioning, but we just switched it of at night. Stayed at 8 floor and balkony works for having a sig. Great balkonies from 19th floor and up.
Would stay there again

title: Perfect location, nice hotel with friendly employees
text: Super beliggenhet med gå avstand til de fleste fasiliteter i NY. Fine store rom med egen balkong, gode senger, hyggelige ansatte, super service fra både Dijana og Kristina. Vi kommer tilbake hit, anbefales.

title: Lovely honeymoon
text: Thanks to Kristina, Aditya, Tina and Alex for their majestic treatment. It has been an extraordinary trip and we hope that all the hotels in the world have a staff like you. The location is perfect, and you have everything close so you do not have to use urban transport. I think it is a hotel that adapts to the needs of travelers. Silence in the rooms, privacy is respected, has comforts, and you can rest thanks to your mattresses to be the next day at 100%. Many successes for this hotel.

title: Outstanding customer service!!
text: First off I would like to thank Sanela (Front Desk Manager) for going out her way to ensure our stay was perfect! Receptionist team was all smiles every time we walked through those doors and houseman were very quick to bring any extra amenities that were needed. Once again thank you Sanela for everything and ensuring our stay was a memorable one. You’re truly a gem!

title: Utmärkt hotell
text: Fint hotell centralt beläget på Manhattan. Stort fint rum med egen balkong (dock lite störande med alla fläktar som lät runt omkring). Trevlig personal och många frukostmöjligheter i närheten. Vi valde att inte inkludera frukosten i boendet.

title: Great Location
text: Arrived at the hotel around 1pm and was lucky enough to be given a room.  However it was on floor 5 at the rear of the hotel and the noise from the air conditioning units made it impossible to sleep.  We asked to move rooms and the lady on Reception and she kindly moved us to a front room on floor 8 at the front of hotel which was ok until a skip was delivered to the building site across the road and they then stared throwing metal into it at 5.30am which was totally unacceptable.  Having said that the hotel is in a great position the staff are helpful.  On thing is that you need to ask them to refill the coffee pods.

title: Amazing Hotel / Hotel maravilhoso
text:
Nossa hospedagem foi ótima, a localização é incrível, fica de esquina com a 5ª avenida, há 600 metros da Times Square andando, muito próximo do Rockfeller Center e da Grand Central, inclusive fomos de metrô pro aeroporto e andamos até a Grand Central com as malas tranquilamente.O quarto que ficamos é o menor do hotel, ficava no 3º andar, mas mesmo estes tem um ótimo espaço (26m2) com um pequeno terraço, móveis novos e de bom gosto, bom banheiro, cama confortável, frigobar e uma nespresso com 2 cápsulas de brinde (foi o único café bom que tomei em NY). Os funcionários são gentis e solícitos, porém só falam inglês, o hotel não cobra taxa de resort, nem cobra para receber entregas de compras online. A região tem bastante trânsito de veículos, tem um prédio em obras em frente ao hotel, mas não era barulhento para dormir, a obra era feita em horário comercial apenas, então nem estávamos no quarto. Recomendo, gostamos muito.

We had an incredible staying at this hotel, it has a great localization, near the main  tourist attractions of NYC, like Times Square, Rockfeller Center, 5th Ave and Grand Central Terminal. I stayed in a beautiful and large room on the 3rd floor (room 32, not very noisy) with a minibar, a nespresso machine, a small terrace, great bathroom with amenities. Very attentive staff. No breakfast included, no charge resort fee and they receive online shopping packages for free. We enjoyed it a lot.

title: Great Location
text: Great location in midtown. Nice, spacious rooms, comfortable beds, good shower and bathroom and nice amenities upon checkin. We arrived very early and there were no rooms available and therefore only checked in at 15:00hrs but they held our luggage so we could wander the city in the meantime.

title: Hands down one of the best experiences staying in NYC
text: I just wanna start out by saying from the first visit of the hotel I was pleasantly greeted and taken care of by Sanela Sau (Front Office Manager). She went over and beyond to make sure that my stay was comfortable and successful. She prides herself on keeping her guest happy. I stayed on the 19th floor where I had both rooms and the view from the balcony was amazing. I've stayed in many hotels in NYC but this by far was my best stay. Location to all the stores was easy accessible but the customer service level in that hotel is beyond commendable. I recommend anyone that is looking for a nice boutique hotel to book this hotel. Sanela Sau you are one of a kind and I appreciate you. Thanks for amazing stay.

title: Average!
text: Stayed in the Gotham hotel with my partner for a special trip to NYC.  We arrived early in the morning to be met by rather rude check-in lady who informed us there was a check in procedure.  We were also not so kindly informed that our room would not be available until 15:00 and there was nothing that would change this.  We returned later that day and at 15:00 our room was not available.  I had to chase and be rather stern and we finally got into the room at 15:25.  Had I not chased this I think it would have been a lot later.   Overall, the front desk staff were moody and just generally disinterested in their job and the hotel guests.  The door staff stood around chatting and messing around and it felt like as a guest I was an inconvenience.  The room was a good size with a lovely front balcony looking down to Times Square. The room was not as clean as I would have expected with the shower broken and a number of the blinds not working. The location of the hotel was great, near enough to get to things but not in the middle of it all. Would I stay again, probably not.  Staff can make or break a hotel and the staff at the Gotham seems disinterested and sloppy.

title: Just ok...
text:
My fiancé and I stayed at the Gotham in December 2017, we came to New York for his 30th birthday. 

I had requested a city view if at all possible and also mentioned via email that it was my partner’s special birthday and asked if they could add a few special touches to mark the occasion. The email exchanges I had before our trip were actually very good and quick. I was told that we would be put on the same floor as one of the communal balconies which meant that we would get a great view of the city albeit not from our room which was fine.

When we arrived check in was great and as promised we were on the same floor as one of the communal balconies I think it was the 23rd or 24th floor. You could see Times Square from the balcony but with it being December we didn’t stay out there for long! 

The room itself was huge much bigger than I have stayed in in New York before. The big negative for me, however, was that at the back of the hotel right beside our room was a huge generator which was sooooo loud! After travelling from the UK I was really looking forward to a good nights kip and unfortunately this wasn’t to be! I struggled to sleep for most of the six nights we were there. It may have been better in a different part of the hotel but I would avoid the back at all costs! 

Another really annoying issue was that our key card was constantly deactivating. We would get up to the 23rd floor to find it had gone to have to go back down then back up. This happened at least twice a day and although the staff tried to suggest it might be our mobiles causing it, I kept the card in my pocket well away from my phone. This was a real pain! 

We also had to ask a lot for supplies like coffee pods, toilet rolls etc which again shouldn’t need to be done. 

This hotel isn’t a luxury hotel by any means and if you are after the NYC experience of a huge hotel with a huge lobby this just isn’t the hotel for you. Having said that it does the job, you aren’t going to be in your room in NYC most of the time anyway or at least you shouldn’t be! Avoid the back of the hotel if you do want some sleep though!!

title: Expected better service
text:
Only stayed for one night but it will certainly be the last. Before heading out to see a broadway show I discovered that the drain was completely backed up while taking a shower. Dealt with it and let the front desk know on the way out so that it could be fixed. I returned to the same issue without any explanation from the staff. So either the maintenance staff doesn’t know what they’re doing or they didn’t bother trying. Also,  if the shower was properly cleaned before my stay this would have easily been detected. 

Another annoyance was that the wifi could barely be detected from my room. And whenever it did show up the password would not work. On the positive side they provided some nice snacks. Not enough to make up for the hassle of nearly flooding the bathroom while simply trying to take a shower.

title: Carino, ma...
text:
L’hotel tutto sommato era carino, bella stanza, arredamento moderno e posizione ottima. La possibilità di poter cenare su alcune terrazze dell’albergo ci è piaciuta molto.
Purtroppo era abbastanza sporco... il tappeto della hall emanava un cattivo odore ed era sempre circondato da zanzare. La nostra stanza non veniva pulita per bene e neanche quella dei miei zii. Nonostante lo avessimo fatto presente più volte, per i primi 4 giorni tornavamo la sera e il pavimento era sporco, successivamente la situazione è migliorata leggermente, ma c’era comunque sporco. Per quanto abbiamo pagato speravamo in un servizio migliore.
Molto gentili i portieri e i ragazzi della reception.

title: Amazing Stay
text: My wife and I were in town for a few nights and decided to stay at the Gotham Hotel. Very convenient location in the center of midtown Manhattan, walking distance to Times Square and the doormen were extremely helpful in finding local places to dine. Big thank you to Alex for recommending Uncle Paul’s lasagna slice.

title: Dejligt lille hotel med god beliggenhed
text: Pænt hotel med fint værelse. Personalet var hjælpsomme og imødekommende. Rigtig god beliggenhed 100 m fra 5th Ave, 10 min gang til times square og 15 min gang til central park den ene vej og Empire State Building den anden vej. Hotellet er ikke særligt stort, men der er en restaurant i forbindelse med hotellet.

title: Brilliant!!
text:
Long overdue first visit to New York. Im so glad we chose this hotel.
I made sure that we booked a Junior skyline suite as I had read some negative reviews about the standard rooms and the balconies facing a brick wall. Our suite was lovely and the views were amazing right through to Times Square. We stayed at The Gotham a few weeks ago when the heat was literally melting everyone. The air conditioning in the room was so welcome. 
Staff were really nice and so friendly, Kenny the doorman was especially friendly. Offering us advice on where to go and which ways to get there etc..
Reception girls were all lovely too and nothing was too much trouble. They printed some vouchers out for us and always very attentive. 
Location was perfect for us. We bought the Metro cards and hopped on and off the busses with ease. (Busses are all air conditioned and comfortable). 
We would definitely stay here again and would have no hesitation in recommending to anyone.

title: New York City stopover
text: The staff at The Gotham are so accommodating. Very nice, especially Kenneth the doorman. He gave us suggestions on where to go. He also remembered us every day and greeted us with a smile. He even helped us load our luggage into our Lyft to the airport. I would definitely stay again. Great balconies & location can't be beat.

title: Brilliant staff and excellent service
text:
Staying on a month long business trip, you need more from a hotel. The Gotham did exactly that.
The reception staff - Christina, Tina, Diana and Aditya - and the hotel porters - Artan and Kenneth - were always happy, friendly and helpful.

title: Brilliant staff with Excellent location
text:
This is the second visit to New York on a business trip that lasted just shy of 5 weeks. So choosing the right hotel for such a long deployment was of paramount importance bearing in mind our first hotel experience the previous year was not so positive. We hit the jackpot as our stay was pleasant, comfortable and the best that it could be in terms of location to Grand Central station; Times Square; NYC Library and 5th Avenue shopping with great balcony views of Manhattan from the 19th floor onwards.

We were always pleasantly welcomed with an attentive and friendly front desk of Tina; Aditiya; Christina and Diana who attended to all our esoteric and quirky needs. Any issues regarding room service and hot water (or lack of) issues were quickly dealt with and fixed. 

I was impressed with all the staff from Kenneth and Artem who recommended great places to eat, to room service's high standards of work to Tina whose attention to detail and conversation made my stay much more enjoyable.

I would recommend this Hotel to anyone and will definitely be staying here next year.

title: Modern room, great location, great service
text: If you're looking for an extremely centrally located hotel in the city this is the one for you. I was a solo traveler, age 35 looking for a nicer hotel that wasn't outrageously priced.  It's right near all of the tourist stuff you'd want, and probably about a 10 minutes cab ride from the trendier neighbourhoods.  The room is modern and very clean, the bed is big and super comfortable, and the shower is great.  If you want to be in the center of the city this is a great hotel.  The only things that wasn't amazing was the wifi, but that's just being nit picky.

title: Great service
text:
Thanks to Tina, Cynthia, Alex and Sean for making our trip much more enjoyable, they went above and beyond, big shout out to Sean for the pizza advice, great hotel within walking distance of a lot of shops and restaurants, management should be very proud of these guys.
John B

title: ATL—->NYC
text:
Friendly attentive staff. Never had to wait long for any requests. Amenities were perfect. Check out the balcony on 21 floor. Rooms are spacious and clean. Thanks to Kenneth and other staff for a wonderful trip. 
—The ATL crew

title: Worst stay ever - Don't go there!
text:
Since there is nothing good to say about this hotel, here are the top reasons why you should NOT stay here:
1) WiFi hardly works, even updating Outlook folders takes 30 minutes. Even had to go to the lobby late a night to work from my laptop. When mentioning our WiFi issues at front desk, I got "yes, we have that sometimes". Good to know.
2) Construction all night so plenty of noise and little of sleep.
3) Unattentive staff to say the least: despite mentioning a few times, one coffee capsule instead of 2 in the room. With 90+ degrees in the city, we turned AC on when leaving the room only to find that staff turned it off when we got back end of day soaking wet from humidity.
3) We had hotel call us a cab. I know flat fares are 60$ to JFK and asked prior if this is a "flat fares" too. They said yes and called us a Suburban shuttle with flat fare $120. I went back inside asking why and was told "yellow cabs we just hail for you" and flat fare suburban should be $80. Well, it's not and also not what we asked for in the first place! 
4) Prices per night were kind of expensive which we didn't mind expecting a nice hotel. Next time, stay at your preferred chain / business hotel which is cheaper and has functioning WiFi.

Info: I've stayed in NYC 20+ times for business and leisure and never did I stay in such an unwelcoming place where literally nothing works and staff did nothing to improve the situation.

title: Óptima localização e bastaste confortável
text: O The Gotham Hotel para alem da sua perfeita localização, tem em todos os quartos uma varanda, onde existe uma mesa e duas cadeiras que permitem tomar um café logo pela manhã ou beber uma bebida refrescante no final do dia ao ar livre, claro que esta dica serve para quem vai no verão como foi o nosso caso. O conforto e espaço do quarto também é bastante agradável e muito limpo. Existe um restaurante que serve de bar também, mas sobre o mesmo não posso comentar porque não utilizamos. Todos os funcionarmos foram sempre muito simpáticos e prestáveis, alias no ultimo dia o nosso transfere era ás 18:00 e o hotel concedeu-nos late check out,  em resumo acho que é uma óptima opção para quem pretende ficar na zona de Midtown

title: Comfortable rooms and great location
text: We stayed here for 5 nights and loved the location. Walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, subway and shops. Spacious room with balcony, good free WiFi and clean. The air conditioning was not working in our room, so they moved us to another room the next day. Great service.

title: Good location, nice staff, average rooms
text:
When i am in NYC, i always look for special places to stay. The Gotham Hotel is wuite small and nothing special but still a recommendation if you want a central location and an easy in and out.
Rooms are average, not super clean but still ok. Staff is friendly and helpful.

title: What an awful experience - do not stay here if you value your health
text:
I had to change rooms 3 times at this hotel. The first time the air conditioning did not work properly and after contacting the front desk I was fobbed off with an excuse that it was very hot outside!!  The 2nd room I was offered woke me up with a pungent smell of petrol. This gave me and my son a headache and made us feel sick.  The third room again did not have a properly functioning air conditioner.

I complained to the management who are refusing to refund me my money for this terrible experience.  Please avoid this hotel at all costs.  The last thing thing to say is all 3 rooms I stayed in had very poor lighting and so if you feel compelled to book a room take a torch!

title: Not sure about that one
text:
We were staying in The Gotham Hotel for a week
We got room with the balcony... don’t bother- you’ll be looking at the wall - like most of New Yorkers- but no point paying extra for it....
The room is big enough but bathroom very basic and wouldn’t call spotlessly clean... we have seem to get less towels as the week passed by....
And because shower door weren’t sealed properly we needed to dry the floor every time after taking shower....
There was Nespresso machine in the room but every morning I needed to ask for an extra coffee pot for next day... as it shouldn’t be a standard in 4 star hotel to refill it.... 
we decide to do different things  with my boyfriend on one day but he forgot his hotel card.... the girl at the reception -despite that she knew him from passing everyday and him presenting his ID wouldn’t let him in the room explaining as a security reasons 
I get that but it would be nice if she uses common sense and a bit of will to help
Our passports and all belongings were in that room - what my boyfriend would do if anything would have happen to me???? 
Overall ok hotel for New York I guess.... wouldn’t call it 4 star....
Ok location but not on the friendly side....

title: Lovely big rooms, a short walk to 5th Ave, Time Square etc
text: I chose this Hotel because of the room size, having been warned by friends that most hotel rooms are very small. The room 33 was nicely furnished, with a fridge and mini bar, a small balcony with table and chair. The room looked onto the side of a building, so no view. There are 2 Balconies for guests use at the front, near top of the hotel. the staff were friendly and helpful. really enjoyed our 6 day stay there.

title: Great hotel near fifth  Avenue
text: Nice and clean room. Looks bigger on the pictures but it works for a couple of days. Curtains was very dirty!! The AC was very loud!! Needed to turn it off while sleeping. Good WiFi. I recommand takeaway breakfast from the dunkin  donut  next to the hotel. Good location while staying  in NYC.

title: High light of my holiday
text: I was very nervous booking a hotel in New York but thankfully choose The Gotham. Having read reviews I was aware it is not clearly from street view so look for Wolfgangs. Room was larger than I expected for what I was paying. Bed was super comfortable , coffee in room was very good ( you can buy more pods for $5 which to me is a great deal) The shower was great in that it had a wand to simply have a rinse . Yes the balcony faced a wall but I spent my time on the 19th floor balcony having my dinner there many a night. Fluffy dressing gowns, slippers I felt rather spoiled. The staff were so helpful , i felt for the few days I was there it was home. I cannot say enough positive things about them. From printing off directions, directing me to some of the most terrific places to eat or simply having a chat, they made my stay memorable. Tina , Tina would always welcome me with a chat , some skitting ( in our side of the pond that is like " we are friends" ) . If there was an issue it was amended , if there was a want , it was looked after. I saw many people come to the hotel when other hotels let them down in some way. All were delighted with their move and I can see why. I know I have not included the door staff names, the cleaners names, the maintenance guys names but they  all made for a memorable stay. I found the hotel very well situated. It is a short walk to Times Square, cheap eats nearby as well as a discount shop to purchase the likes of coffee, snacks if like me you are on a budget. Grand central is about 2 city blocks away . Fantastic eatery near there with various vendors and a selection that should please anyone in your party. Dunking Doughnuts is two doors away, what more could you want really ? I am so glad I took the chance and will be returning to stay again.

title: コスパ良し！
text:
ニューヨークの中心地にある割には割安なホテルかと思います。
部屋も綺麗で広く、立地は文句なし。
ベランダ付きは最高です。
ただ、ベランダへのドアが壊れていて、強い風が吹くと夜中に大きな音を立てて開閉していました。
2泊だけでしたので、部屋を変えるのも面倒なので、そのまま泊まりましたが気になりました。
スーツケースを開けてアンパッキングする前に扉確認してみてください！

title: Living the High Life
text: I went with my daughter we thought we would splash out on a posh hotel. what a disappointment the Mid Town Balcony turned into a room facing onto a wall. We asked to be moved we were but the room was smaller , the balcony faced a building being renovated, if we sat at a different angle we could see a corner of time square.

title: I Had High Hopes
text: The Gotham is a boutique hotel just past 5th Avenue.  I was attracted by the private balconies and honestly, did not realize it was 46th St E, not 46th St W so I thought it was closer to Times Square - yes I realize it is right at 5th Ave so not far from 46th W.  Although the crowds are a bit much in Times Square, hotels there are close to the action, especially waking up in the morning and wanting breakfast.  It’s just more convenient. So the hotel’s location is not the fault of the hotel but rather mine for not booking in Times Square.  I enjoy boutique hotels but this one had some issues.  Checkin was a breeze and the staff was very friendly.  The room was large and the bathroom was nice.  The shower had both a wand and a rainfall shower head.  It took a bit for the water to get hot, but that happens sometimes.  There were a few drawbacks.  The Wifi kept going in and out and after I notified the front desk, it did stay on but only at 1/2 strength.  It was unusable.   It has been very hot in New England and this weekend was no exception.  The room air did not work well.  When we checked in, the temp did not get lower than 72.  We notified the front desk, went out to a show.  When we arrived several hours later we were told the air had been fixed.  We got to the room and the temp was 69 and did not get any better all night.  It was difficult to sleep with the noisy air conditioner blowing and us sweating into the sheets.  The touted private balconies were a strip of metal outside the window that was approximately 2 ft wide.  Certainly too small to enjoy, even if it wasn’t 95 degrees outside.  The room had iffy satellite TV too.  The amenities included an in room fridge with space to put things into, an iron, ironing board and umbrellas.  The room was clean and we had a view of the street.  We booked a king bed and were told we had a king room but the bed was an oversized full - not quite queen sized.  All in all, we were glad we only stayed one night.

title: Hello Dolly Weekend with mother-in-law
text: Well, it was an okay place. Wish we would have stayed closer to Time Square. The staff was nice. Our room had a/c issues. When we went to the show we told the front desk. When we returned from Hello Dolly we were told the a/c was fixed. Well not so much, room didn’t get below 70 and the fan rattled the entire time.  Other than that the room was good. They claim balconies for everyone. A balcony about 1 foot wide for our room. However there were community balconies upstairs somewhere. We won’t stay again.

title: Pleasant
text:
Stayed at the Gotham for four nights during a two week tour of the east cost.

It was well located and very comfortable. The hotel was quite basic but the balcony’s (especially the one in 19th) were a nice addition.

However the room appeared clean but one day a comb turned up on my bedside table and it didn’t belong to me so must have belong to a previous occupant. This made me doubt how thorough the cleaning was. Also the toilet kept breaking we told one of the staff who shrugged did something and it worked for the next two flushes but broke again.

title: Trevligt
text: Tycker att Gotham Hotel var ett trevligt litet hotell, med hjälpsam personal. Hyfsade rum med skön säng, man är ju bara där för att sova. Närheten till i princip allt gjorde vistelsen ännu bättre även om man har trampat några mil på en vecka. Vi är nöjda.

title: Value, location, and very nice design
text: The Gotham is a terrific little hotel that's accessible to all parts of Midtown. The rooms are chic and minimalist without trying too hard, and everything seems to run well. I highly recommend it if you don't want to spend an arm and two legs to stay in Manhattan.

title: Great vication
text:
We came to the gotham hotel and met 
 mrs. sanela sau. she and her stuff gave us exclence treatment and take care of all our needs. We felt at home .the hotel is near the time spear. Clean and freindly . We will come back soon.

title: Spacious room, nicely located
text:
Choosing a hotel in Manhattan was tricky, but after balancing cost against space/comfort and location, I chose The Gotham Hotel.

My first contact with a member of staff was when my train to NYC broke down and my arrival time was pushed towards midnight, far from ideal! I e-mailed reception to advise of the situation and a friendly, prompt, reply alleviated any concerns about being too late to check in.

Walking from Grand Central to the hotel at around 11.30pm I quickly realised the area was safe, I saw plenty of people walking around on their own.

Check in was efficient and friendly.

My room was a Skyline Jr. Suite with Terrace on the 14th floor at the front of the hotel. 

The suite had a wonderful feeling of space, with the layout making it feel like you had separate sleeping, sofa, bathroom and terrace areas. It was clean, but I did feel that the decor was a little tired, with finishes in some areas being a little sloppy (e.g. some paint marks on the curtains). This didn't negatively impact my stay but did leave an impression. There's always hustle and bustle in a big city, so of course there was noise from the street overnight but it didn't affect my sleep.

I made good use of the terrace, the weather was particularly hot and after long days walking around the city it was nice to kick back on the terrace and immerse myself in the sounds of New York. The view was pleasant, with Times Square in the distance to the left, and skyscrapers all around you.

Location wise, it was fantastic. I could walk everywhere and was very well placed for many of the tourist attractions. Times Square was very close by, I did the walk to the Circle Line boat tour and Intrepid in 25 mins, and the Rockefeller Centre and Central Park were in easy reach too.

I didn't try any of the food from Wolfgang's Steakhouse, but did find the nearby Uncle Paul's Pizza which I would recommend if you like Italian food, they delivered to the hotel for free, but pick up is just as easy as it's round the corner. There are so many options for food nearby that you are bound to find something to your taste.

All the staff I encountered were friendly and helpful.

title: Great Location!
text: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Gotham. I found the doorman and the front desk staff (especially the afternoon/evening staff) to be incredibly helpful and friendly. They gave us clear directions on how to get to the parking garage and took our luggage up to our room while we parked the car. The parking garage is within walking distance of the hotel. It is expensive ($150 for the 3 nights) and there are no in-out privileges, but you really don't want to be driving around the city anyway! We stayed in room 183 and were pleasantly surprised by how spacious it was. We were also incredibly happy that it was quiet. We did not hear anyone in the hall and rarely heard any sound from outside either. The location of this hotel was perfect! It was within walking distance of Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, and Broadway. We purchased a hop-on, hop-off bus tour and used this as our means of transportation to other, further attractions. The balcony was small and the view wasn't great but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway so we didn't mind. Upon our arrival, I pulled the whole bed apart to search for bedbugs and I am happy to report that I did NOT find any. The mattress did have some stains though and I would suggest that the hotel invest in removable/washable mattress covers to prevent this. The bed was decently comfortable but the pillows were very thin. The only major complaints that we have are that the room was quite dark and the air conditioner was very loud. Although there were windows, the room needs more lights to make it more functional, especially over the mini bar/coffee area. I had to use the flashlight on my phone to see/operate the coffee maker. The air conditioner was very loud and made many strange noises in the middle of the night that woke us up. It also had a strange smell that came and went throughout our stay. Overall, we were satisfied with our stay here and very impressed with the staff!

title: just back what a take on
text: I have never been to such a rubbish hotel, There was building works which stared at 5.00am in the morning & no-one said a word. When we got there the floor we was on was a workplace for new flooring being put down which went on until about 8pm. never told us this either. but the 2 worse things was I ask when I got there if I could use the phone to phone the transport company I had booked for my pick to come home, I wanted them to pick us earlier, but the hotel receptionist told me that he would deal with phoning them, but unbeknown to us until we went to get out the car at the airport we had to pay $80 (bunch of thieves), why would I book 2 pick up's when I have already paid for one, then the other one was they took our cases and when I got to the airport I check my hand luggage one and they had smashed my 2 Hard rock café glasses. I would really like one of the management to see this and email me so I can really go for it. they also tell you that they will take a print of your credit card but no money will come off, then when you check out you get told your money back in 3 to 5 days. so why say they don't take any money so they are liars as well. I would never go back to this heap of rubbish place again

title: Excellent location and fantastic service
text:
I booked this hotel via QANTAS website. It was a long flight from Melbourne to New York with a stopover, and a delay via LAX. I am terrible sleeping on flights and so by the time I arrived at the Gotham Hotel, it was 27 hours in between sleep. I arrived about 1800 hrs to a warm welcome at Reception, which was efficiently staffed and was quickly provided with my room on the 3rd Floor.
The Gotham is a boutique hotel and getting out of the lift, I was amazed how the decor was...pretty amazing.
The room Itself was a roomy, great size and there was a welcome gift of water and nuts. 
I had a quick shower, and a coffee, which refreshed me and found the tiredness dissipating.
Rather than I should have, gone straight to bed, I was too excited after not being in NY for 15 years and decided to explore the surroundings.
The hotel is 2 blocks and a short 10 min walk to Times Square. Walked around in delight of the buzz of NY. I walked back towards the hotel but rather than 46th Street, ventured down 44th, and found myself in the gorgeous Grand Central Station.
I decided on a pizza from the amazing markets on the Ground Floor. Wow!
The hotel is central to all the places I had planned to visit, and the public transport was close by. It is walking distant as well to Central Park.
While there was a balcony attached to the room, there was a better balcony on the 19th Floor which I used quite a bit during the stay as it was a quiet relaxing space. The balconies on the 20th to 23 rd floor were smaller so preferred the 19th Floor.
The Concierge boys were all very friendly, and were a source of information, from which subway and train to take, to their recommended food trucks. 
Had breakfast at the restaurant the next morning, and there was a good breakfast choice, plus a great cappucino.
There were just three points that on reflection, was an inconvenience. The first was that the room allocated on the third floor was somewhat dark, and there was no sunlight. It was fine as I was out most days but if I had preferred a bit of a nap / rest and Vitamin D, it was just a wee bit dark even with the balcony door opened.
The second issue was the air conditioning that was very noisy and as it got quite muggy summer nights, I want able to get it to cool down to a preferred temperature i.e about 20C
The last issue wasnt so much a hotel issue but one of plumbing and design. There was a lovely jungle shower but the taps were located close by the wall rather than by the shower door, so one had to quickly turn the tap on, and jump out the way,wet, until the water temperature was tepidly warm. But thats a design that seems in hotels worldwide.
All i all, a great stay, great location and highly recommend.

title: Highly recommended!
text: I stayed at The Gotham Hotel for at week with my son, and we had a great stay. The room was nice and clean with a comfortable bed, the staff were really friendly and very helpful and the location is perfect - walking distance to Times Square, Central Park and Grand Central Station. I will definitely stay at The Gotham again; I highly recommend it!

title: I loved this place until my husband was bitten by bedbugs
text: I have had more hits on my prior review for I loved this hotel. But last visit we saw bugs and my husband was badly bitten by bed bugs. I told the front desk. I wrote 2 emails and even sent a letter just to tell them that a doctor confirmed that the bites were from bed bugs and we never heard from the hotel. Do you want to stay in that type of establishment? Sorry but I must correct the record AVOID THIS HOTEL!!!

title: Good weekend stay
text: The hotel is in a great location. We had the skyline terrace room. Beautiful terrace and the room was spacious and clean. The staff are so wonderful they sent a bottle of rose up to the room after we told them we were celebrating our anniversary. Very thoughtful. Would definitely come back here :)

title: A Great Stay
text:

title: They Cancelled my reservation the day before we were to arrive!

If they knew about the glich and that it was over booked why didn’t they call me 6 months ago!! Won’t be staying at this hotel next time I go to New York if that’s how they treat their customers!!

title: Best Hotel in New York

We checked in with Darline Pete and Sean, and were devastated to learn that our plans of going to Carmine's weren't possible because we didn't have a reservation but oh well that's NYC right? Everything is so busy and everyone is too busy to care about you. Except for at the Gotham! About 10 minutes after we got into the rooms we got a call from Pete that our plans were back on. title: WARNING: Choose another hotel (unless... caveats contained within)
text:
This is why we chose the hotel: We (2) like to think of ourselves as budget-conscious travelers who occasionally spend a bit more to enjoy a nice trip. We looked at a number of hotels in Midtown Manhattan, and thought The Gotham seemed like a very good option amongst the plethora of fancy establishments. The location appealed to us as it was central to many attractions. The hotel also advertised balconies for all of its rooms, which sounded idyllic for taking in the sights and sounds of NYC. So, despite the hefty price tag ($275 a night with taxes/fees, definitely out of our normal price range), we thought a 2-night splurge would be a nice way to spend a weekend in Manhattan. The location was as advertised. Everything else… read below: 

First of all the lobby is tiny. A rough estimate of the size would place it at around 250 square feet. This is mostly a non-issue if you are checking in and out at the appropriate hours (3PM and 12PM, respectively). However, if you are arriving early (or leaving late) and had planned to spend the extra time in the hotel lobby, this might be a problem. There is a nice little coffee shop immediately adjacent to the hotel (Gregory's), however, in case you need a place to camp out for a little bit. This doesn't factor into the negative review whatsoever; this is purely FYI. 

As any reasonably well-traveled individual might expect, hotels have a spectrum of “standard rooms”. There are ones on higher floors with gorgeous views, and there are ones on lower floors where… you are on display to the public. Given the price we paid for our stay, I was really anticipating something at least reasonable. Boy was I mistaken. My guess is that the room we got was probably one of the “worst” rooms in the hotel. The word “worst” is in parentheses because… #firstworldproblems. 

Let's break it down into the individual complaints:

1. It had absolutely no natural lighting. Being that it was on such a low floor, with high-rise buildings all around, absolutely no sunlight came into this room. I mean, it truthfully felt like night regardless of the time of day.
