While we didn’t anticipate spending much time in the hotel room during the daytime hours (our NYC itinerary was packed!), we also didn’t want to suffer from seasonal affective disorder in the height of spring. 

2. It had no balcony. Part of the reason for choosing this hotel was because the rooms were advertised as having balconies. The thought of sipping some coffee while taking in the sights and sounds of NYC was definitely part of the appeal. Perhaps I was reading too much into the word "balcony", but I was really expecting it to be… elevated. However, our room actually opened up onto a cement courtyard. So our "balcony" was actually a flat patch of cement that... connected to more cement. I think “porch” would be the appropriate term here. The hotel should amend their ads to say that all rooms come with a balcony (or a porch). 

3. Our “balcony” was flooded. Because our room was situated on the lowest floor that had guest rooms, this (very excitingly) meant that condensation from the AC units above ours fell down onto our porch. So not only did we not have a balcony, but the patch of cement that we were supposed to "lounge" on was basically filled with a pool of condensation from the AC units above (and our own!). This meant that we got to listen to the dripping of AC droplets 24/7. 

4. Our room didn’t have heat. NYC sure does have some wacky weather! The first night we stayed at the hotel, the temperature was in the high 80s, it was humid, and we had the AC on blast (we were just adding to the collection of condensation that was already collecting on our porch). The second night, though, it was in the 50s! It had rained all day, it was quite windy, and we were shivering through our poorly planned lack of layers. So, on the way back to the hotel, we were super excited to get that heat cranked up! A warm hotel room after a cold rainy day... what could be better?! I'll tell you what... a cold hotel room! Why? Because our heater didn't work. I think it was the hotel's way of telling us to toughen up, stop whining, ask for a second comforter, and gather around a wastebasket fire for warmth. NOTE: Please do not light any wastebasket fires. 

So, in summary, I would recommend that you avoid this hotel if you don't want to be relegated to one of the “special” rooms that I described above. However, the title of my review mentioned caveats! So... TL;DR version: 

1. If you dislike garlic and holy crosses, produce no reflection in mirrors, come from Transylvania, then the room above would be perfect. Expect no natural light. 

2. If you are extremely averse to heights, and the concept of a balcony scares you (but you love porches!), then the room above would be perfect. Your balcony is a slab of concrete on the ground floor. It’s a porch. I’ve now typed the word porch so much that it has lost all meaning to me. Porch. 

3. If you can't sleep unless you hear the incessant and inconsistent pitter-patter of water (on your ground floor “balcony”) then the room above would be perfect. The sound of AC condensation from the rooms above you will lull you into quiet slumber. 

4. If you like the thought of paying a lot of money to have certain luxuries (IE: electricity, running water, a fantastic Midtown Manhattan location) but not others (IE: a functional heating system), then by definition you enjoy glamping. And if that’s the case, then this hotel room is the perfect fit for you. No fires please. 

End diatribe.

title: Great Memorial Day weekend stay!
text: Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. This hotel has a great location in Midtown. Has close access to Grand Central Station subway station. We stayed on the 8th floor in a King room. Room was clean. Bed comfortable. The few staff members we encountered seem nice enough. Not much more you can ask for out of a hotel if you ask me. I'd stay here again!

title: Excellent hotel, excellent location
text: We were in Gotham Hotel 11 days. The hotel has fantastic location, room was nice and neat, personnel very kind, efficient and very client oriented. Special thanks to Tina, Darline, Alex and Shaun in this regard. We had a small terrace, our view was to the wall, it is a bit noisy when you are out on terrace, but it is irrelevant when you consider that you are in the heart of NY and can visit almost all best city sites on foot!  That really matters! We will for sure book this hotel again when we visit NY in future and we are pleased to recommend it to our friends. Many thanks to Ms. Adisa Feratovic and all staff of the hotel. See you soon, Bora and Jelena

title: Absolutly Not 4.5 Stars
text:
Stayed at this hotel 7 nights: from April 26th to May 3rd 2018.
 We are outraged at the Hotels.com site which advises hotels without saying the major drawbacks and without checking the correspondence of the stars that the hotel claims, for The Gotham 4.5 stars. We asked for a suite with a quiet terrace on the upper floors, a month before, also with a note at the hotel as we arrived on the night of April 27th. The management assigned us  the first suite, the lowest and the noisiest, exploiting our late check-in. The big surprise was that in W 46th Street, right in front of the hotel, a big building is in complete repair and the work lasts day and  night, including those with the jackhammers, as well as the delivery of the equipment by huge trucks with trailer. Hotels.com should be honest and treat its guests by informing them (not hiding the flaws), while it seems that the only purpose of this reservation system is to collect the commission. In addition, this hotel is by no means a 4-stars hotel for the following reasons:
 The hotel does not have a lobby (just 2 little benches in front of the desk). No maintenance of the rooms (handle of the broken terrace during all the stay, heating broken down for 4 days) The refuelling (toilet paper, coffee, soap) is not done (it is always necessary to ask). There is not a breakfast room. Nobody said that there is one.The cleaning of the room is very bad.

title: Feces-water overflow onto my property, limited toilet use, freezing showers, dirty, unimaginably rude staff, noise
text:
Stayed here for a long time in May. Horrific. Every type of complaint that I made has already been made by someone else on this site.

To begin, The Toilet. It was faulty and couldn't even handle a test flush without any prior use. Frequently had to leave hotel to search for public toilets. On one occasion after peeing in the toilet and depositing a few sheets of paper in it, the toilet brought back up other people's feces and belched them over the floor and my property. On another occasion I sat on the bed while listening to someone pumping out bile and sloshing it into a garbage bag they'd brought up.

Second, The Freezing Showers. The shower system seemed faulty. Warm water was available on the first day and then never again, despite using the exact same settings. 

Third, The Dirty State. After a housekeeping session, it was normal for rubbish to be left uncollected, for replenishment of room items (like toilet paper) to be forgotten (despite repeated reminders) and for parts of the room to be ignored (like the shower, which was never cleaned despite how long we stayed). 

And finally, the crescendo that was The Unimaginably Rude Staff. I politely reported all issues from the second day that we were there but nobody followed up to see if our experience was improving. I think this description of our check-out process does a good job of summarising how poorly we were treated: HOTEL: Did you enjoy your stay? / US: No. It was disappointing, if we were being honest, just as we have reported to you throughout our whole stay. / HOTEL: (Squares eyes) What? / US: It was disappointing, if we were being honest. / HOTEL: (Rolls eyes) Well it was all paid in advance so that's done now.

title: Last minute booking.
text: About to have our last night in this lovely hotel. Great room with a balcony for some fresh air. Fantastic service from the guys on reception and the door service. The other half and I would definitely book this hotel again. We really have no complaints.

title: great location and nice hotel
text: stayed here with a friend just for two nights.  it was a bit last minute so we didn't really do much research but we ended up choosing the hotel by chance.  it is a nice hotel with comfy beds and the location is really good.  Our view was terrible, but we were out all the time so it doesn't matter that much.  It wasn't super cheap but then it is NYC!  And maybe youd get a better deal booking more in advance.

title: Terrible stay
text: Was here for three nights. Never once had hot water in the bathroom. Complained twice but nothing done. There was a welcome note in my room for a previous guest which was there for the duration of my stay but I never got one. Says it all!

title: Great location, but expensive
text:
We stayed here for a week, our first time to New York. We paid for a room with a balcony about £1600. I emailed before arriving asking if we could have a nice view, the hotel did reply basically  saying ‘no chance’. On arrival, we were greeted ok, we didn’t get told anything useful about the hotel. Our room was a good size, lovely bathroom, very clean. The bed was lovely as beds are in America hotels. As for the view, well a brick wall in my book isn’t a view. We were on the 4th floor, we had no natural light, could only see the sky if we leant right over the balcony and looked up, see photo’s. We had to have the lights on all the time.
Do not pay extra for a balcony unless you can afford one of the top floors.
As for the house keeping, check your alarm clock each day, ‘very strangely’ all the alarms on our floor went off at 8.30am every morning until we pulled the plug.
We kept having to ask for the condiments to be replenished each day and annoyingly the housekeeper would knock on the door within 5minutes every time we returned to the room to see if we needed anything, instead of just doing it when she cleaned the room.
There is no bar, well we weren’t told about one, no sitting area except in the small lobby.
The guys on the door were more helpful & polite than the reception staff.
The hotel is in a great location walking distance to all the main attractions. If you only going for a couple of days than I would recommend it, but any longer I wouldn’t.

title: very nice modern hotel
text: stayed here for 2 nights whilst in new york for 5 nights, check in was fast and easy we were given room on the 17th floor lifts (2 of) are quick, room was very nice huge comfy bed and a handy balcony and a lovely coffee maker, we were at the back of the hotel and the view was of nothing really just buildings and windows was a little disappointing but to be fair we didnt spend much time in it only for sleeping, didnt try the onsite restaurant but it looked nice, the location is great times square and all the hustle and bustle about 10 minutes walk away but when you get back to the hotel its nice and quiet, would stay again would of been better with a nicer view but would recommend

title: Great bar.
text: We met friends for drinks here on Black Friday (sorry I’ve only just gotten round to writing a review!) Perfect place after shopping. Great atmosphere, good food and drinks. I’ve heard the hotel is amazing too and would like to stay.

title: 近隣ビルの空調設備の音がうるさい！
text:
バルコニー付きという事で興味本位で宿泊。
バルコニーからの景色は隣のビルを眺めるだけで価値はありません。
近隣のビルの空調設備の騒音が反響し、とてもうるさい。
特に夜は酷く、ホテル自体の空調から定期的に蓋がしまるような「バタン、バタン」という音も加わり寝るのに苦労します。
二度目の利用はあり得ません。

title: Bella vacanza di 5 giorni a New York
text: Veramente un ottimo hotel, familiare e non troppo grande ("solo" 25 piani), piccola hall ma con addetti che aprono le porte in uscita ed entrata! Bel bar ed ottimo ristorante della catena Wolfgang's Steak House! Avevo una suite non enorme ma con tutto l'occorrente e, molto importante per i fumatori, una bella terrazza ammobiliata, materasso e cuscini perfetti, grande doccia! La posizione è eccellente, a 50 metri dalla 5th street! Il personale tutto era veramente sorridente e gentile ristorante compreso, una nota in particolare va alla signorina Tina, presente alla reception, splendida ragazza con un sorriso ed una gentilezza fuori dal comune, oltre che molto efficiente!! Serberò sempre un bellissimo ricordo di questo Hotel!

title: The gotham Hotel and its fees!!
text: Lovely hotel and facilities, great location as central but also down a side street away from the hustle and bustle of NYC. However watch out for the fees they take from your card as incidentals, paid my entire bill including taxes but it has been almost 2 weeks since I checked out from the hotel and the incidentals are still showing as pending transactions on my debit card which when they total over £500 can be hard to cope with when I have a mortgage and other monthly payments to be taken. Add onto this a lack of communication from hotel management as to why over £500 in incidentals have been debited from my card instead of the £100 agreed on the day of check in and I have a bit of a sour taste in my mouth about my stay here now which is a real shame as I would have recommended this hotel to others.

title: Boa localização
text:
O hotel The Gotham possui alguns pontos bastante positivos: localização (próximo aos principais pontos e muito perto da Grand Central Station), conforto e espaço (o quarto e grande, com boa cama e chuveiro). Único ponto não tão legal é o restaurante do hotel (terceirizado pelo que entendi). Os valores são absurdos e a comida particularmente não nos agradou. Não tomamos café da manhã nenhum dia no hotel, mas isso não foi problema pois ao lado tem uma cafeteria muito boa, com bastante opções, a preço justo. 
Em cordialidade, alguns colaboradores do hotel foram bem cordiais outros nem tanto. Mas isso não atrapalhou a hospedagem. Como os valores praticados em Manhattan são bem salgados, não saberia dizer se pelo preço (o hotel não é barato), talvez merecêssemos um pouco mais de mimo e cuidado em alguns pedidos durante a hospedagem. 
Ah, outro ponto positivo: o hotel não cobra para receber até 05 caixas de encomenda. E são bem organizados quanto a entrega. 
Ficamos por 12 dias e ficaria novamente, sem problemas.

title: Unbelievable Value!
text: I had high expectations for this hotel after reading the reviews and the hotel still managed to exceed them.  The rooms are very clean and beautifully appointed.  The beds were really comfortable and the staff amazing.  I can’t wait to return to the Giotham hotel.

title: Loved it here!
text: The Gotham is perfect for solo or couples! The beds were super comfortable, with a feather pillowbed topper and premium sheets. Balconies were a lovely touch, seeing Times Square from the communal balcony was an added bonus.  . Almost everything is walkable from The Gotham, which was awesome! The in-room nespresso virtuo machine convinced me I need one of those at home!  I only wished there were a bathtub, but other than that I couldn't be happier!

title: Great location if you need to be in Midtown, really needs a coat of paint and some better sound proofing
text:
We spent a weekend here for work in the city. The hotel is pet friendly and didn't give us any grief about having our service dog. The lobby area was small but the check in process was quick. 

The room was probably nice when it was new, there is a small balcony which isn't looking at too much, the building directly across the street is under massive construction and isn't much too look at. I know this isn't the hotels fault but its just what it is. The walls in the room were dirty, they were painted white and had a lot of black stuff and hand marks on them. They were very obvious and the room really needed a good cleaning. The bathroom was a nice with a spacious rain shower, and the bath soaps were all top notch. 

Wolfgang's Steakhouse is downstairs and although it is very pricey they have a great selection of food and booze. They provide the room service and the breakfast was great. 

Overall the place just needs a coat of paint and some love, wouldn't hurt to check the sound proofing either, the noise of midtown was pretty loud in the morning. We were there on the weekend too, Im sure its much worse during the week.

title: Excellent location and standard
text: Great beds, fantastic location and helpful staff. We stayed for 5 nights and were very pleased. We had booked a Deluxe King to get a view towards the 46th street. Cheaper rooms are probably towards the back, which is not as great.

title: great location
text: Excellent little hotel just off 5th Avenue and close walking distance to so many of NY attractions. The staff were welcoming and helpful The main feature though is location.The room was smallish but adequate. The only criticism is we chose a back room for the quiet and it was a little dark and the balcony only functioned as a space for clothes drying. But we really only slept in the room so it was not an issue.

title: Review of booking process/contact with hotel for upcoming trip
text:
Trip booked for Dec 18;

In booking a surprise trip to NYC for my parents, I’d been researching hotels and had set my heart on the Gotham hotel mainly due to location, amenities and the reviews on here. I was pricing the booking through Expedia but wanted to see if booking directly through the hotel could offer any additional benefits (and of course, any savings).

My enquiry was responded to, very promptly by the lovely Maggie and she was able to provide a competitive price for the same room type along with explaining the many perks to be had by booking with the hotel.
After much back and forth (all questions on my part and answered politely and very promptly each time by the aforementioned Maggie), it was not to be, as when taking into account the added credit card fee my back would charge for the overseas transaction/exchange rate conversion, it was more cost effective to book the flight plus hotel booking with Expedia.

So despite not booking through her, Maggie continue to be very accommodating and has noted my special requests against the Expedia room booking.

If all the staff are as lovely as Maggie and the hotel lives up to the reviews on here, then I know my parents will have a wonderful time!
I’m gutted I’m not going 😝

title: Great location. That’s where it ends
text:
We stayed for eight nights.  
The room was comfortable but a little nosey and there was no extra blanket provided. 
Twice when the room was serviced the bath floor mat was not replaced. 
The coffee pods where not replaced, also the hot water 🚿 took quite a wile to come through. 

Overall it was ok but we won’t be coming back due to the points above.

title: Awesome stay
text:
The Gotham Hotel is a wonderful property that has the personal touch. Maggie, goes above and beyond to make sure every detail is just as expected. 

The location is wonderful and I was able to walk everywhere I needed to go and a ton of food establishments are in the area, that offer a very wide selection for every appetite.

The rooms offer a wonderful use of space and are bright and clean.

title: Amazing stay
text: We came for a date night to the city to see a Broadway show. We stayed for 1 night but we didn't want to leave. The girl who checked us in was very friendly and welcoming (don't remember the name but she was Serbian). The room was very spacious and quiet. Nespresso coffee in the room was a big plus. I would definitely stay again and already recommended it to my friends.

title: Olor a aceite quemado, nose puede respirar, muy ruidoso, mucho frio en la hab.
text:
Imposible dormir. Tres razones:
1-Un olor horrible a aceite debido a los extractores de restaurantes de las plantas bajas  que dan a las ventanas, es como si durmieras enmedio de una fritanga. Un olor insoportable, insalubre y peligroso. En la recepción no se hacen cargo y el supervisor tampoco ofrece soluciones, solo una maquina ionizadora super grande que hace muchisimo ruido, imposible dormir con semejante ruido.
2-Muchisimo ruido. Antes de poner el ionizador en las habitaciones hay un ruido imposible. Olvidate de dormir y descansar. Las máquinas de AC parecen un tractor, es como el ruido de volar al lado de las alas del avion... 
3-Frio, habitaciones muy frias. El aire acondicionado hace muchisimo ruido, asi que tienes que escoger entre dormir o estar calentito. Si encientes el AC no podras descansar. Y si no lo enciendes mueres de frio. No tiene la opcion de regular la velocidad. 
Aparte habia mucho polvo en la habitación, los filtros del aire olian mal. 
Asi que, un regalito de hotel... vamos que en pocos sitios peor para quedarse... El personal por cierto muy impersonal, excepto el chico de mantenimiento que fue muy amable y no sabía donde meterse.
El supervisor y las personas de recepción no fueron nada de ayuda. 
De lo peorcito de todos los sitios que hemos estado...
Pd. A la direccion por favor ahorrese contestar. Pudieron hacerlo durante la estancia una de las 10 veces que os pedimos ayuda, ahora es tarde.

title: Awesome stay
text: The Gotham Hotel features a comfortable, yet modern, aesthetic that allows you to remain comfortable while still being in the heart of NYC. My friends and I loved every minute of it - from the customer service to the mini bar ;)

title: Great for a city break
text:
Location was great on 46th street, about a five minute walk from time square. Room was very small but I don’t suppose we needed it bigger, same with the bathroom (which was permanently freezing cold) ... tv in room, wardrobes etc, no complaints... staff very friendly on leaving and arriving each day! 

We paid extra for a room with a patio outside but we didn’t use it once because it was just too cold

title: Hotel proche de la 5eme avenue avec un rapport qualité prix correct
text: C'est un hôtel new yorkais rénové, très bien situé avec beaucoup de possibilités pour visiter la ville, personnel aimable, chambre rénové, un peu bruyant comme tout les hotels à New York, rapport qualité prix bon, restaurant dans l'hôtel est très correct

title: We'll be back.
text: Our room was very clean and the room was surprisingly a bit spacious for Manhattan. The Front Desk Staff was friendly. Our room didn't have a view though. We were facing a huge brick wall. Not really charming since we made sure to book all our hotels with a 'view'. It made us want to leave our room and go explore around but we might stay here again since the location is great!

title: Honeymoon
text: Stayed at the Gotham for the start of our honeymoon the staff were great and looked after us so well  and made sure if we needed anything they sorted it for us. organised pick up from the airport and dropped us back off. Very tidy  and smart rooms with great balcony views of New York!!

title: Great service
text: Booked 7 nights at the Gotham for march,wanted to upgrade room so contacted them via Facebook messenger,so far the service has been great with the help of Maggie,if the pre visit service is as good as the visit it will be a great honeymoon,all service I have received so far has been faultless,I look forward to staying and having a great time in new york

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
The Gotham Hotel has a great location. Almost every tourist attraction is only a few walking minutes away. 

What makes this hotel very special is its staff. Starting at the reception: Sanela, Darline and Aditiya are amazing people that always try to help - it does not matter if it is a recommendation to eat somewhere or any other questions that may occur. The bell man Shaun, Alex and Artan had always a smile on their faces when opening the door. Also, they were always very happy to help if there are questions for a food recommendation or how to get somewhere the fastest. When the reception was occupied by other guests, they always kept someone busy with small talk. 
Do not hesitate to ask for some ice or extra drinks. The house man Max, David and Ivan are more than welcome and very quick with bringing these up. 

Small hotel like this one make it special for every single guest because they treat each guest as an individual and try to do their best work to make everybodys stay memorable.

title: Great location
text: The Gotham hotel was clean and the rooms were nice. I must say I have never slept on such a comfortable bed in my entire life. The location is great. Walking distance to most of what tourists come to NYC for. A few problems though- checking was postponed over an hour (maybe we just got unlucky) and our balcony door would not shut all the way and lock. That would have been okay if it wasn’t 4 degrees out. Besides those two issues it was a wonderful hotel.

title: Amazing hotel and amazing staff
text: Was so impressed with The Gotham.  I stay in NYC a lot and in different hotels, and the is by far the best.  The room was very big.  And we had a balcony. Unheard in NYC hotels.  The price was amazing.  And then there was the staff.  So kind and gracious.  I need to do a special shout for Shaun the doorman.  While I was waiting for my car I watched Shaun help an elderly lady get a cab.  Not just hail a cab, he walked to the end of the street, got in the cab, drove it back to the hotel and then helped her get into the cab. And she wasn't even a hotel guest.  Just someone needing help on the street.  So impressed with that!!!  Great job Shaun.  We will definitely be back to stay again!  Thank you so much for just being amazing!!!

title: Registration Process - Wonderful sales staff
text: My trip isn't until October, but I felt compelled to leave a review of the service I've received so far. I noticed that a lower rate was available from the hotel than the one I booked at on Expedia. I cancelled my Expedia reservation and called the Gotham Hotel and spoke with Maggie. I told her that their website was showing a length of stay rate promotion that I wanted to take advantage of. She told me that that rate had actually expired but she would be happy to honor it for me. She quickly pulled my new reservation together and the whole process was so easy, and Maggie was a dream to work with. I have booked a skyline junior suite and she made a note in the system to be put in her favorite room with the best view and larger terrace. She even personally followed up via email and said she wanted to leave a note the staff leave a bottle of wine or Prosecco in the room prior to our arrival, to let her know our preference. JUST WOW. I will never book through Expedia again, and always choose to deal with lovely people like Maggie directly. Thanks Maggie and Gotham Hotel... can't wait until our visit in October!

title: Great Customer Service
text:
My experience with The Gotham Hotel got off to a very rocky start, and I was close to give them 1 star rating, but it ends up with me giving them a well deserved 5 star rating instead. How'd that happen you might ask? Please read on:

Through a booking snafu with an online booking site (company's name withheld, but it rhymes with shmeaptickets.com), I got my wife and I stuck with a booking reservation at The Gotham Hotel that we weren't happy with. I called the booking company to try to have it changed, but they said they couldn't get authorization from The Gotham Hotel to do anything about it. After over 3.5 hours of going in circles on the phone with the booking site, it left me extremely dissatisfied and annoyed. During that time, I had also contacted the hotel but couldn't get a definitive resolution either way. The hotel gave me the email contact of their sales coordinator, Maggie Moriarty, which I (now regretfully) ended up venting all of my frustrations towards with a couple of angry emails. A couple of hours later, Maggie responded to my emails, and was extremely cordial with me, apologizing profusely for not being able to respond sooner; this is in spite of the unwarranted lack of manners I showed. She genuinely seemed sympathetic to my concerns and she took the time to figure out the situation and rectify the issue. The cause of the issue ended up being a miscommunication because the booking site didn't communicate all details to the hotel. I felt like a jerk considering, she was the one apologizing to me. I told her as much, but Maggie continued to follow up with emails and offered to help compensate for all of the trouble I experienced. This goes above and beyond good customer service. Considering the trouble I caused myself booking through a hotel booking site, I will certainly look to book with The Gotham hotel directly anytime I visit Manhattan. Aside from this, the location is great, central to most things, and the prices of their rooms are some of the best around for what is offered. Each room has a balcony which is a nice bonus. Special thanks to Maggie for changing my views of The Gotham Hotel. I definitely recommend staying here.

title: We will be back!
text:
I loved everything about our weekend here. The room was clean and exactly as described on their site. Check in was quick. The staff was very professional and quick to respond to requests for extras such as coffee, towels, etc. we had to ask for a do not disturb sign but has it in less than 5 minutes. Smoking is allowed on room balconies and they will give you an ashtray if you ask. 

The only problem we had was not directly with the hotel but with the parking garage they use. We were given a voucher and were told parking would be $40/day. When we picked up the car we presented the garage with the voucher and were charged $120. We were there for 2 days (almost to the minute) I questioned it at the garage and the attendant just looked at me like I was an idiot and repeated “that will be $120”. I mentioned it to the hotel staff who apologized but has no control of the situation which I completely understand but it was still frustrating.

title: Great Small Modern Hotel In An Ideal Location
text: We just spent a winter weekend at the Gotham and it is now at the top of our list for whenever we visit New York in the future.  It's close both to Grand Central and to Times Square.  The staff is friendly and attentive.  The rooms are remarkably large for the city and because there are only three or four rooms on each floor you have a sense of privacy and very little ambient noise to deal with.  There is also free Wifi, which a lot of NYC hotels don't offer.

title: Great stay, great location, and access to Equinox gym was a plus
text:
I stayed at this hotel for a work conference and found the staff to be friendly and helpful. They do not have a gym on sight and their usual Equinox gym they partnered with was closed for the weekend, but they were able to call to another Equinox gym and get me in free of charge. The room was spacious, the bed comfortable, and the waterfall shower a huge plus. 

The location near 5th Avenue and the Rockefeller center makes it very easy to go out and experience the city.

title: Mostly good...
text: We arrived for check in after a 7 hour flight. Got to our room which the heater was not working, no hangers in the wardrobe, 1 robe and pair of slippers, no kettle, spoons, cups...staff however were very quick to rectify all the above. The room itself was very comfortable; large comfy bed and pillows, gorgeous bathroom with large walk in shower and modern fixtures. Big shout out to Sean and Shaun; Doormen who always had a smile and were extremely courteous. Hotel is well positioned to enjoy all the main sights of NYC. Also offer a Limo service to the airport at good prices. On the whole, once we had settled in, we enjoyed our stay. Would recommend. Reasonably priced rates also.

title: Very Attentive Desk Staff
text: Stayed one night to meet a friend who had a layover.  Hotel desk staff were very helpful and pleasant.  Room was attractive, clean, and quiet.  Price in January is very good for the quality and location.  Will definitely book a room there again.

title: Great hotel ideal location
text:
Me and my fiancee recently returned from a 5 night stay at the gotham hotel.
Not the easiest place to locate but if you look for Wolfgang steak house and not gotham hotel that should do it.

We had a junior suite with a balcony with great views of time square loved it.

Really good location 5 min walk to gran central , rockerfeller centre and times square. 

Rooms really spacious huge beds really comfy not too much noise full cable tv selection.

Overall 9/10 would definately return highly reccomended

title: Exelente
text:
El hotel es divino,ubicacion perfecta .a pasos de la 5 avenida , la habitacion es muy comoda .
Darline de recepcion es super amable y toda la atencion en general fue exelente
Su manager Mirio muy atento .

title: I love a hotel that loves books!
text: For a New York hotel, this was pretty sizeable and pretty affordable. On the better end of shabby chic i.e. the shower was a bit dodgy. But, generally clean and very welcoming with little balconies and a rooftop balcony. Little chocolates and an inspiring quote after the room clean and a generally relaxed experience.

title: Excelente ubicacion
text: El hotel esta perfectamente ubicado a 4 cuadras de times square, la gente en recepción es super servicial y atenta. Las habitaciones son muy grandes y cómodas y cuentan con un amplio baño. Es un excelente hotel boutique en pleno Midtown.

title: Won’t Stay Here Again
text:
With the wide variety of hotels in NYC, you would think that hotels would do their part to try and stand out from the competition so their guests can return. The Gotham clearly has no interest in doing so. 

I called a few days prior requesting an early check-in and didn’t receive one. You’re never guaranteed an early check-in, so that’s no big deal. But I was told there were no other rooms available in the hotel (I was willing to pay for an upgrade) - but I ended up finding out that the hotel was, in fact, not sold out like I was told by the front desk agent. Why they felt the need to lie to me when I was willing to pay more is beyond me. 

The rooms are okay. Mattresses and pillows are comfortable. Room is clean, but very dusty.  Had problems with the TV throughout my entire stay. Reception would come in and out, receiver would be out of range for the remote control, TV randomly would turn on and off. Very bizarre. Room had a great heating system, so it kept me warm in the 20 degrees temperature (this Miami boy really needed it!). Rooms are also pretty big, according to NYC standards. 

I was not told that there was construction on the street where the hotel was. 46th Ave was completely blocked off and had to walk in from 5th Ave. No big deal ... until I tried to nap. My room was facing the construction and it was incredibly noisy. A heads up would’ve been nice. 

I asked the front desk agent and the doorman, both of which were inattentive and disinterested in being there (almost as if they were bothered by my questions), about restaurant suggestions. I was suggested a nearby diner, “a Portuguese restaurant, two Italian restaurants and a Brazilian restaurant” ... how about some names for these places?? NYC is a world-class city for food - I was shocked to see that the hotel couldn’t provide a solid list of good nearby restaurants. 

Also, there’s no secondary lock on the room door, nor is there a do not disturb sign. So privacy and security is limited here. 

On several occasions, I’d get off the elevator and would see trash bags in the hallway. Not cute. 

Overall, I wouldn’t stay here again. There wasn’t really anything to make me want to come back. If you’re looking for a no-frills place to sleep, you should be fine. I travel often, so I enjoy properties that offer friendly service and amenities. The only thing keeping me from rating this stay “terrible” was the fact that I got a good night sleep, hence my “poor” rating. For the amount of money I paid, I feel as if I didn’t get my money’s worth. Sad!

title: A Good Choice
text: The Gotham Hotel provided us with everything we were looking for during our recent weekend in New York City: an ideal location for access to the Broadway theaters; a wonderfully accommodating staff; and a clean, comfortable and reasonably priced room.  We were especially impressed with the friendliness and service of Aditya. Try this hotel; you won't be sorry.

title: Overall nice stay in great location
text:
I took my fiance to NYC for his 30th birthday. I selected The Gotham due to its proximity to the theater district (we had tickets for a Broadway show). Making a reservation was easy and I was able to take advantage of a sale. 

I was able to "pre check in" via email that confirmed I was coming, authorized charge to my card, and asked for my estimated arrival time. I put in 2:45 since I thought we would arrive by 3 (normal check in) and thought it might ensure our room was ready. (SPOILER ALERT: IT DIDN'T). It also stated that I would receive an email verification that my room was ready- it was never completed. 

When we arrived, I was informed that the room wasn't ready as it was a full house the night before. Things get busy, I get it. The receptionist stated that it would be 15 minutes and they would call when it was ready, but we were welcome to wait in the lobby. We stayed and waited, since it was very cold outside. 

40 minutes later, I approached the desk as I had received neither phone call nor email. Lo and behold, our room was ready! Nice of them to tell us that as we sat there....

The room itself was very nice. Our one gripe was that the toilet appeared to be a "low flow" and you had to hold the flusher down in order for it to actually complete a flush. We had a king sized bed and balcony. There were plenty of lights, and a nespresso coffee machine. Even though there were two of us, there were only 1 of certain things, like the robe and slippers, but it didn't matter since we didn't plan to use them. There were also plenty of cream and sugar for the coffee, but no stirrers!

When the room was serviced on the first morning, they left a weather report and chocolates, but neglected to refill the coffee pods. This was not a big deal, as we aren't big fans of the single pod coffees and there is both a coffee shop and dunkin donuts in the same block. The room was very clean and check out was a breeze.

title: Worst Stay In NYC
text: This Has Been The Worst Experience We Ever Had In NYC Sorry But Ms. Sanela Sau Should Be Taking Her Job More Serious Instead Of Hanging With Friends While At Work.. In Some Rooms Heat's Not Working Properly In Specially The Penthouse, and 14th flr Also Hot Water Runs Out in Just A Few Minutes And It Comes Out White... They Gave Us Keys To Our "Room" To Find Other People Already Checked In It You Go To The Front Desk And They Seem Bothered By Their Own Mistake.. Got Moved 3 Times Was Charged For A Specific Suite And Never Even Got To See What It Looked Like... OVER ALL NEVER AGAIN I DEF DON'T RECOMEND IT TO ANYONE! Stay At Marriott Courtyard Manhattan/Central Park Go To Hotels.com And Retailmenot.com For Deals And Coupons On Your Stay

title: Better places to stay for better value
text:
Spent 8 nights at here. On the day of check out I had arranged to have a late checkout at 1pm instead of 12pm. At 1.06pm I received a call from the front desk from a very rude woman asking why I hadn't checked out. After 8 nights I thought they could have forgiven my 6 minute delay. When I went to the desk to check out the blonde curly haired woman who had called me was very rude and unfriendly.

The minibar in my room wasn't restocked any day. The lifts, corridors and my room stank of weed throughout my stay. There was constantly laundry and full trash bags left in the corridor by housekeeping. 

The bed was comfortable and the hotel is a good location for tourists and business travellers.

title: Great Location
text:
I stayed here for 5 nights in December, and the location of this property is ideal. Centrally located, and walking distance from a lot of major attractions.
There is a great restaurant inside the building, and staff were very helpful and attentive. 
The rooms are of a good size, but the bathroom was a little on the small size. There also needs to be a ceiling light in the room, as it was quiet dark due to only having the bed side lamps.
Staff were very helpful, and welcoming. Very easy check in too.
Only thing was they charged my account twice for the stay, which took over a week to be rectified which was slightly frustrating.
On the whole though a very good stay, and I would stay here again.

title: Christmas in NY
text:
Enjoyed our stay at The Gotham Hotel for 7 nights in December. 

Pros: 
1. Location is great! Short walk to Rockefeller and shops! We walked everywhere except caught taxi to Brooklyn, downtown & upper west side. 
2. Friendly snd helpful staff! I needed to print some tickets and the staff were very helpful with this. 
3. Great view of city out our side window. We could see Times Square lights. 
4. Balcony was a great addition - however we didn't use much because it was cold. 
5. Great shower - 2 shower heads with good pressure. 
6. Popular restaurant on site - we didn't use this but it looked nice! 

Cons: 
1. There is an Nespresso coffee machine in room however the pods were not re stocked. We didn't mind because we liked trying coffee in different spots throughout the city, but I can imagine other people would like them to be re stocked. We didn't ask about this but maybe if you want to ensure you have pods each day you could check with staff. 
2. Small bathroom -  bit squishy but was not a huge issue. 

Tips: 
Stay in a queen skyline - this ensures street views. 
We stayed on level 18.

title: Sanela Sau is the best!
text: I booked this hotel via the "Hotel Night" which I highly recommend people do. The service I received from Sanela Sau as soon as I stepped in the hotel was definitely 5 stars. I highly recommend booking through her and at this hotel.

title: Never ever stay here find somewhere else
text: We went out in the middle of the night to eat and when we came back our room door was OPEN!!! Now in the morning I realized I left a $700 designer item called 40 minutes after I checked in said I left the item in the room they told me they will call the lady that cleaned the room since she left for the day already (hard to believe) then said they couldn’t reach her she was probably on the train I had to keep calling back and getting different answers I told them about the open door they said “that happens “ I asked if they had cameras the first person said yes then later said no they said they checked my room and found nothing and they had no reason not to believe the housekeeper I have warned others about this dishonest so be cautious because of u leave your room door will somehow mysteriously open and your items will disappear

title: Wonderful Stay
text: Just got back from a 4 night trip to New York staying at The Gotham Hotel. As hotels go this is definetely up there with the best of them. We booked a Skyline terrace on the 16th floor with a balcony that gave us great views onto the New York Streets. There was building work going on oposite but it didnt disturb us in any way at all. The room itself was clean, spacious and well equiped. The staff were extremely pleasant and helped us when we had a couple of small issues. I loved the small touches like he books and the complimentary drinks available and with it being a small hotel we never once has an issue with waiting for lifts unlike other hotels i have stayed in.I should also mention the bed which was extremely comfy and gave is a wonderful nights sleep. All in all a fabulous location and place to stay, highly reccomended.

title: Great value and experience
text: Everything in this hotel is efficient and optimal . Not too expensive , fantastic breakfast experience. Try their fabulous pancakes and omelette. The  bar is also very robust at night . The rooms are comfy and very suitable for family or business .

title: Great Boutique Hotel!
text: This is a wonderfully located boutique hotel - midtown on 46th.  What makes it extraordinary, though,  is its staff - Mirio, Front Desk Manager, Jasmine, Sean, Alex and Aditya were spectacular ambassadors for the hotel!  We were personally greeted each and every time we left or entered, the staff's help in finding restaurants, transportation or anything and everything we asked for was stellar.  The rooms were larger than normal.  Loved this place and plan to come back again!  Also, restaurant is not associated with the hotel is lovely.  Their bar is also very nice.

title: Kleines Hotel in der Nähe der 5.Ave
text:
Keines  freundliches Hotel im einer überschaubaren Menge an Zimmern.
Die Zimmer sind gut ausgestattet und sauber. ca. 100 m entfernt von der 5.Ave.
Das es in NYC nicht leise ist darf man nicht erwarten. Die Fenster würde ich auch nicht öffnen aber in welchen Hotel in Manhattan geht das schon.

title: Wonderful Weekend
text:
We recently stayed at the Gotham Hotel while in NYC to visit family and see the show Beautiful.
The weather was perfect and we walked everywhere during our three day, two night stay.
The folks at the Gotham Hotel could not have been more helpful and a special thank you to Aditya, who gave us great recommendations for breakfast, Italian dinner and an Irish pub to enjoy a late afternoon libation.
The room was clean and simple with plenty of room for the two of us, bed was comfortable and everything worked fine.
The location was an easy walk to Radio City, Central Park and all the mid town attractions.
We will certainly book here for our next visit to the city.
Parking a block away for $40 a night was an added bonus if you drive into the city.

title: Great Value!
text: I booked this hotel last minute for my family. The value was very good compared to other chain hotels. This boutique hotel has a great location and the rooms were spacious and clean. I got a room with a King size bed with a balcony. I would not complain about the view of facing another building. The whole point of visiting NYC is to get out and enjoy all the great sights, especially during the holidays. Every staff member that we came across was very professional and nice. I will stay here again on my next visit.

title: Agradable, céntrico y recomendable
text: La verdad que las expectativas eran normalitas para la grata sorpresa que nos llevamos. Habitación muy amplia con buen servicio y trato. Muy limpio y recomendable. Muy céntrico y con restaurante en la planta 0. Sin duda un hotel para volver.

title: 最悪な部屋・エアコンの故障、トイレ流れずｅｔｃ
text:
ﾆｭｰﾖｰｸで一番おもてなしの出来ていないホテルでしょう！
最低でした。確かに場所は中心部ですから良いですが…それだけでした良い点は。
寒い日にエアコンは調子悪いし、暖かくなくて！
なりよりも、毎日の清掃がデタラメでした。
大変雑なホテルです。残念でした。

title: Amazing Staff
text: The staff at Gotham Hotel is incredibly friendly and make for an overall great experience. The room is quite large for NYC. Be mindful that balconies on the backend of the building have absolutely no view.

title: Teşekkürler The Gotham Hotel
text: Merkezi bir konuma sahip olan otelin aynı zamanda ilgili ve çözüm odaklı bir çalışan kadrosu mevcut. Amerika'ya balayı için geldiğimizi öğrenen yetkililer sürpriz yaparak otelin en üst 26. katında yer alan Penthouse odasına yönlendirdiler. Ek olarak ikramlarda da bulundular. Her şey çok güzeldi. Teşekkürler...

title: Would definitely recommend this hotel.
text: Wonderful staff, with special mention to Aditya our doorman, Max and front desk staff, Karissa and Clarissa!  Perfect location, comfy bed and room was fabulous! I will definately stay at this hotel again.

title: Good value and size for NYC
text:
I decided to book here based on review info and I’ll share some things to help other guests.
Hotel is a small independent so it’s not your typical chain with a big lobby and common areas.
I booked a skyline junior suite and had the 10th floor with a huge private terrace but limited view. It is across from a major construction project but that didn’t bother me or keep me from sitting outside.The king bed was so comfortable and I slept so well the three nights I was there and that’s not typical when I travel ! 
I turned the thermostat fan on and that kept any street noise from being an issue. (The room itself is pretty sound proof)
Some areas of improvement would be DUSTING! 
Some of the shelves hadn’t been touched in awhile. 
The tv remote doesn’t work unless you are pointing it near the top of the tv ( the cable box is hiding behind tv) so you can’t change channels from the bed. 
Fridge in room is a big plus and the shower is great.
There seemed to be plenty of lighting once I found the switches for over the coffee area that has nesspresso but I don’t drink coffee so they brought a tea kettle up and that was perfect. 
Also, if you need ice just ask they will bring that up to you,promptly! 
Overall I really enjoyed the location and the staff. 
Both ladies running the front desk (AM and PM) were helpful and kind and they were very professional. The rest of the staff were all kind and helpful as well. 
Thanks!

title: AMAZING HOTEL! Great staff
text:
Travels from Australia and first time in New York and the States. We were looking for a hotel close to everything and we found it! The price was average compared to other hotel we were looking at BUT this one has a balcony and is reasonably large. 

We stayed in the junior skyline terrace. From the reviews we have heard such good things about glass walls and good views. Unfortunately, we got put in the bottom one so we had a very large concrete wall blocking everything (it was the biggest balcony they had but the worst view). We didn’t get to see anything which was a big downside. In front of us was a construction site which was worse. LUCKILY they have a shared balcony on the top floor you can use. 

Aditya and Michelle are the ones who made our stay so special. Aditya (doorman) was the more friendliest person and was so welcoming. An asset to the hotel definitely. Michelle (receptionist) was also so lovely. It was my birthday so I was provided complimentary champagne (twice). One of arrival and one on my actual birthday. This was very special. 

We will definitely stay again (considering we actually get a good view next time lol) 

Thanks guys!!

title: Recommended, but with some reservations
text:
First of all let me be clear:  I would definitely recommend this hotel, but it does have some shortcomings- as all hotels do.
Starting with the good things- the location is PERFECT, it is just off 5th Avenue and walking distance from Grand Central, the Chrysler Building, Shopping, Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, Empire State, Central Park etc etc etc...
The staff are great- very helpful and friendly.  There is a restaurant on the ground floor which looks nice, but is HUGELY expensive, as is room service.
There are public balconies on the 19th-23rd floors, which give good views of the immediate surroundings, but they are VERY scary of you have the slightest fear of heights!
We were only 3 floors up and immediately above the, very noisy, restaurant with no view other than a wall, but the glazing was enough to keep all the noise out, so we slept well in the (typically) HUGE bed and the lack of view wasn't an issue, given that we were out and about most of the time.
Now the not-so-good stuff:
The room was really dusty.  I was able to write me name in the dust on the bedside cabinet.  The attention to detail in the room was poor- especially the cleaning:  the skirting boards and other surfaces were very dusty and there were a lot of places where the paintwork was chipped, or had scuff marks which weren't covered or cleaned.
All the furniture in the room was worn and the varnish and stain had been rubbed off with use- this wasn't a huge issue but it looked poor and the whole room had a poorly maintained feel to it.
The lighting was also poort, with no lights above the minbar area where the coffee machine was, or in the middle of the room, it was sometimes hard to see what we were doing.
All in all, not worth paying a lot for, but we will definitely look at staying here again the next time we are in New York.

title: Nice hotel, ideal for smokers
text:
Hotel is near everything and staff are brilliant especially Aditya and the Oracle Mustafa, who knew everything about everyone and they were my favourites. I moved rooms after the first night as I ordered a suite with a terrace and got a large room with a balcony overlooking office rooftops and a shared terrace, which wasn’t what i was expecting. When we moved to the front of the hotel the room was a lot smaller but had a bigger balcony,but it wasn’t what I would consider a terrace and we only had one chair on it too.It overlooked a building site and had no privacy at all and we had to drop the blinds, which were in a terrible state with big white water mark stains all over them and dusty too. It was very dark in the room and needs more lighting as i had to go into the bathroom to read anything and that was with the blinds open.Room furniture was dated and dusty and hadn’t seen a bit of polish in months. Bathroom was great but was let down by the maid forgetting to replace toilet rolls and towels. Sheets weren’t changed the whole time we were there, 5 days.
In saying all that the bed and bedding was the best I’ve slept in and was really comfortable.
Although I have given a lot of details I wouldn’t say they were negative as each thing can easily be put right with very little effort and I would definitely stay again.

title: Thanks goodness for the staff
text:
Despite a larger-than-expected room, the logistics at his hostelry left much to be desired.

The heat was turned off (but no notice to that effect until, shivering, I called down: “Management is waiting to turn it on” the pathetic reply). When a plugin heater was delivered to diminish the chill, I realized too late (the affable staff member long gone) that this particular unit was DOA.

The missing bathmat was resolved the next day; the suddenly appearing lamp (on day 3) remains a mystery. Ditto the absent guest directory, espresso instructions and decided lack of “regular” coffee. (“Perhaps in a few days…”). No worries, the lighting was so poor in the coffee “alcove” that no one could be sure just exactly what might be streaming into their cups.

If only the balcony door handle could remain “secure”.

Despite all of those concerns, the experience was a success due solely to the unflappable nature of the staff and their sincere interest in providing customer satisfaction, not the least of which was Juan!

title: Perfect location and ideal for smokers!!
text: I stayed at The Gotham for 8 nights recently and was delighted with my experience. The hotel staff including Mustafa, Aditya and Shaun were so helpful especially Shaun who hailed 2 taxis for me. The room was a good size and clean with a small balcony where my companion and I could start and finish each day with tea, coffee and a smoke!!The king size bed had a mattress topper making it difficult to get out of bed - it was soooo comfortable and cosy. Other reviewers have complained of not knowing how to operate the coffee machine but we rang the front desk and within minutes someone came to explain how to use it. I asked about tea making facilities and a kettle was promptly brought up - I had my own teabags but I'm sure the hotel would have provided them.The hotel is situated minutes from Grand Central Station, 5th Avenue and taxis are always easy to hail.It's not a pretty street but it is walking distance from so many attractions that this didn't really matter. It is a modern boutique hotel so there is no grand foyer but it is clean and the customer service is the best that I have ever encountered. I will be back!!

title: Super Hotel an perfekter Lage
text:
Das Zimmer war sehr grosszügig und sehr sauber. Wir haben nach der ersten Nacht nach einem anderen Zimmer gefragt, da unser Zimmer im 2. Stock und direkt an der Straße war. Dementsprechend auch sehr laut. (Man muss aber auch wissen, New York ist laut) Ohne zu zögern und ohne Aufpreis gaben sie uns ein Zimmer gegen den Innenhof. Das Zimmer war noch grösser und mit einem King-Size Bett ausgestattet. Das junge und aufgestellte Personal war sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. 
Die Lage des Hotels ist perfekt! Man innerhalb von 5 Minuten am Times Square und anderen Sehenswürdigkeiten. Auch diverse Subway Stations sind schnell zu erreichen. 
Wir können the gotham hotel auf jeden Fall weiter empfehlen und werden bei unserem nächstem Besuch in New York wieder dort buchen! 

Vielen Dank nochmals an das ganze gotham Team für den tollen Aufenthalt

title: OTTIMO HOTEL IN PIENO CENTRO
text:
Ho soggiornato all'hotel Gotham a ferragosto per una settimana. Mi sono trovato molto bene in particolar modo per la gentilezza e professionalità del personale dell'hotel, tutti molto gentili e cordiali. La stanza era al sesto piano, moderna con qualche piccolo difetto nella doccia, comunque prontamente corretto dal personale.
In più l'hotel si trova a 5 minuti a piedi da Time Square. Ve lo consiglio assolutamente per una vacanza a New York.

title: A week made perfect.
text: Mine and my girlfriends time at The Gotham Hotel was 10/10. Anything we needed was provided instantly, we were made to feel welcome and come the end, didn’t want to leave. The room was so comfortable and was always cleaned to a great standard. When we return to NYC we will without a doubt be staying at The Gotham Hotel. Full credit goes to Mustafa, who always helped us at any time and with anything we needed, he made us feel at home and in my opinion showed great management qualities and tip top professional customer service levels. Full credit also goes to Aditya, who was the friendliest staff member I have ever come across. He showed severe interest in our daily activities and we just loved to chat to him after a full day of walking around and seeing the city. He was also very professional and made us feel at home from the moment we first stepped on to the welcome mat. You can’t put a price on an experience like we had. Thank you.

title: STAFF are the key to success! Mustafa & Eldis were amazing! Ps. Amazing Room too!!
text:
We had the most amazing Skyline View Terrace Junior Suite (Rm 161) which we loved!  It was perfect location between 5th & Madison and had views east/west from our glass walled balcony. (We stayed 19th - 21st Sept)

Our room was beautiful, with most amenities except could do with that female touch ( mirror and plugs in suitable locations to do hair & makeup!!) We had a sweet welcome of some Popcorn in our room which was lovely, and the staff were available to cater to all our needs.....
Mustafa I recognised at Check-in as I had read so many good reports on trip advisor, and Eldis was very hands-on helping us with luggage, welcoming us each time we returned and updating on how our adventures had been, which was so lovely to have someone show interest in your trip and what you have been doing.... This was an especially nice added touch - He really cared :-)  He even took time to wish us a happy anniversary and offered to arrange some beers (were not wine drinkers) as a treat.
The room was very clean, the bed was extremely comfy and we were informed of the building works across the road when we arrived, the only problem I had with this was we had to keep our curtains closed but in all honest, you would only be looking at an office block anyways!  
The road was blocked off due to the UN Sumit meetings, so when leaving the hotel had arranged us a town car for JFK, so Eldis helped us with all our luggage out to 5th Ave to get our ride... Definately going that extra mile.
A very enjoyable stay, very welcoming, warm and we will definitely be recommending your Hotel and we will most certainly be returning too 
Thank you gents for looking after us xx

Again having issues loading pictures, will add when possible

title: Beautiful place to stay!
text: I had a really nice experience there! Aditya was very sweet and friendly. He was wonderful and made the stay enjoyable. The rooms were very stylishly elegant as they were spacious. The hotel conveniently located near the heart of the city. It would definitely recommend to others and would come back again.

title: AMAZING STAY AT THE GOTHAM!
text: I stayed at The Gotham with my family and in all honesty my stay could not have been any more perfect. Rooms were clean and service was great! In particular, one of the staff members, Michelle was very kind and helpful with whatever we needed and recommended great spots for us to visit in the city. I suggest booking this hotel for anyone visiting NYC. It’s in a great location with friendly faces. You won’t regret it!

title: Luna di miele a New York
text: Abbiamo soggiornato al Gotham hotel durante la nostra luna di miele a settembre .. L'accoglienza è stata ottima sin dal primo momento.. Lo staff della reception e in particolare Mirio sono stati gentilissimi e hanno reso la nostra vacanza ancora più "easy" consigliandoci locali, percorsi e quant'altro. La camera molto bella,  pulita e spaziosa con ogni confort.. Inoltre il Gotham hotel si trova in una posizione praticamente perfetta, a due passi dalla 5 ave, consentendo di arrivare a piedi in numerose attrazioni della città... consigliatissimo!!

title: Mrs cropper
text:
Me and my husband came here for our honey moon we stayed for 3 nights and couldn't have picked a better hotel! The room was spot on and the hotel was in the perfect area. 
Aditya made a great difference to our stay. He was so helpful and always had a smile on his face. 
We would definitely return to this hotel and will be recommending it to others.

title: Nice stay in New York City
text: We had really nice stay there. Our first night was in Kings room with balcony. Room was clean and nice, we did not mind the balcony facing the wall of other building, it was private. The only thing I would complain was a noisy generators on the roof at the next building, we could hear it even with closed windows. Two other nights we spent in Skyline Junior, room was very spacious and we had nice balcony with the view of the city, that we enjoyed in the evening. Boys downstairs (at the reception and in doors) were very friendly and helpful. Hotel is in a great position for New York City walks. We would definitely stay there again.

title: Great location with friendly staff
text: The location was the best - just off 5th avenue - great for shopping and entertainment and eating. The staff were very friendly and did everything to make our stay a comfortable one. We were in and out of the hotel many times a day due to its convenient location. Will definitely come back!!

title: Decepcionante! Roubada neste hotel
text:
Gostaria de relatar O desabor que passamos ao descobrir que fomos roubados em dólares que deixamos no cofre do quarto. Foi nossa primeira parada nos EUA e foi muitíssimo desagradável. Durante os 15 dias que ficamos viajando pela Califórnia ligamos para o The Gotham e tentamos, de varias formas resolver mas mesmo quando voltamos para NY, nada foi resolvido. E acreditem, desde o dia que demos por falta do dinheiro e em todas as tentativas o gerente do hotel sequer se deu ao trabalho de nos atender. Nosso interlocutor com o hotel foi um responsável pela segurança que não pareceu fazer muito em relação ao assunto. Me senti desrespeitada, e agora vamos tomar serias Providências contra o hotel. Estou relatando para que mais nenhum turista passe por este desabor!
A única coisa que ouvíamos era; mas isso nunca aconteceu antes.... 
Take care!!!!!

title: 4 days away with my wife
text: The hotel is a lovely clean and very friendly hotel. From Michelle and the gentleman whos name i cant remember sorry on the front desk to the door staff who helped with taxis directions and places to eat to the friendly house keeping people i couldnt say a bad word about any of them. We stopped in room 161 on the front of the building with a balcony. The room was very spacious clean and the omg comfy as hell. Only downer there is construction work ongoing on the building across but if you like being woken up at 4am every morning then fine but please please PLEASE dont let this put you off booking this hotel we would go back in a heartbeat just request a room round the back not as good views though. It is ideally situated for site seeing not in a busy part but Times Square 10 mins Central Park 15 mins and Macy's for the shoppers 15 mins away also. Sorry never thought to take photo of room just view from our balcony.

title: Good location - But that's it...
text:
After reading reviews from others we were looking forward to our stay at The Gotham Hotel, however we had to high expectations that were not met. The location is great to see NY for the first time, few minutes away from Times Square. If you can bear a little noise from the city's hustle and bustle + AC.

The guys working in the lobby often greeted us, but the door clerks was often taken by a surprise and was more into checking their phone or talking to the receptionists than opening the door. In our week at the hotel they were to slow with the cleaning of the rooms, one day it was not done before we arrived at our room 5.30PM. The phone didn't work, all do we told them, they never fixed it.. Keeping in mind that you had to call for them to refill the coffee, you can imagine our frustration with jet lag and in need for coffee..

The beds are comfortable, the towels are nice and fluffy and good toiletries from MB. Our stay was ok, but we will look for another place next time. 

Ops! If you have a late departing flight they can grant you late check out, you haft to call 7-8AM the day of departing and it's first come first serve - We were lucky and got granted late check out at 12:30 PM, regular check out is 12 - what a joke!

title: Great Stay!
text: Great Stay! The staff was very helpful, the bed super comfy and I loved the view from my room. The location is great for us so we were in the center of everything. Would definitely come back next year.

title: SATURDAY NIGHT OVER NIGHT STAY WITH MY HUSBAND
text: I loved the hotel, it was in a great area of the city, had a wonderful restaurant in it, clean, neat, gracious staff.  i will definitely be back when i want to stay over in the city, i am a NYer so this was a treat to not have to get back home after seeing a show.

title: Clean, modern but nothing too special
text: This hotel is nice, it's clean the staff are friendly, however there was nothing too special. We stayed for 2 nights, in 2 different rooms (the balcony door on the first room was broken so we couldn't get out). It is worth noting that the balcony on both these rooms was at the back, with the not unpleasant, but also not spectacular view of a brick wall. Following our complaint of the first room our second room was located on a higher floor and these did have a public balcony to the front which was very pleasant, it would have been nice to know about these communal balconies sooner. Generally a clean and fairly well appointed place.

title: Second visit and still great
text:
We stayed at this hotel less than a year ago. We came back last week and the staff welcomed us at the door and helped us with the restaurant choice for the evening.
The check-in was quick and the room was clean with free Nespresso coffee machine!
I would definitely come back again! Can't beat the location and terraces.

title: NYC Visit
text: Gotham is ideally located in the heart of Manhattan, Times Square / Chrysler / Empire State Building are only a short walk away.  The hotel is relatively small for New York, with a steak house / bar at the back.  The staff were friendly and helpful at all times.  Only complaints were the WiFi which only really worked in the reception area and not in the bedroom.  The aircon was also noisy but as we didn't use it much that wasn't really an issue.   The rooms were fine, clean and pretty basic but sufficient for our needs.

title: Nyc vacation 2017
text: When i first walked into the hotel i noticed it was much smaller than i expected. Andrew who helped me at the front desk was very friendly and got me my room quickly. We had the skyline room which came with a balcony, and the view of midtown was just amazing. The amenities were also great. The room came with a stocked mini fridge and was full of snacks from Dean&Deluca!

title: haven't had a chance to stay here
text: Make sure that when you make your reservation that you check every day to make sure you have a room.  I made reservations in February for trip in September 2 days before we were supposed leave I get an email saying my reservation has been canceled I am not glued to my laptop I don't look at my emails everyday so I didn't see it until it was to late they could have call me at home. This was very unprofessional. I will not recommend this place to anyone at all stay away from here.

title: It is just okay
text: I would say that the room was not spacious but it is okay. There was a balcony so if you are a smoker you could use that. Some of the requests were given so long. I requested for a shaving kit and when a I followed up the guy said the one who has it was stuck in the elevator. >.< We stayed there just for a night and moved to different hotel as we still waiting for hurricane Irma to leave Miami.

title: Modern hotel, good midtown location, friendly staff
text: The Gotham Hotel is a great small hotel that does almost everything right: the location is perfect if you want to be in midtown Manhattan; the rooms are clean and modern; the beds are comfortable; the employees are very friendly. We paid for a room with a terrace, which was pleasant -- although the balconies are small and the building's position means no attractive views, even from the higher floors. The furnishings are attractive, albeit a little bit spartan. We did experience a fair number of small service errors - e.g., items forgotten in the room (e.g., no chairs on the balcony -- just a tiny table!), all of which were speedily addressed with a phone call downstairs. Concierge services are minimal, although the staff do their best to help you. Finally, while they have a smart partnership with a nearby gym, the gym is closed on weekends and holidays! They should consider a better alternative. Overall: We enjoyed the visit and will almost certainly return.

title: An Oasis in Manhattan
text: Our room was clean and well appointed. All the staff were friendly, welcoming and efficient. Mustafa in particular was outstanding. His knowledge of New York was amazing. From which Subway to catch, where to find the best pizza to some must-see places we should visit - he had all the information at his fingertips. Room service was fast and courteous.The balcony was small and noisy with no views, but the Terrace was absolutely perfect. Amid the noise, crowds and garbage on the streets, this was like an oasis of calm.

title: la fortuna di trovare un ottimo hotel
text: scegliere un buon hotel al centro di manhattan e soddisfare tutte le condizioni è veramente difficile. questo hotel per noi le ha superate di gran lunga, camere spaziose con balcone piccoli e grandi, letti comodissimi, bagno spazioso con doccia eccellente, staff gentilissimo e pronto a soddisfare tutte le ns richieste e il direttore italiano premuroso nel rendere il soggiorno più confortevole e nel saper consigliare bene dove andare nella city. albergo non è grandissimo ed anche per questo riesce dare uno standard elevato. buono anche il ristorante interno. la posizione rimane in una tarversa tra la 5 str e la medison le vie più in della città e vicino alle attrazioni principali. consigliatissimo da parte nostra e un saluto caloroso ha tutto lo staff.

title: Good location, large but noisy rooms
text: I've been in two rooms. The first one at the back 9th floor. It would have been almost perfect, unless the view outside was pretty poor, that is an endless brick wall, approx 10 meters away. And secondly, unless it was so noisy, because of air conditioning engines. That room had a tiny balcony which cannot be used because of the mentioned above. It was replaced by a similar room facing 46th street, this time without a balcony, but with the same noise problems. If you are using hearing aids, it the perfect room for you, just turn it off. I used earplugs.

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
August 2017 we spent 7 days in NYC for my wife's 30th Birthday 🎉. This was our second visit to NYC and learning from experience we knew where we wanted to be located. (Last time upper west side).
The Gotham Hotel is perfectly sited to allow easy access to all tourist sites and shops within a short walk. 
The hotel itself was ideal, the rooms were spacious and with all amenities including a stocked mini bar. 
Rooms and bathroom were clean and serviced daily. 
The staff couldn't do enough to help always friendly and very helpful answering all our questions and attending to our needs. 
We would recommend The Gotham Hotel to anyone looking for the ideal location to enjoy NYC's sites, shopping and daily life. 
Thanks
Matt & Jen

title: Amazing crew
text:
Just felt at home! Tony Chinese, Heldis, Balcan, Andrew, Mustafa Arabian and italian Cazzo, the manager, are such a nice guys. Unforgettable.
The bedroom is good.
Everyday they change the towels, covers and clean the room. There are coffe machine, beer, whiskey, vodka and tequila inside the room. Guys are really friendly and make you feel home. Share cigarette, carry your bags, do whatever you ask them. So, nothing to complain. Just say thanks and ansiously to return.
Go, it worths. Even in a rough city as NYC, it worths.

title: Great Location and Staff
text:
I've lived in NYC for over 45 years and know a great place when I see one. Super helpful staff and a very clean, open, modern rooms. Great location. I almost didn't want to write this review because I wanted to keep this gem to myself. I travel often and have experienced many hotels and this one is a keeper. I've recently moved to MD and so will make this my go to place when I'm in town. Already planning my next stay.
Gail  W

title: Lovely hotel near Times Square
text:
Just came back from a week in New York to celebrate my 50th birthday with my husband. We stayed in the Gotham Hotel having a skyline junior suite.

Hotel is very clean, amenities plentiful and the staff were very welcoming and attentive. Tony on reception sent up 2 flute glasses and a chilled bottle of prosecco on my birthday tea time which was a lovely touch. Shaun on the door was very helping and welcoming too, always with a smile and an enjoy your day he'd say. Can't remember names of the other staff but all very polite and happy.

Hotel is situated 2 mins walk from 5th avenue and 5/6 mins walk to centre of Times Square.
From our balcony we could see and watch the lights and people going to and from 5th and Times Square.

Highly recommend this hotel with it being 2 blocks of Times Square so you get the views but not the noise and still being in the heart of it.

Opposite the hotel there is a building getting renovated but didn't keep us awake or anything so didn't bother us at all.
Within the hotel entrance there is also a steakhouse called wolfgangs. Next door is a coffee shop called Gregory's which is similar to costa coffee, 3 doors down there's a dunking donuts too.

Plenty of Irish pubs within a 5 min walk, o'lunneys was our favourite.

For any smokers planning to visit, your allowed to smoke on your own balcony only which was nice on an evening with a glass or two or early morning with a cup of tea if you take a travel kettle that is because only a coffee machine in suite.

We would definitely stay here again.
Thank you Gotham Hotel for a lovely stay

Peter & Karen Jeynes

title: well located nearTimes Square and Grand Central.  Good service but dirty
text: Its an ok hotel but it could be better.  Reasonably quiet except for the noisy ac unit outside the window.  The desk staff were very good and obliging, the location works well, only a couple of blocks one way to Grand Central and a couple of blocks the other way to Times Square. But it really could have done with a clean. Our room was dusty, nothing really felt particularly tidy.  Then there was the furniture, hard edges at ankle height that remind you if their presence every time you walk around the room.

title: Very happy
text: Stayed here for two night on a recent work trip. Lovely large room and super comfy bed. Great location for me (my meeting was close by) and it's great location for tourists on a first time visit to NY. It's not a cool part of town though but tbh there are still some fab eateries nearby. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly. I was very impressed that the hotel provides free passes to the nearby Equinox gym. I've never had this at a hotel before and as someone who likes to keep fit when travelling for work this was a real boon for me. If I go back for work I would definitely stay here again. My only downside would be that the balcony is quite dark but that isn't the hotels fault, it is simply the tunnel effect of tall buildings, but it does mean you're probably not going to use it.

title: Great Location for Tourists
text: The Gotham Hotel is a great boutique style hotel, the staff are friendly and helpful. Mustafa checked us in on the day we arrived and was very pleasant to deal with. We had a room on the 20th floor and it suited our needs precisely. As tourists, we spend very little time in our room, and this was exactly what we needed. It is close enough to Times Square and the East River for local sight seeing. We really enjoyed the shared balcony during the evening and morning times, and the view up 46th street is great. The hotel arranged a car to take us to JFK on the day of our departure and we had no problems at all during our stay there. Overall it was a great hotel experience.

title: Interesting stay...
text: When we arrived Christian was very professional and took care of us... Mustafa checked us in and they set us up with a bottle of prosecco which was very nice upon our rerurn from parking the car nearby.  We got the penthouse with 2  balconies... well it's cute but a pretty small space. Thank God for the balcony w some view of the city.  The other balcony is a public one for any hotel guests which we later found out.  I thought it was private since they claimed "u have the whole floor..." NOT so.  2 ladies almost walked into our room and the linen closet is right next door and kept unlocked... creepy... anyone can hide in there since people have access to ur floor via stairs or elevator. Inside the penthouse the leather sofa and black leather chair are quite uncomfortable. We stayed for the weekend and wud have been nice to not just have to lay in bed to watch after roaming the city.  The air conditioning was another.  U can't control it.  It's either too cold or too hot lol! We had to call front desk for the remote for the tv/cable which they promptly brought. There was some construction noise going on late in the evening as they are renovating.  For the amount of money... shuda stayed @ the Bryant park hotel.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text:
The Gotham Hotel is a great boutique style hotel. The staff is great. Very Friendly, pleasant and helpful
The rooms are updated and very modern in style.
Rooms could have better lighting. too dark for us
The bed was large King. However for us it was way too soft and sunk on both sides
But overall we enjoyed our stay and the location
Nespresso Coffee in room. But Dunkin Donuts is just 2 doors down
Air conditioner worked well for us
we asked for back room and it was quiet but a view of walls and no sunlight
