title: Great location, unexpected parking issue.
text:
We visited over Memorial Day weekend for our anniversary. This hotel is in an excellent location. It was very clean and the staff were very nice. Our room was on the 18th floor. It was extremely small and made me feel claustrophobic, but we did have a balcony so that helped tremendously.

My only complaint is related to the parking. The hotel has a deal with a garage down the street. When we arrived the attendant at the garage asked us approximately what time we would be back. We gave a time, which was a little over 24 hours later. When we went to the hotel to leave our bags (it was too early to check in) we told them the same thing. When we went to pay at the a garage the next day we expected to pay the $40 that we were told by hotel that we would pay, but instead it was $80 because it was over 24 hours. No one ever mentioned that the parking was only for 24 hours. In retrospect it was our own fault, but it seemed shady to us that neither the hotel or garage made note of the rate only being for 24 hours (we were there for about 26 hours).

title: Nice Boutique Hotel
text: The Hotel is nice, clean and well located. No on-site or valet parking. They do have a discount rate with a parking garage west of the hotel a block or so away on 46th Street. The balcony in our room faces a brick wall, nothing to look at, but there is a common balcony on each floor that faces 46th Street and has a nice view down the street. Given that there are only two rooms per floor they are not typically occupied. We did not dine in the restaurant but did have a few drinks at the bar in the hotel. As with any midtown hotel the room is small but not unreasonably so. The front desk staff were helpful.

title: Great stay
text: Stayed there last night (August 12/13) to catch a musical on broadway. Awesome location and easy walk to Times Square/Broadway. Room was outstanding. Not much of a view from our balcony because we were on the fifth floor. But went up to the roof balcony for a picture or two. Then again, I didn't go to NYC for a pretty hotel room balcony. The bed was comfortable (and so were the pillows, which I usually can't stand hotel pillows). The shower was great, bathroom and room super clean. I give this a 4 and not a 5 solely because the bathroom sick could have had better pressure. But that's also being super picky. Otherwise, all was impeccable.

title: Comfortable Bed!!
text: We stayed here for four nights.  Great location, close to times square.  Boutique style hotel.  Room is a decent size for New York, bathroom was a little small but it had a roomy size shower.  Lighting in the room wasn't the best. There is an nespresso machine in the room.  I had no idea how to use it and there were no instructions. There was no price list on the mini bar products   The balcony is about 5x6 not very big and absolutely no view only of concrete walls. Great if you are a smoker.  Front desk staff were really helpful.  The hotel was definitely in a great location for the price.  Being from Canada we had to add another 32% to the price. For a $100 you can get a ride to the airport from this hotel. The driver was very friendly.

title: I won't stay here again
text: It was dirty.  The toilet leaked and they didn't replenish any towels, bath mats or soap or shampoo. Go to the London or Greenwich. The beds are old there weren't enough pillows even after asking 3 times.

title: Ok if you are in a budget
text:
The only great thing about this hotel is the location. 

The beds are comfortable, but rooms are poorly lit. Not very fancy or nice. 

It's comfortable enough if you are in a budget, but not where you want to stay if you want something good quality. The "balconies" are tiny and you can't really go out there and the terrace is not a place you can easily hang out in.

title: Decent
text:
We stayed here for the weekend. 

Good Stuff
The hotel is really conveniently located. Central Park, Times Square, and various Train stations. So if you value time, this is the place to be. There is a pizza place nearby on Vanderbilt called Uncle Paul's, try to visit this location. Definitely worth it. There was dude name Mustafa who was at concierge, he was very helpful. I dont know what other rooms are like, but our room was good. 

Not So Good Stuff
This hotel lost points for silly stuff. I asked for ice one night, and i never received it. I understand the staff at the hotel might be busy, why not put a ice machine on one of the floors for people to go to. The main issue we had was the air conditioning- it was so loud. We didnt sleep well for the nights we stayed at the Gotham. For the amount of money spent every night, it is not much to check the noise level. Finally, i feel like the staff can be a little nicer. I m not saying they are bad, i understand NY means people speak differently. I m saying, understand your guests come from all walks of life and to be a little more polite. The last thing i want is attitude after 8 hours travelling. 

Anyways, I gave this place 4 stars because of location and quality of the rooms (they had nespresso coffee!). Compared to other hotels in the area with the amount you have to pay per night, this place isnt that bad. They can definitly work on a few things to make the experience amazing.

title: Очень шумный кондиционер!
text:
+Чистый, просторный номер. Мебель и ремонт новые, кровать и подушки комфортные. Обслуживающий персонал приветливый. Рядом с Times Square.

-Были 4 ночи. При заезде блокируют 1000$ в качестве депозита, который обещали вернуть на карту в течение двух дней после выезда. Прошло уже две недели, как нам деньги не возвращают. Мы звонили на ресепшен, каждый день переписываемся с супервайзером отеля, но денег не видно. В итоге, супервайзер написал, чтобы мы сами разбирались с нашим банком. Так что имейте при себе лишние 1 000 $, которые вы на месяц, без процентов одолжите The Gotham отелю. Бронировали номер с view , в первый день дали номер в стену, аргументируя это тем, что все номера с видом на город сегодня распроданы!!! Обещали переселить на следующий день в 12 утра.  В первую ночь номер нам дали просторный, но с видом во двор- колодец, солнечный свет туда не проникал. Wifi в этом номере или на этаже отсутствовал. Несколько раз подходили, звонили на ресепшн, но ничего не изменилось. На следующий день переехали в номер на 8 этаж с видом на стройку и 46 Street. Размер номера слегка меньше, но значительно светлее. Wifi в номере работал только с утра, вечером с перебоями и очень медленно, о фильмах можете забыть, мы читали книги. Во всех номерах этого отеля все было в единственном экземпляре: халат, тапочки, кофе и т.д. Чайник отсутствует. Самое ужасное - это очень шумный кондиционер, по ощущениям турбина самолета, который с диким треском включался и выключался каждые 30 сек и это не преувеличение, мы засекали. Ни одного супермаркета, кроме small grocery, по нашему - ларёк с пивом и химическими булками, в квадратной миле не было. Ближайший grocery store - Whole Foods, самый качественный, и самый дорогой в 1,3 мили от отеля. Вывод: отель предназначен для бизнес путешественников, на одну ночь.

title: Not as Advertised!
text:
Sadly, our experience at the Gotham Hotel was very poor. I have only ever done two reviews on TripAdvisor before and they were extremely positive reviews of two hotels we had stayed in. I wish I could say the same about The Gotham.
We arrived in NYC looking forward to the hotel we had booked and paid for because it had a balcony - not common in city hotels. 
We went up to our room on the second floor to find there was no balcony. This was extremely disappointing as it was the reason we had chosen this hotel. We did not let this dampen our spirits however as we didn't want to ruin our limited time in NYC.
Unfortunately, we then discovered the bathroom door would not close, the toilet seat would not stay up (difficult for men) and the sink was missing the lever which allowed it to drain. The curtains were also cut around an air conditioning unit and had no sheers. This meant that when you opened the curtains for some light (in the very dark room) you were eyeballing the construction workers across the road or the people walking in the street.
On alerting the desk to these issues we were told they were sorry but the hotel was full so no other room was available. When we mentioned that the hotel advertised that ALL rooms have balconies we were told - "Yes, there are 67 rooms and only 2 don't have balconies". 
Admittedly, we were also told that PERHAPS there may be a different room available if we checked the next morning. As we were only staying 2 nights the PERHAPS was not really practical as it involved packing, unpacking and coming back at 3.00pm to get a new key on our one full day in the city.
That next day I asked if anything could be done as we didn't feel we should be paying full price for a substandard room. I was told that only the manager could say and they weren't in until 11.00am and would be gone by 5.00pm. I gave my number and asked to be contacted while we were out and about. This did not happen.
I was told we could get a discount on our next stay.
On checkout, I again mentioned that I didn't feel they should book this room out at full price and was told our next stay would be discounted. Although we hope to be back in NYC I kept reminding them that as we come from Australia it is unlikely to be for a very long time. It is also had to imagine why they thought we would want to stay here again.
Such a shame!

title: NEVER STAY HERE!!!
text:
I am not a person who writes reviews very often.  I worked in the customer service industry for over 15 years and know how people can blow up in reviews over even the smallest and most ridiculous things.  With that said, I am writing this review because of how bad the situation was and how bad it was handled afterwards.

My wife and I were very excited for our trip to New York City!  We had booked this trip almost 6 months ago and were ready to get to NYC and have fun.  We already had some flight issues getting to NY and that did cause us to be very late arriving.  My wife worked in the hotel industry for over 3 years and knows how things work.  We made sure to call The Gotham in the early afternoon the day of and let them know we would be arriving late.  We called again when we were at our connecting airport and said we would get there eventually tonight and wanted to make sure we had a room whenever we arrived.  We had been told in the afternoon not to worry and the lady in the evening said we could arrive whenever and our room would be ready.

So we finally get to NYC and arrive at The Gotham only to find out our room had been given away!!!  We arrived at 1:00am and now have no where to spend the night.  The night desk guy tried his best to call other hotels and find us a room, but literally every hotel in Manhattan was sold out.  After almost of hour of calling my wife found a room at a hotel in a part of the city we would never stay at.  We only went just so we had a place to crash for a few hours hopefully.

We arrived back at The Gotham in the morning to ensure we had a room for the remainder of our stay.  While the staff was very apologetic and helpful in ensuring we had a room for the rest of our trip, the general manager, Adisa, was less than polite.

The general manager’s initial offer to us to make up for the trouble was pay for the city hotel we stayed at and offer us the crappy mini-bar they have in their rooms.  What a ridiculous offer and shows her lack of respect and appreciation for the customers that are staying at the hotel than enables her to even have a job.  The hotel finally offered to comp our first night, where any other hotel would have comped the entire trip.
The general manager cares so little about her customers that she never came to apologize to us and make sure we were ok.  She also never replied to our follow up emails about this.  I wanted to speak to Adisa’s manager and never heard from anyone.  So here we are now, instead of finding a compromise I am writing a very rare review.

I have one thing to say to anyone who is considering staying here.  TAKE YOUR MONEY ELSEWHERE!  There are over 200 4-star hotels in Manhattan and you will find a better one that respects you as a customer.

title: Fantastic Location
text: The Gotham Hotel is in a great location for anyone visiting New York. This was our first time in New York (13.7.-19.7.2017) and at the same time it was 50v. A birthday present for me. Rooms were clean and the staff friendly. A short trip to most attractions. I recommend everyone. Thanks to the hotel for my wonderful trip <3

title: First time in New York
text: This hotel was very nice and clean. I really love the location because it is very close to Time Square, Broadway and nice shops around. The hotel employees were very nice and made my first experience in New York. Tony helped me check in very quickly and Shaun brought up my luggage to my room which was very kind. I love the hospitality and the vibe from the front desk agents. Mustafa was very helpful with directions and Andrew was very nice and welcomed be back every time. I really enjoyed my stay, will be coming back for sure!

title: Nice, Clean and Quiet Rooms in Manhattan
text: Nice, quiet room on 19th floor with little balcony as well as a shared balcony on the opposite side of elevator core.  Location was convenient to everything I needed to do.  Would definitely consider staying here for personal NYC visits in the future.

title: Superb location!
text: The young reception staff were very welcoming (Mustafa in particular advised us regarding places to visit), plus Robert (who organised our excellent transport to the airport) and also Shaun.  The guys at reception were always friendly and helpful.  We were given a very welcome bottle of Prosecco as it was our Wedding Anniversary!  Due to some negative "construction noise" reviews on Trip Adviser, we had asked for a quiet room on a high floor (got the 15th floor).  Had a large superior room with a balcony, which we did not actually use, as our room was at the back of the hotel and there was a view of buildings.  At first we found the air conditioning unit a little noisy, but we got used to it after the first night there and slept really well throughout our holiday.  Huge, really comfortable bed.  Room and bathroom very clean, serviced daily.  Shower really effective.  Molton Brown mini products available.  Restaurant and coffee shops close by.  Would definitely stay at The Gotham again - the hotel is so well placed for all of the sights - near to Grand Central Station, Rockefeller, Chrysler, etc.

title: Bra beliggenhet
text: Stort pluss for en god beliggenhet, men mye trekk for meget bråkete air condition og minibar-kjøleskap. Hadde superior room med terasse. Rommet var romslig og fint, men terassen var plassert i bakgården hvor man så rett inn i en murvegg. Et hotell med lite "karakter". Ingen room service i form av vask/nye håndkler o.l. under vår 2 dagers opphold. Velger nok et annet hotell neste gang.

title: Gotham Hotel NYC desk clerk rocks!
text:
I booked a room with "Martin" in Midtown Manhattan through Airbnb and arrived 7:00pm at the provided address to find it was a hotel and that it was booked solid. Mustafa was on the hotel desk and not only did he call multiple hotels for me but found me a great deal at the Dylan Hotel 4 blocks away. He told me this "Martin" had done this before. Mustafa was wonderful and kind and gave me his card and said if I came back to NYC to email him at the Gotham and he would get me a reservation at the Gotham. He was concerned not only for me but also for the Gotham's reputation. He and the Gotham doorman were welcoming and so kind - they rock!
When I reported "Martin" to Airbnb, Karl got me a refund and a future credit.

title: Good location
text: The hotel is well located and the staff are all friendly. I was also pleasantly surprised by the size of the room with a good size balcony. My only criticism, which isn't the hotels fault, is the building work across the street which overlooked my room. The banging starts at about 6am which wasn't the most relaxing start to my holiday. I would recommend getting a room on the other side of the hotel if possible.

title: Good hotel in downtown Manhattan
text: Hotel is located in a great position, a few blocks from Times Square with easy access to 5th avenue shops. Stylish hotel, great artwork in their foyers (drawings of local attractions like the Brooklyn Bridge, Central Park, etc). Lovely staff who were really helpful  and always cheerful. I had one of their superior rooms with a terrace - very roomy and comfortable. Terrace looked down 46th street. Hotel attached to a Wolfgang Puck Restaurant.

title: Great location and great service!
text: Recently stayed at the Gotham for a week. Whilst there is a construction site across the street at the front of the building, we read the reviews and requested a room at the back of the building prior to our stay. We had no issues and were able to have a decent night's sleep. Super comfy bed and a good sized room. Having the balcony was an added bonus just to be able to open the door or step out for some air. Centrally located, only a short walk to lots of attractions such as Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, Grand Central Station and 5th Ave shopping. Could not fault the location. The staff were very friendly and helpful, even helping us with finding a barber for my husband and contacting a tour company when they were 40 mins late for our hotel pick up. The service met our expectations and would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again in the future. I'm just sorry I did not record the names of all the staff who were so helpful during our stay!

title: Nice View on Guest Balconies
text: The Gotham hotel has a nice location, right off of 5th Avenue.  The room I stayed in was the largest room I've ever had in NYC.  Everything was clean, and while my room's view was of a brick wall, they have open balconies for the guests that have nice views, especially in the early morning or evening.  The staff was accommodating and I used their driver service once.  It was top notch, although pricey.  I didn't try the restaurant, but I heard good things.  I would definitely stay here again, and would recommend it to others.

title: Ótimo hotel!
text: Fiquei quase uma semana hospedado neste hotel e fiquei muito feliz com a minha escolha. O quarto é excelente e grande, além de ter uma varanda (coisa rara em NY). O atendimento da recepção foi muito bom, assim como todo o resto. A localização é perfeita para quem gosta de pontos turísticos e tem um ótimo restaurante também, localizado próximo a recepção. Ficaria novamente nesse hotel tranquilamente.

title: Amazing location & service!
text: Stayed at the Gotham hotel for a week. Amazing location close to Times Square & shopping. Friendly staff, special shout out to Eldis who provided exceptional service. The rooms are nice & clean. The beds are almost too comfortable making it hard to get out and get going.

title: Great Service
text: Stayed at the Gotham Hotel for a week while in NYC for a holiday. Great proximity to Times Square and Broadway. Surprisingly spacious room with balcony. All the staff were great, but Eldis specifically went above and beyond to arrange transportation to a concert in New Jersey. Great customer service!

title: Amazing Staff!
text: My significant other and I stayed in NYC this week. This was our first time staying in the Gotham Hotel. Shaun the bellman was nice and very helpful with our luggage. The two front desk agents whose name I believe are Tony and Andrew welcomed us with great hospitality. We mentioned that we are here for our anniversary and they sent up a bottle of prosecco for us! That was such an amazing gesture and we appreciated it. They also suggested places to eat and do things while we were here. The rooms are spacious and there is a terrace on the floor which was great when we wanted to sit there and relax. We will be returning to the Gotham whenever we're back in NYC.

title: Trasandato
text:
Abbiamo scelto una camera con balcone ai piani alti per goderci la vista  (inesistente) ma purtroppo di fronte l'hotel c'è un grattacielo  in costruzione e la pulizia del balcone lascia a desiderare.
La camera: purtroppo la moquette era sporca, stanza piccola, guardaroba inesistente (c'è solo un  comodino ed un piccolissimo armadio senza ne cassetti e ne ripiani ma con solo 4/5 stampelle!!!).
Unica nota positiva la posizione.
La prossima volta a New York cambierò hotel

title: Very Poor Accommodation
text:
We had a room at the front of the Hotel and the noise from the construction site was a huge problem. You could not sit and relax on the balcony, or have a conversation whilst they were working. 
Our fridge door didn't shut properly and the ice melted and soaked the carpet. The maintenance man moved a bottle in the fridge and declared it fixed. The door was actually broken and not fixed at all! The air conditioning unit on the floor also leaked and the carpet there was also soaked. This was unable to be fixed straight away. 
We had booked Bed and Breakfast a year ago, however new management refused to acknowledge this and we were denied any breakfast. 
we were offered a downgraded room to move to as this was all that was available. Very poor accommodation for a 4* hotel. We contacted our travel agent who we had booked through and they changed our Hotel after the first night. This led to further problems. The travel agent had paid in advance, but we were also charged and it was taken off our card without authorisation. The travel agent contacted them again and decided to pay again there and then so that we could have a refund straight away. The receptionist refused to acknowledge the payment had been made. Horrendous experience. After waiting in reception for 2 hours whilst reception and our travel agents tried to sort it out I eventually demanded to see the manager. This finally gave us our refund. The hotel at one point had been paid 3 times for the same room for the same night. Disgusting situation and extremely poor communication. Would never ever stay there again.

title: Surprisingly great room for the price
text: Large room for NYC, with an open air patio on the 18th Floor, nice view down 58th St., large windows, very clean and the roof deck was really cool.  Ask for the patio rooms facing the front when you book.  Very close to everything in Midtown.

title: What a waste of money
text:
I booked a superior king bed with  Terrace and I was given a small room with half balcony facing a brick wall not a terrace( see photo ). As a gold + member at Expedia and the hotel categorized VIP GOLD + hotel I supposed to upgraded but there was nothing. Moreover, I booked a room for two people my wife and I again the room one robe and one slipper all accommodating for one person. 
Never again

title: our 1st stay at The Gotham Hotel
text: Great hotel great location everything you need plus all the sights is close by would definataly stay again. All the staff were friendly and polite especially Eldis and Robert who couldnt do enough for you went above and beyond reccomending restaraunts bars and directing us where we wanted to go. Really nice guys

title: Fantastic Location
text:
The Gotham is in the ideal location for all visitors to NYC. Its ideally placed, its in a relatively quiet spot and is close to Times Square and all of its magical aurora.
The staff are really helpful especially as New York has been taken over by the TIP  CULTURE meaning that customer services comes a long way behind any financial gain. The staff here are totally the opposite and we couldn't have found a more helpful set of staff from the bell boys to the reception staff and cleaners. Room was great, plenty of space, bathroom was spotless with a large walk in shower, it had the most comfortable of beds ever that was so huge it could fit 5 in it ! Even had a mini bar which we didn't have to use but it is there if you want it and the prices are comparable to others nearby if not a little cheaper. We have just got back and the temperatures were in the 90's so the cold blast of cold air was a welcome relief from the aircon. Highly recommended and if we go again the The Gotham is the hotel for me.

title: Great place
text:
We honeymooned here for 6 days... a terrific place to stay if you want to do a little of everything. The location is outstanding! Staff were all pleasant and helpful-- especially Jenina for her help with booking and Mustafa for giving great ideas on where to go and what to do. 
There's a skyscraper being built across the street- maybe a negative for some, but the soundproofing in the room was definitely adequate and we were thrilled to watch the crews work while we had our coffee on the balcony every morning. The balcony is in itself a huge selling point for us. We will definitely be back.

title: Wonderful Staff, Convenient Location
text: Every staff person we encountered at the Gotham was friendly and helpful. The front desk people, including Mustafa, gave great restaurant suggestions and directions. I didn't get the name of the young man on duty Friday night, but he also printed out directions for us. Another employee, Christian, helped us with our Lyft after we checked out and even spoke to the driver in advance to find the fastest pick-up location, then walked us to the corner (in the rain!) to be sure we caught our ride. The only problems we had involved the electronics - the coffee pot was complicated and only seemed to make expresso, the shower is ultra-modern and hard to figure out, and our key didn't work one night, so we had to get a duplicate. I think if they put directions for using the coffee pot and shower in the rooms, that problem could be easily resolved.

title: Surprise 30th Birthday
text:
Fabulous location, fabulous views, fabulous staff, fabulous rooms!
This hotel is literally minutes from Times Square which we could see from our balcony. It's perfect for sightseeing as it's central to everything!
Will definitely be returning to the Gotham.

title: We love this hotel. Mustava at the check in desk was awesome. He gave us great outside the box places to see.
text: The service at the Gotham is top notch. The room is huge and love the private balcony as well as the shared balcony. Perfect location. Short distance from all forms of transportation and walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, and a lot more. Look for Wolfgang Puck's sign on the front entrance as the Gotham sign is not as noticeable. Ladies you will love the complimentary body wash, shampoo, conditioner, bath bar and lotion at this hotel. You will want to take some home. The rooms are spacious and extra clean, the bed was so luxurious and huge. It's just the perfect place to stay and I can't say enough about the friendly helpful staff. Especially Mustava. You tell them where you'd like to go and they will find the easiest way for you to get there. Also, don't worry if you forget to bring something or just want to grab something in the middle of the night. Walk out the front door, turn left walk across the the street at the cross section and there is a deli/bodega by the name of Smiler's.

title: Wonderful long week-end
text:
My son and I stayed here for a long week-end in May to catch a Rangers play off game and see some broadway shows. We booked directly through the hotel website and got a great deal. Our room was on the 22 floor and quite large and very comfortable. It was quiet and we slept soundly. They had a turn down service and were always available for help ad advice.
The location is fabulous. Just off the beaten path by a block so quiet but a block away from the shops and the subway and excellent restaurants.
I would definitely stay again.

title: AMAZING
text: We stayed here for our very first trip to NYC, being from Texas, we expected New York to be very different. However, we were made to feel right at home every single day by Shaun and Jeinina as well as the other staff members. I will never stay anywhere else in New York other than The Gotham Hotel...and I will truly miss seeing their smiling faces everyday. They definitely earned a spot in our memories of NYC!

title: 好立地、ユニーク、コスト・パフォーマンス良好。
text: 1泊だけでしたが便利しました。便利な場所でロックフェラーセンター、MoMA、Times Squareなどどこも歩いてすぐだったのでNew York最後の一泊に当てて地の利を活かして歩き回りました。1FはWolfgang Stakeってのも面白いのですが、空いてた部屋が裏側の部屋だったのでバルコニーから下を見ると、レストランのトップライトを上から見下ろす形でステーキを楽しむテーブルが真上から見えてたのもある意味ニューヨークらしくて面白かったですよ。フロントのサービスはフレンドリーで親切でした。もうちょっと泊まってもよかったと思いました。

title: Customer Service
text: Out of the many times I have traveled to NYC, the Gotham Hotel staff made this a memorable one, they have yet to fail my expectations. We were right on 5th avenue where all the shopping was and Times Square was very close by! The hotel was clean, roomey, and it had a super comfy bed. The front desk agent Andrew and Elvis were nice enough to send me up a free bottle of champagne for my belated birthday trip! Thank you guys'!

title: Fantastic hotel with great staff!
text: I stayed at the Gotham from May 5-8th and had a great stay. The hotel is clean and bright and modern, close to Time Square & the bed was super comfy. The room was a god size with a small balcony. Not much of a view but the whole of NYC is right outside so it didn't matter much. The best part of my stay though was the friendliness of the young staff at the desk. All of them were always eager to help and went out of their way-including one bellboy who even walked me two blocks with my luggage- to another hotel I had to move to for a business engagement. Otherwise I would have stayed at the Gotham. So much nicer and friendlier. I'd go back in a heartbeat to the Gotham. It was great!

title: Perfect location
text: Checking in was easy and quick. The room was large (not what you'd expect in a city hotel) and all amenities were high end, even down to the complimentary toiletries. We were in a front facing room, with a smalllish balcony but gave us terrific views along 46th. It was also very close to many must see places. All staff were very helpful and friendly, including door staff - thank you Eldis and Christian.

title: Great hotel!
text: Just back from a dream  trip to NYC. The city did not disappoint. We had a blast. We stayed 5 nights at The Gotham. The hotel was fantastic!  No complaints. Comfortable clean, good size room, queen sized comfy bed with great shower. Central location not far from Times Square and Grand Central. Great base for exploring this amazing city.  Lovely friendly staff especially Mustafa, Elidis and Andrew at the front desk always welcoming and helpful. Thank you . Would definitely stay again and would recommend to others. ❤🗽

title: Hotel was great and staff amazing
text: My husband and myself stayed recently. We loved the hotel, it was centrally located and the staff was incredibly helpful and friendly, especially Mustafa and Eldis. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Fantastic Stay in Manhattan
text:
I was very impressed with the Gotham Hotel in Manhattan.  We were a few blocks from everything that we wanted to see.  Andrew and the rest of the staff were incredibly friendly.  They gladly took photos of us in front of the "Big Apple" picture in the lobby each morning, recommended places to eat, and gave us directions to where we wanted to go.  The room was clean and very roomy for Manhattan.  We even had a terrace!   This was my first trip to New York City, and when I return I know where I'll stay ~ right here at The Gotham Hotel.  
Thanks for making our trip so easy, fun and comfortable!
Until next time,
    Michelle

title: Fab hotel!!!
text: Great hotel in good location and staff excellent. Mustafa is an a real star nothing is too much trouble for him. Made are stay excellent helpful info on subway restaurants and shopping. would visit again.

title: Very good experience! Great view!
text: The hotel was an amazing experience. The staff was very attentive and friendly especially the front desk agent Andrew. He was very poise and professional. I felt really welcomed when he checked me in. The hotel is super clean and is in a great area. The views from the room was amazing. Will be staying here in the future.

title: Andrew made my visit extremely satisfying
text: I stayed here with my girlfriend for a couple of nights. The rooms are big and the bed was super comfy. We stayed at this hotel because of the private balcony it offered and it was two streets away from Times Square! Its a very small hotel but the staff are great, thank you to Andrew and Eldis.

title: Great service, great location, very old and noisy AC system
text:
For a modern day hotel this one has key issue - it's AC/Heat system sounds like a tractor. For people used to quiet nights this overshadows the rest of the experience.
It's location, willingness of the staff to help, pretty good rooms all try to compensate for this major drawback. I believe that for this kind of money this should not be the case.

title: Very good location in New York
text:
Un ottimo hotel. Da consigliare per la posizione, per la location in se e per l'ottima accoglienza ricevuta.
Thanks so much to: Mirio, Andrew, Antonia, Jarina and Eldis.
Da non sottovalutare la steack house proprio sotto l'hotel.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text:
I stayed on the 17th floor with a balcony on 46th street... What a great place to unwind after a busy business day and before dinner.  The hotel a small boutique, contemporary styling with an AMAZING staff. Rooms are as described on the web site.  I traveled with another person who's room was as nice as mine.  

I 100% will be back to stay again and in a city of 1,000's of places to stay that says alot.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
Myself and my better half stayed a week in this hotel and could not fault any part of it. We had a suite with a balcony which gave amazing views. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The service by all staff was exemplary and they spoilt us when my guy proposed to us by sending champagne to our room. 

It's perfectly situated near Times Square and the Empire State Building and Rockafella are within easy walk too. 

I want to go back!

title: Honeymoon
text: My husband and I had our belated honeymoon in New York and we stayed at The Gotham Hotel. What can I say... the hotel is super clean and modern. The shower in the room was lush! Unfortunately we had a little issue with not having any hot water but the staff had it sorted within 30 minutes! We went out and explored a lot so didn't eat in the restaurant located within the hotel but judging by the smell... top quality! We asked Mustafa and Dwayne for recommendations on where to eat and they were so friendly and helpful! We sat and had lovely chats with them about the difference in English and American cultures and they were a great laugh. I would 100% recommend this hotel to anyone looking to go to New York. It isn't far away from Times Square, about a 5 minute walk, so not far at all from the action!

title: Outstanding staff
text:
I have been staying at the Gotham for at least 6 years.  Every time I stay I am always treated fantastic.  The staff knows me and the things that I like.  One person in particular, Mustafa, has taken care of me the past few times.  He is always pleasant, has a smile and does what ever he can to accommodate me.  

I plan on staying at the Gotham each time I go to NYC.

title: Baustellenatmosphäre
text: Die schlechteste Hotelerfahrung in NY nach 10 Aufenthalten in Manhattan. Allein die Lage und die angenehme Zimmergröße haben den zweiten Stern gerettet. Leider gab es auf dem Buchungsportal keinen Hinweis auf die der Zimmerfront gegenüberliegende Großbaustelle, auf der ab 5:00 morgens bis spät abends sehr laut gearbeitet wurde. Da die Fenster praktisch keinen Schallschutz haben, waren die Nächte recht kurz. Allein vor diesem Hintergrund sind die aufgerufenen Preise trotz der guten Lage maßlos überzogen. Hinzu kam, dass es keine Tagesgardinen gibt - lediglich die Befestigungsröllchen sind noch in der Schiene, so dass man tagsüber den Raum mit den Verdunkelungsgardinen komplett abschirmen und mit Kunstlicht auskommen muss, wenn man nicht auf dem Präsentierteller wohnen möchte. Der in der Zimmerbeschreibung erwähnte Balkon entpuppte sich als lediglich ca. 50 cm tiefer Austritt – also komplett unbrauchbar. Im Zimmer war ein Stuhl kaputt und die Toilettenspülung defekt. Nach Reklamation wurden diese Mängel behoben. An zwei Tagen hintereinander funktionierte die elektronische Zimmerkarte bei unserer Rückkehr nicht. Bis das geregelt war und wir unser Zimmer wieder benutzen konnten, mussten wir jeweils über 30 Minuten in der ungemütlichen Kleinstlobby (jedes Arztwartezimmer ist größer) warten. Zunächst wurde allerdings der Fehler – auch beim zweiten Mal - beim Gast gesucht, der mehrmals rauf und runter geschickt wurde und selbst andere Karten ausprobieren musste. Immerhin hat sich hier später ein anderer Mitarbeiter sehr freundlich engagiert. Dass der Safe nicht im Schrank verschraubt ist und somit problemlos samt Inhalt herausgetragen werden kann, wurde hier schon mehrfach angemerkt und bleibt unverständlich. Die angenehme Überraschung, eine Nespresso-Maschine vorzufinden, währte nur einen Tag, danach wurden weder Kaffee noch neue Becher bereitgestellt. Nachlässigkeit, Desinteresse, Methode, Sparmaßnahme? Die Freundlichkeit des Personals war sehr unterschiedlich ausgeprägt, man fühlte sich nicht bei allen Mitarbeitern als Gast willkommen. Bereits der Empfang war unterkühlt. Entgegen der Buchungsbestätigung war das Zimmer auch nicht um 15:00 bezugsfertig, sondern erst nach 16:00. An einem Tag wurden Zimmer und Bad gar nicht geputzt, an anderen erst spätnachmittags. Der Teppich im Zimmer war wellig, wirkte schmuddelig und sah wenig vertrauenerweckend aus, die Fenster waren schmierig und streifig und wohl schon lange nicht mehr richtig gereinigt worden. Das Heisswasser kam erst milchig aus dem Kran und wurde erst einige Zeit später klar. Das alles hat weder etwas mit einer 4-Sterne Klassifizierung noch mit auch nur akzeptablen Service zu tun, schon gar bei im Schnitt über 200 $ pro Nacht! Da hilft dann auch die gute Lage nicht mehr. Definitiv nicht zu empfehlen.

title: A Suprisingly Pleasant Stay
text:
We booked the Gotham based on location and price. Imagine a building 25 feet wide and 25 stories high with interesting architecture. If you weren't paying attention, you'd walk right by it. We arrived at the hotel in the evening and Mustafa checked us in. He was friendly and efficient, explaining how our credit cards would be used. The next morning, Jeinina on the front desk efficiently corrected a billing issue. 
  The location of the hotel (East 46th between Fifth and Madison Avenues) is amazing and was an easy walk to the theater district, the shops on Fifth Avenue, Times Square and many other places. A Dunkun Donuts a couple doors down supplied morning coffee and an afternoon snack.
   Room 192 was very spacious and contemporary in design. The bathroom was equally stylish and well appointed. Since it is the location of the Gotham Book Store, there were books in the room one could read. I enjoyed looking thru one on southern cooking. The linen on the bed and in the bath were of the best quality. A feature that I liked was a small terrace off the bedroom, and a large terrace off elevator lobby on our floor. Since there was only one other room on that floor, we felt we had the space to ourselves The terrace had a large table with four chairs, a sofa and chair. With electrical outlets, one could relax there with ones laptop and work, enjoying the view.
  Eldis was very pleasant, eager to be of service. He told us of places to eat in the neighborhood.

title: Fantastic staff and location
text: We stopped for 6 nights at the end of March, beginning of April, 2017. This was our second time in NYC and the more central location than last time was a major factor in our choosing the Gotham Hotel - this proved to be an excellent decision since it really is conveniently located for the major touristy things (Times Square, theatres, etc). The room was a good size and well kept and more than met our needs (the bed was huge and really comfortable - one of us is now trying to work out how we can lever such a large bed into our home bedroom) - the only thing it could have done with was a second chair to sit on (however, since we didn't spend too much time in our room this wasn't really a problem for us). All the staff at the hotel we encountered (Eldis, Mustafa, Krystal, Dwayne, Jeinana, Robert, Shaun, and the housekeeping staff  - sorry if we misspelt any names or missed anyone one out) are the outstanding strength of this hotel - friendly, helpful, and efficient - what more could anyone ask for?

title: Great hidden gem
text: Thanks for a great stay, felt like I had an apartment in the City, perfect location, everyone was nice and helpful.  They even found the Bluetooth device I left and are holding it for me. The most spacious room and bathroom I've had in NYC, great value.

title: Extremely nice staff in a great location
text: Located very conveniently in midtown this hotel has a caring staff that goes out of their way to help you out.  We stayed 4 nights and only have nice things to say. Highly recommended if you want to be close to Rockefeller Center, Shopping and the Theatres.

title: Great Staff, Great Location but SHOCKING hotel!
text:
To start Mustafa and Eldis are brilliant in this hotel, you couldn't fault them at their job, they are the only reason I gave the hotel a 1. As well as the fact the hotel is in a brilliant location to see all the main sights. 

However my boyfriend and I booked here for a 5 night stay in a Skyline Junior Suite (supposed to be on the highest floors of the hotel, I requested this before arrival, yet we were put on floor 12 out of 24) and upon arrival our room was not ready at 3pm. When we finally got to our room the door handles to the balcony were not sufficiently working, the shower tap wasn't working and we had to fix this ourselves in order to shower. The plug socket in the bathroom wasn't working so I could do my hair in a mirror. Other than these issues we just carried on...

That was until our last night in the hotel when we came back to our room from a busy day out to find laminate flooring in our hallway. It stunk of sawdust and the noise from the builders was outrageous. Baring in mind this was 7pm!! We wouldn't have minded if it was during the day or we had been informed of this happening! We rang reception for them to tell us that this would be carrying on for another hour (8pm!). The noise and smell was so bad we had to leave our hotel room and go for a walk around instead of being able to relax. To be fair to staff they apologised and asked housekeeping to go into our room to clear the smell. Although we felt this work shouldn't of been happening in the first place!

All in all this hotel has great potential, it's a great location, it's just a shame the upkeep and informing of customers is extremely poor. I wouldn't recommending staying here as the pictures you see aren't exactly what you get. The amazing views that are shown of the balconies don't also feature the construction sight across the road, which is basically all you can see...

title: Amazing experience
text: Eldis and Mustafa were phenomenal during our stay in January. They were very friendly and helpful for sites to see during our trip. The hotel was clean and very nice. It was an overall great experience.

title: Best boutique hotel in NYC
text: Great rooms most with balconies. Great staff. Great prices also has great steakhouse In Building called  Wollfgangs.  And wonderful NYC location    Love it.   Have stayed in many hotels in NYC some more expansive but this hotel is the best of them all

title: 7 night stay
text: Stayed in a skyline junior suite and the size of the room was excellent as was the bathroom. The location was superb and close to Grand central station and 5th Avenue. We could not fault anything about our stay at this hotel and the staff were very friendly, helpful and always had a smile on their faces especially Mustafa, Aldina and Eldiz. We would recommend this hotel and will hopefully visit again in the future.

title: Amazing Stay!
text:
My wife, daughter and I stayed here last week while I was at a conference and it was an incredible experience! They gave me a coupon for a parking lot they are affiliated with just down the street so parking was so easy and reasonably priced.

The hotel is a short walk from Time Square so my wife and daughter had so much opportunity to enjoy the city while I was working. We took advantage of everything this hotel has to offer including the restaurant which was awesome. My daughter is 10 months old which can be challenging in a big city but the hotel staff was extremely accommodating. 

We checked out and left the day of the St.Patrick's day parade, streets were closed and traffic was a nightmare. I could not get my vehicle anywhere near the hotel so one of the hotel staff actually helped my wife carry our luggage several blocks away to meet me which saved the day for us. Had we not been leaving that day, it would have been an excellent location to check out the parade! 

The hotel itself is beautiful and every detail is well thought out. The rooms are not only incredibly stylish (beautiful shower, amazing hardwood floors, etc.) but extremely comfortable. I travel a lot for work and stay in hotels up to 100 nights per year and this place is by far my favourite in any city I've been. This hotel has everything you could possibly ask for in a New York City Hotel. Awesome location, beautiful rooms, and great people. I would highly recommend it and will certainly be staying here on every trip to NYC from here on.

title: Location perfetta e personale gentilissimo
text:
L'hotel è posizionato al centro di Manhattan, vicino a diverse stazioni metro. Il ristorante all'interno è aperto anche a acolazione nonostrante sia una stekhouse.
Il letto della nostra camera era comodissimo e ela macchina del caffè faceva un buon espresso (Nespresso). L'jha differenza l'ha fatta il personale, sempre pronto a darci suggerimenti per ristoranti o bar nelle vicinanze. Super consigliato!

title: Amazing time for my daughters birthday
text: This hotel met and exceeded my expectations. The staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our entire trip. It was a long weekend trip for my daughters 15th birthday. The hotel is located right in the heart of everything you could possibly want to do. Time square is just 3 blocks from here. The room was very spacious for 4 people and very clean.You just need to ask for something and it is brought right up to you. I would defiantly stay here again I highly recommend this hotel. I am planning my next trip to The Gotham.

title: The warmest part of our trip!
text:
After over 30 hours of flight delays, lost gate-checked bags, and frigid NYC wind and weather, the warmest part of our trip was being greeted and taken care of by Mustafa and the crew when we checked into The Gotham Hotel. 

We booked through Hotels Tonight only knowing the property by it's location and few great pictures in the ap. I called before arrival asking about parking options. Boom! 100% perfect instructions and the process went perfectly. When we arrived at the hotel, a young man welcomed us to the Gotham, held the door for us while we dragged our tired bodies over the threshold to the front desk. Immediately, Mustafa was on it - ensuring the best room he had available in our range was ready for us. He gave great sights-to-see advice when we asked. Whipped out a map and started circling must-sees.

When we got to the room, we were pleasantly surprised by how bit it was! The hotel we stayed at the night before was half its size. Spacious, comfortable and clean! The bathroom was gorgeous! 

When we left for dinner, we asked Mustafa for a couple extra large towels and pillows to be delivered. Yep, they were! When we got back from dinner, we complained about the price of bottled water and soda at the neighborhood Walgreens (captive audience I supposed, near Times Square). Boom, comped! He gifted us a Coke and the large bottle of water! What a nice guy!

The next morning, when we were getting ready to check out, I was bummed that we wouldn't see him. I wanted to give him a tip for taking such good care of us. That's what we travelers are supposed to do, right? Well, much to my surprise, he was at the front desk! I reached out my hand with money in it, and he put up his in resistance. He put one on his heart and said he was honored to have had the opportunity (or at least that's how I remember it). I was grateful to know there were still decent people out there being kind because it was the right thing to do, and not just for the all mighty dollar. 

Thank you Mustafa!  Thank you Gotham and crew we didn't interact with. We will definitely be back next time we are in town.

Warmest, 
Amy & Linn
from the other Windy City, Chicago

title: Eldis made the difference.
text: On top of the fact that there it is a great location in the core of NYC, the rooms are clean and spacious. This small hotel is very welcoming and the staff is always ready to make your stay a little big more comfortable. I would like to underline the work of Mustafa, Dwayne and a special thanks to Eldis. Eldis has always making sure that our day has gone well and making sure that we would enjoy our evening. He went beyond the hello & goodbye that is to be expected from the reception. It shows that he actually cares about the guests of the Gotham Hotel and wants us to keep a positive image of our stay.

title: Awesome first time in New York
text: The service and desk people was super nice and very helpful. Especially rob the door man, very kind and very helpful. It was in a great area, very easy to walk to the best destinations New York has to offer.

title: Diamond in the rough
text: If you need to stay in midtown, it's hard to beat this location. A nondescript spot tucked in on 46th b/w 5th and Madison. Bare minimum lobby with not much going on, but the room, bath and bed are hard to beat. Room had a nice look, seemed to be recently renovated, bed was super comfy and the bathroom was brand new. A good nights sleep and within walking distance of Times Square, Grand Central, NY library, Bryant square and Central Park. Really good value to be had at this spot.

title: Fabulous Boutique Hotel
text: We truly enjoyed our 5 night stay at The Gotham Hotel.  The room was spacious, with a private terrace, Turkish cotton towels and high thread count Egyptian cotton sheets.  Milton Brown toiletries and a Nescafe coffee maker in the room!   The whole City of New York has excellent coffee, some the best of the best was made directly in our room courtesy of the hotel!   The staff is polite, efficient and friendly.  The front desk, door person and everyone we encountered is young, hip and helpful.  I requested additional bedding and a substitute pillow and it was delivered promptly.  The staff made us feel like we belonged there and gave the vibe they were happy to be there as well.  Staff is happy to make recommendations or simply just offer a welcoming smile.  There are public terraces on the higher floors for all guests to access.  I highly recommend this hotel.  Be sure to say "Hello" to Mustafa - he's excellent at customer service.

title: Massive room with balcony!!
text: I loved my stay at Gotham. What the hotel lacks in lobby - after all, what do you need except the reception desk, water and sofas: Perfect - it makes up for in the room. Very large and with a balcony! Fantastic shower and a beautiful bed. The style of the room is plain but who cares when it is functional and still feels homely. The staff went out of their way to help in any way they possibly could, they were truly outstanding, and once outside you right on 5th Avenue and walking distance to Times Square.

title: Enjoyable Stay
text: I enjoyed my stay at the Gotham. The room was very nice - not too fancy, but modern, clean and not too fussy. The hotel was a short walk to Rockefeller Center and Times Square. The staff was professional. There wasn't much of a lobby, but I wouldn't hang there anyway. Had a little problem with the wifi at the end of my trip, but other than that, no major complaints.

title: Great stay
text: It's  very rare to find a true hospitality professional.  But, I found my gem. Mustafa was one of the most helpful, caring and knowledgeable front desk clerks I've ever come across. He gave us advice and tips all about the city ANYTIME we asked. Truly amazing!

title: cold showers, foul smelling room, fake smiles, bad service.
text: I stayed at the hotel for two night (8-10/2/2-17). During the snowstorm. I was put in a room with foul, awful smell. After complaining they switched rooms. There were no hot water in the room. Showered in cold water.  Complained - was told it was fixed. The next day again - cold water only. Complained - brought me to a different room to shower. No compensation or real apology offered. A really bad experience and I will not return to this hotel.

title: Really well located hotel
text:
We spent 10 days at this hotel and it was very pleasant. We were quite high up with a  balcony giving us a fab city buildings view. The room was fairly large with a sitting area and flat screen tv. The shower was quite big too but the rest of the bathroom was fairly smallish. The bed was also very comfortable. 

Ceaser the Manager was extremely helpful and has done a great job with making this hotel perfect for people wanting to explore NYC. 

GREAT LOCATION!!!!

title: Delusione
text: Il front office manager di quest'hotel è stato così garbato e gentile da farmi passare solo una minima parte di arrabbiatura. Il nostro arrivo è stato deludente: stanza al sesto piano e non al piano alto come da nostra richiesta. Fosse solo questo. La camera era fredda ma, soprattutto, aveva una moquette sporchissima, e la cassetta di sicurezza che non funzionava. A nostra richiesta ci hanno spostato: ci è stata assegnata una King a fianco anzichè una Queen, ma la moquette aveva gli stessi problemi. Macchiati, in modo irrimediabile, anche i ripiani dei mobili. La vista: vogliamo parlarne? E' sulla 46ma, di fronte al cantiere di un palazzo in costruzione. La camera è dotata soltanto di tende oscuranti, dunque per non avere in stanza gli sguardi indiscreti degli operai bisognava stare al buio tutto il giorno. L'illuminazione della camera era decisamente insufficiente.  Solo abatjour, una lampada vicino alla tv e un paio di deboli faretti all'ingresso. Le porte hanno maniglie molto dure, dunque la sensazione al nostro primo rientro in stanza è stata quella di essere rimasti chiusi fuori. In realtà bisognava essere più decisi e sforzare. Passiamo al frigobar. Bottiglie, ma nessun cavatappi. Per una sera, la prima, e solo per quella, abbiamo preso una piccola bottiglietta di acqua minerale e nient'altro: ci hanno addebitato 18 dollari sulla carta di credito. A proposito: il soggiorno di nove giorni era già stato pagato tramite Expedia, ma al nostro arrivo ci sono stati addebitati 900 dollari (cento al giorno) di cauzione, poi restituiti. Un'enormità per la categoria dell'Hotel. Gli addetti alla pulizia della stanza sono, inoltre, decisamente disattenti ed è il motivo per cui non abbiamo mai lasciato la mancia: pigiami spostati in modo disordinato in giro per la stanza, asciugamani a volte non sostituiti, cuffia della doccia idem. Il giorno della nostra partenza abbiamo visto arrivare un camion, gli operai e tantissimi listoni di parquet. Evidentemente stanno rimettendo a posto ciò che si sono resi conto che non va. Poi il front office manager, incontrato nella hall alla nostra partenza (purtroppo non prima), si è scusato sia per i 900 dollari, sia per la moquette. Ha riconosciuto tutte le pecche di cui ci siamo lamentati e ci ha detto che ci farà avere un parziale rimborso tramite Expedia (mi auguro accada davvero). Tra gli aspetti positivi del soggiorno, abbiamo apprezzato la posizione, ma solo parzialmente: vero che l'hotel è in piena Midtown, e praticamente a ridosso della Fifth Avenue, ma rispetto ad altri alberghi la metropolitana non è poi così vicina. Il bagno è ristrutturato, con una grande doccia. Pochi, tuttavia, i prodotti a disposizione (uno per qualità e non uno a testa). Alcuni giovani della reception sono davvero gentili (non tutti) e disponibili: ci è stata fornita un'ottima indicazione per il diner più vicino. L'hotel è, inoltre, a ridosso di un Gregory's, caffetteria molto diffusa a Nyc, in cui fare ( se lo so desidera) una colazione italiana, con croissant e cappuccio. E' un albergo in cui potremmo decidere di tornare solo se risistemato.

title: Good spacious room, good hotel and staff
text: Room on level 16, extremely spacious. Very good hotel and great staff, whom gave me great recommendations. The only downside was that I would have preferred brighter and/or more lighting, felt dark without ceiling lights.

title: Great Location
text:
This hotel is in the best location ever, you really can't beat it.
On arrival we had a very quick and easy check in by friendly staff. Staff were very friendly and helpful all week.
We booked a Junior suite with terrace and I have to say we were both disappointed when we walked through the door. It is tired and needs some money spending on it to be sure. However, the bed was really comfortable, bathroom good and the terrace was great as my husband is a smoker. The wifi was excellent, I need to work whilst away and did not let us down the 7 days we stayed.
In summary, if you can get a good price, it is a superb base but don't expect luxury.

title: Better than expected
text: I say in this area of the city often for work.  I usually stay a few blocks south at similar sized hotels.  this hotels room size, staff, level of luxury and cleanliness was beyond what I expected on my first visit.  Nothing in NY ever looks as good as the pics and that holds true here.  But it was a much nicer room than I expected... it has a warmth that was refreshing and the hidden corners you expect to find shabby were not at all.  i will stay there again for sure.  Only down side was a more limited lobby common area than we would have liked... even for a NYC hotel.

title: Great hotel but a few niggles - and wifi --let it down
text:
When i first walked into the room i immediately thought this could be my new "go-to" hotel in New York. The room was very spacious and modern, with nice fittings. I had a balcony, too, which is unusual, albiet overlooking a wall only, but the view from my window was ok. I also had access to a terrace out the front of the hotel (shared only with one other room on my floor) though it was too cold to take advantage of it unfortunately. 

i then started noticing a few niggles: i had to ring down for a "do not disturb" sign and the room service menu (turns out the room service was from an adjoining steakhouse which was very expensive - the least expensive meal would have set me back about $70! - but i made do with Grubhub and of course all the restaurants around); the door into the small wardrobe scraped on the floor so i couldn't open/shut it properly, the safety deposit box didn't work and one day, having left my room at 8.30am and returned at 3.30pm, my room still hadn't been serviced.  All these though i can forgive as they were relatively small points. The toiletries were lovely, there was a lovely walk-in shower, and the staff were without exception absolutely delightful. 

The one thing i find it harder to forgive, however, was the awful wifi. Not only could i not FaceTime home (important to me) without it constantly freezing and failing, but even downloading and sending emails (essential when on business!) was very hit and miss and at times impossible. I did mention it once and they said it was unusual and it should improve, but it didn't. 

It is, however, in a great location with lots of restaurants around and overall a great hotel (the room size being a big plus), and if wifi isn't important to you then i really do recommend this place. But if you're there on business and (like me, being from the UK) dependent on reliable wifi, then i'd think twice about it. I'd love to return here but unfortunately don't think i could until i knew this has been improved.

title: Birthday Weekend Getaway
text:
This by far has been the hotel with the most friendliest staff that I have ever stayed considering that people in NY is known for being not that friendly. Mustafa, Dwayne and Andrew were really helpful on giving us directions and ideas on what to do and where to go. Also sending Champagne to our room for my wife birthday making it a little more special and at the end of the trip setting up the ride back to the airport for which the driver was fantastic, friendly and gave us historical facts from different places on our way to the airport. On the downside I would say that the room was kind of dated since the carpet looked like it was really old and dirty, the countertop had water stains from cups, furniture looked really worn out and walls definitely need a fresh paint. The bathroom on the other hand looked like it was recently updated and was very clean. 
On my next trip to NY definitely The Gotham Hotel will be my place to stay and again kudos to the great staff that made me and my wife feel at home away from home. Great Job guys!!!

title: Great location and friendly staff
text:
My partner and I visited new York for a few days at the start of this year and stayed a few nights here.

The location is fantastic and puts you right in the heart of New York only a few blocks from times Square.

The rooms were spacious and the beds very comfy.  We opted for the superior king with terrace and were slightly disappointed that the terrace was the same tiny balcony you get in the standard king overlooking the back of the building and offering views of air-conditioning units and the only superior aspect was that the rooms were located on the higher floors.
There are public balconies from the 19th floor that offer much more space and better views.

The hotel was undergoing some refurbishment, but this aside we would recommend it for the staff working there who went out of their way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible.

Ellis deserves a stand out mention here.
He was very friendly and went out of his way to take care of us and recommended a number of places to visit during our stay.

We look forward to visiting again and seeing how the hotel looks once the refurbishment has been completed.

title: Loved This Place
text: Great impression for my first time ever staying in NYC.  I live in Westchester so I never felt the need to stay in the city because I am so close.  Decided to stay here for my 5 year anniversary and we were so glad we did.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Will definitely stay again.

title: The Gotham is truly a home in the City when traveling
text:
I've stayed with the Gotham for several years now.  And each time I am more impressed.  From the superb location to the even more excellent staff, it reminds me to never look elsewhere.  The rooms are perfect especially on the back with the balcony and ability to always have fresh air.  

The Restaurant Wolfgangs is a short elevator ride down and provides excellent service and food and lively nightlife.  

A small business center is off the lobby.

I just can't thank them enough this trip for their kindnesses and support and excellent service!

title: good location, clean and good service
text: found the location very convenient, rooms clean, service at desk friendly and helpful with good price for NYC.  you could not hear the noise from the streets in the rooms, always a plus. There is a Wolfgang Puck Steak House as an extension of the lobby, good asset

title: Wasted potential
text:
Stayed here 10+ times over past 2 1/2 years.  Great location.  Limited# of rooms, cool design, and bar/restaurant on site.  

Over time, however, the lack of focus on customer service and maintenance has taken its toll.  

During latest stay the unengaged management issue came crashing in on many fronts.  Scary drunk at restaurant that management wouldn't address.  Wait 10 minutes for elevator, no exaggeration.  Why? Housekeeping locking one out from floor to floor while other out of service. Non-engaged front-desk staff and no management visibility.  Staff not empowered to fix issues.  Room maintenance making them darker, dirtier, and less appealing over time.  Request to change out feathers in room ignored/lost until forced by me at midnight.  2nd attempt had staff bring MORE feather pillows and comforter!   45 min later finally done only through force of my will. 

It shouldn't have to be this way, especially in New York and for these prices.  

Plenty of better options.

title: Mustafa made this a 5 star review.....
text: Ya know what? What I didn't like about this place all melted away when we met Mustafa. Sincere character is how I would describe him Caring, intelligent,  helpful,  GREAT sense of humor, polite,, just raised right kind of guy!  The rest of the staff was very nice, but Mustafa would be the reason I will book here again.

title: Great staff, great location and very comfortable bed but needs some serious TLC
text:
My husband and I spent a couple of weeks at the Gotham during our long stay in New York. When we arrived and we were shown to what we thought was our upmarket deluxe King balcony rosom in a boutique hotel in central New York and after being told we were getting one of the best rooms we were very disappointed. We found that our balcony room looked out onto a wall on one side and air conditioning ducts on the other and also that the furniture was badly scuffed and tired and the carpet was worn and stained. 

Despite our disappointment we decided to stick it out as the location is great - it's on restaurant row - this means you have great access to fabulous food and also all the nice things that come with being close to Broadway and Grand Central station. I should add that the room was spacious and the bathroom modern and nice.

On net I'd say that although the place lacked charm and was in need of a serious renovation, the bed was extremely comfortable, the rooms were quiet and clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful - special shout out to Eldis! Would I stay here again? Only after they have completed a serious refurb...and only because the staff are so nice...just ask if the owners have started/completed the renovation they refer to on the signs in the lift...if they have...well maybe I'd give them another  go....but not before..too many other options

title: NYC at Christmas time
text:
Our stay at Gotham proved to be the perfect location for enjoying Rockefeller Center and the Fifth Avenue windows during our recent visit to see New York City at Christmas.   

The front desk folks were young and refreshing,  as well as helpful.

The hotel has wonderful breakfast and lunch facilities in the same block. 

Our room was the largest one we've ever had in NYC.  Hope we have the opportunity to stay there again.

title: More than just a batsymbol
text: great stay at the hotel, very clean, friendly staff. will be returning to the gotham hotel. the location was almost near perfect. A special thanks to Rob, Dwayne, Andrew,and Aolina for the wonderful stay.

title: Super rapport qualité prix pour rester dans l'hypercentre !
text:
Voila un bon plan pour les gens qui ont besoin de rester dans l'hypercentre et ne pas forcément en subir tous les inconvénients. 
En effet, les abords de Time Square regorgent de vieux hotels supposément de luxe qui sont vétustes et très mal insonorisé. 

Au Gotham Hotel, vous trouverez des chambres parfaitement propres et particulièrement calmes. Ne dérogeant pas à la règle elle ne sont pas très modernes : vous trouverez des revêtements de bureau qui se décollent, des minibars qui ne fonctionnent pas. Mais ce ne sont que des détails comparé a la concurrence ! 

Point important, les chambres sont équipés de petit balcon, pour les fumeurs c'est un des seuls hotels du quartier !

title: Our NYE NYC getaway
text:
To start with I (we) are going to give you all you need to know. I'm not going to shop around for another hotel on my next trip to NYC, this'll be the one that I (we) will use on our next trip here.

The Gotham is a hidden gem. Tucked away on 46th street you could (as we did) walk right on by it. If you're after glitz and glamour then it isn't the hotel for you, there's no grand entrance hall or 20ft chandeliers, but what it doesn't have it that department it has everywhere else. 

1-It's incredibly well placed being only a 5 minute walk in a straight line to either Times Square or the Rockafella building and its positioned perfectly for shopping along 5th avenue and surrounding areas and only a 10minute taxi ride down to Soho for the less tourist-y shops.

2-The rooms are fantastic. Although not the cheapest of rooms, ones of a similar size would've cost a lot more even at worse hotels in the city.
2.1-The beds in the room are the single best hotel bed I've slept in, and I've stayed in a few flashy places back on our side of the Atlantic. Although not a conventional construction the mattress/topper combo works perfectly to create a place in which you don't want to leave. Ontop of that the physical side of the bed is way and beyond what we were expecting, being from England the biggest size on offer there isn't anywhere near the size of these.
2.2-There is more space in this room than anyone could need, to give you an idea there is more than enough room for another super king sized bed and another single to use up the floor space, which in midtown manhatten is in itself a treat.
2.3-The t.v/cable service is upwards of what we were expecting, rather than a limited hotel service as we have been accustomed to it was a full cable package.
2.4-lighting controls by the bed are a nice touch and the bedside lamps are nice.
2.5-Bathroom was near perfect. Spacious, again more than enough room. Shower was spot on with two heads, one fixed rain style and one movable head, with the option to run them both simultaneously. Again it was incredibly spacious with enough room for 5 people let alone one.
2.6-Decor was nice and up to date, a fresh feeling compared to some hotels in the area that still have the same trim and fitting they had in the 70's ( not the good type of vintage)

3-The hotel is very very good, but it's the staff that make it what it is. 
3.1-Eldis, the Bellman has been helpful to no end and always went the extra mile in his manners, this was reinforced by the offering to help us with anything and everything from alternatives to cancelled trips to bars and places to eat. Unlike other places in the city he didn't seem like a robot just there to earn his money, he was engaging and chatty showing genuine consideration. He definitely brings something to this hotel.
3.2- Andrew on the front desk was also incredibly and made check in and any other of our requirements super easy, and again was incredibly well mannered.
3.3- all of the other staff whose names I don't know, everyone at the Gotham was very polite and I believe this reflects the business as a whole, they are all a solid representation of what the hotel and name is.

Now there are only two bad points that I can make about the Gotham and they are;
1- exterior noise from the balcony side. Some form of A/C / exhaust/ generator on the ground floor in the middle of all of the buildings on the block was off putting-ly loud. As it's cold out we didn't use the balcony, but when I did go out on it the noise level is beyond that of comfort. From inside the room (on the 23rdfloor) you can hear it. From the room it sounds like a heavy duty computer tower fan system or a fishtanks water pump is in the room.
2- Although the light in the room is adequate, it isn't perfect, and if I'm being picky I'd say there needs to be another bulb in the middle off the room rather than the two above each pillow and the one above the door.

To conclude, I'm definitely stopping at The Gotham again without considering any others.
This is down to the fact that it ticked every box, and the staff turned it from a nice hotel to one I (we) have fallen in love with.

-Alan & Shantelle

title: perfect location
text:
Fantastic location, Grand Central subway less than a five minute walk. Times square just over a five minute walk and plenty of bars and restaurants to chose from. 
The room itself was nice, just be aware of the construction site opposite! Great views down the block though.
the floors are very quiet, there are only 3 rooms per floor which was ideal. had to call for bathrobes that were listed on the website but we soon got them. no coffee making facilities which were also listed on the website, but coffee shops close by.
comfy bed, great pillows and duvet.
the balcony was great, even though it was december, we enjoyed using it.
shaun was a lovely bellman, always happy to help and offer any suggestions of where to go and what to see

title: Not just for Batman
text:
Yes we specifically looked at this hotel because we're Batman fans... but it was worth it!
Great location was the best part; five minute walk to Rockefeller.
Doormen were the sweetest! They recognized us coming down the street and asked us about our excursions. 
Rooms were older than I expected. And the balcony door did not stay shut (but they knew and were apparently in the midst of replacing all balcony doors).
Loved having our own terrace and even better, we discovered you could go up to the top level and sit on that terrace! (See picture for view!)

title: No compassion for death in the family
text: Gotham Hotel room itself was ok, but my big issue is that I had a death in the family and had to leave NYC a day early, so I asked for a refund of my last night there, which was New Year's Eve.  I prepaid an unrefundable package, but most hotels, airlines, etc that I know have an extenuating circumstances policy for things like unexpected death (for example, my airline changed my flight at no charge).  Besides I told them 4 days in advance of New Year's, so they could have easily turned it around and resold the room for double the price.  But instead of making this a win-win, they refused to do anything, so I lost nearly $500 and they had a room sit empty on New Year's (or maybe they resold it anyway and still didn't give me a refund).

title: Perfect Family Visit
text: We were looking for a centrally located Hotel that was a good point for walking the city, easy to subway and this midtown hotel was great. There are only three rooms per floor so the rooms are quiet. We had a room at the back of the hotel so no street noise. There is a bar and restaurant in the building. Most important for my husband, a coffee house right next door with great coffee, tea and pastries not Starbucks.The most helpful was the staff, they had helpful suggestions and got us headed in the right directions. Our favorite Bellman was Mustafa, he was charming and most helpful. There was a few glitches, our toilet was running but the repair man was in the room shortly, I think I needed to call for the bathrobes that are listed on the website and it was time for a carpet clean. Great mattress, slept well. Small balcony but it was December. We booked real early and got a special off the hotel website.

title: My go to hotel in NYC
text:
I love the Gotham, the staff are young and vibrant and so helpful.
I initially chose this hotel because it had a balcony, important for smokers!!!...but I find myself returning for so many more reasons.
The beds are like climbing into a fluffy cloud, if I could smuggle one home in my luggage, I would.
Location is fantastic, just off fifth ave.
The only downside is the lack of tea/coffee making facilities, but thankfully, there is a Gregory's right next door...their coffee is divine...
I would not suggest the restaurant attached to the hotel, having had a bout of food poisoning from there, but I believe it is a separate entity, just housed within the hotel.
The young girl with frizzy hair on the front desk and the boy, mustafa(?) are so welcoming, they made a fuss over my daughter when I took her there last trip and were full of suggestions of places to visit...
Googling dates for my next stay...

title: amazing staff
text: The staff at the Gotham are definitely what made the stay, from us arriving early and doing all the check in formalities so when we returned later we could just grab a key and holding our luggage for the day, to them again one check out finding room to hold our 6 pieces of luggage and organizing our car to the airport. The staff were all to happy to point us in the right direction give tips on where to go and where to eat, they were invested in our holiday which is great to have such invaluable information at your fingertips. We booked a junior skyline suite and had a room at the front of the building although there was construction across the road you couldn't hear anything with the door closed (it took me a while to work out but the door locks by pulling up) The balcony was great to sit out and relax away from the crazy of NYC. The room was nice and spacious with the basic needs covered, there was no real wow factor aside from the bed which was the most comfortable bed i slept in during our 4 week trip. House keeping could use a little more attention to detail in stocking the mini bar and coffee machine. There were a few minor things that could have used some maintenance attention but nothing major. The location is fantastic right off 5th only a 10min walk to times square and subway stops close by. All in all this is a great hotel with an amazing bed and even more amazing staff, thank you team Gotham in particular Shaun, Eldis and Dwayne you made our stay.

title: Decent just not exceptional
text:
We booked the standard room, balcony on the back side (brick wall view, as reported by others but less road noise). 

The Good: 
Location is great, near shows and restaurants. Staff was efficient and friendly. (The doorman, Eldis, was always ready to be helpful.) Nice down pillows and duvet, roomy bath and rain shower. Relatively clean and complimentary bottled water and some snacks, too! Generally quiet, if you don't need to use the noisy HVAC unit by window. Good black-out curtains.

Not So Good: 
Hard mattress, not notepad and pen by phone, only one chair on balcony (??), 3 coat hangers (for two people!!!) but no wall hooks for coats, etc., furniture was shabby with surface damage. No tea or coffee kettle (and no mention of complimentary room delivery, as some hotels do instead) Yes, there are coffee shops int he same block but we'd rather relax and read the news & mail sipping something warm upon waking instead of having to get dressed to go out and get something. (It is vacation, after all.) Electric outlets by bed BUT you have to plug in below and feed cable up through hole. Really bad design. Other places get this right. Balcony door didn't lock. (Is that intentional so guests don't lock themselves out there?) No robes in room. Thought website listed them?
