I'd say the hotel was upper middle price range so we had hoped to like it a bit more. Still, if you get a good rate, aren't very particular about details, and like the location, then book it. Otherwise, we probably won't return.

title: No complaints
text: Nice little hotel just outside Times Square. Quick check in, friendly staff. Booked a Superior Room, 1 King Bed, Terrace. Room was spacious compared other New York hotels I've stayed in. Terrace was basically just a door that open to a 15" overhang with a railing. Was nice to have access to the fresh air, however the noise from the ongoing parking garage construction across the street put the kibosh on that. Room service from Wolfgang's was exceptional. Bathroom was stylish with glass door rainfall shower. Although the shower knobs were on the far inside of the shower, so you had to be under the head when you turned it on: and it was COLD. Toiletries supplied were more than acceptable, as were the linens. All in all, a nice stay. I would probably stay again as long as the rate is competitive.

title: Great Location but disappointing stay
text:
I frequent NYC often and I am a very seasoned traveler for work. I really wanted to like The Gotham due to the great location but our stay was very disappointing. 

The Pros: Great location esp for the holidays. Mustafa and other staff members were kind and helpful. Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks are close by for morning coffee. Ask for a higher floor, which helps with traffic noise (if not on construction side of hotel). Decent size room for NYC. Mini fridge in rooms. Nice amenity to have a balcony but should have 2 chairs. The balcony is a nice touch for early Spring/Summer.

The Cons: We did not start our trip out very well. We were told at check in the amount due on our reservation plus a $100 deposit. Long story short, the hotel tried to authorize 3 times multiple amounts which added up to almost $2000 more then our entire stay. Due to the multiple authorizations, the bank thought it was fraudulent activity and shut the card off. We were were told by the FD clerk in front of other staff members and guests in the lobby that our credit card was declined. He made no mention of the multiple authorizations and advised us to call the bank. We were very embarrassed and called the bank. That is when we found out about the multiple authorizations. When I asked the FD clerk about this, he at first tried to brush over it but I was pretty persistent with my questions. He finally stated that he did process multiple authorizations but for why the amount was more than double for our entire stay, he claimed that it was "a system glitch" that added the wrong amount.

Room- overlooked construction which had the lights on 24/7 and they started working very early in the AM. The lights were not blocked by the fitted curtains and gaps in the room. If you are a sensitive sleeper or light sensitive, ask before booking if construction is still ongoing.

Housekeeping- Our third night, our room was skipped and we had the Service please sign on the door since 10:30am. Only the last night, we asked for no service. No amenities/towels/toilet paper were replaced the first two nights so we had to request more. We had the same lint on the floor our entire stay so the room was never vacuumed. We also had a large grease stain on the table that we finally cleaned ourselves the last night. Only 4 hangers in the room and we had to call 2X and wait 4 hours for them to bring more. The toilet kept on running but a kind gentleman came quickly to fix. The phone only worked on speaker phone.

No coffee maker in the room which should be standard at all hotels. Also, the lobby had no holiday decorations and it was early Dec which made the resort feel a bit cold and stark.

We did notify the desk of our complaints the last night of our stay. The lady who was working apologized but by that point we were already disappointed. She was very nice but when you have many hotel options in NYC, there did not seem a desire to make us want to come back.

title: Fantastic Service, Great hotel
text: We stayed here for the week before Christmas on a business trip. The room, King Deluxe had a great bed, nice spacing, and large (bigger than normal) closet space. The hotel, on 46th near Madison Ave, is extremely convenient to all of the Midtown Manhattan sites (Times Square, Grand Central, Rockefeller Center, etc.). The hotel staff and management is just fantastic. They all support every request from the guests and try to provide all at the time. Sasha, Mustafa, and Mirio (Front Desk Manager) were especially supportive and helpful.

title: Piu' centrale non si puo'!
text:
Situato in posizione strategica, centralissimo, comodo per muoversi a piedi in pieno centro.
Camere enormi e ben riscaldate, bagni confortevoli, e sopratutto staff eccezionale.
Disponibili al massimo, sorridenti, ci hanno aiutato in tutto, anche nel risolvere uno spiacevole inconveniente avvenuto nella nostra camera.
Una bella esperienza!

title: Not What Was Advertised !
text:
First I want to say that the individuals at the front desk were very good... They remained ready to assist any guest with directions, recommendations, luggage, etc. No issues with the employees that were at the front desk. 

Second, we chose the Gotham Hotel because of the hotel website offerings of amenities and location. Plus this location had good trip advisor reviews. Our experience at the Gotham did not meet our expectations as promised on the website.

The location is great for exploring NYC and the front desk employees were very friendly and helpful. But the Gotham Hotel falls short on everything else. After the fact once we reviewed things more closely the reviews on Trip Advisor were inconsistent. 

On arrival as we checked in another guest was complaining of no hot water. We then entered our junior site and had the following experiences; a broken toilet seat, a balcony door that would not lock, a coffee pot with used coffee pods in both the coffee maker and plastic container for used pods, two safes that were not secure to any permanent item, a used blue bra and hair brush in the closet next to the safe, no snacks as indicated on the price list, only one paper cup and one new coffee pod, and different toiletries than indicated on the website.

During our stay there was not replacement of new coffee pods or paper cups, room was never vacuumed as the same white lint was on the floor for five days, one day there were no clean towels left and one garbage can were not emptied. One day we were without hot water and when I call the front desk they did not believe and had to send a worker up to test for hot water himself. There was one robe in the room and I had to ask for everything piece mill. 

Our travel companions staying in regular rooms had not robes although on the website it said all room had robes. One companions room had coffee pods but no coffee machine, the other room had a non working coffee machine.

There appears to be no oversight for the GRAs (cleaning personnel). we notified the front desk 3 times rgarding the unsecured patio door, it was never fixed. I am sure management was afried that someone would lock themselves out on the patio. But, anyone could access my patio and room from another window. I suspect if someone were to be molested in our junior suite because of the unlocked patio door management may think twice abosut this.

In closing the Gothma Hotel website promised a lot but the Gotham Hotel did not deliver.

title: Excellent Service, Comfy Rooms, & a Great Location
text: This was my first time in the Gotham Hotel, and I will definitely return. The room was huge by NYC standards, and very clean, with great bed linens. The staff was friendly and ready to help with any questions, small or big, and you can't beat this location no matter what you're doing in the city. It's an easy walk to Rockefeller Center, Grand Central, Broadway, The Empire State Building, etc.

title: Great hotel and service
text:
Would definitely recommend this hotel. The room and location were great. 

The service was also brilliant from start to finish as well. Special thanks to Mustafa and Dwayne for making sure we got to the airport on time after our transfer got cancelled.

title: ESTADIA
text:
Hotel excelentemente localizado. Muito Limpo quartos espaçosos e banheiro maravilhoso.

Atendimento da recepção maravilhosa em especial ao Mr. Mustafa que muito nos ajudou pois não dominamos o idioma ingles.

title: Great location, overall pretty disgusting
text:
Upon entering, the staff was welcoming and professional, however the lobby was disappointing and cheap looking. 
    The room was a decent size, however the carpet was stained as well as the curtains. The toilet kept running and had to get fixed because it wouldn't flush. The beds were decently comfortable. 
     Waking up in the morning- there were so supplies for the coffee maker, and only one cup, no coffee? The shower wouldn't heat up. When we called down to the desk, they told us to let it run for 20 minutes? They finally sent some one up who said they were going to go check the boiler. Finally, we got hot water after an hour wait, with no real apologizes from the management. 
     What really topped everything off was when we returned to the hotel to grab our luggage and to use the restroom before heading out of the city. They told us to take the elevator to the basement, getting off the elevator there were about 20 trash bags all along the hallway when you get off the elevator. Then you head down to the hallway where there are a few very disgusting restrooms. Absolutely unacceptable. 
     If you are looking for a super basic, and your expectations are low- the location is close to all the tourist attractions in NYC. However, if you have any sort of expectations of a romantic, clean, relaxing place to stay... spend the extra money and stay somewhere else with more class.

title: Incredible Experience!
text: We were in NYC at the end of October 2016 to get married in Central Park. The staff at The Gotham were so friendly, helpful and really made the trip that much better. Great location, right in the heart of midtown. We would absolutely stay there again.

title: A Canadian experiencing an American Thanksgiving in NYC.
text: This boutique hotel is very chic and well decorated. My room was located on the 22nd floor with a private balcony. Not to mention that the bar/restaurant was none other than Wolfgang's Steakhouse with great food and well experienced bar and wait staff. I had the pleasure of meeting the general manager of this hotel who was very helpful and accommodating along with her team of wonderful and professional employees throughout the hotel. Unfortunately I don't remember all their names but thank you to all for making my stay so wonderful. the location of the hotel is fabulous, given the easy walks to Central Park, Broadway theaters, Times Square and Rockefeller Centre, minutes away from the Macy's Day Parade, Grand Central Station and so much more. I do plan on visiting NYC in the near future and definitely will be returning to stay in this hotel. Thank you again for such a wonderful stay.

title: Thanksgiving Getaway
text: The best hotel in NYC! Special thanks to the general manager who went above and beyond to make my stay exceptional. The room was great, #22 with a balcony, comfy king bed, modern bathroom, very clean. The staff were professional, courteous, and very helpful with directions! Thank you all :-). The location was awesome!!! Right around the corner from Rockefeller Center, St.Patrick"s cathedral, Saks. The light show in the evening at Saks is amazing! Macy's day parade was fantastic, everything you want to see and do is right here! The window displays for Christmas are beautiful all around the city that never sleeps. Wolfgangs steakhouse is in the hotel, OMG so good! NYC is known for it's bagels and pizza, all right there, you didn't have to cross the city to have the best meals. Bryant Park is amazing that offers over a hundred vendors and artists open till 10pm. There are three ice-rinks, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park and Central Park. So much to see and do in one location, coming back to this hotel very soon! Thank you all again for a fabulous stay! :-) Cheers

title: Had great expectations, unfortunately not met...
text:
We stayed at The Gotham Hotel over Thanksgiving weekend, arriving Thanksgiving Day. We faithfully stay at another great nearby hotel on each stay to NYC, but were too late to book this time and it was sold out.  We were excited to give another property a try. Unfortunately, it didn't quite meet the expectations based on the hotel's reviews and website. If 2.5 was a rating, I'd give it only because of the few staff members that were a great help, but feel honesty is the best policy for anyone on the fence about staying here...

Upon arrival, we were immediately greeted by door staff with a quick check in. We were on the 11th floor in a King Room. Upon walking off the elevator, there was a mattress right in front of the elevator/our room door in the small hallway. Upon entry, I immediately noticed how dirty the room was. Since we had just spent the day traveling with plans that evening, I didn't get around to much more of an inspection. The beds were OK, but the sheets themselves were a bit itchy, which didn't help my opinion of an unclean room. 

My opinion became fact when I woke up the next morning, when all the lights went on and we were getting ready for the day, the room was much dirtier, and unkept than I had realized. The desk countertops were filthy, carpet a disaster, bathroom totally gross--not only unclean but literally falling apart. I had planned to make a note on the way out for the day, but upon getting out of the shower, I stepped on a sharp metal object when coming out of the shower. I immediately went downstairs to request a room change, which they were very apologetic about. I must note that the mattress was STILL in the hallway...

We moved rooms, and while the next room on the 16th floor was cleaner than the first, it wasn't all the way clean or kept up. The rest of the stay was uneventful. There were familiar faces up front who were quite friendly, and a few who were kind of complacent, but for the most part the staff was helpful. 

Overall, I think that there's potential with the hotel if the rooms were kept up and kept clean. I will say I loved the shared balcony on the 19th floor and the location. I don't know if we'll be staying again, but wouldn't completely write it off for future travelers.

title: The Gotham - my go to Hotel!
text: I frequently visit New York on business and find the prices (particularly in the peak summer months) are insane and what you often get is tiny, dirty, noisy rooms and terrible service.... well, The Gotham is the very opposite of all of these things. Rooms are excellent in size, always clean and very well insulated from noise passing between rooms. The staff are what really makes the place extra special for me, those on the front desk, the doormen AND the housekeeping staff all feel like extended family to me whenever I'm in town. My only hope is that not too many people read this and my secret ideal Hotel in Manhattan stays that way!

title: Home Away from Home
text:
My wife and I went to this hotel lured by the fact that it has balconies in the rooms. From the moment we step into the lobby we were greeted by Alexandra (Sasha), the reception manager and Mustafa. They were so cordial and warm we felt we had known them for years. This excellent treatment continued during our stay and extended until check-out.
The room we stayed in was great, neat, large and very practical. Excellent view. Mustafa took us to the 19th floor were you can enjoy a common area balcony overseeing 46 street where you can meet with friends, entertain outside your room and have a great time.
The hotel location could not be better. Walking distance from Times Square to Grand Central Station. Close to all you want to see in NYC, attractions, first class restaurants and bars. Wolfgang, at the hotel is superb. As we said Sasha, Mustafa and Shawn at the lobby made our vacation. A repeat now becomes a must! 
J.& A. Roca

title: Ottima posizione e personale disponibile
text:
Ho trascorso una settimana al Gotham Hotel e mi sono sentita come a casa anche grazie all'aiuto di tutto lo staff della hall: sempre pronti a darmi suggerimenti e indicazioni per posti da visitare a NYC.
La camera era spaziosa e il letto super-comodo! Ci tornerei sicuramente.

title: Great staff with personal attention to your specific needs
text: This hotel is in a wonderful location and it is also small and personal. The rooms are huge with very nice bathrooms and the entire room is very well appointed. What I enjoyed most about this hotel was the wonderful customer focus. All the staff are very attentive to your needs and very quick to fix any issue that may arise. I would like to make a special mention to Eldis the bellman who was just delightful and very personable and gave me little toy cars for my nephew and godson which they love! I would also like to mention Aldina at Guest Services who was also very kind and considerate and very thoughtful to offer me complimentary bottles of water after a long day sightseeing. As someone who was travelling on my own, it was very comforting to be able to come to my hotel at the end of the day and be able to have such a lovely chat with persons who were eager to listen and were sympathetic to you, your issues and concerns. Thank you Eldis and Aldina for your kindness and the enjoyable conversation.

title: Great Hustle!
text: What a great staff!  Nice clean hotel- with a very helpful staff greeting you at all times!  On Halloween, in true Gotham style- batman himself worked the door and did fantastic!  Thank you for making our crew feel so welcome, and Go Indians!

title: Will be back next year!
text: Awesome little find! I can't explain how happy I am to find a hotel in the city WITH NO TRAFFIC NOISE!! The rooms are large for NY standards. Bed is super comfy. Bathroom totally updated (great towels too). Best part - the staff!! They are top notch. Specifically Mustafa!!! Couldn't ask for a nicer, polite & helpful person.

title: Great location & staff
text: The staff here is top notch and responded quickly to any request.  We had a high floor room and because the hotel is located between Fifth and Madison we heard absolutely no street noise which can be a problem in NY.  Elevators were fast and because this is a smaller hotel, not so crowded.  The location was great for seeing the glitter of Fifth Avenue and Rockefeller Center and getting to the Theater District and Times Square, only a few blocks away.  I highly recommend.

title: A jewel of the town
text: Is a very small hotel located in the east of mahathan, super clean, super frendly and conveniently located near to everything. The front desk was super friendly in special a joung guy called Mustafa. Defenelly will return to this place

title: MUSTAFA IS AMAZING!
text: My boyfriend and I were were only in NYC for one night and wanted to make the most of it. Mustafa sigle-handedly guarunteed we had a great night, with his reccomendations and inside info on the city! The room was also very nice and the shower was huge! Only downside was the room balcony view, but we didn't care all that much because we spent little time at the hotel.

title: A lovely stay
text: The Gotham was a lovely place for us to anchor our anniversary weekend. The location was just right, giving us a good launch pad for lots of walking, which was what we wanted to do. We put in a lot of miles as we explored Central Park, museums, Times Square and shopping avenues. The room was small but clean. The front desk folks were friendly and considerate- they gave us a room in the back to protect us from construction noise in the front. We enjoyed delicious drinks and a meal at Wolfgang's Steakhouse, connected to the hotel's lobby. Vitae, a terrific restaurant next door, was a perfect place for a celebratory dinner! The only disappointment we faced at the Gotham was Housekeeping. They serviced our room by pulling up the bedspread and putting away the hair dryer (and my hair straightener- which I luckily found before leaving), but they didn't remove a dirty glass, replace toiletries, or wipe down bathroom surfaces. In fact, if the tip I left hadn't been picked up, I would have doubted they had serviced the room at all.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay and we're glad we chose The Gotham Hotel.

title: Awesome Location
text: After a 7 day vacay to Italy, we had to complete our trip in New York City. Here for 3 days and found The Gotham Hotel through booking.com. The location could not be better, 2-3 New York Blocks from Time Square, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center and Central Park. We stayed in a Skyline Room with the most comfortable king size bed fitted with an amazing duvet and soft sheets. The shower is huge and open with very hot water. The staff were awesome, very helpful and accommodating. I recommend this hotel if you are an on the go individual.

title: Great Hotel & WONDERFUL staff
text: I don't write reviews but this hotel deserves one! My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel a couple of weekends back and it was amazing. Hotel location is great with amazing views, our room was great and clean with a private balcony & free wifi! The bed was nice and comfy. The bathroom was great with the walk in shower. The staff was so friendly and helpful, especially Andrew! Thank you for such a wonderful weekend!

title: Excelente atendimento com boa localização
text: Hotel bem localizado na 46 , recepção bem pequena porem com pessoas muito simpáticas e solicitas . Quarto muito bom para os padrões de NY , com bom tamanho , banheiro novo e bom conforto . Cama otima , toalhas e roupas de cama de otima qualidade . Peca um pouco na iluminação que poderia  ser melhor. Pelo preço pago esperava mais , mas considerando localização, conforto e atendimento valeu a pena .

title: Terrible night's sleep!
text:
I had the unfortunate luck of being stuck with a room facing the street. Had I known how unpleasant this would be I would NOT have stayed here. There was a jackhammer going until 11pm, and then construction on the building across the street started at 7am. I got virtually no sleep. Also, The room is extremely dark. Only one light near the bed worked. I wanted to open the shades to let more light in but then I'd have to deal with the construction workers staring into my room!
Then, I was met with another unpleasant surprise that the road that the hotel is on was being blocked off for the entire weekend. This made it difficult to catch a cab. I really did not enjoy staying in a construction zone all weekend, and CERTAINLY didn't enjoy my stay here. There was no effort made by the hotel to make the guests aware of the potential problems that all of the construction would cause.
Will not be staying here again.

title: El punto excelente
text:
Excelente ubicación, en la Quinta Avenida y junto a La Estación Central. A un paso de Times Square.
La habitación es muy espaciosa y cómoda.
Tenía contratado alojamiento y desayuno, pero éste último servicio ya no está disponible, y me dieron unos tickets para desayunar en la cafetería del lado, BUEEENISÏMO todo.
Recomendable.

title: Perfect Location and Friendly staff
text: Recent Holiday to New York, booked this hotel for the location.  Was not disappointed! Staff from the moment I arrived were extremely friendly and accommodating.  The room was spacious with a nice balcony (although a bit cold to relax on).  There is lots of tourist attractions within a few blocks of the hotel, which is really helpful.  My only issue was the high speed internet could be problematic at time (although there is a number of cafes in the area offering free wifi).  Will consider returning on next visit to New York.

title: Amazing experience
text:
Being from a small town in Georgia I was very reluctant to travel to New York City however the employees helped me out! Not only was the hotel beautiful and clean but Adina at the front desk was very friendly and made me feel important. Rob and Mastafa were two of the bellmen
Who gave me directions and made me feel as if I fit in. I will definitely return to the Gotham and everything about the experience was great!!!

title: Great Hotel!!!!
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week long vacation to do all the "touristy" things and the Hotel was GREAT!!!  Our rooms were spacious and clean, private balcony, very roomy shower, it was a great home away from home for a week.  We were located pretty close to all the attractions and walked almost everywhere, Empire State Building, the Rockefeller, Central Park, museums....we did have to take the subway for the Statue of Liberty and other down town activities but Grand Central is like two blocks away.  All the employees were amazing, friendly, and nice from the front desk to house keeping.  The door guys were great, super friendly and very helpful with our questions they suggested restaurants, bars, and other fun spots to see.  

We will definitely be back to 
The Gotham

title: Customer Service at its best!!!!!
text:
My name is Armando Gonzalez and I am currently staying at the Gotham hotel on 46th Street and Madison Avenue. I'm on a business trip and after a long day at work, I always seem to find amazing people working at the front desk catering to my needs. This luxury and modern hotel is an elegant way to spend time here in New York. I would highly recommend this place towards my family, friends, and guest who are traveling to New York on a business trip or leisure. 
The customer service here is excellent. The first person I encountered was Sasha, she has a charismatic character that uplifts the whole atmosphere of the hotel with an amazing customer service skills. She is very joyous and is great at her job by asking how my day was and for being very perceptive to how my day is going. 
Andrew and Maeed are just the guys who I have seen working at night giving me great recommendations on where to eat and visit in New York. They have given me wonderful customer service and have directed me to the best places I have ever been to in this city and I give my thanks to them. 
Aldina and Eldis have great personalities and have given me the safest route when traveling and always greet me with a warm smile and hello every time I come in. They deliver a personalized service when speaking with me and care for my safety in this city. 
Sasha, Andrew, Eldis, Maeed, and Aldina are a great asset to the team because of the way they care for their customers. Because of their professionalism and amazing service of this hotel. I would highly recommend any guest to come and visit here. When I'm here I feel at home because of the way these 5 individuals make me feel. 
Thank you Gotham Hotel and amazing associates for making me feel welcomed in a city that I'm unfamiliar with. Thank you very much.

title: Great location. Amazing view!!!!!
text: I had the Skyline room, it had an amazing view of the city and i had a solid sized terrace! The service was great and i couldn't be happier. Special thanks to Andrew for helping me out on places to eat around times square!

title: 2nd visit
text:
Second visit in as many years. Not as good as last time. Booked Superior Room like last time but as per Hotels.com photos, got a Deluxe room which had a little balcony and not a terrace, facing back of buildings (aka no view) . Called reception to discuss and they said it was basically pot luck if you get a front or rear view room and the photo of the terrace on Hotels.com is the communal area one, not for a room so very misleading! Will be complaining to them. Was asked to be made aware if any front rooms became available, they said they would in two days, never did. No plug sockets near the bed, shelf in bed side cabinet fell off when I put something on it, safe was locked by previous occupant (had to chase reception twice to send someone to sort it), wifi is slow and erratic and bed frame has very sharp corners (learnt the hard way, twice!) also their hotels.com listing says they provide shuttle to/from JFK but got told before we arrived by email this service has stopped. TV satellite signal also plays up frequently. Water pressure is poor especially in the sink. 

Great base for exploring Manhattan. Loads of decent eateries nearby. Only a few blocks from Times Square. King bed was massive and super comfy though not crazy on the pillows (too soft). Air con works effectively but is pretty noisy. The housekeeping staff do an amazing job every day to make the rooms up lovely and super clean. You get some toiletries and the hairdryer was powerful (don't bother bringing one from the UK, unlikely to work regardless). We didn't pay a city tax on departure this time but I'm positive we had to two years ago. A taxi from JFK mid afternoon was about $65 yet $80 there back in peak hour. 

Enjoyed my stay in the end and would've liked it more if I hadn't have stayed before to compare but I felt I got the wrong room, a cheaper one than what I booked and this stay was not cheap.

title: Fantastic staff, fantastic location, fantastic rooms
text: I recently booked The Gotham Hotel for a business trip to NYC for a group of people and the staff were amazing to deal with, very accommodating from the start to the end. The food in Wolfgang's was fantastic, as was the service - although a little dark for breakfast in the mornings! The rooms were nice and spacious, very clean. The location could simply not be any better for New York Cit. I will come back time and time again. Mustafa is an absolute gem, great attention to detail and willingness to help with any queries, large or small. Thank you to all the staff for a lovely stay.

title: Great location, good sized rooms boutique hotel
text: If you are looking for a smaller hotels (where you are not just one of 1000 guests) and good sized room ideally located in NYC id town then this is is. . .fairly priced as well. There were some challenges on laundry service where quality was poor and time frame not kept, but the hotel took charge and solved the problem to my full satisfaction. . .a sign of good customer service and that the guest is not just a number in a big group.

title: Great location, AMAZING  staff. very clean room
text:
The location of this hotel was just perfect for my sister and I who were visiting NYC for 10 days, right in the theatre district the heart of midtown and lots of places to eat around (including wolfgang steakhouse which is attached to the hotel- we dined there one evening it was pricey but well worth it-  the portions were huge and the food was delicious!) It was right near central station which made getting around the city a breeze and great bus routes on 5th street. Its really was the ideal location for tourist like us. 
The staff were unbelievably welcoming, kind and friendly. Nothing seemed too much for them, always a warm welcome as we came in and out of the hotel. Shoutout to Mustafa and Sasha who really stood out on our trip, all the hotel staff were amazing but these 2 were there from day one and always made us smile with their kindness. The room was beautiful, the bathroom was stunning and the shower was exactly what I was dreaming of after a long hall flight. The cleaners were impeccable also, always making the room good as new daily as we were out enjoying the city and refreshing our towels, cups, tissues - The whole experience was truly a treat.
The only down fall which does not reflect any of my views of the staff or hotel as it is out of there hands was the construction sight across the road /sigh obviously this is a problem out of anyone's control but if anything next time id request a room on the opposite side of the hotel just to avoid noisy construction sites but at the end of the day its a big city and it is noisy anywhere you go! 10/10 would recommend this hotel if you're in the city for exploring/adventure/musicals. Great experience over all would definitely recommend

title: It could have been so much nicer
text: Location wise the hotel is great, staff lovely and friendly. The room lovely and spacious but it was unnecessarily dirty. The room and bedlinen smelt of cigarette smoke when we arrived. We complained and the room was cleaned bed linen replaced but that's not the point shouldn't have been like that for the price you pay. Sideboards and bathroom needed a good clean it's just such a shame because this place has the potential but just does not deliver.

title: Great staff but a disappointing experience
text:
We were greatly looking forward to our stay at this hotel however it did not meet expectations. I had booked a skyline suite specifically to take advanatge of a larger room and to have access to a terrace which ended up being a complete waste of money.

Whilst the room was large by New York standards, and modern with nice finishes, there were 3 main areas of complaint:

1. Wifi connection was terrible and only accessible in certain areas of the room (even in these areas the connection was still not strong enough to make skype calls without constant loss of connectivity which was frustrating when trying to make business calls).

2. There was only one cable channel available and when assistane was sought the hotel staff said that there was nothing that could be done to improve the reception.

3. Due to the construction site opposite, the terrace was virtually unsuable as it was too loud to sit out there or even have the door to the terrace open. I was aware of the construction site at the time of booking and from other reviews but was not aware that it was a 24 hour site and so I was under the impression that the terrace could be used in the evenings without the constant drone of jackhammers. On a positive note, when the doors and windows were closed the construction was barely audible and so there was no interruption to sleep. 

I understand that this is only a boutique hotel however the rates for the suites are comparable to normal rooms at established hotels such as the Hilton. To be honest, seeing as though the terrace didnt end up being usable, I might as well have stayed at an ordinary room in the Hilton and had the advantage of major hotel infrastructure such as good wifi, cable, breakfast included etc. 

The one positive was that the staff were excellent, friendly and did try to make our stay enjoyable as possible. I cannot fault the hotel management itself, just that the hotel itself could do with some improvements or a reduction in the rates which just simply did not translate to value.

title: Great location, warm service
text: The Gotham Hotel was an excellent discovery in my last trip to NYC. Found about the hotel in a website dedicated to boutique hotels, which is something not that easy to find in this town. The location was really fantastic on 46th Street between Fifth and Madison. The staff was very polite and always available, especially Eldis, Mustafa and Shaun. The only setback was a malfunctioning A/C that forced us to change rooms. After that all went perfect. Definitely recommend the hotel.

title: Large, clean room!!! Very Good location!!!
text:
It's a very good hotel at a great location!!!! 5 minutes from Time square!!! we stayed for 5 nights at the beginning of October!! The room was large and clean and the staff was friendly and ready to help you at any time!!!!
When i will visit New York again i would stay there for sure!!!!!

title: Large room and friendly staff
text: We stayed for 5 nights at the beginning of October: the warm welcome and a large room were the best things in this hotel. The location is super central in Manhattan and the subway line is just 5 minutes away. The guys at the reception are friendly and gave us many advices for places were to eat in the city. We found a great deal and would come back again!

title: Unhygeinic.
text: This hotel really needs big time improvement. The rooms are big but unhygeinic.. I do not feel fresh when im in the room. The elevators always smelled bad.. disgusting. I stayed few days in this hotel but i was fed up so I moved to another hotel. The only good thing for me was the hotel's location. Also, room service was not bad but very unproffesional! I do not understand why this hotel is even a 4 star!

title: Location location location
text:
Just returned from 5 nights at the Gotham.   

Plus points:
location, friendliness and helpfulness of staff, cleanliness, room size, balcony, value for money. Room comfort, especially the bed, balcony.
Negative points:
No bath robes, view of construction work.

My review is very straight to the point.   would I book this hotel again? Yes.

Special mention to Mustafa, very helpful and friendly.

title: Not as good ad expected...
text:
The Gotham Hotel NYC is a hotel situated in mid town Manhattan just off of 46th Street between Broadway and 5th making it very easy to get around town! Local to the area are a few coffee shops and eateries so there isn’t much need to opt for the paid breakfast although the Wolfgang restaurant within the hotel is very high end and attractive.

Unfortunately on arrival we were disappointed by the service – ( we were given no guidance as to the area or offered any helpful tips – it felt like the reservations guy was keen to get rid of us ) and the room (although relatively spacious for NYC) was also disappointing.  Although well equipped with a flat screen tv, sofa and fridge and balcony the frustrating thing was that the balcony to room 1212 overlooked construction works – very noisy construction works I might add. This meant that our view was awful and we feared opening the window due to the dust from the construction works. Had these works been mentioned when we booked we would have opted to stay elsewhere. 

Furthermore, the bathroom, although designed to be space saving wasn’t overly practical for 2 guests.  The shower has no screen or divide from the toilet or sink meaning the water flies everywhere and steams up easily leaving you floating in puddles of water whenever you opt to use the bathroom. 

So overall, although this hotel has potential and was clean and tidy l it didn’t fully meet expectations based on the cost and as such I would be hesitant to recommend it to family/friends other than for the location alone.

title: Ci tornerei
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per quattro notti;siamo stati accolti da Sasha, Mirio e i loro collaboratori, in modo gentile e professionale nello stesso tempo.
Sentendoli parlare in  italiano ci siamo sentiti subito a casa.
Hotel nuovo, camere spaziose e tutto pulito.
Abbiamo avuto un problema durante il soggiorno con la carta di credito non dovuto all' hotel; Sasha con la sua premura ci ha aiutato a capirlo e risolverlo tranquillizzandoci.
Visto la nostra agitazione si è premurata di offrirci una bottiglia di prosecco italiano(wow!!!!!) direttamente in camera.
Peccato aver conosciuto Mirio solo il giorno della partenza.
Il nostro giudizio complessivo è ottimo.
Un saluto a Mirio, Moustafa e tutti gli altri collaboratori ed in particolare modo a Sasha

title: Great hotel which is well located
text: The hotel is great. It is well situated between 5th avenue and Maddison avenue. The shops are 30 seconds away and the Empire State Building and Times Square is a 5/10 minute walk away. The breakfast in the hotel is good. The only down side is the housekeeping was ok beds made everyday but the floor wasn't hovered often. I would definitely stay again. The reception staff and door staff were excellent and always smiling

title: Wonderful Experience
text: This hotel could not be better! It is a perfect location with a family friendly space . The staff there, Mustafa and Sasha, made my family feel right at home. My hope is to make this an annual visit and to stay there again. Highly recommended.

title: Vacaciones en Manhattan
text: Hemos estado una semana y desde mi punto de vista en el global hemos estado a gusto. Si que es verdad que si tienes la habitación que da a la calle tienes un edificio en frente que están rehabilitando pero a nosotros nos dieron una habitación interior que el único pero que tiene es que los ventiladores del bajo se oyen pero llegábamos tan cansados que en 1 minuto estábamos durmiendo. El aseo, la tv perfectos y el personal de recepción muy muy atentos en todo momento.

title: Lawaai
text: kamer was ok, maar aan de voorkant van het hotel wordt een nieuw gebouw uit de grond gestampt en dat gaat (ook in het weekend) met veel herrie gepaard. Wij zaten aan de achterkant maar daar kun je ook niet van je balkon genieten door de herrie (en de stank) van de airco's en de restaurants beneden.

title: 素敵なホテルでした
text:
9/29から7泊しました。
バルコニー付きの20階の部屋にアサインされました。景色はビルの谷間なので、あんまりでしたが、広々とした感じがありました。
フロントはみんなフレンドリーで、いろいろ相談に乗ってくれました。

良くなかった点は、シャワーなどの水圧が低い、隣の部屋の音が聞こえるくらいでしょうか？

5th avとマジソンavの間の46stで、ロケーションは最高でした。

あと、入口や各階のバルコニーには灰皿があります。スモーカーにもお勧めです。

title: Perfekt område, hyggelig personale og nydelige rom
text:
Vi hadde et veldig hyggelig opphold på The Gotham. Vi bodde i 10. Etasje og rommet vårt var stort og veldig fint. Sengen var fantastisk å sove i, og overraskende nok var det helt stille på rommet selv om det ligger midt i NYC. Det eneste vi hadde å sette fingeren på var at airconditon bråkte veldig. Vi hadde lest i tidligere reviews at den bråkte litt, men vi kunne ikke ha den på når vi skulle sove fordi det bråkte så mye. Hotellets personale var imøtekommende og hyggelige, rommene var rene og vi var veldig fornøyd.
Hotellet ligger sentralt til, og det er kort vei til undergrunnsbanen.

title: Excellent stay Great Room & Friendly Staff
text: My wife and I spent 5 nights at this boutique hotel near Broadway and half a block from fifth avenue and it was awesome The room was very spacious and very quiet and the staff was super friendly and helpful The rate was very reasonable and we would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends and family

title: Friendly but so noisy
text:
This is a small hotel discreetly tucked away off 5th Avenue.

The staff are very friendly and professional and a credit to the hotel. 

The room itself was small and awkward - the slanting front of the hotel may look very funky but it means there are blinds that are specially fitted to match the angle of the windows, accordingly, if you want any privacy, particularly in the bathroom, you end up having them closed all the time. There is only a table, socket and light on one side of the bed which is ridiculous. There are no drawers. The safe is located on the floor behind a highly sprung self-closing door to a cupboard - very tricky to access and certainly impossible to those with disabilities or dodgy knees.

I thought Americans were renowned for their powerful showers - well not at this hotel......the pressure was pathetic. Also, the hot water always took at least 2 minutes to come through and, as you could only turn the water on when you were actually in the shower, it was a very long and tedious 2 minutes.

Finally, you expect a fair amount of noise in NYC, however, this is opposite a major construction site and they start knocking girders together, angle grinding, drilling, banging etc from about 5.30 am. HIDEOUS.

I would not return.

title: Modern elegance meets world class service!
text:
I recently had the pleasure of being a guest here this past weekend and the experience was quite simply - exquisite! 

The layout of the hotel itself can only be defined as  beautifully modern with a strong emphasis on sophistication, which is on true display beginning as you enter the hotel. 

I stayed in the "Superior King" room which was ultimately named appropriately as the room offers such amazing amenities you'd think it was designed for royalty from awe inspiring views from the terrace and private balcony to the amazingly designed bathroom! 

It's paramount that I mention that the most majestic element of the Gotham Hotel isn't its beautiful decor or it's breathtaking views, but rather the staff themselves! 

Let me begin by showing my sincerest appreciation by thanking Mustafa, Andrew and especially Ms. Dimitrijevic as well as the rest of their colleagues! 

A staff like the one I had the privilege of meeting this past weekend is clearly second to none and displayed poise, grace and the utmost class while exceeding all my expectations! 

The Gotham Hotel and its staff is simply the standard by which excellence is measured when visiting New York! 

 If you're looking for an experience like none you've ever had, look no further as your pursuit is over!  You've arrived.

title: FANTASTICO
text: Sono stato con mia moglie per la terza volta a NY e ho scelto per caso questa struttura e dico francamente che è all'altezza dei migliori hotel della grande mela, perché la disponibilità delle persone alla reception, una su tutte ALDINA e a seguire Sasha e Mohammed è veramente eccezionale. le ragazze parlano perfettamente italiano ma sono veramente dolci e squisitamente cortesi nell'approccio, nella cordialità e nell'educazione. In occasione del compleanno di mia moglie mi hanno fatto trovare una bottiglia di spumante, molto buono, al giorno: figuriamoci se in Italia fanno questo!!! Mohammed parla inglese, ma anche lui è molto cortese, disponibile e molto educato. Ho soggiornato alla stanza 212 molto grande, e con un balcone a nostra disposizione dove si vede addirittura il mare dall'altra parte di Manhattan: spettacolare sia di giorno che di sera. ho sempre fatto la prima colazione in albergo e devo dire che anche i ragazzi che ti servono sono molto cortesi, forse un po' di più la ragazza, perché il ragazzo è un po' timido. L'albergo è all'angolo tra la 46TH e Fifthy evenue, per cui non si può volere un punto di riferimento più centrale di così. Assolutamente andateci, perché ne vale la pena in ogni suo asspetto

title: A week in New York
text:
This is an excellent hotel. It is located very close to Times Square,Grand Central station, Broadway, Fifth Avenue and many more iconic Manhattan landmarks.
The staff are very friendly and helpful. Special mention to Mustapha,Andrew and Eldis.
The room was spacious with an enormous double bed. Free WiFi, large television with a well stocked bar. There is a fantastic shower.There was a balcony available to us.
Bar staff were also very helpful with a nice selection of alcohol available for all tastes.
This is a gem of a hotel, and we would thoroughly recommend this to you all.
We look forward to visiting it on our next visit to New York.

title: Awesome location, helpful staff
text: We read many positive reviews and the Gotham did not disappoint. The boutique feel was evident throughout, from the friendly doorman at all hours to the bellman (Eldis worked both roles during our stay) to the efficient desk staff. We were on the 8th floor, and only 4 guest rooms on that floor, very intimate. the room was large by any city standards, and the bed was comfortable. Amenities included Molton Brown bath products, large shower, hair dryer, in room safe, iron, mini bar and room in the fridge for my own water, dean and deluca snacks (though some were past expiration and should have been swapped out as an FYI). We found the NYC ground noise as to be expected and did not partake in the open space available on the upper floors, but the room was very comfortable and we would stay here again. Free wifi on the property. One item we saw online when booking was valet for the car, which the contract was no longer active upon our arrival, but we were provided with a garage voucher for a garage 2 blocks away for the same price. No in and out for the car means more $$ in cab fare but not too detrimental.

title: Fantastic balcony !
text: Stayed at the Gotham in Sept 2016, the greeting was friendly and the staff attentive. The room was a great size, massive bed, great decor. We stayed on the 20th floor the view from the balcony was great, a great place to have a few drinks with our friends.

title: Férias
text: Excelente localização, muito perto a Times Square.  Otima limpeza e funcionários educados e solícitos.  O quarto muito confortável e amplo. Não tomei café da manhã no hotel e ao voltarmos ao Brasil vimos que tivemos que pagar $9 sobre algo do hotel que nem desconfio o que seja, pois não utilizamos nada deles. Mas em geral isso não foi problema para mim e voltaria a me hospedar lá.

title: Nada recomendable!
text: Buenas instalaciones y ubicación del Hotel. No lo recomiendo por el mal servicio que ofrecen. Contrate con desayuno y nos enteramos que no estaba más ese servicio la primer mañana que bajamos, nadie fue capaz de decirnos y menos de recompensarnos. La habitación era con terraza y la que nos asignaron era imposible de usar. Daba a una chimenea y después eran 4 paredes. Una vergüenza que ofrezcan una habitación con terraza cuando la misma es imposible de usar! Hubiera estado perfecta si la ofrecían sin ella. Además tuvimos que reclamar x toallas casi todos los días, las habitaciones tienen poca iluminación y encima tuvimos una lámpara quemada que nadie arreglo durante los 10 días que estuvimos. También estaba rota una parte del TV que tampoco nadie  arreglo. Prácticamente todos los días tuve que comunicarme por algún detalle. Nada digno para un hotel de 4 estrellas!!

title: Fabulous stay
text:
Stayed in this hotel for eight nights-really couldn't fault anything about it; location was perfect for us just far enough away from Times Square not to hear it but could still glimpse it from the balcony. Round the corner from 5th ave and short walk up to Central Park 
Room was spacious which was important to us because of extended stay and balcony was perfect to sit out on. Bathroom was extra large and great shower. No probs with wifi. Staff incredibly helpful - very friendly and welcoming. All in all top marks and would return for sure. Tip book higher floor for brighter rooms

title: Pulito e particolare
text: Per caso ho prenotato in questo hotel attraverso una buona offerta di booking e recensioni buone. Abbiamo pagano nella media e la struttura vale in quanto camera luminosa con balcone (purtroppo guarda nell'interno). Bagno luminoso nuovo e pulito. Colazione compresa molto limitata a un piatto ed a una bevanda. Wi fi ottima. Posizione invidiabile. Poche camere per piano = poco caos. Unica pecca vera moquette in camera e la vista. Letto veramente abbondante e comodo.

title: Great service in the middle of the Manhattan
text: We checked in around 6pm, the guys at the door helped us with our luggage and the girl at the reception was very helpful with directions to nearby restaurants. The room was big, great minibar option (Dean&Deluca) and comfy bed. There is construction going on with the building in front of the hotel, but it wasn't a big deal for us (if you close the window there's no noise). Overall great place and staff! Recommended.

title: WOW!
text:
Booked ages ago the  5 night stay at this amazing hotel.....I wasn't disappointed! 
Not only was this hotel in a centralised midtown location  (which is a must for any would-be-tourist) but the room was very much desired.
We had a junior suites on the 17th floor with a large balcony.
Apart from a new building under construction just opposite, the views down to Times Square were overwhelming. 
The hotel is just a stones throw from 5th Avenue  (which is heaven for you rich shopaholics).
Despite having a disability I found everything about the hotel to be disability friendly.
If anything needed sorted all the staff were very very helpful and couldn't have been any nicer.
Thank you to all the staff....the girls on reception ( especially the receptionist that sent us wine).....the lads on the door (especially the lad that organised our car for leaving).
Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great staff can't compensate for all the problems
text:
I had a hard time deciding whether to rate our stay a ‘1’ or a ‘2’.  I decided on a ‘2’ simply as thanks to Dwayne and the staff at the door – they were all great.  I unfortunately can’t say the same about the rest of our stay, or others on staff.  It started when we were assigned the wrong room.  When I book a “King Skyline Suite” with a “Living Area with Sofa and Coffee Table” and a “45 square foot bathroom”, I don’t expect to get a room with a queen bed, no seating area and a bathroom so small that I could barely turn around.  And when I go to the front desk to request a change of room, I don’t expect to be told that I was assigned the right room, as per my booking.  Even after Sasha looked up our reservation and realized that we were given the wrong room type, I was still told that the room we’d received was ‘really the same room’ as what we’d booked, and was same price.  We were not moved the first night, but fortunately did get another room – a King Skyline Suite - for the remaining 5 nights of our stay.  

The second room was very nice but still was not as described in the booking.  The bathroom was small – definitely not a 45 square foot bathroom – and contained the only mirror in the whole unit; there was no ‘floor to ceiling mirror’.  That made it awkward for two people to get dressed and ready at the same time, particularly since the main room was so poorly lit.  As for the amenities, the ‘generous supply of towels’, the ‘400-thread count linens’… well, they were nice when we got them.  We arrived back late one afternoon to find that while our room had been cleaned, nothing had been left for us.  Not a single towel, no amenities, no coffee, no coffee cups, nothing.  (And thank you – NOT! - to the day manager who told us, upon reviewing the problems encountered during our stay, that we had in fact received everything but had called down to get more).  Another day we arrived back around mid-afternoon to find that our room simply hadn’t been cleaned and serviced at all.  Then there was the day when our room appeared to be reasonably well serviced, but the bed was missing a sheet.  Some days were better than others but there was not a single day when everything was there and the room had been fully restocked.  restocked.
 
Separate from having a cleaning staff who clearly haven’t been properly trained, or who simply don’t care, it seems that they have the same problems with the maintenance staff.  No back-up batteries in the bedside clocks (in either of the two rooms we stayed in), ceiling lights burned out, and that nasty little ceiling smoke alarm that went off with an ear piercing screech at about 5:20 a.m. on our first night at the hotel  – and could not be stopped until we had maintenance come to the room to change the battery. (Oh, and the front desk phone wasn’t working so I had to get dressed to go down to the lobby to request that maintenance come up.) By that time getting any more sleep was obviously out of the question.  (And thank you again – NOT – to the day manager who told us that the alarm batteries are routinely changed twice a year.  I don’t think so.)

I won’t get into the issues of the 24-hour construction noise coming from the building across the street; after all, that’s not The Gotham’s fault, and if they were considerate enough to warn customers in advance, they might lose business. 
 
Here’s what it comes down to.  Problems happens.  But when a customer has a problem in a particular area, a good hotel will ensure that this same problem doesn’t repeat during the customer’s stay.  Yet we had issues with room service every single day.  And when a customer is assigned the wrong room and endures all the problems that we encountered, it should be a given that compensation will be offered.  Not so at The Gotham Hotel.  Had I not insisted that our rate for the first night be reduced, we would never have received any compensation.  And while we were compensated (but not enough), it came with the all the explanations and excuses from the day manager, which frankly was rude and insulting.  Thankfully Dwayne stepped in and tried to smooth things over. 

I’ve noticed in many of the other reviews that people have fairly significant complaints about the rooms not being as described when they booked, or about noise or service/cleaning (or lack of same), etc..  However in many of the reviews, it’s the great work of the staff in addressing these concerns that bumps the review up to a 4 or even a 5. That’s great, but the staff at a hotel should not have to spend all their time apologizing to customers and working to fix problems.  That said, in the end I did give the staff credit, by rating The Gotham a ‘2’ instead of the ‘1’ that they probably deserve.

title: Great stay at the Gotham
text:
My girlfriend and I took a nice, long vacation including several nights at the Gotham.  We had actually stayed here two years ago on a previous trip and quite enjoyed it,  so we opted to stay there again.  We were not disappointed.

The location alone makes this hotel great.  They're just a few blocks from Times Square,  so it's convenient to virtually anywhere one would want to go in the city,  but far enough removed from the giant jumbo-trons so that you're not trying to sleep while illuminated by a giant, fluorescent commercial outside your window.  

Our first night,  we were on the second floor,  and to be completely honest,  the building across the street (unaffiliated with the hotel) was undergoing some major construction,  including overnight.  It was like something out of a movie.  Quite literally jackhammering at 3:00 in the morning.  That,  combined with the traffic noise made for some tough sleeping.  Also,  there were some minor issues with the room.  The thermostat didn't work,  the bathroom door didn't close,  and the one and only lamp in the room would only stay on (had to be unplugged from underneath to turn it off).

The second morning on our way out,  we mentioned this to a fabulous concierge named Mustafa.  First off,  he immediately heard all of our complaints, and assured us that they would be addressed by that afternoon.  Upon returning later that evening,  sure enough,  the issues had been addressed with the exception of the bathroom door, which was going to have to be removed so that it could be fixed properly.  However,  Mustafa had worked with the rest of the hotel staff to arrange for us to be moved to another room.  

The next room was on the 14th floor and was fabulous.  Spacious,  quiet,  comfortable,  just perfect.  We really appreciated the extra effort of Mustafa and the staff in making sure we were accommodated.  

And,  I must mention that in addition to giving us great service,  Mustafa was a fabulously great person.  He's got a great sense of humor,  and always had excellent recommendations on places to eat,  roof top bars,  and other attractions.  It was a really nice addition to an already wonderful trip to have such a warm,  affable person at the hotel.  He's the best,  so if you stay here,  he's your guy.  The rest of the staff is excellent,  but he's definitely our favorite.

title: From not great to quite nice; Staff is great
text: Booked 3 nights via Hotel Tonight. On the first night we were on 2nd fl/46th St side. Horrible construction/traffic noise; barely slept all night. Bathroom door didn't close - it was hanging off-center. The room was very dark and the one (!) lamp in there did not have a working switch so you had to crawl on the floor to unplug it to turn it off/on. The TV remote was quirky and the thermostat wasn't working. The next day we mentioned these things and were switched to Room 143 on the 14th floor = heaven! Had a nicer view, MUCH quieter - much brighter with more lamps in the room, bathroom door closed, thermostat worked, bed was excellent. Mustafa and all the staff we worked with were great. Would stay again as long as we could get a higher floor.

title: Horrible !!!!
text:
Horrible customer service . I was told it was ok to unload my bags in front of the hotel . I walked in to leave my bags at the front desk and walked out to seeing 2 tickets on the car. The hotel stated they were going to take care of it but didn't . I had to pay over $300 for the tickets . The door man was standing outside and did not bother saying a word . He saw me unloading my bags and placing them inside the doorway. 

I had ordered to have a bottle of wine, a coffee maker and baths robes waiting in the room for when I checked in . I had to call the front desk to ask why it was never brought up . They had an attitude and only delivered the bottle of wine . It was not a big deal that I never got the bath robes but if I am paying for an extra item or service in my room, I expect to have it without an attitude. They have special rooms for a higher rate for a reason . But why should anyone pay for the extra room if they are just going to place us in a normals standard room . We got up to our room and both room keys didn't work . 

I have been staying at this hotel for the last 3 years but not I refuse to stay there anymore .

title: All was ok apart from getting bitten in bed
text:
There are a lot of plus points about this hotel: great location, staff were always incredibly friendly, modern, nice bathrooms. Room facilities were good.

I feel disappointed having to write this but unfortunately I was bitten quite badly (37 bites in total!) a couple nights into our 6 night stay. The bites occurred while in bed one night. I did go to reception the following morning to discuss and although the member of staff was friendly and quickly changed our room, I felt that I was 'hushed' so other guests wouldn't overhear. This member of staff also blamed the bites on a mosquito being in our room. This was before having even inspected it?! 

Let me assure you, there was no mosquito. Our window had not been open once, there had been no occurrences of insects in our room and there definitely was no mosquito under the bed covers (yes I made us get up at 3am after the bites inspecting the sheets!) 

Sadly the bites somewhat hampered our trip. I was in so much pain and discomfort wearing shoes (bites mostly on my feet). We got back to the uk a few days ago and the bites are so itchy even a week on, I have now had to seek advice from a health professional with further planned treatment at the end of the week if the bites don't let up :( 

I did not get any kind of apology or refund for this. 

Other points to note, we found the wifi very hit and miss in both rooms we stayed in. We struggled to keep a connection most of the time, whether using iPad, laptop or our phones. 

Also, for those who are interested, we had chosen this hotel both for location and also for gym access. However the gym they use only opens week days and shuts at 5.30. Although I realise this isn't the hotel's fault, it wasn't very clear to us when booking.

title: Manhattan
text:
Durch die gute Lage konnten innert wenigen Gehminuten das Rockefeller Centre, der Times Square, der Central Park, die Grand Central Station und viele weitere Sehenswürdigkeiten erreicht werden. Auch viele Restaurants und Shops waren in nächster Umgebung. Das Personal an der Rezeption war sehr hilfsbereit und zuvorkommend und tat alles für unser Wohlbefinden.
Einzig das WiFi im Zimmer war ungenügend. Wie worden dafür mit 2 Frühstücksbon entschädigt. 
Das Hotel hat auf 4 Stockwerken ein Patio, wo die Internet-Tätigkeiten bei sommerlichen Temperaturen, einem kühlen Drink und schönem Ausblick getätigt werden konnten. Wir würden dieses Familienhotel jederzeit wieder buchen, da wir uns sehr wohl fühlten und es sehr gut gelegen ist.

title: Todo perfecto.
text:
Muy buen hotel boutique.
Ubicacion: 10
Limpieza : 10
Tamanaño hab.: 8 (los bacones internos no se pueden usar por el ruido) 
Personal: 10 (especialmente los chicos de las maletas y puerta)
Desayuno: 8 (no es americano, a la carta con pocas opciones, pero de mucho nivel)
Lo volveria a elegir.

title: The Gotham hotel experiência
text: Estive hospedado neste hotel por sete noites e a experiência foi ótima. Localização perfeita, três quadras da Times Square. Perto de tudo. Restaurantes famosos: red lobster; Fridays, Hard Rock; Planet Hollywood. Os atendentes foram gentis e sempre solícitos. Retornaria sim. Não compraria o café da manhã. Há várias opções muito perto. Star Bucks aos montes. Enfim, nota dez.

title: GREAT STAY!!!!
text: Spent the past 4 nights at The Gotham. Staff, super friendly and accomadating, went over and above the call of duty to be helpful! Rooms are clean, beds comfy, and the shower was lovely! A.C. was a bit noisy, but kept us cool during a heat wave!  Very pleased and will return! Thank you for everything!!!

title: Great hotel and awesome staff!
text: Stayed here for a quick trip to NY recently and had a great experience.  Room was great with a balcony and a view of the street.  Staff was awesome!  We needed a cab to get to the airport the day we departing and the bell guy literally ran down to the corner to flag us down one!  The front desk was also very accommodating with directions, etc.   Also, very centrally located...easy to hop on subway to 9/11 Memorial and easy to walk to Central Park or to Broadway.

title: Always stay in Gotham Hotel for my NY visits
text: Staff are always there to be helpful and very friendly, made the stay more comfortable.  The rooms were nice as well, very spacious which was nice since there was a bit of luggage to bring.  Little balcony to get some fresh air and it's central location in Midtown made it easy to travel around the city.

title: Honey Moon con bimba
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato al Gotham per una settimana, parte della Baltea luna di miele, con nostra figlia di 16 mesi.
Accoglienza calorosa.
Il check in è stato facile e rapido.
Accompagnati in stanza e dato a disposizione un lettino da campeggio per la bambina (con relativa biancheria). 
La camera, che mi aspettavo molto più stretta, era molto vivibile.
Noi abbiamo soggiornato nella stanza 111.
Letto 'big size' comodissimo, divano, TV, bagno ampio e doccia meravigliosa (per momenti di relax posto lunghe camminate per NYC).
Pulitissima. Ogni giorno, chi si occupa di rifare le stanze, ci ha lasciato dei cioccolatini in camera... un tocco dolce per allietare il rientro. 
Inoltre, godevamo di uno splendido e ampio balcone, con tavolino e sedie, affacciato sulla 46esima: uno panorama unico!
Il resto dell'hotel è ordinato, elegante, essenziale e curato. 
Se dovessi tornare a New York, soggiornerei sicuramente ancora qui!

Una nota speciale va a Sasha, receptionist: una ragazza dolcissima, piena di attenzioni, disponibile e molto preparata nello svolgere al meglio il suo lavoro. Si è innamorata di mia figlia e la lodava ad ogni nostro rientro!
Ringraziamo tantissimo anche Eldis, concierge: sempre sorridente e disponibile! Qui, invece, era mia figlia ad essersi innamorata di lui... :D
Infine, ringrazio il Manager dell'hotel (italiano) per la disponibilità e la cortesia e tutto il resto del personale. 

Indimenticabili!

title: Most recommended hotel in NYC
text:
Lets start by saying that the location is just unbelievable! More than that, the staff is the nicest I have ever encountered with! Rob the doorman is my man!! Rooms are very big and fully equipped. Queen deluxe would do. It has a small balcony you can stand and smoke. King deluxe has a bigger bed and a bigger balcony. I would recommend taking the room facing the front, as the back is a bit noisy due to AC engines.
Great choice for a very, very convenient trip! Pleasure

title: This is where we'll stay in NYC every visit!
text: Can't say enough good things about the Gotham Hotel.  Large, clean, modern and comfortable rooms.  Loved the luxurious bath!  All at a reasonable price.  But what makes it our new favorite NYC hotel is the professional, friendly and helpful staff.  Everyone we met was courteous, smiling and focused on making sure we had everything we needed.  But Mike was THE BEST!  He was fun, helpful, outgoing and we had a ball just talking to him.  He helped with directions to get safely to Brooklyn and even took selfies with us.  We'd come back to the Gotham just to see him!  Thank you to all, we can't wait to see you again!

title: Lovely hotel with really excellent staff
text:
Myself and my partner stayed for one night in the Gotham Hotel. 
The hotel itself is in a great location and is a fantastic design. The bed was comfy, the AC worked well and it was a really nice touch to have books in the room.
What really made us rate this hotel with 5 stars was the hotel staff. They were all exceptionally pleasant and helpful (we needed to leave bags before we checked in and they were very helpful with this when they didn't have to be). 
Robbie the doorman also helped us order transport to the airport at a good rate which was brilliant and he was very pleasant and polite (they all were but I can only remember his name).
This was a really lovely hotel in a great location, there is construction across the road but that's not their fault and isn't too noisy). It is also next to a Gregory's which does lovely coffee in the morning.

P.S. I accidentally left behind a milky way in the mini bar fridge in room 22. If anyone finds it they can have it with my compliments.

title: Excellent Contemporary Hotel
text: I stayed at the Gotham Hotel July 2016 and was pleasantly surprised.  I had never heard of them so I was taking a chance.  I was greeted with such warmth and kindness.  Because I arrived early, my room wasn't ready.  They gladly took my bags and gave me directions to a very nice restaurant, although they have a great one on the premises (I believe it's Wolfgang-but don't hold me to that).  Upon my return I rode their quaint elevator to a room that was extremely nice.  The bedding was great and the bathroom was excellent.  The view was not good, but with buildings all over New York, you can expect to have a view of another building.  But overall this hotel is great.  The staff was especially nice, all of them.  I highly recommend this hotel. I have booked my return stay for November 2016.

title: Great friendly staff and a awesome location!
text: The room was very nice and clean, bathroom was also very nice with a rainfall shower and room also comes with a small balcony..Its in a great location right around all the tourist spots and tons of food options including the restaurant at the hotel which was also great..Rob at the door was very friendly and helped with anything we needed and was also great at recommending things to do in the city while we were there...The entire staff was great though and I would definitely come back next time im in the city!

title: Friendly people, good location but very noisy AC
text:
I read about this hotel here and the many good reviews, and on this basis we booked 4 nights. We tried to contact the hotel by email, but never got any response. When I called and said this they said that they got so many emails that they had no time to answer them. That is really not good service. 
We booket the "penthouse" room, which is marketed as "A new height of luxury. Sprawling and sleek across the entire 25th floor, the Gotham Penthouse Suite offers nearly 740 square-feet of total space and the ultimate urban luxury experience.", and really looked forward to the stay. Our first impression was disappointing, the room was not as big as marketed, and I think they have counted in both a balcony on the opposite site (available from the elevators) and other. I would estimate the room to be around 400 - 500 square feet. The bath marketed as "mammoth en-suite bathroom" was not big as expected but very small, and you did not feel like beeing in a penthouse at all. A strange thing was that only one of the elevators could get to the upper floor, if you got the wrong one you had to go the stairs from the florr below. That is no big deal, but annoying, especially since the stairs was rather dirty and filled with chairs and garbage. One time the door was stuck, and I had to press hard to open it, to my surprice there was a man in the staircase, sleeping on some of the stairs! What are you doing he said! Well, it was probably one employee trying to find some sleep, but doing it in the stairs is not a good idea. The worst problem was the AC, two large, old units were making a lot of noise, so much that we were not able to sleep. After a night we complained, and - to their credit - the staff handled the complaint very professional. We got another room on 12th floor at lower price, and even though the AC was noise also there (it was only one unit), we accepted to try another night. But after two nights we checked out and found another hotel. It was positive that the hotel reception manager dropped the 24 hours cancellation fee. All in all this is a hotel with nicely designed rooms and a great location (but a lot of building activity is going an at the oposite side of the road). If they updated the AC system and cleaned up the stairs area it can be a very good hotel alternative, but considering the price (which is on the luxury level) I rate it below average. The first thing this hotel should do is to change the description of the penthouse room and "mammoth" bath, the description is overrated and not according to facts, and guests don't like to be disappointed in such matters.

title: A great, hidden option.
text: Charming, modern, perfectly located if you enjoy Central Park. The restaurant downstairs is very good and cozy. The staff is friendly (Rob & Adina are smiley, courteous, and friendly). All in all a great experience. The room is spacious. This hotel has everything to be my favorite in the City.

title: Excelente opção
text: Excelente opção para hospedar-se em Nova York. Estrutura moderna, confortável, impecável. Atendimento de toda equipe é ótimo. Bem localizado - dá para fazer tudo a pé! Recomendo a todos que forem à cidade. Aproveitem o café da manhã delicioso!

title: Small enough to care, big enough to cope!
text:
A great place to lay your head here in Midtown. BIG rooms and luxurious bathrooms. Great TV and great minibar prices!! Breakfast at Wolfgangs restaurant is a great way to start the day. 

Our room had s terrace. That's right you heard that - a terrace in Manhattan!! 

Staff were also welcoming, friendly and helpful. Knowledge of where to go to eat and where to visit - very good. Even if you e been the NY a few times remember the city is always changing. Use their expertise. 

I would single out Mike (on the door) for particular praise. Always cheerful, always ready to help. Whether it's a car you need or a restaurant recommendation. He was professional and courteous and a great ambassador for The Gotham. The other staff have been chosen carefully - they sell the brand so well! 

Looking forward to a chance to come again 

Thanks.

title: Great find!
text: So conveniently located near the Theater District with well set up rooms, comfy bed and excellent bathroom with good counter space.  I especially liked the super efficient, friendly and helpful staff- kudos to Andrew, Eldis, Dwayne and Mike!

title: Great Location, Great Staff, Can't wait to visit again!
text:
My husband and I stayed at the Gotham to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary this past Saturday- Tuesday. As soon as we arrived they wished us a happy anniversary and hand delivered a bottle of chilled champagne a few minutes after we got settled in the room. Our room was fabulous, we were on the back side of the building, it was quiet but we still had a view from the side. I can't say enough about having your own private balcony after a long day of walking and you just want to sit outside, listen to the sounds of NYC and have a glass of wine, it was just incredible! 
Our room was clean, housekeeping made sure we had clean towels and the room always looked great. I can't say enough about the staff as well...Robert and Alen helped us with directions, our luggage, and overall just were a wonderful addition to our stay. 
We can't wait to visit again and stay at the Gotham!

title: Great Hotel
text: We had a great stay at The Gotham Hotel and would happily stay again. The rooms were solid, the location is prime, and the staff works hard to provide a wonderful experience (Mike is particular). Thanks for everything! We will be back next time we're in town.

title: Great Location & Very Comfy Bed
text: My finance and I stayed here on the first six nights of our honeymoon. After our flights being delayed the 24hr front desk were able to check us in as soon as we arrived. The bed was EXTREMELY comfy, and we loved the location as we were so close to all the action in Midtown, and so close to a couple of subway lines. Would definitely recommend!

title: Glad we stayed.
text: We stayed in this hotel on the recommendation of a friend who lives in New York and we are happy we did.  Great location and friendly staff.  The upper floor balcony's which anyone could use were a bonus.  We spent a few evenings having a drink on the balcony watching and listening to the world go by 19 or so floors beneath us.  Coffee shop next door - Gregory's - is excellent and lots of other deli's and countless restaurants nearby.  There was construction going on across the road but this was not a problem.  The a/c unit in our room was noisy but that would be our only complaint.

title: Perfect locations
text: The hotel is located in a perfect position. We reccoment a room with the balcony facing the street. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We do not feel like to give 5 stars for 2 main reason: there was a coffee machine in room but no pods or coffee/tea to use on it and for the huge work in progress going on just by the hotel. We highly recommend this hotel

title: HOTEL ACOGEDOR EN EL CENTRO DE MIDTOWN
text:
Hotel de pocas habitaciones con un trato muy personal. Gracias al Staff por su amabilidad y en especial a Mirio por su gentileza. Habitaciones muy amplias. Destacar las bonitas terrazas accesibles para todos los huespedes (de la planta 19 a la 23). Ubicación excelente al lado de la 5 Av.! a 5 min. de Times Square.
Lastima que el edificio de delante esta en obras :(

title: It was fairly good
text:
It was ok here. The rooms were fine, the beds were really comfortable, bathroons were nice. The staff were friendly and happy to help with any problems or questions. The air con was strong, if a little loud.
There was a coffee machine in room but no pods or coffee/tea to use on it. I also had a couple of beers from the mini bar on  first two nights but these were not replenished the rest of week. Things like this and the coffee you shouldnt have to ask for, they should be just be done. 
We had a Skyline suite, but this was on the  twelve floor, so i do not see how that represents skyline. 
Everything was fine and comfortable, just did not blow me away and was expensive for what it was. The location was brilliant.

title: Great Location.... Excellent Service
text:
We stayed from 07/15/2016 - 07/27/2016 travelled from Australia.
The location was excellent close to many sites.
On arrival the room we booked (skyline suite) had plumbing issues, so our first night was in a standard room & the next morning we where moved to our room which was spacious, clean & had a great balcony. Can't thank the staff enough,,, Aldina, Sasha, Eldis & Mike nothing was to hard so helpful.... Thank you so much.
Would definitely stay here again & will recommend to my friends.

title: IDEAL SERVICE
