text: I stayed in this wonderful hotel for 13 nights for work and it was such a pleasant stay the rooms are very clean and big the staff are efficient and on point, I had trouble with he internet and the supervisor (Sasha) compensated me immediately with the best service ever.I recommend this hotel to all my friends and family for its amazing service and its awesome location.

title: Great rooms, even better staff
text: It's easy to keep coming back to the Gotham. The rooms are extremely spacious for NYC, the showers are great, and every room has a balcony. On top of it all, the staff is top notch.. Aldina, Sasha, Eldis, Fabjon and the whole team are always smiling and do whatever they can to make sure your stay is as enjoyable as possible. They literally do whatever they can to accommodate a guest's needs, something very rare in the hotel business. Kudos to management for making sure their guests are in great hands!!

title: El mejor hotel de new york
text: Estuve una semana en New York con mi pareja y este hotel resultó perfecto. Su ubicación es inmejorable y la atención de los empleados fue excepcional. El precio es alto, pero es Manhattan, que se puede esperar. Todo está cerca y puedes ir a muchos de los lugares de interés sin tener que usar transportación. Lo recomiendo al 100%.

title: Great Location, very helpful staff
text: Boutique hotel right in the middle of many, many sites.  Very short walk to theatre, Times Square, Grand Central Station, and tons of bars, restaurants and shopping.  Right near the corner of 46th & 5th Avenue.  Very helpful staff--much thanks to Michael, Eldis, and also Dwayne.  Very reasonable price, and spacious room.

title: Great location, nice staff
text: I was located in a skyline suite which was very unlike the pictures, i required a fold out bed because i was with my nan and the bed was very uncomfortable. The air conditioning which was needed due to be it being quite warm during my stay was very noisy and i couldn't have it on in my sleep but then it would get very warm during the night, there was construction across the road which was unfortunate and also disrupted sleep. During my stay the door handle to the outside was broken 99 percent of the time and we had the technician out twice and it still broke, leaving it unable to properly close the door from the noise. Anytime we asked for cups or tea or even a shower cap they took forever to come, if they did ever come. it is also the first hotel i've ever stayed at to pre-auth $600 and take out $100 each night for incidentals. Overall the location was perfect but the place was basically falling apart it definitely needs some renovation and the extra charges were really annoying but id love to give a special mention to eldus who was wonderful and the front reception were also lovely and very forgiving. I also left my charger there and was coming back in a week so i think it was really good of them to keep it for me until i returned.

title: Five Star Boutique Hotel
text:
We enjoyed a 9 day stay at the hotel from July 8 - 17, 2016. 

An amazing hotel and wonderful staff. The best kept secret in Manhattan.

Upon our arrival from western Canada to NYC we had a couple "snags" with our room.
Then the most amazing things happened. The hotel staff jumped into action.
They were all warm, wonderful, and professional. They moved us to a beautiful King Suite. The room was spacious, well decorated, and comfortable. The bathroom was large and modern. The terrace had an incredible view. It was unique to have a large terrace where we could relax at the end of the evening.
During our 9 day stay the staff genuinely made sure that we were comfortable and content. Any request we had was addressed promptly and professionally. Dwayne, Mike, Eldis, Adina, Andrew, and Sasha were all incredibly helpful and caring.

Make sure you pay the "upcharge" to have breakfast included as part of your stay. Wolfgang's restaurant is first class dining and the breakfast is gourmet food. Breakfast is served on white linen tables with professional waitresses/waiters. The restaurant staff are personable and knowledgeable. Ilir, Maria, Irene and Agron treated us like family and we looked forward to our morning sojourns with them.
.
The hotel is a 6 minute walk to Grand Central Station. You can easily connect to any subway. The hotel is within walking distance to Times Square and the Theatre District. It is a great central location to almost everything in Manhattan.

The hotel has free WiFi. 

I would happily recommend The Gotham Hotel to my friends and family.
We have just returned home and we are both missing "The Gotham Hotel".

title: Ok, wenn man das richtige Zimmer hat
text: Zimmer schön eingerichtet, aber ein dunkles Loch. Roomservice war mangelhaft. Frische Badetücher hatten noch Spuren der Vorgänger und es war erkennbar, dass der Boden im Badezimmer nicht gereinigt wurde. Deskpersonal sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit.

title: New York New York
text:
La posizione è centrale, comoda per ogni spostamento a Manhattan. 
Il personale disponibile, professionale e divertente ci ha fatti sentire a casa (si parla anche italiano!)
La camera piccola, pulita senza vista, aveva un piccolo balcone. Abbiamo cenato un paio di volte alla steakhouse di Wolfgang e siamo usciti soddisfatti :-) 
A presto NYC

title: Deludente
text:
Unica nota positiva la posizione centralissima, ma per il resto lontano dai canoni di ospitalità base. Abbiamo ricevuto la camera al 18esimo piano, che si presentava vecchiotta e fintamente pulita, in quanto piena di polvere. Le pulizie quotidiane, riguardavano solo il riassetto del letto e cambio asciugamani, il water è stato pulito velocemente a distanza di tre giorni. Il Wi-Fi non prendeva se non nella piccolissima hall: tornare in camera e non avere internet, è davvero un grande disagio. 
Una nota dolentissima è il rumore assordante degli impianti di climatizzazione, che specie di notte non ti lasciano riposare. 
Altra nota dolente, la colazione inclusa, il bar offriva un drink e una pietanza da mangiare ( pane cake o omelette): siamo stati costretti a fare colazione altrove. Il personale impeccabile e gentilissimo, nulla poteva di fronte alla cattiva gestione, in definitiva visto quanto pagato, più di  € 200 a notte, resto profondamente deluso, ed oltre a non tornare, non lo consiglierei.

title: Pleasant experience
text: This is more of a boutique type hotel. The price is very reasonable for New York and the room was very generously sized. The two staff members we encountered could not have been more caring. They went above and beyond to give us a great experience including little extras that they were not required to do. Aldina found a room for us even though we arrived earlier than check in time and Mike gave us great advice and assistance with a smile. Each time we would run into one of them, we were given a friendly greeting and asked if there was anything they could do for us. Even though it was our first time, these two staff people treated us like we were their best customer. We will use this hotel as our go to place whenever we travel to New York.

title: In Walk Distanz zum Times Square
text: In Walk Distanz zum Times Square, einfaches Hotel, unkompliziert. Kompakte Reseption. Wir hatten ein Zimmer im 14. Stock mit Blick & Terrasse mit kleinem Tisch und dreckigen Stühlen in den weniger schönen Hinterhof, ev. gut für Raucher.

title: Excellent service and very helpful Mike
text:
I just stayed here for 3 nights before going to Cornell at Ithaca and as soon as I arrive I felt like in home 
Mike was very helpful and friendly from the beginning of this travel 
Front desk team as well and the fb manager too
Room very nice, clean and all you need 
Wifi perfect and the best location you can get in Manhattan !!!
Many Thanks for all the packages and see you next year 
Matias

title: La Cortesia è di casa
text: Siamo stati al Gotham all'inizio di giugno. L'hotel ha una posizione ottima e le stanze sono di standard elevato, sicuramente più ampie e curate della media a NY. L'unica nota negativa è stata, per quanto ci riguarda, il fatto che avevamo prenotato una stanza con terrazza ma la terrazza affacciava sulla parete di un palazzo distante pochissimi metri. Insomma zero veduta anche se al 17' piano. Data l'impossibilità di cambiarci stanza, perché era tutto pieno, l'hotel non ha fatto problemi, nonostante avessimo già pagato, a rimborsarci, accogliendo la nostra richiesta, la somma per le notti in cui non abbiamo dormito lì. Un ringraziamento particolare a Dwayne che ha curato la trafila per la sua cortesia e professionalità

title: Amazing!
text:
My friend and I stayed in a skyline room at this hotel, and having the balcony was well worth the money in my opinion, the view is beautiful, even though the building opposite was under some construction. 
The location was perfect for a tourist, many of the sightseeing locations were easily walkable. 
The front desk staff were honestly amazing, I'm english and driving in NYC was a nightmare, we had an issue actually finding our way to the hotel but the man at the front desk stayed on the line, and gave us constant directions on how to get there, we were so thankful. 

The room was perfect, it was big, spacious and had all the tech needed. I would love to stay again!

title: Great experience - highly recommend
text:
Staff was wonderful, helpful and friendly.  Room was clean and very comfortable for two.  Bathroom was especially clean and bright.  

Convenient location to theater district, shopping.  

Unassuming from the outside - as a matter of fact, we walked right by it when we were looking for it!  For as small as it looks from the outside, our room was quite spacious enough for two.  Never felt crowded.  Will likely stay again the next time we visit.

title: Mike , Andrew and Aldina .
text:
Hey there ,

First of all the hotel was very private , central , so clean and the beds are amazing, everything was perfect everyday  !!!! Ticks in every area . But the best part was the service , in particular Mike , Andrew and Aldina . They are lovely to talk to and so helpful all the time . So knowledgable about New York and all the areas to visit and live . I recommend them highly . I would defintely stay at the Gotham hotel again , it is now my hotel of choice . 5 star rating in all areas . The beds make you never want to leave as well . 

Thanks !!😎

title: nice modern rooms
text:
good location ... near all action.
Room was good with balcony but there is construction going on so a bit noisy.
Best & most comfortable bed I slept on in a hotel lately .
Restaurant / Bar/ coffee shop was nice and the bar tenders were very nice.
There is Gregorys coffee shop next to it , which serves excellent coffee.

title: Great Location
text: Chic hotel located in an ideal location for touring NYC. Friendly and attentive staff.  My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and the staff went above and beyond to make certain that it would be special. Rooms are chic, and comfortable. I recommend you visit the terraces on the upper floors with a magnificant view of the City. Looking forward to staying at Gotham Hotel on my next visit.

title: Очарование Готэма.
text: Просто обворожительный отель, в который влюбляешься с первых минут пребывания в нем. Красивейшее лобби, чистые коридоры, приятное освещение, быстрый вай фай. Персонал приветлив и дружелюбен. В номерах чисто и уютно. Советую.

title: Extended weekend in NY
text:
Nice and clean hotel. The rooms are spacious and our room had a large window (which is kind of rare to find in this city).The bathroom is completely renovated and clean. Also, the crew is very considerate. The hotel is well located, close to Grand Central station, very convenient.
I will definitely come back!

title: Long weekend at Gotham hotel
text:
Nice Roomy rooms, great bed . Bathroom very elegant and designed very originally. Good service at reception, with nice crews  that help out kindly and professionally. The location is very good- central , but not too noisy. 
Negative point: the air conditioning was locked at a specific temperature , and there was no individual control in the room ( or at least was not working in our room..).
 Summary: pleasant stay, good prices. Will go back!!

title: Ótimo hotel. Bem localizado
text:
O hotel fica a poucos minutos da Times Square. Os quartos são amplos e o banheiro é ótimo. Nosso quarto possuía uma pequena varanda com uma mesinha e uma cadeira.
TV LCD com diversos canais. O quarto tem carpete, não que seja um problema, mas prefiro quartos com piso laminado. O quarto que ficamos tinha um ar condicionado, desses portáteis instalado. Ele era bem barulhento, mas suportável. Talvez em dias mais quentes ele não de conta de resfriar o quarto inteiro. O quarto ainda conta com um frigobar e wifi grátis. Os funcionários foram sempre cordiais e educados. Um agradecimento em especial para o Mike, que nos deu várias dicas.
O quarto conta ainda com frigobar

title: Great location
text: Great location!  Small restaurant/bar.  Everyone was very nice at check in and throughout my stay.  Negatives are room could be a bit cleaner but bed was great and very nice.  Other negative is they might have the smallest towels I have ever seen.  Couldn't tell what was the bathmat vs towels as they were all the same size.

title: Gotham
text: Отель находится в шаговой доступности от всех достопримечательностей Манхетенна. В номерах чисто и комфортно. Интернет хороший. Меня поселили в номер с видом на сплошную стену. От этого все впечатления от отеля испорчены. Больше не осеменяешь писать. По соотношению цена/качество не самый лучший вариант. Дороговато.

title: Wonderful
text:
Our new favourite place in NYC.
Central to everything, incredibly friendly and also surprisingly inexpensive.

From the moment that the door is opened for you by the concierge, to the slick and easy check in - you are wowed by the level of service and friendly faces.

The rooms are huge, for New York, and very quiet - with extremely high quality beds, linen and furnishings.

Molton brown toiletries make us UK people feel at home, and the balcony gave us a feeling of having some outside space in this bustling city.

Basically, as people who travel a lot - and stay in lots of different hotels - this one has it right, flawless!

title: Great location
text: If you want to be close to Time Square, Broadway and be in the Midtown this is the place. The staff is nice and helpful. The downside is that the air conditioning is very noisy. I got used to the street noise (it's New York after all) but I couldn't sleep because of the loud air conditioning. They should have given me a discount because of it. Apart from that, the room and the bathroom are clean.

title: Il meglio
text: Ottima accoglienza, bellmen che danno suggerimenti e procurano taxi, al desk gentili e col sorriso. Camere spaziose, silenziose anche se con poca luce. nonostante i lavori in corso nell'edificio di fronte tornerei subito visto il personale che parla anche italiano (Sasha) e che ci ha aiutato molto durante il breve soggiorno. 5 stelle

title: Anniversary Visit
text: We celebrated our 2nd anniversary in NYC at the Gotham Hotel .  They were so nice to us!  When we got there, I told them we were celebrating our anniversary...so they checked us in and took our bags saying they would bring them up to the room on the 17th floor....while we brought out car to the nearby garage.  Well when we got back they had not only brought up our bags, but gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne as well!  The room was spacious and looked brand new...the shower was amazing and the king bed ultra comfortable!  Also had a balcony   I am afraid of heights, so we didn't spend much time out there...but could have sat out there and it would have been nice.

title: Great Location
text:
Once we figured out how everything coordinates we found the parking garage easily. We had a good amount of things to bring so valet would have been nice but honestly it's on the same street as the hotel, 3 minute walk. And this place is walking distance to 5th ave and Times Square. Awesome. We checked in with Dwayne. He's the man. Very professional and accommaditing. More people should be like him. Penthouse was beautiful, mini bar, refrigerator room for food, big wine cooler. Balcony was very nice, waterfall shower was amazing. Wish the bathroom was a little bigger though. We had dinner downstairs at the Wolfgang steakhouse, its very small inside BUT the staff is really friendly, the food was well worth the money. I had filet and my wife had 3lb lobster, both perfect and were snobs. Big wine menu but small on hard stuff.. Either way it's so convienient.

Here's what bothered me, If you stay in the penthouse you have to use the left elevator. The left elevator sucks. It took up to 5 minutes to come on several occasions, floor level and room level. When we said something to a bell boy he went to see what the problem was, he came back to tell us to just take it to 24 and walk up to 25. Yeah I know it's 1 flight of stairs but I'm paying good money to stay here and this happened after dinner too. We were bombed, who wants to walk a flight of stairs... Come Morning the construction across the street woke me up, that was terrible but we're heavy sleepers so it wasn't a problem falling back asleep luckily

title: Well located boutique hotel
text: Stayed two weekend nights, staff was very nice and attentive, room was clean and updated including bathroom, hotel is located about three long blocks from times square, and a 10 min walk from Grand Central station. Got a decent price in a last minute booking site. Reason for the 4 stars is a little of noise from elevator lobby and other rooms, but really no biggie. Would recommend.

title: good location
text: Good location, close to 5th Av. Staff at front desk were pleasant.  Unique... The building gets narrower as you go higher...we were staying on a higher floor, so by the time you reached our floor(23?) the building was so narrow that there were only two rooms on our floor and the rest of our level had a common balcony facing the street. Kind of neat. We felt quite comfortable.

title: In the heart of Midtown
text: First time at this hotel in the heart of Manhattan and the first impression was great. My boyfriend and I arrived early, so the bellman at the door stored our luggage and the young lady at the desk took our number and called us back around 1pm to tell us that the room was ready. We had lunch at the Wolfgang steakhouse that's hidden in the back of the lobby: loved the meat! The room we booked was in the back and didn't really have a view but it was clean, with a small balcony and a lot of storage space. Everyone at the desk was very helpful: they gave us directions and great suggestions about restaurants and amazing rooftop bars in the area! I would definitely come back again.

title: Incredible Experience
text: This was my first experience with the Gotham Hotel. From start to finish, everything was excellent. The entire staff was friendly and helpful and anything I needed was delivered in a very timely manner. They even attended to the small details like hailing me a cab or providing an umbrella, which helped make my business trip to NYC go smoothly. After long stressful days of meetings, returning to a comfortable room and a pleasant staff was exactly what I needed. I will only stay at the Gotham going forward.

title: Look no further - this place is wonderful!
text:
The three things I want in a hotel stay: Character, cleanliness and location. The Gotham had it all. Character: My room was decorated with a big mirror, beautiful tiled bathroom with walk-in shower and a BALCONY!!! We had a big fluffy king sized bed that was probably the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. The lobby was decorated in a modern way but with clean lines and in sync with the Gotham theme. Cleanliness: Above expectation - no roque hairs in the bathroom or on the bed linens (that is a huge gag-factor for me). Location: Perfect - a few blocks from everything. 
On top of all this, the staff were extremely friendly. 
The price of the room was a great value for what we got back in the experience of our stay. I will be coming back to The Gotham for sure!!

title: Good location - design - noise
text:
My stay at the Hotel was quite satisfactory. Very friendly accommodating staff, free WiFi (as it should be), well designed clean rooms and exceptionally nice bathrooms. 
The only negative was the air conditioner, which was deafeningly loud. Opening the window was not a viable option, because the noise level outside was equally loud in spite of the fact that my room was facing the inner courtyard - it must have been the noise from multiple aircons...

title: not bad for a business trip
text: I stayed for 3 nights on business trip.  Not bad, but a little bit shabby.  And it was cold - I couldn't get in-room temperature higher than 21 -22 C (cold for me).  BUT initially I was offered the room facing the wall and with awful noise of AC units.  I asked for a better one and practically instantly was given a room facing the street.  Much quieter, much better!  Thank you (hotel staff) for that!  The definite plus is Wolfgang's Steakhouse - it is inside the hotel.  Great place.  Overall OK.  Good, but not very good.

title: Lacks customer service
text: Great location. Walking distance to the Empire and Bryant Park which hosts some lovely bars to sit out in the sunshine and enjoy.  For us, what really let the place down was the impersonal customer service.  We arrived a little early and hoped we could check in but we're just dismissed

title: Posizione ideale
text: Sono stata in questo hotel durante il mio soggiorno a NY.. Bello, pulito ed accogliente.. Situato in una posizione centrale ,comodo per muoversi anche a piedi. Per chi non volesse fare colazione in hotel  perché abbastanza cara può andare nel bar adiacente dove fanno degli ottimi cappuccini ( buoni quasi come in Italia) e tante varietà di dolci

title: Muito bom!!!
text:
Hotel muito bom! Adoramos a localização! Atendimento excelente, boa limpeza, quarto e acomodações muito bons! Internet gratuita. Para ser perfeito só faltou ter café da manhã incluso na diária. 
Mas com certeza será uma opção que irei escolher para uma próxima ida a Nova York

title: Fantastic location. Great value Midtown hotel.
text: Despite the extensive building works we saw opposite, we really loved this hotel. The location was faultless, although it is really central our room (junior suite - definitely worth the upgrade if you can stretch) was street facing and quiet! The junior suites have large balconies which is almost unheard of for New York hotels - one of the biggest NYC hotel rooms I've stayed in! Great coffee shop options in the immediate vicinity, well placed for Rockefeller Centre, Empire State, shopping and for the subway. I've stayed in other New York hotels and this was by far the best combination of location and boutique luxury. The service was great when we needed help.

title: Excellent hotel and service
text: Visited here this weekend and had incredible service from all staff but especially Fabian. Genuine and friendly and his service will bring us back. All the staff was able to recommend places to see and where to go. Hotel room was clean and everything was excellent from start to finish.

title: Great Midtown Hotel with excellent mix of value and quality of experience!
text:
Stayed here for business and was impressed. Location is spot on Midtown in the heart of NYC. On 46th Steet so not as "busy" as Avenues so a bit more quiet and cozy by Midtown standards. Very nice sized rooms for the money. I see this is a mid-priced boutique NYC business spot and much better than others nearby in its category. Staff is awesome and friendly; especially Sasha at the front desk and afternoon bell staff - they rock! 

Pros: Solid location, good sized room, balconies on front side have are a nice touch (though directly across is a building in mid-construction). Nice bath with solid shower head and H2O pressure/temp. Clean and wearing well interior. Comfy beds and good TVs with loads of channels. 
Cons: Lobby area is small and not very useful.

title: Great staff in a great location
text:
Checked in on Easter Sunday.   Found the staff very responsive to concerns.  Room was nice, excellent location. Close to everything!
The staff went out of their way to help me out when I left my computer in a cab.  Above and beyond!

title: Very Good Location and comfortable
text: Stayed over long Easter weekend. Super convenient location for 5th Ave, Times Sq, Central Park, Midtown, Grand Central Station and Rockefeller Center. I was considering Airbnb but got a good deal on hotels.com as NYC is usually very expensive for hotels. Most hotel rooms are usually small and/or old in New York (especially compared to Asia where I come from) but I would say the room was larger than average. The design of the room was modern and functional. The wifi was reliable and good. There was a modern tv with good range of cable channels, There was mini bar with an ok selection which I did'nt use. What is it with air con in New York hotels? It was noisy and the air con control did'nt seem to work. There was a small balcony but since I was on a low floor facing the back, I did'nt use it. The bathroom could have had more space to put things, and the shower hose had a leak thus I could only use the overhead rain shower. The design of the wardrobe door was poor since it was spring loaded thus awkward to keep open whilst trying to use the safe. Other gripes - nice if they provided bottled water and toothpaste, elevators were a bit on the slow side. Overall great location, value for money, good wifi, modern and comfortable.

title: Service Could Use Some Improvement
text: Although the location is good and the price is probably reasonable for New York City, the service at this hotel leaves something to be desired.  The staff is friendly enough, but there were enough annoyances that we probably won't stay here again.  The doorman was rarely at the front door, and we had to struggle with packages to get in the heavy front door time and time again.  This is a small hotel, and the rooms are quite small as well.  There are no ice machines, and the ice must be requested and brought up by the doorman.  Maybe that's why he's rarely at the front door.  We had requested ice and, another day, a sewing kit, which was urgently needed.  It was not brought up by the time we had to leave, which was an hour later.  I had asked the housekeeper for clean towels, and she said she had to call the manager to get approval to replace my dirty towels with clean ones.  I have never heard of that in a hotel before.  This was during her regular housekeeping visit to the room.  There is not much of a lobby here, just the small space in front of the check-in desk.  There is a restaurant in the back, which we did not visit.  Because the restaurant is open to the public, there appears to be no security here.  Anyone can just come in the front door, head towards the restaurant, get on the elevators and get off on any floor.  You don't need a room key to operate the elevator.  All in all, I probably would not stay here again.

title: Nice Hotel ... Poor Customer Billing Experience
text: Room was nice, and large by NYC standards. Unfortunately, they have a very poor billing policy where they charge you for the room upon check-in, then charge you again upon check-out. They claims it takes 3 days for the first charge to reverse. It has been 5 days, and I still am double charged. When I spoke to them on the phone, although very professional, they could offer no resolution other than 'just wait and trust us'. There is no reason for them to make this charge twice, they could have 'justed waiting and trusted me' to pay upon checkout.

title: Quality room
text: Very nice comfy bed, good use of space & decent sized room, modernized. I was only there for one night by myself for business but zero complaints. Best value in the area as other hotels (considered luxury) nearby are way more expensive.

title: Very good, but could do better
text:
Very good location for 5th Avenue, subway and places to eat.
Room very comfortable; huge bed, although made so duvet was tucked in and so way too far down bed.
Housekeeping a bit hit & miss with insufficient space to hang towels, which were partially replaced on first night (weekend team), but then not touched for three days.
Really could have done with drink making facilities in room, but at least there is an excellent cafe next door.
Why architect put balconies on back of rooms, which had no view at all (brick wall) is a mystery.  However, large, much more usable balconies at front of building are great.
Intermittent Internet was immensely frustrating, especially when staff say it is fine on their phones.
TV also a bit frustrating with tricky remote control and annoying info/advert(?) bar appearing at foot of screen much of the time.
Staff, especially door guys, very friendly.
Would return, but I'd pack a kettle next time.
Restaurant (not used yet) on ground floor not part of hotel, so feedback reflects this.

title: Best hotel in Manhattan
text: Just back from a weekend trip to New York for st Patrick's day .we stay in the Gotham hotel in Manhattan ,great room ,great space for a hotel in Manhattan ,nice and bright and clean ,we had a belcony which was great a little bit off out door space with a view up to time square ,there was building work going on across the road ,but it didn't take away from how good the room was,the staff are really nice ,and couldn't do enough for us ,nothing was any trouble ,the hotel is in a great part off town ,so we could walk to most places ,I will be back for a second visit .😎😀😄

title: Made my St. Patty's
text: Fabijon (I Know I'm hacking that do death) is the best doorman this city has!! Very cool, and makes you feel welcome and at home. He will direct you to great food, that's not gonna break the piggy. Room was decent and has a great location. The steaks at wolfe's are unbelievable! Pricey but amazing!! As long as my guy works here I will stay here!

title: Great hotel , location , service and food
text:
What can I say . A really great hotel in the midst of Manhattan . Has all the things a traveler or businessman may want . 
1) a great bed and room and barroom . Top notch quality and cleanliness .
2) great location 
3) affordable price most of the nights .
4) fabulous breakfast and restaurant downstairs .

The only reason for the 4 stars is that I had to check out 3 nights due to the escalating prices for these nights , by 60% more .

title: Great business hotel in midtown.
text: For a midtown hotel the Gotham is reasonably priced, with big rooms, good location, and a very accommodating staff. My only complaint is the low light in the rooms. A coffee shop is next door and my friends said the hotel restaurant was very good. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Lovely hotel
text: Lovely hotel with great views down the street go times square. Just a shame that there is a noisy building site opposite which looks directly into our room. The builders start early too, we woke up at 7 and they were already underway.

title: Great hotel & Great location-Staff was very friendly
text: This hotel was in a perfect location for us. It's close to Time Square and close to everything we wanted to do. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly. We arrived early before our room was ready, so they stored our luggage for us. The room was spacious and clean. We also had a terrace, which was really nice. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Great staff and rooms!
text: My fiance and I live in NYC and just wanted a little stay-cation day for our anniversary and to hang out on a balcony in the strangely nice weather we had last week. We saw the pictures on the site and don't live too far so went in to check out the rooms. Fabio at the front was kind enough to show us a few of the different rooms before we decided on booking to make sure it was what we were looking for, and recommended hanging out on the public terraces which are a little bigger with more of a view. As we were checking in, he even asked if there was any special occasion, and got us a bottle of wine sent to the room compliments of the manager for our anniversary! The rooms were cozy, the bed so comfortable, the balcony was perfect, and the staff was excellent. We definitely plan on coming back!

title: Room as good as the photos, amazing views, attentive staff and delicious steak room service!
text:
My wife and I visited the Gotham Hotel for a week holiday around Valentine's day 2016.

This is a lovely clean, spacious hotel in central Manhattan with spectacular views over 46th street towards Times Square. 

There is great water pressure in the shower with an overhead "rain" style shower and handheld attachment.

Unfortunately the shower fitments in our specific room (161) were a bit loose (the handle kept falling off) and you couldn't adjust the angle of the detachable shower head as I would have liked to while mounted on the wall, but I'm just nitpicking really.

Unfortunately we also came to new york when it was -17 degrees Celsius, and the heater in our room was struggling to keep the room temperature about 18 degrees Celsius (my wife prefers it warmer).
Thankfully the Hotel were very helpful and brought us a secondary electric heater to warm our room more!

Overall the room was lovely, we used the minibar and ordered delicious room service several times from the wolfgang's steakhouse in the building. Everything was clean and maintained to a high standard.

Hotel staff were helpful and attentive, we can't wait to come back again!

title: Go to Boutique Hotel in Manhattan
text: This has turned into one of my favorite boutique hotels in the city. It’s located at 46th street between 5th and Madison Avenue in midtown. You’re a short walk from Grand Central Station, you’re not staying in Times Square, but if you want to walk there – it’s close. Rockefeller Center is a stone’s throw away as well. There is a Wolfgang restaurant in the hotel and you can order room service. There are only 4 rooms on each floor, max. Every room I’ve stayed in has an outdoor balcony. Request the back of the hotel if you want a quieter area. Across the street from the hotel is a building under construction – so not much to look at there. The rooms are a good size for Manhattan (for the price). The bathrooms are modern and have always been clean. The shower is very nice. I only have good thoughts about this hotel. Whenever I see a good price on this hotel, I jump on it. I usually book via Hotel Tonight app, however, if I call the hotel they will honor the Hotel Tonight price, plus give you a 5% discount.

title: Perfecto!!!
text:
Un hotel perfecto; buena ubicación, buena atención, limpio y acogedor.
Lo mejor la cama, con una calidad de inmejorable, almohadas y colcha de pluma... La mejor cama en la que he dormido!
Igualmente la ubicación cerca de Bryant Park una plaza con un encanto especial, muy cerca de la boca del metro y justo al lado del hotel una cafetería estupenda para desayunar.

title: Bien mais trop de bruit
text: Nous avons passé une semaine fin janvier au Gotham nous étions au 4 ème étage, il y a des travaux juste en face de l'hôtel et niveau bruit c'est une horreur toute la nuit !! Sinon la chambre était spacieuse et le lit confortable dommage. Bonne situation proche de Times square.

title: Chambres spacieuses à New York
text: Hôtel très bien situé dans Midtown. Le gros avantage sont les chambres qui sont très spacieuses pour New York. Les équipements sont correctes et la literie de bonne qualité, la déco est sommaire et la moquette mériterait d'être changée. Le personnel de l'hôtel est jeune et extrêmement disponible pour vous aidez, spécialement Fabio le portier. Seul petit bémol, j'avais demandé un late check-out qui m'a été seulement été accordé jusqu'à 13 heures. Dans l'ensemble c'est un bon plan pour NY avec un excellent rapport qualité/prix.

title: Gute Lage - Motel
text: Die Lage des Hotels ist sehr gut und man ist mitten drin. Die Begrüssung der Reception war unterkühlt. Das Zimmer war in einer akzeptablen Grösse mit Balkon gegen die Strasse. Die Balkontüre konnte man nicht verschliessen da das Schloss defekt war, was den Hotelangestellten bekannt ist, sie es aber nicht ändern wollen. Der Safe ist ein Witz, da man diesen raustragen kann, er ist nirgends befestigt. Die Möbel sind bereits ein wenig dreckig und die Vorhänge kaputt. Das Bad ist sehr schön, warmes Wasser jedoch nicht immer verfügbar. Im grossen und ganzen ist die Erscheinung im Motelstil. Verabschiedung des Hotelpersonals dann wieder kühl und desinteressiert. Ich werde dieses Hotel nicht mehr buchen.

title: Lovely Hotel
text:
As a Christmas present we had been bought a Champagne Afternoon Tea
The hotel is in a great location and we were greeted by a very friendly and welcoming guy, we were impressed walking in but we were shown to the Honey restaurant which was lovely but we didn't get the best seat, all the seats with a view were taken unfortunately
The service was OK, we had to wait a while initially, but the staff were friendly when they did come over.

The afternoon tea itself was nice, never enough sandwiches for us as we do have a savory tooth but the deserts were nice, the only thing that was a little disappointing was the scones, they were nice but smaller than usual and when you tried to put the cream and jam on the scone just crumbled apart and in the end had to eat trying to piece it together 

We were going to order a bottle of Proseco but this was £45 a bottle, we are not tight with our money but you can get a decent bottle for £30 if not less and would have been quite happy to pay that but £45 is not really justifiable so maybe a few other options could be on the menu 

Overall we did enjoy our experience and we would go again but maybe with some small improvements that's all.

title: Lovely
text: This hotel was modern and clean. The staff were professional and pleasant. We enjoyed our stay here. We went to the restaurant downstairs and enjoyed our dinner. The location of the hotel was perfect. Close to everything we wanted to see. The hotel itself was modern. We didn't have a balcony in our room but there was one in the hallway with beautiful views of the city.

title: Average hotel
text:
I recently stayed at this hotel and it was just fine....
It is well situated on the east side of the city, right off 5th Ave.  The room was clean and average size.  
Somewhat difficult to sleep due to traffic noise, but this is NY, not much can be done about that unless the room is on upper floors.  
Overall, it was a fine stay.  Nothing special...It certainly doesn't the deserve the premium rates that it commands.
Worth the stay if you can get a deep discount.

title: 3rd stay very disappointing
text:
I visit NYC often for business and this was my 3rd stay at Gotham since September 2015.  I have been very pleased by the hotel in the past by this last stay was bad.  My room did not get cleaned my entire stay (I stayed 3 nights) and there was not a "privacy please" sign up.  The first time it happened, I came back to my room at 11 pm in the evening so I asked front desk to clean my room the next day.  On the next day, I came back to my room at 4 pm and it still wasn't cleaned.  So after requesting for the room to be cleaned again, it finally did get cleaned on the 3rd evening of my stay.  Some other minor things.....The mini bar did not get restocked with water.  The deadbolt on my door was broken and had to be fixed.  The toilet did not flush properly.  And finally, the ironing board they gave me did not prop up.  

As I was checking out, I let the front desk know about the list of issues and she said a  manager would call me.  It's been 5 days and have not heard from a manager yet.

I work in HR for a very major international company and I often arrange for candidates who are interviewing to stay at this hotel.  After this last stay, I embarrassed to have one of my candidates stay there therefore will recommend they stay somewhere else.

title: Bien
text:
Ubicación buena, el hotel esta reformado y esta limpio, el aire acondicionado es un poco ruidos, solicitar una habitación alta porque ha nosotros nos pusieron en la primera planta y el tema de los coches, policia etc. se escuchaba bastante, pero como vas tan cansado tampoco no le das mucha importancia ( en nuestro caso que nos dormimos en cualquier sitio) Las camas eran cómodas pero las sabanas eran cortas, el baño esta muy bien pero cuando te duchas se inunda todo de agua.  
wifi esta limitado. Recepcionista no saben español pero son agradables. suerte del chico de la puerta que es hispano.

title: Hotel okay..
text: The location was absolutely perfect! 100% for location! The room was not bad, only one dressing gown between two of us, the maid came twice and only on one occasion changed the towels. The shower ran out of hot water on a few occasions. The first night we changed rooms as the air con unit was broken. The staff were polite but I wouldn't go as far to say friendly. Free Wifi was a plus, but overall just okay.

title: Quite disappointed!
text: You couldn't ask for a better location for a Christmas shopping holiday in NYC, and we were really excited when we booked it..  Sadly the hotel nowhere near lived up to it's website, or the $350 a night we paid for a standard room, overlooking a shaft!  The front desk staff were at best polite, but not very friendly.  The room was clean BUT the bed very uncomfortable and long overdue a mattress change.  The shower ran out of hot water on 2 of the 3 nights requiring repeated attending to by a plumber.  We only had one dressing gown between the two of us, though a second was quickly brought when we asked, and lastly the Wifi in our room was rubbish!  We will not book the Gotham again on our next NYC visit.

title: Un gran hotel para una gran ciudad
text: Sólo tengo buenos recuerdos de este hotel dónde me volvería a hospedar sin dudar. Habitaciones amplias, con un WC también amplio. La cama es muy cómoda y confortable y amplia. Destacaría también que hay balcones en las habitaciones y es todo un lujo al ser en pleno Manhattan. Tanto el diseño de la habitación como el del hotel son muy modernos. Tienen mucha cura de la limpieza del edificio y a su vez de las habitaciones. Personal muy amable y dispuestos a ayudarte siempre. Por el tema del desayuno, comimos fuera del hotel, pero cerca se pueden encontrar cafeterías donde desayunar bien por un buen precio.

title: Location great, but hotel just ok
text:
This hotel could be fantastic, but unfortunately we were a little disappointed. Maybe we are fussy - but the hotel just didn't live up to our expectations, especially in comparison to others we have stayed at in the area. 

The location is fantastic for tourists, you can walk to Times Square within a few minutes, literally by walking out the hotel entrance and turning left. Great for those visiting and wanting to see all of the midtown attractions.

We had booked a bed & breakfast rate, but were advised at the point of check-in that the hotel were no longer working with the restaurant, so they would not honour that arrangement. We were given our room, but no offer of reimbursement or credit for the restaurant (even though I asked).

Room was on the 9th floor and pretty small, but we only planned on using it for sleeping so were not fussed. It was clean, although slightly run down. The wallpaper was discoloured and coming away from the wall (looked like water damage).

There was a small balcony which looked out into another building, literally into a dentist's chair. 

If you are looking for somewhere to rest your head when visiting NYC, this hotel would be a good fit. It is just a shame that with a little effort, the hotel could be modern and great. 

We maybe had high expectations (comparing it to others in the area and the price we paid), and we weren't unhappy with our stay (except for the breakfast issue), but it isn't somewhere we would choose to book into again.

title: Excellent hotel in NYC
text:
Awesome location (5min walk from Grand Central or Time Square), very reasonable price & super nice staff.
The rooms was quiet despite being so close to the downtown. 
Definitely coming back there again.

title: Eine Frechheit sondersgleichen
text: Eine Juniorsuite für eine Woche gebucht zu 541,67 USD / Nacht. Ankunft um 22.14 Uhr, Bar geschlossen. Zentraler Hotelsafe nicht vorhanden, Safe sei im Zimmer, aber wenn Wertsachen darin verstaut werden, keine Haftung des Hotels...Zimmer 141 verfügt über einen Balkon, die Tür dazu läßt sich von innen nicht verschließen und geht die Nacht über auch von alleine auf. Kleiderschrank reicht gerade für eine Person. Im Schrank liegt der Safe auf dem Boden, nicht befestigt, den kann man unter den Arm klemmen und mitnehmen. Anderes Zimmer gefordert - der gleiche Zustand. Ein Nachttisch mit Lampe, an der anderen Seite des Bettes ist bereits die Wand. Gardinen gibt es nicht, nur ein Vorhang mit Plastikbezug, der uns vor den neugierigen Blicken der Bauarbeiter am nächsten Tag bewahrt. Früher waren hier mal Gardinen, wie wir an den abgerissenen Röllchen sehen. Bügelbrett Fahelanzeige, Fön Fehlanzeige, die hinteren Beine des Sessels ( ich wiege ja stolze 65 kg) knicken nach hinten weg, wenn man sich draufsetzt. Alles in allem eine Zumutung. Kündigen am nächsten Morgen fristlos. Der Empfang will mich doch glatt eine zweite Nacht berechnen, weil ich die nächste Übernachtung nicht fristgemäß 24 Stunden vorher storniert hätte - wie auch? Erst als ich mit Rechtsanwalt und Polizei drohe, reduziert man auf eine Nacht und wir ziehen aus.

title: Really good hotel in fantastic location
text:
Great room size(if a little dark) with balcony.
Staff very friendly & courteous.Room spotless & cleaned evrery day.
Great location near 5th avenue and all the main attractions there
No problems from speedy check-in to even speedier check out.
It is a great find for the magical NYC.

title: Comfortable Hotel - Very central for visiting attractions - Great!
text:
I stayed here with my wife for 4 nights. We had a deluxe king room on the 6th floor.
There is work going on opposite but I did not find it obtrusive, although we did not spend a lot of time in the room.
The staff were very helpful and the room was serviced every day with clean linen and towels.
I must make special mention of Hemel who was working as doorman when we left and literally saved us from missing our flight home when our prepaid car didn't turn up. Thanks Hemel, they were just closing checkin when we got to JFK. Without your driver, we would not have made it.

The only slight downside was that I read somewhere that the rooms had tea making facilities in the room but this is apparently not the case.
This is, perhaps, something that they might think about in the future.

title: Great find!
text: We booked here last minute for a friends weekend. Parking is about a block and a half away and we had no issues.  Check in was super easy, friendly staff too. Rooms were great, comfy and surprisingly large for NYC.  There was also a small balcony which is unheard of in NYC so that was a nice treat.  Would stay again for sure!

title: Great hotel!
text: What a little gem of a hotel! Great location, near everything you want to be around. Subways nearby so you can get everywhere else. The room were spacious for NYC standards, and the beds were very comfortable. I loved the rainfall shower in the bathroom too. A perfect little boutique hotel, great stay!

title: Great location, great NY home base
text: Very nice room, spacious and not just by NY standards. I really liked the fact it is very small with only a few rooms per floor. I will definitely make this my NYC hotel for future trips. Very close to Grand Central and Rockefeller Center

title: Bien situe
text: Hotel bien situe midtown tout pres de 5th avenue. Proche de tout et du shopping. Chambres spacieuses et propres. Pas de bruit j'etais au 23e etage. Mais aucun accueil, petit dej mauvais et tres limité Cher 345 $ pour le service mais a cause de l'emplacement.

title: Great small hotel
text: The location is perfect - Madison and 46th - and the rooms are excellent for the price.  Most have views of high rises nearby but if you get one fronting 46th the views are better.   They have everything you need and all the creature comforts.   There's a bar and restaurant in the lobby that is actually very good.

title: Good things come in small packages
text: The Gotham is VERY small hotel.  Very worth it.  Staff was awesome!! Friendly..attentive...polite...and always willing to help.  4 rooms per floor...some with a balcony..but its a 18 inch ledge at best! Its a great way to check the weather but your are not going to go out on the balcony to sit and have drinks.

title: Grea location
text: Large clean rooms, great location and friendly staff. Close enough to Times Square to walk over there, but away from the craziness. Near Saks, lord and Taylor's etc. close to Broadway too!! We enjoyed our stay!! It was very close to everything.

title: No vayan al menos hasta 2018
text: Estan construyendo un rascacielos delante mismo del hotel que no esta previsto que acaben hasta finales de 2017. Los obreros empiezan a trabajar a la 05:00 AM y a partir de ahi se acabo el dormir. Asi que ustedes mismos si quieren cometer el mismo error que nosotros.

title: A good medium sized hotel located between Fifth Ave and Madison Ave
text:
A good medium sized hotel located between Fifth Ave and Madison Ave – a great location with a 5 minute walk to Grand Central Station. There are local grocery / pharmacy stores a short 2 minute away for snacks etc… and coffee shops either side of the hotel.

We had a small delay checking in as we arrived around 3pm as no rooms were immediately available, but the hotel offered to store our bags so we went for a wonder around and by the time we came back – we got our room situated on the 4th floor. The hotel ask for a credit card on arrival and they take a pre-authorisation charge of $50 USD per night for room charges on the credit card. Although they do “refund” it on checking out – it might catch some travellers out.

As you would expect for such a city centre location – the rooms can be quite noisy from outside traffic. Also there is a construction site located opposite the hotel which I think will be ongoing until 2018.

The rooms are modern, clean, and spacious and the bathroom has a great power shower and condiments – essential for all travellers. The room also had a TV with about 400 local and national channels on, which is good if you want a quiet night in your room after a busy day. 

Our room did have a (chargeable) mini-bar and fridge but no kettle / coffee maker – so if you need your morning coffee, I would suggest taking a small travel kettle and some supplies (alternatively there are local coffee shops literally next door to the hotel).

In conclusion, a great location and a good place to sleep. My advice, take your own kettle for in room tea / coffee and maybe some ear plugs.

title: Location, location, location!
text:
Bottomline: I'd stay at The Gotham again. The room was clean, comfortable, spacious by NYC standards, and quiet. I have several minor quibbles, and because some things are more important to other travelers I will list them in the interest of being helpful:

* The room is dark. There are two lamps on either side of the bed and two small recessed lights in the ceiling, also at the head of the bed. The bathroom and entry way are well lit but anywhere other than the bed is shadowy.

* The pillowtop mattress is actually a regular mattress with some kind of separate, pillowy addition. This makes the mattress very thick so a flat sheet (instead of a fitted sheet) is used and tucked in between the box spring. Sleep vigorously and you'll wake up tangled in sheet. 

* The room does not come with an iron. Fortunately I managed without one, and I don't know if one could've been obtained by calling the front desk. I stopped traveling with a travel iron years ago because I haven't stayed in a room where one wasn't provided. I found this a curious amenity to lack.

* There is no lobby to speak of. There is an entry with the reception desk to the left and a tiny area with seating for approximately 6-8 people. Hard, uncomfortable seating. I took a red eye and arrived early in the morning, so it would've been nice to relax comfortably for a bit before heading out to explore until check in time.

That's it for minor inconveniences.  I booked my room at a discount on another site so I got a good deal. The bed was extremely comfortable, and as I said earlier, the room was quiet. I was on the 6th floor in the back of the hotel. If you can't get one of the high floors I recommend a room in the back. The view from the front is nothing but scaffolding on the building directly across the street, and being in back cut out all street traffic and construction noise.

The other standout about The Gotham is the location. During my stay I walked to:

5th Avenue
Madison Avenue
Rockefeller Center/Plaza
Radio City Music Hall
The New York Library
Bryant Park
The Empire State Building
The Queensboro Bridge
Times Square
Central Park
A couple of historic churches whose names escape me

In short, I recommend this hotel. I was alone and felt very safe: there were only 4 rooms total on my floor. Wolfgang's, the on-site restaurant has a lovely bar and a great Merlot. The staff were professional and courteous. The room is a great size, the balcony was a lovely treat, and the location - for what I paid - cannot be beat.

title: Carino, personale gentile, ma...
text: Appena entrati al Gotham devo dire che abbiamo avuto un'ottima impressione: personale di reception gentilissimo (una ragazza parlava addirittura italiano), posto elegante. Ecco il primo "ma" avevo scritto chiedendo, se possibile di avere una camera ai piani alti. E infatti la mia registrazione era per una camera al 9° piano, peccato che qualcuno che ha fatto il checkin poco prima di me abbia chiesto una camera ai piani alti e abbiano ben pensato di dargli proprio la nostra facendoci "scendere" al 4° piano. I rumori della strada e del cantiere di fronte sono giunti forte e chiaro per tutta la vacanza. La camera è comunque pulita e ordinata, seppure poco insonorizzata. A onore del vero ci era stato offerto di cambiare stanza nei giorni successivi, ma non l'abbiamo ritenuto necessario. L'altro "ma" è dovuto alla pulizia, che definire approssimativa è pure riduttivo. Al secondo giorno abbiamo gettato gli asciugamani per terra per farceli cambiare e al nostro rientro in camera verso le 17, la stessa non era stata pulita. L'ho fatto presente in reception e mi hanno detto che avrebbero provveduto immediatamente, peccato che la "pulizia" sia consistita in: rifare il letto, piegare gli asciugamani buttati a terra e riporli sul mobile, nient'altro. Mi è sembrata una presa in giro e ho chiesto alla reception quanto meno il cambio di asciugamani che mi è stato consegnato immediatamente e l'incidente non si è più ripetuto per il resto della vacanza. In conclusione seppure con qualche chiaroscuro, questo Gotham è un hotel che mi sento di consigliare e nel quale tornerei.

title: Better than expected for a New York hotel room!
text:
Walking into the hotel we were very impressed, friendly staff, clean and modern reception area. If i remember correctly our room was on the 6th (or 8th) floor, the room was larger than we were expected so we were pleasantly surprised. Large comfy bed, plenty of cupboard and wardrobe space. Large tv with ample channel choice. Lovely bathroom with large walk in shower. The view from the balcony was a brick wall but it being New York and so built up we were'nt really expecting and amazing view. 
The location of this hotel is amazing!!!! It felt like everything was on our door step and within walking distance, it really was the perfect location.

title: Gotham - Chic and a short walk to everything mid-town NYC!
text: This is a really cool and trendy hotel. There's not much of a lobby and there are only a few or two rooms per floor, but it is a high-quality place. The bathroom is plenty big and spacious with a roomy shower, too. Great lighting control throughout the room and very comfortable. Due to its location, the views are minimal. However, from the upper floors, you can go out on the shared deck right on 46th and look east and west for excellent sunrise or sunset views. The bar/restaurant serves excellent food and is quite lively at night. 5th Avenue is a hop and skip away. Great place to stay when in midtown.

title: Noise Noise Noise
text: After a 20 odd minute check in (we were the only ones there)we got a room on the 8th floor our view was a brick wall i noticed the noise coming from the a/c unit on the ground but was hopeful it would stop some time but woke at about 6 am it was like being in the machine room on a ship the noise was very very loud asked to be moved and was told it would make no difference because of the building work on the other side which looks like it will be going on for about another year or so dont shower between 8 and 9 in the morning or let the shower run for about 10 minutes first and check your bill they tried to overcharge me 100 dollars .

title: Nice location, cute boutique hotel
text:
We find this hotel on hotels.com for a good price.  Being we had not seen it in person, we were a bit apprehensive.  But, it was great!  

Everyone was nice and the room was spacious (for NYC) and very clean!  The private balcony was nice for fresh air even though there is no view.  

The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is bc the description states you will receive a complimentary glass of wi e upon arrival.  The girls at the desk said they haven't done that in years and it's a misprint.  I know it's small but that was something that caught our eyes while booking and would have added a little character. :)

Nice staff, nice location, nice stay!

title: Trendy clean and functional
text:
We stayed here due to the excellent price.  It was nice, clean and functional and had great style.
We did not go into the bar or restaurant as we were with kids and its definately more of an adult friendly hotel.

title: Excelente acomodação e serviços!
text: O hotel é muito bom, quartos amplos para os padrões nova-iorquinos e com sacada, cama muito confortável! Ótima localização, perto do Grand Central Station. Não fui ao restaurante do hotel, mas há uma ótima delicatessen bem próxima ao hotel, na 5ª Avenida, para comprar itens para o café da manhã. O ar-condicionado apresentou problemas, mas em poucos minutos um técnico apareceu para resolver. Os funcionários são muito atenciosos. O sinal do Wi-Fi era bom. Excelente experiência e voltaria a me hospedar com certeza!

title: Excellent location
text:
The hotel is quite small but very well located.
The rooms were spacious and we had a small balcony at the back. Unfortunately, it overlooks the back of another building where the AC units are. It can be noisy.
On our level there were only 1 other room I think, and we could share the balcony on the front of the building. The weather was terrible (polar vortex) so we didn't spend too much time there but it could be really nice after a day in the city to relax (the street below is not too loud).
There are 2 small things that I didn't like.
First, I could feel a draft coming from the window. Again, because weather was really cold outside, that was a bit annoying. In other circumstances, I probably wouldn't have noticed.
Second, the breakfast is poor. Very little choice and quite expensive. But being in New York, the closest coffee shop is only 2 minutes away so it is not a major issue.

Overall, we had a wonderful stay.

title: Bonne situation
text: Joli hôtel moderne. Très propre. Chambre spacieuse. Juste bruyant si vous êtes dans les premiers étages (clim et chantier immeuble en face jusq en 2017). Personnel agréable. Attention pas de salle pour petit déjeuner. On a déjeuné le 1er jour dans le restaurant  Wolfgang qui est à l'intérieur. Très bon mais cher : 60$ des pancakes pour 2! Par contre, il y a dans la rue plusieurs  coffees bar très bien et moins cher

title: Fantastic place
text:
With a really good location, spotlessly clean rooms, friendly staff plus having its own balcony this hotel does tick all the boxes. 
One improvement could be made with the addition of a coffee maker but there are several places nearby if you need your morning fix.

title: Modern, Clean, Nice
text: This boutique hotel is wonderful... very few rooms on each floor.  My room was the only one on my side of the building (facing 46th St) with comfortable bed, small but nice living room area and modern bath... with a good sized balcony.  :)

title: Vacanze newyorchesi
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per 10 giorni,  la posizione è ottima vicino alla subway della central station e a quella del Rochefeller center la zona è bella e movimentata a poca strada da Time square e Bryant Park 
Il personale della reception è molto gentile e disponibile ma riguardo la pulizia delle camere direi che non ci siamo ci hanno cambiato le lenzuola dopo 7 notti e la pulizia lasciava molto a desiderare 
Come avevo già letto negli altri commenti ci hanno bloccato 500$ sulla carta di credito che sono stati sbloccati dopo 5 giorni dal mio rientro.

title: Professional staff and good location
text:
We came straight from the airport to the Gotham Hotel and received a friendly and professional welcome. They even wished my daughter Happy Birthday!   As we arrived a couple of hours before check-in, we were directed to the rest rooms to change our clothes as it was much warmer than in London, our details taken for check-in and then our bags stored for us.  They also took our credit card details as they pre-charge $100/room/night to cover room service, mini-bar etc.  This is deposited back onto your card on departure minus expenses.    Luckily, I had read about this in another review, as I might have been taken aback had I not known.

When we returned later and went up to our rooms, we were really pleasantly surprised as they were modern, clean and spacious.  Our road-facing room had a mini balcony you could stand on, while our daughter’s inward facing room had a proper balcony with tables and chairs.

The hotel is in a great location for sightseeing – bang in the middle, so nowhere was too far and it is just round the corner from Grand Central Station – so transport was never a problem, although we did walk a great deal as well.   On our final day, the reception crew advised us not to travel back to airport by the metro as it was rush-hour and they said that we’d never fit our cases on the trains.  They were also concerned that we hadn’t pre-booked a cab and thought we’d never be able to flag one down on the street.  So two of them spent some time calling cab companies until they found one who was free – great customer service.

No comment on the restaurant, as we didn’t eat there, but there are plenty of places to eat breakfast, lunch and dinner close by.

Would I stay there again?  Yes – so a good choice.

title: Great Location
text: Let me start by saying that I would stay at this hotel again. The rooms were very clean, quiet and spacious. The location of this Hotel is perfect if you're wanting to stay in Mid-town. Just a short walk to Grand Central and Rockefeller Center. I was not impressed with our view off the balcony... basically a brick wall. I guess we weren't lucky enough to get a room at the front of the building facing 46th. It was ok since we didn't really spend much time in the room, too much to see and do in NYC anyway. There was not an iron and ironing board in the room, you must request the hotel to bring you one. No coffee maker in the room either, which annoyed me because I NEED my coffee ASAP in the morning... but there is a Dunkin right next to the hotel.

title: Spacious but ok
text: We stayed here in August for a night out in the city. The rooms were spacious as compared to NYC standards but the hotel and the ambience was just ok. It felt more like serviced apartment than a hotel . That said , it was very well located and great value for money .

title: The Gotham Hotel Birthday Stay
text: At no cost my room was upgraded, the balcony and a bottle of wine was waiting for me, as the Gotham Team were super friendly and helpful. The place smelled so refreshing and warm, but of all super clean. The show fixtures are very modern and easy to use. I called at anytime and the team was ready to help.

title: Great location, kind people
text: Nice, clean and cool hotel with kind people, stylish furniture and great location: I can see Madison Ave. looking out from my window. I enjoyed early online reservation as I pay less than half of last minute visitors now.

title: Perfectly place halfway between Grand Central terminal and Times Square
text: I love this place. We stayed on the 23rd floor and there was a balcony on the front of the building overlooking the street.  We were able to get grinders at the Subway sandwich shop a couple of doors away.  We brought them back to the hotel and sat on the balcony for dinner.  I felt  elegant eating a cheapo grinder in New York City 23 stories up. We booked on hotel tonight and got a great rate.

title: Great Location
text:
My overall experience of this hotel is that it met all the important features that you would wish for in New York - clean, good price and great location! 

Situated on East 46th St, you are three blocks from Grand Central and three blocks the other way to Times Square. You are only a minutes walk to 5th Avenue. Right next door you have a deli and also a great coffee shop with lovely pastries (Gregory's Coffee). You are far enough away to get a peaceful nights sleep but close enough to easily walk to everything aswell. 

As for the hotel - I would say it was modern, clean and spacious...the rooms were great, fairly big for NYC and the beds were comfortable with a memory foam mattress - also no noise whatsoever (only three other rooms on our landing). The bathroom was modern with a rain fall shower and nice toiletries. Two minor problems - the air con was noisy and the shower's temperature could be tempermental (had to leave it running a couple of minutes sometimes.) However having said that, it really didnt not impact on us too much. 

Overall, I would definitely stay at this hotel again as it ticks all the boxes!

title: Not much to look at but convenient for wlking to many of the sights.
text: On the plus side, this boutique hotel is small, clean, friendly and reasonably priced.  It is situated between 5th and 6th Aves on E 46th St so you can walk to Grand Central Station and Times Square quite easily.  The Rockefeller Centre is only three blocks north, as is Saks on 5th Ave.  The room is an adequate size and comfortable enough if like us you are out all day and most of the night and only looking for somewhere to rest your head. There is a 7/11 a block away.  On the negative side, there is construction work going on in the building opposite so if you have a front facing room the view is off scaffolding and drop sheets.  There is no coffee machine in the room nor ice machine on the floor, however, ice was brought to the room promptly on request and there are a couple of coffee house next door but they are only open during office hours .  The hotel is not near a Metro Station.  If you book an "Early Morning' call like we did to catch a flight to Niagara Falls, make sure you have a back-up. The call didn't happen which was disappointing particularly when no explanation and no apology was given, but luckily we heard the alarm set on our mobile phone.  We liked the hotel but if planning to use the metro then find a hotel closer to a station.

title: A great travel expriance
text:
From the moment I walked through the door I was greeted with open arms by Aldina she was pleasant and arranged for an upgrade:)

the rooms are NY style size but they are designed with flare and the sheets are Egyptian cotton (I suggest if you are going for business don't sleep on those beds, you just cant get up)

All around a great experience

title: Location is king
text: Walking distance from Broadway / Times Square and other NY attractions. A boutique hotel with bright and clean rooms and a very nice balcony on each floor. They also have a very nice restaurant / steakhouse that can be accessed by the hotel. We made our reservation using hotels tonight so we got a really good rate.

title: A must stay in Midtown
text: Just stayed at The Gotham and what a wonderful place to stay.  Say hello to Liela at the front desk!  What a smile!  The hotel is boutique with only 67 rooms but 25 stories!!  Skinny tall is the new black!  Also, you must try the new famed restaurant, Wolfgang's steak restaurant.  Try the Prime rib!

title: Boutique hotel: nice room and good location!
text:
We were able to upgrade to a king size room with a mini terrace so our room was pretty big.  We were on the 16th floor but on the back side of the building so we didn't have a great view but a view nonetheless.  The bathroom was nice and the shower had one of those waterfall type shower heads.  The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating.  My only complaint was that we only had the bed sheet that covered the mattress and the comforter.  I don't know if we were missing a sheet or we were supposed to use the comforter as our sheet but typically I don't use the comforter as those aren't cleaned as much as a sheet is.  We called down and asked for a second sheet.  We waited about 30 minutes until we called down again to check on the status of the sheet.  The front desk probably forgot at first but after our second call down he brought up a clean (and warm!) sheet for us.  It was an easy fix so it wasn't a big deal.  

The hotel is in a good location and was very close to a subway stop so you had access to anywhere in the city.

title: really nice hotel and right at 5th Avenue
text:
The Hotel was really clean and well decorated. The staff was very friendly and helpful, if we needed anything. The room was big and the beds very comfortable. The bathroom was nice, too. 
The only negative thing about this hotel is, that we didn`t get enough towels at the beginning, when we asked for more we just got 2 more. 
All in all this hotel was really  nice and I would recommend the stay!

title: Ci tornerei...nonostante il rumore!!!!
text: L'hotel è in una posizione ottima, il rapporto qualità prezzo è buono (considerando ovviamente che siamo a NY...noi abbiamo pronotato parecchi mesi prima e quindi siamo riusciti a pagare sui 200€ a notte, sennò costa molto di più!). La stanza era grande e pulita, l'hotel piccolo ma belle ed il personale gentile e disponibile. Purtroppo eravamo solo al 9 piano e quindi la vista era sul muro di fronte....l'unica nota davvero negativa è che nei piani bassi il rumore degli impianti di condizionamento era davvero fortissimo, non si poteva tenere la porta del balconcino aperta e se stavi fuori dovevi quasi urlare per farti sentire.

title: Feather bed had blood stains-no response from management
text: Ive stayed at Gotham previously, and the location is great. During my second stay I couldnt find a makeup brush, so pulled the sheets back to see if it fell between the headboard and mattress. OMG 3 big blood stains where i just slept (albeit w a thin sheet over). Head of housekeeping took pics, told manager-I heard nothing. Called her 4 hours later and she offered $50 off (and that hapened). Called her manager bc that wasnt close to ok-heard nothing back. Emailed her- Sara Duplijak - again heard nothing. Has been a month now with zero response.

title: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in!!!!!! Rude staff and uncaring management
text:
My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon and I've got to say its the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The location is pretty good however the service and accommodation is shocking for the price that we paid. When we arrived at the hotel, as excited newly-weds we told the receptionists that we had travelled from England as we had just got married. Both receptionist struggled to grimace a smile but said nothing. But what else did we expect because when booking the accommodation, my husband emailed the hotel and explain it was our honeymoon but they didn't have the decency to respond. 

As this was our honeymoon we paid more than we could really afford for a terraced room and looking at the pictures on their website we were really excited about this. The terrace was ridiculous and could not be used as it was too noisy from the surrounding air conditioning units (that dripped water), the noise from the road works that were ongoing throughout our two week stay and the fact that we were surrounded by office building with working staff - I understand that nothing can be done about the road works or office buildings however a warning would have been nice and there is nothing mentioned on their website about this. To me this is unacceptable and there shouldn't be an extra charge for this!!!!! We did speak to the receptionist about the room and how we felt it was not worth the money we paid and said we could either down grade our room (with no refund) or upgrade and pay extra which there was no way we could afford. The receptionist was rude, abrupt and uncaring about our stay. 

On arrival to our room we started to unpack and found a pair of used underpants and socks from a previous guest in the wardrobe. We went straight down to report this to the receptionist who offered no real apology and she could not really understand us when we spoke due to her heavy eastern European accent. In truth she seemed like she couldn't be bothered to speak to us. Eventually a handyman came up to our room to remove the underwear however did not clean anything. The fact that the underwear was even there demonstrates the level of cleanliness in the hotel. Again there was no apology and the typical rude personality from staff that seems typical of this hotel. 

The room overall was pretty nice. Our room was cleaned on most mornings however we did have a take away pizza one night and the box was there for over two days. The bed was huge and very comfortable. Through the stay I kept getting bitten, I found this really strange as I always put insect repellent on each time we went out. The only time I didn't put cream on was in the room....I truly believe that I was being bitten by bed-bugs however there was no evidence of this. Other guests from the hotel said the same thing. 

From getting back I emailed the hotel the above information, they emailed back to ask us when we stayed and the name of the booking and said they would look into it. I emailed them this information but they did not respond again. I emailed three weeks ago asking if they had found anything out but they have not responded. I explained in the email that I would be putting this review online but again there is no response. Please see our photos!

title: Très correct dans l'ensemble !
text:
L'hôtel Gotham répond aux besoins d'un vacancier à New York , les salles de bains sont très propres, jolies et rénovées, la chambre est de taille standard avec une literie correct et confortable, il est tes bien situé , le seul défaut est le bruit du climatiseur qui est à limite de l'insupportable dans la chambre.
C'est un hôtel simple et très pratique avec un service plus que correct, demandez des chambres en hauteur, plus c'est bas, plus c'est sombre, ma chambre au 2ème étage était assez triste malgré le petit balcon.

title: The Gotham Hotel, Good Location, Nice Room
text:
The room was very clean and modern. It was a great experience with the staff and the location was perfect. About a 10 minute walk to times square. I really enjoyed my stay here and would recommend to anyone visiting New York.

There isn't a batman theme =( But it was still a darker hotel which made it feel that way.

title: Good location, clean and hip.
text: Booked this hotel at a very good rate through Hotel Tonight. It has a good central location in Midtown on a quiet street. The hotel itself is modern, hip and clean. The room (#53) was large and the bathroom was good sized. There was a small balcony that overlooked nothing. The staff seemed friendly enough. Eddie the bellhop was helpful in getting a ton of luggage upstairs for us. The only drawbacks: for some reason the bed did not have a bedsheet on it, just a duvet and then an non-fitted sheet covering the mattress. We requested a bedsheet, and while it was delivered to the room, it was not put on the bed. Weird. Also, the room was stocked with just two bath towels, no floor mat, wash cloths or hand towels. We asked for more, but they were slow in arriving. The next day, the same thing... just two bath towels. Why so stingy with the towels? There's a great Gregory's Coffee shop next door, a Dunkin' Donuts down the street, and a deli on the other side of the hotel. Wolfgang's Steakhouse inside the hotel is great, too.

title: Wonderful terraces on the upper floors!!
text: We stayed here for 1 night in late June. It was a wonderful experience. We had two rooms, each had a king size bed, flat screen TV, beautifully appointed bathrooms. We did not go to the restaurant that is in the hotel. The best part of our stay was the time we spent on the terrace overlooking the street. Times Square was visible a few blocks down. The view from the room was not great, a brick wall and other rooftops. We stayed on the 23rd floor. There are only terraces above the 19th floor. The lower floors do not have them. I would stay here again. Great location, wonderful access to many reasonably priced restaurants, coffee shop next door. We went and got our coffees and brought them up to the terrace on the 23rd floor, it was beautiful weather and we enjoyed it. We would definitely stay there again.

title: Spacious room in the center of Manhattan
text:
I stayed there for 4 days and did not want to leave. The hotel has an amazing location. I have booked a standard room via hotel tonight. The size of the room was just fantastic, bigger than most of the 5 star hotels where I stayed previously, even with a balcony (not useful because it was facing the wall of another building, but great if you want to smoke). Bathroom was very spacious also with a rainforest shower and great 50ml bathroom amenities. Well stocked minibar, room was spotless, bed was very comfortable. Cosy boutique hotel with just 5 guest rooms on each floor. 
Restaurant is a Wolfgang Puck Steak restaurant, very pricy, well that's what you have to pay for a perfect steak in NYC. The only downturn, they ask you for $100 deposit for extras per day.

title: Hotel tonight
text: Booked through hotel tonight.  Got a good deal and hotel looked nice on the pictures.  Hotel is actually in a great location right by grand central and close to park avenue. Room was big by New York standards but prett bare bones inside and not super clean like you would expect.  But for a last minute hotel not a bad spot to stay.

title: In the heart of Midtown, loved it!!
text:
my mom and I took our yearly vacation and wanted to be near a lot of attractions. The Gotham hit that mark.
