We were within about a mile to Central Park, Times Square, Empire State Building, Grand Central Stations, any subway station you needed, Rockafellar Plaza, the list could go on and on. It has a DD next door to get morning coffee/bagel and Europa Cafe (LOVED) only 3blocks away. 

Staff was always really nice and willing to help.  Room was spotless, clean, bed was comfortable and design layout of entire hotel was super chic. 
room was worth every penny and would recommend it to anyone (just maybe minus the kids).

We never ate at the restaurant as we had our food places planned out. 
only small little issue is the darn corners of the wooden base of the bed frame. I saw others who had commented on same issue. the corners jet out a few inches and when you go to walk they can get you good. 

TIP FOR HOTEL STAFF-just get some bumpers or fabric to cover them and you will be good, we used our towels and we were fine.
Wonderful stay, highly recommend.

title: Extremely Dissapointing Hotel
text:
My wife and I chose this hotel to stay in for our recent honeymoon in June after hours of research. We don't normally spend a lot on accommodation when we travel abroad however given this was our honeymoon we splashed out far more than we usually would (or could really afford!). We paid extra beforehand to upgrade to a room with a terrace and king size bed as we thought it would be nice to have a terrace to look out into the city. Looking at the hotels website the terrace views looked fairly good hence the reason we paid the extra. Upon arrival we checked in and mentioned it was our honeymoon and we'd travelled all day from England to get there (this was barely even acknowledged by the staff - a simple congratulations shouldn't be too hard to muster!!). We checked in and headed up to our room on the 15th floor. Upon looking into the room it seemed nice enough - nothing spectacular but not too bad. We decided to check out the 'balcony' we had paid extra for to be greeted by a wall of noise when opening the terrace doors (see photos below and video on my profile). The tiny terrace looked out onto the back of other buildings and was directly above the air conditioning unit hence rendering it entirely unusable due to the immense noise - we couldn't open the doors for the whole 2 weeks due to this noise. I proceeded to put some of my clothes away in the wardrobe only to find a pair of dirty socks and underwear had been left in there from the previous guests. We went down to complain to the reception about both the ridiculous terrace we had paid extra money for and the dirty linen in our room. The receptionist was very difficult to understand due to speaking quietly with a strong accent however the only offer we were given despite the dirty linen in our room was a downgrade to a front facing room with no money back!!! If we wanted a better terrace we would have to pay $30 more per night.....something we simply couldn't afford. A handyman did come and remove the dirty linen whilst we were in the room (slightly awkward and uncomfortable to say the least) however he didn't even wipe down the area he took them from.

Only thing this hotel really has going for it is a decent location - wouldn't stay there and would certainly advise not to pay for a terrace room if you do!!

This hotel was the only sour point on an otherwise perfect honeymoon so thanks for that Gotham Hotel!!!

title: BED BUGS!!!
text: Stayed here with my girlfriend for 6/26/15-6/28/15 in room 31. My girlfriend woke up on the 27th with bites on her ankles.  We didn't think too much of it until the next day when I woke up with about 5 bites on my leg and ankles as well.  I also saw a bed bug at the end of the desk under the TV.  I told management before we checked out and showed them our bites.  They said they would have someone check it out - two days later they said they found nothing in our room.  They stated that they did not use dogs to search the room (which they are supposed to) and they also said they would email me a copy of the report...never received it.

title: Muy recomendable
text: Con una ubicación de privilegio, este hotel de habitaciones no muy grandes, tiene un encanto particular, quizá sea su característica "boutique" y un precio razonable, lo que hizo que lo eligiéramos para nuestra estadía.

title: Fabulous!!!
text: This boutique hotel is above and beyond NYC standards with million dollar views, a luxury comfy bed and a huge multi jet rain shower. We had a private balcony where were drank wine had a view across town. The staff were fabulous and we were more than impressed. A perfect stay! Five star hotel accommodation for budget conscious travelers. A gem!!!

title: Gran ubicación!
text:
Fuimos a este hotel con mi mamá de vacaciones, nos encantó el hotel en cuanto a ubicación, limpieza y servicio. 
Está situado al lado de la 5ta avenida, cerca del grand central y a pocas cuadras de times square.
Había comprado por internet unas cosas y las envié al hotel, al hacer el check in nos entregaron todos los paquetes sin ningún problema, además todos los días la atención del personal fue muy amable.
El único problema es el restorán tomamos una vez desayuno que si bien no está incluido lo tuvimos que pagar un domingo ya que no había nada abierto, tenían poca variedad y la calidad de los productos no era la mejor. Además una noche comimos ahí, la comida no estaba buena, era caro y tenía poca onda.
Lo recomiendo de todas maneras! Solo hay que tratar de evitar el restorán!

title: Perfect location! Clean!!!
text:
My wife and I recently stayed at The Gotham hotel July 5th-8th 2015. We got a great deal ($720CAN) for three nights which is the main reason we booked it, but only after reading some good reviews on cleanliness on trip advisor.
The reviews were bang on! The hotel itself is not your typical big hotel, very New York actually. But everything was clean. The lobby, the elevators, the hallways, and most importantly the rooms!!! No bugs anywhere. And believe me I tried to find them!
The hotel staff was friendly, the door was always opened for us when coming and going. 
Aside from cleanliness and price, the best thing is the location!!! Right in the heart of Midtown. Times Square, Rockafellar Centre, Grand Central all within two blocks!! There is a great breakfast restaurant next door called FoodWorld with tonnes of selection and very inexpensive, only open for breakfast and lunch. But very convenient for breaky.
We would definitely stay here again. Truth of the matter is we were never in our room anyways. But when we were, we were very comfortable, AC, comfy bed! Clean!!!!!

title: Quick trip
text: Nice hotel. Not far from time square. The deserts at Wolfgang's was the best. Free wifi.. The staff was wonderful helpful. We ask for extra towels and luggage rate, to arrange a car for the morning . They did very thing quickly .Great place to stay.

title: Frechheit
text: Lage und Ausstattung des Hotels sind gut ABER direkt gegenüber wird ein Hochhaus komplett umgebaut und um 7:00 ist spätestens die Nacht zu Ende da dann der Presslufthammer ausgepackt wird. Die Mangerin findet dies absolut normal und war nicht bereit uns in irgendeiner Weise entgegen zu kommen. Es gibt einen schönen öffentlich Balkon in der 19 Etage der aber leider nicht nutzbar ist weil man sein eigenes Wort nicht verstehen kann. Baustelle ok aber man hätte darüber bei Buchung informieren müssen, zumal die Baustelle bis 2017 geplant ist.

title: Not Good at Customer Service
text:
It's my first time in NY so I have this adrenaline thing going on when we (together with my husband, sis-in-law and her bf) finally arrived in this hotel. I'll write down my experience in details to give the other travelers an idea what to expect if ever they'd choose this hotel.

1) Arrival- The doorman greeted us nicely which is good but the receptionist didn't even have the charm to offer the water that we saw on the sides upon getting in.  She was haggard-looking, stressed at such early time(we arrived around lunch) and was just as less energetic with accommodating our luggages(not a good "welcome personnel").  What's frustrating here is that 10 mins before 2pm, our room was still NOT ready! (we drove for more than 10 hours to get here). A minute after two people came in, that finally pushed her to say that they're preparing our rooms already..yep not so smooth getting in.

2) The Room- It's big enough and also comfortable. Bed is very comfortable(queen size) with good pillows too. Bathroom is clean, complete with basic stuff you'll need (vanity set, soap, etc). There's 1 complimentary bottled water in the room. TV and cable channels are superb.  Unfortunately, our aircon was not working--it took almost an hour for us to get transferred to another one with good AC.

3) The Lobby-  It's a nice, small place that's good enough to serve its purpose to receive guests. There's no restroom here so you'd either have to go back to your room or go to the basement(Shared with employees) for any emergency.
4) The Location- Perfect location to walk around NY--very accessible to all(as in right in the heart of 5th avenue, Times Square, etc). 
5) The Bar- We were never tempted to try it.

After our stay, we(3 of us) decided that we'll just drink some water in the reception area prior to the drive back home--unfortunately glasses were not available. Worst part is we asked more than three times(!) to request for glasses so that we can quench our thirst--nobody came and not even one exerted an effort to try harder(apparently they are out of glasses even in the bar!).  That receptionist was the worst in customer service ! We left the hotel (after almost an hour of waiting) still without the glasses--really frustrating for us as we're really thirsty.  We ended up just buying bottled water outside.

Overall, the hotel is nice enough-- location is awesome! But the management needs to train their staff more when it comes to customer service--this factor after all, really sets one good hotel apart from the rest.

title: Sleek and quiet rooms
text: Nice hotel, modern and very clean. Staff were helpful and friendly. We stayed during July 4th weekend, most store or cafes on this street were closed. The area was little too quiet. Room was good size for New York City, with a little balcony.

title: Big space for a not big price
text:
This hotel delivers big on space and comfort.  The king room that I had there was spacious with a good size footprint, a lovely terrace, and a big bathroom.  The "separate" living area was a nice bonus.  I've since returned and will make it my regular hotel when working in the city.  

My only complaint is that there is no clock in the room.

title: Perfect Location - OK Stay
text:
Lots of good things, a few more bad things than we would've liked.

Firstly, let me start off by saying the staff were lovely. There were a couple of new recruits who were learning the ropes so we thought perhaps they have a fairly high turnover of staff. Or we'd just booked when a few people had left out of coincidence. The staff did everything they could to help us when necessary.

Teething problems such as no glass of wine on arrival as promised on booking. The bar inside is not affiliated with the hotel which we found very strange, so this request was met with some confusion. However, they do make a mean Negroni, even if the bar staff look very stressed out and ready to go home. I felt a bit like they were putting on a front for customers and didn't realise we could see their frustration and stress. I know the feeling back in the real world!

I had contacted the hotel a couple of times before to get confirmation on some things, namely that we requested a high room (as high as our price bracket would allow). It was difficult to get in touch - they never responded to emails apart from an exchange of emails I had with someone about booking a car to collect and drop off at JFK (very expensive, I wouldn't recommend), but twice before then my emails had been ignored (or lost in the fray). I had to phone them twice to confirm things but eventually got told we were booked on the 10th floor in a front-facing room. Great! We were very happy with this until we turned up and were told we were actually booked on a 4th floor room because they had 'upgraded' us to a better room and ergo, a better bed. That wasn't really the point of my request: to have a better bed. The point was to be higher up. I've been to NYC a few times before so, like a lot of people, I know what to look for in a hotel room, especially in Midtown. Height is important to me in NYC as I love to watch the city go by and light up, so we were disappointed with this change. They'd obviously bumped us 'down' for another guest because an 'upgrade' was the only explanation they could offer as to why we have moved from floor 10 to floor 4 and they didn't have any rooms to change us to that evening. We didn't want to cause too much of a fuss as the staff were being as nice as possible about it so we took the room on the proviso that we could change before 12pm the next day. We decided to stay, the room was very large for NYC and the building across the street (the glass building in the photos) was shrouded in a black gauze as it was being worked on so there was hardly much of a view anyway - apart from if you looked up at the other buildings. Oh well, we thought. Until we heard the construction noise at 7am. Not much we could do about it, though! 

I slept with earplugs... 

There were a few problems with noise - lots of slamming doors and at one point the lift doors were making a horrible screeching sound on our floor but they did fix it within 24 hours. There was a little bit of construction work on the last day we were there which was incredibly loud in reception when we were trying to settle up. I understand these things are circumstantial but it was one of a few noise issues that disappointed us.

In general, the room was gorgeous. We had a huge TV, huge bedroom, huge bed, huge shower (you can see a theme here, right?). The balcony was tiny but we didn't care, just having an outside space was nice and quite frankly if you want to sit out on the balcony you're going to have to pay a little more than we did! That's fine, just not something we could afford this time around.

The location was perfect, situated a 5 minute walk to Times Square - we did so much walking around Midtown and the park which is also not far at all. We only got cabs or the subway far downtown when we needed to. 

Overall, I would stay here again once they've finished construction on the building opposite and when we could afford a higher room with a wider balcony, but I think they're working out some kinks right now (or we just went at an awkward time). However, the staff were really the standout point for us as they were incredibly helpful in often quite difficult situations and always made sure to do what they said they were going to do. Thanks for the stay, guys! And hopefully when we've stayed again I will write a more glowing review! :D

title: Muito Bom
text: Hotel muito bom! O quarto do hotel era muito novo e bonito, a cama macia e confortável. Localização excelente ao lado da 5ª avenida e apenas alguns minutos a pé do Central Park. O café da manhã estava muito bom. Eu voltaria com certeza neste hotel.

title: Wish it had been slightly different
text:
So this is a hard one for me. I really really really wanted to like this place. Hard facts:  I stayed from June 26-28, 2015 in the Skyline King room on the 10th floor (room 101).

The pros: LOCATION is perfect, room was HUGE, nice terrace with tables and chairs, agents all very friendly and clearly work hard to please their guests. Also, they are very patient with guests who are upset (ahem, yours truly) and do not hold a grudge or treat you badly after the issue you lost your cool about is resolved. 

That all said there are a few reasons I won't return to The Gotham Hotel and they are as follows:

1. Something is wrong with their check in process / computer system (this is the issue I lost my cool about). They ran a charge the morning of my stay before I arrived as they should for the first night. When I arrived they ran a 'hold' on the card I gave them to check in - 10am ET. I was told my room wasn't ready, but they showed me where I could sit and work - great! I finished my business, room was still not ready so I went for a walk. Came back thinking they would just give me my room key (it was well after 4pm) and I could go get ready to meet my friends. But...

The desk agent said she needed my credit card again. I asked why because I gave it to them this morning. She said she needs to put the hold for the second night and it isn't in my folio. Ummm, ok, why didn't they say that in the morning when I checked in? I reluctantly handed her my card and the charge came back declined. I called my credit card company and they tell me the hotel had already been approved for two separate holds and they've tried to charge my card a total of FOUR times! OMG, WHAT?!? So, I'm standing there not knowing who I should be angry with - credit card company or hotel. On the hotel's side, they honestly could not see that the charge for the second portion of my stay had been approved - I saw the log myself - when they kept running the hold the multiple runs kicked off the fraud protection on my card (duh) LOL. Needless to say I got a little "yelly" but the staff was great, they stayed calm and talked to my credit card agent, the agent cleared the last three charges and ran the second charge again without incident. Whew, got my room, I'm good. Thanks. This was a headache for me and the staff at the hotel. Whatever is wrong with their system needs to be fixed. Also, next time they get a decline in the am at check in they should tell the guest right then, not wait until the guest returns after check-in time and surprise them with that nonsense. AND I have to wait a bit to make sure the charges are correct - wish me luck!

2. Shower was great on day 1 and day 2, but for some reason when I got back to the hotel my second night and wanted to shower, the hot water didn't work as well. I didn't complain thinking maybe a lot of people were using hot water at that time. But the morning I checked out the water was also cold in the shower, but not from the sink - what the?

3. Terrace flooded because of the rain - I told the front desk and they fixed it immediately, but honestly, it was a big pain in the butt for me and I just think that at the rate I paid I shouldn't have had to deal with multiple problems each day.

4. No coffee in room, charged $4.50 for a very small cup of not so great coffee from the bar. This is just stupid. They don't have that many rooms and could easily put a coffeemaker in each one for guests to use.

Overall, 4 headaches = not worth the price. I won't return. Again, very sad because the staff works so hard and really wants to be accommodating, in many ways they are just set up to fail. Not cool.

title: aspettative deluse
text: Nulla da dire sulla posizione, direi ottima. All'arrivo l'impatto del servizio è stato molto positivo, ma giunti nella camera posta al secondo piano le prime delusioni non si sono fatte attendere. Apparentemente pulito, ma una volta giunti sul balconcino, la visuale era pessima con tanto di parte non accessibile a noi simile a un posacenere ( il giorno dopo il nostro arrivo il balconcino è stato pulito). Dopo poche ore , nonostante avessimo pagato prima di partire , ci sono stati bloccati più di 400 euro sulla carta, sbloccati ben 4 giorni dopo la nostra partenza. Abbiamo soggiornato 8 giorni, al terzo nel pomeriggio mi sono trovato uno scarafaggio dentro una scarpa e uno sulla moquette . Abbiamo tempestivamente avvisato il personale che ha provveduto a pulire. Personalmente non ci torneremo più

title: Ottimo!
text:
Piccolo Hotel nel cuore della 5th avenue, inizialmente ero un po scettico al momento della prenotazione, non essendo appartenente alle solite grandi catene avevo qualche dubbio ma ho voluto provare. Arrivato a Nyc mi sono resto conto di aver scelto veramente un ottimo hotel, niente a che vedere con i soliti mega hotel all'americana, questo albergo offre solo due grandi camere per ogni piano con uno esclusivo di una corte esterna alle camere con rispettivo terrazzo con tavolo e sedie dove potersi rilassare nei periodi che lo permettono, personalmente sono andato con la mia famiglia quindi avevo presto due camere e abbiamo potuto quindi usufruire in maniera esclusiva del nostro piano! la camere poi veramente eccellenti, spaziose, letto gigante e di una comodità che ancora ricordo con tanta nostalgia, bagno grande e comodo.
Infine il personale estremamente cordiale e di livello. 
Piacevole trovare sempre un bicchiere di vino bianco al proprio rientro in albergo per rilassarsi dopo una giornata in giro per la città! ottimo omaggio da parte dell'hotel!

title: Locked out of our room for 2+ hours.
text: We chose the Gotham because of reviews, location, and the TripAdvisor award the hotel received.  The hotel's internet listed room service as one of it's amenties - unfortunately we learned they did not offer it - so after a long day of sightseeing, we went out for dinner.  When we returned to the hotel our room keycard would not work and we could not get back in our room.  After several trips to the front desk and new keycards made we could still not get into our room.  Next came the maintenance people at the hotel - after several trys - they still were unable to unlock the door.  We were told that the head maintenance person was being called in and would be there in about 30 minutes - 1 1/2 hours later he arrived. Still no luck opening the door - one of the maintenance people told us the last time that happened he had to go through the room next door and climb over the balcony to unlock the door.  So they decided to try the same approach - which I was very nervous about - since our room was on the 7th floor - and a wall separated the two balconies.  One more try with the keycard and the door opened.   After 2+ hours sitting in a hot hall floor we finally gained access to our room, around midnight.  Only one little problem - no one could get the keycard to work again - which meant that either my wife or I had to stay in the room so we would not get locked out - talk about inconvenience.  And what did we receive for this inconvenience after bringing it to the attention of the Manager?  $50 off our room - totally unacceptable.  First and last time at the Gotham!

title: Nice
text: We stayed here for 4 nights and we enjoyed are stay. The hotel is in a great location right on 5th avenue and about a 5 minute walk to Times Square. The staff at the hotel were always friendly and were always happy to help. The room was spacious and always clean. All in all you probably don't spend much time in a hotel whilst in Manhattan and it was ideal for what we wanted. Would stay here again.

title: Ok but small issues are annoying
text: This hotel is in a great location.  It is modern and the staff are welcoming.  We thought we would enjoy staying here but there are little problems that let this place down.  For instance our air conditioner did not work.  They kept telling us it was fixed but it wasn't and the room was getting stuffier.  We only had one bath towel and had to ask several times for another towel.  It was as if we had to really lose it with them before they would rectify the situation.  The next day they moved us to another room where the air conditioner worked better.  However it was so noisy like a jet taking off every 20 minutes or so.  The hot water takes ages to come on in the shower.  Another day for some reason we had only hot water coming out of the tap.  They were very apologetic but we think our stay could have been better.  It is really poor form to keep telling customers that problems are fixed and they go back to their room and it's not fixed.

title: Good hotel, but poor attention to detail
text:
We chose the Gotham hotel as it was well located between Times Square and Grand Central Station, and is a great base to take in Midtown from. 

The hotel was good quality, with large room, large bed, good storage etc, but bizarrely the little touches were missing, such as: 
- Booked a deluxe room, but it only had a single towel, single bathrobe, slippers etc, even though they knew the room was booked for 2 people 
- Requested more towels, which came promptly, but as the days progressed, these disappeared each day, one by one, until we were returned back to one. This was despite us not putting them into laundry & asking for replacements (we're happy re-using towels over a few nights), they still disappeared. The same thing happened with the complimentary toiletries - not a big problem, but it felt odd.
- no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. 

The stay was good, and the staff on reception were excellent, friendly and helpful - it just felt like the service staff weren't delivering quite the same level of service as the rest of the hotel.

title: Просто и лаконично
text: Отель - супер! Находится в самом центе Манхеттена, "в двух шагах" от Таймс сквер. Современный, уютный. Номера отличные. Были всего 2 ночи. Заселили в номер с окнами во двор, но после первой ночи потек потолок, нам предложили переехать в другой номер. Нам не очень хотелось переезжать, так как оставался всего денек до отъезда. Но администратор настоял, и в счет компенсации за неудобство нам подарили бутылочку шампанского, которую мы и приговорили в тот же вечер ))) В новом номере был шикарный балкон, от куда открывался чудесный вид на East 46th Street. Отель очень понравился, тихо, спокойно - то что нужно, чтоб отдохнуть от шумного, головокружащего (в хорошем смысле) Нью-Йорка.

title: Having a terrace was awesome!
text: the boutique hotel was great for our one night stay.  we had a room on the 10th floor and the terrace was huge.  the room itself was very large with a separate sitting area.  the bed incredibly comfortable and the sheets very clean and soft.

title: Great Boutique Hotel in a convenient part of east midtown
text:
I regularly travel to NYC for business and have stayed at many of the hotels in the east midtown area. This hotel does not disappoint and provides great value for being so close to Grand Central. The rooms are spacious (by NYC standards), clean, and modern in their design. The floor-to-ceiling windows are a nice touch and provide ample light and views (when available). 

The rooms came appointed with pretty much everything you might need, but they are missing a coffee/tea maker, which would have been preferred. Employees were all very friendly and attentive and made sure your stay was great while you were there. I will definitely put this hotel in the mix for my future business trips to NYC.

title: Ottima posizione, moderno e pultio
text:
Hotel situato in ottima posizione, vicino alla stupenda Grand Central Station da dove è possibile prendere agevolmente la metro, a pochi metri dalla quinta e da altre importanti attrazioni. Moderno, pulito, buona insonorizzazione, camere di media grandezza. Il personale è gentile e disponibile per informazioni e consigli.
Lo consiglio.

title: Overall, great for the price, so long as the charges match the agreed price booked.
text: I'll start by stating that my stay was only marred by the fact that a previously cancelled booking was still charged (at least a portion) to my credit card, however that didn't deter from the actual stay (and the front desk did what they could to get the charges taken off.) Regarding billing, I was not made aware ahead of time that there would be an incidentals charge that had to be paid along w/ the cost of the room. Maybe I should travel more,  but I wasn't familiar with this charge. I stayed during the Memorial Day weekend and got a relatively great rate for the area. This hotel is in a great location, and within walking distance within the area of Manhattan that most of the tourist attractions area. I personally really liked the fact that the hotel, especially for the price, didn't feel so closed in. Large for a queen room @ 220 sq ft. Would recommend this place, and would most likely stay again as well.

title: Molto bello
text: Hotel molto centrale, vicino a qualsiasi punto turistico in nyc.  Stanza molto grande addirittura con balconcino. Molto pulito, personale cordiale e disponibile. Ho trascorso solo una notte ma ci tornerei sicuramente. Un po' caro ma siamo a nyc

title: Very nice stay with future potential
text: My wife and I stayed here over the Memorial Day weekend.  I picked up a nice rate on one of the travel websites which made for an even better experience.  The hotel is a small, boutique hotel - in which they are remodeling their restaurant (Wolfgang's Steakhouse) so no food there.  We stayed on the second floor - which I read other's reviews to upgrade to go higher - but with the terraces - it seemed no matter which floor you are on - you'd still be facing a brick wall to the back of the hotel.  Maybe for the front of the hotel it would help - but you're still facing 46th street with not too much to see.  The room itself was great for NYC - fairly large, comfortable bed and the best part was the bathroom - the shower was a tiled, large walk in - with a rain head shower and wand.  The part that made it even better is that I'm 6'7" so usually I'm cramped or need to bend down -not this shower! - I could actually raise my hands and still not hit the shower head!  So if you are 6 foot +, this is a great stay!  They also have some items in the room (drinks, chips) - but they are at the usual very high prices so I would suggest bringing in your own.  There is a nice wine/liquor store across the street which is great if you're up for a drink in the room.  My only complaint would be - around 10:15 pm and again at 2:15 am - the staff made a huge disturbance in the hallway - with what I believe was bringing down bins of linens or maybe trash?  But it went on for about 10 minutes and sounded like they were banging the carts into the walls or pushed them down the stairs?  So overall - great stay if you get a good price.  We found the staff to be very polite and helpful.

title: decent stay in place
text: If you are looking for a place for a comfortable stay in Manahattan, Gotam hotel has the peace for a good night sleep. It has a perfect location, so close to times square. Donot expect too many amenities at the hotel. Only a cozy room to stay with a mini-bar, television and a decent bathroom.

title: I have hope for this hotel
text: The hotel seems to be undergoing some changes. A few new staff at the front desk, floors are being renovated and the resturant is now Wolfgang's Steakhouse (closed for breakfast during our stay) Stayed over the Memorial weekend in the Skyline Room. First off if you are staying during the week, be prepared for some early morning and ongoing noise as the building across the street is going through a complete reno, it's currently just a shell.  Door staff need to pick up their game with regards to taking of luggage and interaction with hotel guests.   I actually held the door open for one of them and they actually walked though first.  Doesn't bother me at all but not really the way you should dealing with your guests.   They were late with the room and sent up a bottle which was very nice, we don't drink, so they replaced it with a few bottles of Fiji water.  Room was clean although missing toiletries, bed was very comfortable and love the terrace facing the street.  It was great sitting out there at night with a coffee. Would I stay there again?   I would, as long as I got a great deal.  If the rate is the same as say the Bryant Park Hotel no.   Like my title says, I have hope for them.  They need to improve in some areas and they do have a couple staff that you can tell are trying to rise up a level.  If they can get there, it will be a nice boutique hotel.

title: Very nice boutique hotel
text:
We stayed here for one night over Memorial Day weekend and were not disappointed. The room was clean, spacious, and had a nice King-sized bed. Although our room had a balcony, we were located on the back of the hotel, therefore with a limited view.  Still it was a nice stay at an affordable price for NYC.

My only criticism would be that the restaurant was undergoing renovations and not open for breakfast.  It would have been nice for the hotel to have suggested somewhere upon check-in, or provided a coupon for a future date.

Otherwise, our stay, albeit brief, was very nice.

title: A real find!
text: This hotel is located on an unassuming block of east 46th between 5th and Park.  Very modern design without being trendy.   The staff were excellent.  I went through orbitz for my reservation and the hotel staff called and worked everything out.  The room was huge by New York standards, and I mean this as the highest compliment.  This was a big room.  Nice Juliet balcony.  My room faced the street and I didn't hear any street noise.  The hotel had what appeared to be a nice restaurant that served breakfast and dinner, but it was closed for renovations.  Very reasonable rates.  I would definitely stay here again!

title: Excellent location but expect some slight defects...
text: The hotel is really ideally situated and the staff is polite. The rooms are clean and bathroom is very well equipped. Do not spend too much on balconies as they are probably overlooking the wall. What can be quite annoying is the sound of ventilation if your room is close to the roof. However it is quite possible to enjoy the hotel despite this. Bedding ( we required a king size bed) was perfect! The staff helped us to book our shuttle back to the airport and even though there was a problem <with the company, they sorted it out for us quite effectively. All in all we enjoyed our stay very much!

title: Cute and in good location
text: This was a comfortable hotel in a good location for where I needed to be.  Their restaurant was undergoing some work at the time so there was no food available in the hotel.  But aside from that inconvenience of having no room service, it was a nice stay.

title: Very Good!
text: When we arrived all the staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming. The room was very clean, modern, and bright. The bathroom was just as nice. the balcony was okay, not the view we had wished but otherwise a very great- overall had a wonderful stay.

title: Nice room and balcony, BUT charge me wrong, and did not refund me
text: I just stay one night. I stay in Skyline Suite room with Terrace. The room is nice. The bed is comfortable. The terrace is good. The bathroom is also nice and clean. I like the hotel and the location is pretty nice. BUT after I checked out the afternoon, they charge me a ginger ale in the minibar. I did not drink or take the ginger ale. I called to the hotel. They did not refund me. Be careful when you stay in the Gotham hotel.

title: Cool boutique hotel
text: Did Hotwire and got a great price. Upgraded to a 23rd floor room and it was really quiet for NYC. Really large for NYC too. Nice room. Terrace was nice although it's direct view was a blank building. Could have further upgraded to a really good view. Still was nice to be able to go outside. There was another shared terrace on the other side of the building with a much better view. Everything went fine. No way to get coffee but they seemed to say I could get it from the restaurant in the morning. Went to one of the at least 3 espresso places on the block though. Only 2 rooms on my floor I never did figure out exactly what the building uh was. Amazing location though between Madison and Fifth.

title: Great Location but a bad Sleep Experience
text:
We arrived at the Hotel at 3.00 for a 4 night stay and only had to wait a few minutes to get our room (113 on the 11th floor) .We were attracted to the Gotham because of its location and the outside terrace. In practice the terrace was unusable as it was just opposite the roof of an adjoining building and consequently the noise of the air conditioning was very loud. In addition the terrace was very dark and surrounded by taller buildings. The Room was fine and the shower excellent (but you need to wait a long time for the water to heat up). We had trouble with the air conditioning and together with the bed (which had a clinging mattress topper arrangement) and the noise from the adjoining air conditioning sleep was poor. Other reviewers have also mentioned that the rooms are very dark, a sentiment we agree with. Staff were very friendly but there were language problems as not all receptionists spoke clearly (they had heavy , not American, accents.).
We had breakfast in the hotel a couple of mornings for 16 dollars each, It was very average but convenient. Few people seemed to use the Hotel restaurant / bar at any time of the day. Location is excellent and we walked to many of the local attractions (Empire state Building about 20 mins , Rockefeller Centre about 6 mins , Times Square 10 mins etc). We used taxis for some trips downtown and found them convenient and reasonable.
An OK hotel that for us was spoilt by the very poor sleep experience.

title: The Gotham Hotel
text: Super bem localizado, na área central de NYC. Fica a 5 minutos de caminhada da Times Square. Próximo de quase tudo. Quarto muito bom, cama gostosa, banheiro espaçoso, frigobar, bom atendimento e preço justo.

title: Lovely Hotel
text: This was our first time in New York and the Gotham was a great base. Very clean boutique hotel. We stayed on 17th floor so nice and quiet. Small terrace with a side view of the city but any outside space is a bonus. Room was spotless with a really comfortable bed. Staff were very efficient and friendly. Would definitely return.

title: Ótima escolha
text:
Excelente localização, quartos amplos, bom preço e bom atendimento.
Minha cama possuía uma espécie de edredom sobre o colchão que era irregular e tive dificuldade de dormir confortavelmente por conta disso.
O chuveiro demorava para regular, mas me adaptei.
O wiffi é gratuito, mas nem todos os dias eu conseguia me manter conectada.
A região é movimentada e o barulho noturno me atrapalhou um pouco.
Acho que estes detalhes são pequenos e facilmente resolvíveis (exceto o barulho da rua).
O custo-benefício é excelente. Já fiquei em outro hotéis na região central, com custo equivalente, e este foi o melhor.

title: muy bien situado
text: nos gusto mucho , bien situado entre la gran central y time square , moderno y limpio , desayunabamos fuera , pero en la misma puerta tienes dos sitios , y segun la epoca , en mi caso abril , puedes encontrar habitacion a muy buen precio para lo que es NY , recomendado 100%

title: Pleasant weekend stay.
text: Great staff. Had a skyline room on tenth floor. Not much to look at but nice to have a huge balcony for some air, comfortable bed. Small hotel, no crowds, very close to everything midtown. Nice change from large chain touristy hotels.  Tenpenny great for drinks and a meal. Wonderful bartender. My room needed a full length mirror. Thats about the only negative I have.

title: Boutique hotel with unique qualities.
text: We stayed here during a last minute quick trip to NYC. Love that I found this hotel-it has a really nice balcony large windows we had a beautiful view. On to the not so good part- our air conditioning wasn't working but they did everything they could to help us out. We loved that they had a balcony in the hall on our floor of the hotel it was really enjoyable to sit out there to take everything in. If I'm in NYC again I would not mind staying here again. Comfortable beds and nice rain shower.

title: Good Place to Stay!
text: Stayed in The Gotham Hotel in January 2015, vacation time! The hotel is adorable! everything was perfect: well located, rooms very clean and comfortable, bathroom modern and new, but the shower took a little time to warm up. The restaurant (Tenpenny) is not that cheap, but the food is good and has a good customer service with friendly people. Internet connection worked very well. Didn't have any kind of issue there.

title: Great Location
text:
I was in New York for business and I chose this hotel because it was very close to the offices.

The room wasn't ready when I arrived at 3:15 and I had to wait 15 minutes, but I wasn’t alone, another couple were waiting too, and the next day I noticed other guests had arrived and were waiting, and they were checking in at 4:15. I think they need more staff to clean the rooms if they can’t be ready for the 3:00 PM check in time. 

I had a queen room, modern, clean and not a bad size for New York. As for decor, there isn't one painting or photograph adorning the walls in the room, unusual for a hotel, but fine. It's too cold to enjoy the balcony, but it is too noisy to have the door open anyway. The building across the street is being renovated and the exterior is completely shrouded in protective netting. I asked at the front desk and it's been going on for about 6 months, so I expect it to continue for a while. After the rush hour finishes the night crew start working on disposing of the debris, the noise from the heavy trucks and the crashing rubble goes on until after midnight. If you are a light sleeper bring earplugs, as it’s not just the construction outside the window, but inconsiderate guests outside your door at 4:00 AM having a chin wag that’ll wake you up.

The first day it took a long time for the hot water in the shower, turn it on and run it for a minute, it only began to get hot when I was finished my shower, but it was better the next day. The robes are great and a welcome warm snuggle after your shower.

The hotel is located very close to Grand Central station and a half an hour walk from Penn Station. 

They have a restaurant, check out my review of Ten Penny for their dinner menu. I did try the breakfast buffet one day as I was in a hurry; it’s nothing special, scrambled eggs and bacon in a steamer, fresh fruit and super market croissants. The buffet is half price for hotel guests at $15, but if you have the time to go out, you should, as the food at breakfast is a little lack luster.

Overall, I liked the hotel for its location, cleanliness and free Wi-Fi. I will definitely stay here again.

title: Average - good location - needs updating
text:
There was nothing drastically wrong with this hotel however being a boutique hotel I expected a bit more of a personal touch.  The staff on arrival didn't welcome us to the hotel/NYC.  It just felt like they were going through a process. I expected it to feel a bit more personal. May as well have stayed at a big chain.

The room was fine, however it could do with a little update.  Carpet a bit worn, nets a bit black & there was a hole in the wall between the Wall and floor, however it was hidden by the curtains. 

The TV had a great choice of channels, the bed was very comfortable, I loved the pillows.  The shower was great too, although give it a few moments to warm up. The room felt quite dark, it could do with better lighting. One lamp was broken they sent someone twice to look at it but it never worked so we stopped asking.

We were on the second floor, so you do hear the road, but its a city what do you expect. 

One thing that did annoy me... after we checked out we left our luggage at the hotel.  When going back to collect it we asked to use the restroom to be told there was a photoshoot going on with no other offer or suggestion.  Not great customer service especially as that is our last memory of the hotel.

title: Vários prós e alguns contras
text: O hotel tem tudo para encantar: não é muito grande, tem quartos limpos, espaçosos e novos; o staff, em sua maioria, é agradável e é muito bem localizado. Porém, tive alguns prolemas que contribuíram para a falta de excelência, ainda que tenham potencial. No ato da reserva, solicitei quarto com duas camas, somente no momento do check in fui informada de que não tinham quartos assim e não poderiam me atender. Ou seja, se você for com amigos ou familiares e quiser ter seu próprio canto para dormir, vá para outro hotel. As funcionárias do front desk não são lá um primor de simpatia. É preciso ter paciência com a falta de jogo de cintura. Todos os demais, por sua vez, esbanjam a simpatia e cuidado que faltam a elas. E o problema da água é um fato. Vi alguns relatos antes de viajar, e enfrentei o mesmo problema. Para tomar banho quente no frio abaixo de zero de NY, você precisará reclamar o ajuste. Tem tudo para ser ótimo, mas falta um pouco de cuidado no tratamento do hóspede antes e durante a estadia.

title: Comfort e posizione strategica
text: Ho soggiornato per nove notti  in una camera deluxe con letto king size al settimo piano. Camera spaziosa e pulita, bagno con doccia enorme. Prodotti da bagno,cassaforte,frigobar e asciugacapelli in dotazione. Balcone con vista sul cortile interno e quindi più silenziosa. Posizione ottima praticamente  sulla quinta strada e a breve distanza da times square e dalle attrazioni principali. Wifi gratuita e ben funzionante. Presente al suo interno un ristorante di buona qualità,  consiglio di andarci almeno una volta per cena. Nelle vicinanze si trova il locale Red Flame che offre ottime colazioni/brunch...andateci e non ve ne pentirete! Unico appunto: nonostante avessimo pagato l'hotel interamente già dall'italia, ci hanno "bloccato" all'arrivo sulla carta di credito circa 300 dollari come cauzione, denaro che ci é stato riaccreditato alla fine del soggiorno.

title: Terrible customer service
text: The Gotham Hotel charged me $45 for a bottle of wine that I purchased at a local liquor store and brought to my room.  Their housekeeping staff claimed I took it from the mini bar.  I have left four messages with the manager, but no one has returned my call.  This is an unbelievable scam!  Do not stay here.

title: Terrible customer service!
text: This hotel doesn't deserve a star. Terrible customer service, cancelled a reservation with them over the phone and weeks later they still charged me for a stay I never came for! Make sure they give you a cancel reference over the phone, cancellation confirm through email, and document every call otherwise they will completely rip you off!

title: Excellent location, spacious rooms, attentive service, nice find
text: I found this hotel on a discount website that revealled the name after purchase.  What a nice surprise!  Located within walking distance of broadway, 5th Ave, Grand Central, yet on a quiet block.  Rooms are spacious and comfortable.  We had a rear facing room that was so quiet we slept long past our usual wake up time.  Decor is basic and modern, not upscale or trendy.  Some may find it lacking personality.  If you're looking for character this may not be the right find for you.  I would stay here again.

title: Bien ubicado
text:
Estuve en este hotel en el mes de noviembre y tuvimos una buena experiencia. El hotel no es muy grande, es de pocas habitaciones en comparación con otros hoteles de Nueva York, lo que permite una mejor relación con el personal. El desayuno tenía que pagarlo aparte, y no era muy abundante pero para nosotros era suficiente (el primer día no habían muchos panecillos, le pedí al encargado y me consiguió algun que otro pan, pero tuvo la deferencia de decirme que no me iba a cobrar el desayuno por los inconvenientes y así fue). Tiene wifi gratis, cosa diferente a otros hoteles aunque personalmente tenía problemas de conexión desde la habitación por lo cual tenía que bajar al lobby del hotel para poder conectarme sin problemas.
En resumen una opción recomendable, aunque no tengo claro su costo porque fuimos por razones laborales y estaba cubierto por la compañía.

title: Not for a long stay!
text:
Pro's:
Staff are approachable
Free Wifi
Heaps of Free TV Channels
Local phone calls are free

Cons':
Linen on bed is terrible and heat trapping
Staff don't follow through with all requests
Breakfast is terrible and overpriced
No kitchen amenities (Kettle, microwave, etc.)

Experience:
- food in Tenpenny restaurant downstairs is amazing
-Our wifi dropped out for 3 days and we were told it was due to construction outside which was clearly a lie
-the breakfast was scrambled eggs and bacon which were cold and fruit and pastries which were nice but still not worth it. 
- we downgraded bed size for a higher floor. the king bed is not needed as the room is still the same size. the highest floor we could get was 8 which was not good anyway.
- the hot water took so long to heat up (might have been because of the cold weather) to the point of us having to run the hot water for 20 minutes before the temperature was bearable

Conclusion:
I would say there for a night or two but any longer and some of the luxuries that were missing really started to matter to us so i would not recommend this to anyone who wants to stay longer than that.

title: Cheio de Problemas
text: Nova York está a -10 graus Celsius e pelo terceiro dia consecutivo tenho problemas para ter água quente para tomar banho. Só consigo depois de reclamar muito e esperar o reparo por mais de uma hora. O mesmo acontece com o aquecedor do quarto... Não esquenta! Fiz 4 reclamações em 3 dias! Apesar da boa aparência e boa limpeza, com estes problemas básicos não pode ser considerado 4 estrelas!!!!

title: Great Location & Service, get a good deal
text:
Cleanliness and Rooms are great, Great Staff, I did get a big deal on February so it was great value for Money. 
I would stay again here definitely.
Only downside was safe deposit (was closed and had to ask front desk to come and open it)

title: Small is beautiful, small and high is unrivaled
text: The Gotham hotel is unlike many others you might have visited. It is small (I figure only about 40 rooms), yet high (22+ floors). It is located in a very busy, very urban, very chique area (close to 5th Av and the Rock), yet it is rather quiet, almost 'introvert'. It is fairly new, yet the rooms have been decorated like a well designed and homely apartment, a space which feels home immediately. I really liked the balcony of the room; there's another bigger balcony at the other end of each floor, looking out at 46th Street. There are only two rooms (rather spacious) per floor. Good Wifi was offered for free, there was even a tablet computer available to use for the guest during the stay. Breakfast was ok...not too many choices, but fresh fruit were available. One could also get a true Italian cappuccino. Staff was friendly and attentive. I would recommend a stay to both business travelers and to people who seek a nice and welcoming basis for a NYC exploration. If you come by car, be prepared to dash out some $50 per night for the valley.

title: Balcony in every room!!
text:
The rooms are large and well appointed with a balcony - although you might have a view of the wall.  The bed was big and quite comfy.  The bathroom was somewhat cramped, but otherwise clean and modern.  Upon arrival, there was a welcome note from the management on the desk with a bottle of water and bag of nuts, leading me to believe the water and nuts are complimentary - this was NOT the case and I was billed $11.  
The saving grace for this hotel was the cool restaurant on the main floor.  It has a really inviting atmosphere for a small space: nice wine selection, nicely dimmed lighting and comfortable seating. The staff is excellent and attentive.

title: Perfect little spot to stay in Mid Town NYC!
text: This is a return visit to The Gotham.  Small, neat,caring and the most comfortable bed!  My husband became ill and they referred me to a physician and were extremely conscientious and there for us.  I can't wait to come back and stay there for our next visit to NYC. The rooms are small but definitely fine.  Nothing fancy but clean and the staff is very attentive!  Especially the front desk.  They will see to all of your needs.  They put the hospitable in hospitality!  The one thing that I would correct is the Restaurant located in the hotel. It needs some work.  So, Gotham, until next time and Thank you!  The Kotkins

title: Perfect Hotel
text: This hotel was the perfect place to stay in NYC. It was in walking distacne to most major attractions such as Times Square, The Empire State Building, Central Park and Grand Central Station. The rooms are large and have a balcony. The beds were very big and comfortable. The shower was amazing as well. Staff were also very helpful. Nothing to fault, if I vist NYC again I would definitely stay here.

title: Excellent price, location, and hotel! I highly recommend!
text:
After months (almost 3) of reading reviews, googling images, and looking for deals I finally booked The Gotham. Many other hotels in the same price range had many mixed reviews and nearly all of The Gothams reviews were very good. Conveniently located and in close walking distance to Times square, Central Park, Grand Central Station, etc,. Rooms are exactly as shown, very roomy and clean. The room also had a mini-fridge, full-length mirror (for the ladies), and small ledge. 
We stayed January 1-5, 2015 and check-in/out was quick and easy. We caught drinks one night at the restaurant TenPenny that is attached and the staff was very friendly. They are a restaurant, so if you want a late night drink, you will have to go elsewhere. The shower is very spacious, but is only separated by a glass wall between the sink/toilet area, which was no problem for us but just a FYI.
We were located on the 4th floor, there seems to only be 4 rooms per floor but it was very quiet and was not bothered at all. Room service is quick and helpful. If I had to say anything negative, we had a couple of towels that looked like they had makeup on them, but we called down and got fresh ones immediately.  I would absolutely stay here again!

title: Walk to Everything:)
text: Spent New Years week here for the second time in a row! Love the big comfy beds and the balcony is a nice touch!  Staff was very courteous and helpful and loved the location for walking pretty much anywhere. We logged 10 plus miles each day and loved coming "home" to relax before exploring some more! We did the 4 mile midnight run in centrealupark instead of the ball drop and and had a blast! Will stay here again for sure.

title: Capodanno a new york....fantastico
text:
Ottimo hotel situato in pieno centro,a due passi dalla 5° strada e da Times Square.
Splendida vista dal terrazzino tra i grattacieli di manhattan.
New York in quel periodo e` indescrivibile.....assolutamente da provare

title: Small but tasty boutique hotel
text: Well appointed, if small room.  Very clean, modern and the windows open which is great if you hate air conditioning.  Good location, relatively quiet and nice restaurant on the main floor.  Amazing price and excellent value for $.  Would recommend.

title: Excellent Hotel in the heart of New York
text: My husband and I stayed here over Thanksgiving / eary December 2014 for a week. We know New York well having lived there for several years, and have stayed in various hotels as well on visits. This hotel is in an excellent location, a short walk from everything you want to see or do in New York. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable, with an excellent comfy bed and large walk in shower. The room was clean and well furnished and a big plus in New York  - absolutely quiet (we chose a room at the back as had not stayed there before, but I think even the front would be fine as the road is relatively quiet by NY standards). There are only 4 rooms per floor. There were only 2 minor flaws - I would have liked a tea / coffee maker in the room (as there is a fridge) and, although the staff are very friendly, there is a real mix of languages and we never received the same order of 2 pots of coffee from room service on each of the 5 days we ordered! Tip - go to the top floor - ther is a small common out door area with great views up and down 46th St

title: excellet week at the gotham
text: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel in November/December, from start to finish our stay was fantastic, staff was very helpful and attentive, any questions or queries you have they are happy and willing to help, food at the hotel was lovely, the hotel is in a great location just a 5/10 minute walk from all your main attractions, rooms are large and spacious with a nice comfortable big bed, the bathroom was also modern and clean, room was cleaned daily, the only downside to our trip in New York was the cruise along the Hudson river and the helicopter round new York got cancelled due to bad weather on the plus side we got plenty sightseeing and shopping done during our week long stay, special mention to Hamal (concierge) and also Donaldo who helped organise tickets to Broadway and were generally as helpful as possible, would defiantly recommend staying here great small hotel with a great bunch of staff!! Well done from Scotland keep up the good work.

title: Ottima Posizione
text:
Abbiamo passato 4 notti durante il nostro viaggio di nozze, nuovissimo hotel, curato nei minimi dettagli, ottima la pulizia, l'unica pecca era la vista della camera in quanto ci hanno dato una camera che affacciava all'interno e quindi abbiamo perso tutto il panorama della città...........
Il punto di forza è che si trova al centro di manhattan a pochi passi da tutti i luoghi di interesse, e un grazie speciale al personale dell'albergo........

title: Hire capable management!
text:
The location and the view was nice. Clean room. The guy helping with car parking and luggage was super efficient and courteous. 
 But management was not capable to handle simple issues. I was double charged and even with receipt and transaction details to proof the front desk manager could not reimburse me for the extra charges. Her explanations were very confusing and not making any sense. Ohh, not even to mention I paid $56 for valet parking and had to wait 2 hrs to get my car back. The parking costs actually $48 and it's 2 min walk from hotel.

title: Good Small Hotel in Midtown
text:
My daughter and I stayed at the Gotham for one night during holiday season, 2014.  It is in a great location near the theater district and Rockefeller Center, but just far away to get away from the Times Square madness.  After checking in, we went to our assigned room only to find the door open and the maid busily preparing it (but far from done).  We went back down to the front desk and was told that there had been some miscommunication between them and housekeeping and that they showed the room as ready.  Nevertheless, they quickly got us another room on a higher floor (6th vs 5th, normally a small upcharge) and we were able to settle in.  The rooms are small but neat and clean (although there was a discarded cigarette butt on the terrace).  Since the terrace overlooked a wall and it was a cold day, this did not present a problem to us.

While the view was not great (not unusual in boutique hotels in Manhattan), the staff was courteous, the room was an adequate size, quiet and modern.  We did struggle a bit with the newfangled shower but once we figured out how to use it, it worked fine for us and was actually kind of fun.

All in all, a very pleasant stay, highlighted by an excellent location..

title: Great boutique hotel
text: Great hotel in a great location. We travel to the city frequently and are always looking for a reasonably priced quality hotel near the theatre district.  We have stayed at a number of places , but I think I just found our "go to" place.  Close enough to all the midtown attractions but far enough away that you don't feel like you are in the throngs of tourists that flock the city.  Easy access to great restaurants on manhattan's east side and a quick walk to grand central. Room was modern and quite large for New York standards, the King bed was comfortable and we had a balcony! Practically unheard of at any other hotel in the city.  Granted there was no real view, but how nice to have access to some outdoor space. Staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Only negative is the parking. All the lots around were full as it's the week before the new year.  I was lucky to find street parking (it was Sunday) and later moved my car to a lot late in the evening.  Overall a very excellent stay!

title: Great location
text: We stayed at The Gotham in December, the location of this hotel is perfect for anyone looking to explore NYC by foot. Walking distance to all the major places Central Park, Times Square etc. The staff here are amazing will do anything for you at a request and help you out with any questions on where things are or how to get there. Rooms are a great siZe and very comfortable. Would highly recommend anyone to stay here and if I return to NYC I will stay again.

title: Little, nice boutique hotel
text: We were there in October, and had a good experience in this hotel. The lobby is nice, the people there very helpful. We were able to get another room as the first one was to the back, where a very loud generator made a lot of noise. The room onto the street we got was good, the street in the night isn't very busy. It's a clean and comfortable room. The breakfast is very mediocre. And you don't get an espresso unless you pay extra.

title: Fantastic gem of a hotel in Manhattan
text: If you know Manhattan, you know how cramped everything is! But this is a gem of a hotel in the middle of Manhattan. My room was clean, comfortable and very spacious. It also had a nice little balcony that you could step out to. Not much of a view but I can't complain. The bathroom was very clean, nice and spacious as well. Loved the shower! It felt as if I was standing under a waterfall because the shower head was huge and high up :-) The location was just perfect...walking distance to almost everything in Manhattan. And if not, at least you could get to Grand Central, which is only 4 blocks away, and get to any place you want to. The staff was very friendly, polite and courteous. They even have a luggage room where you could leave your bags once you have checked out. Best part of all, I felt like bat-woman ;-) Absolutely a gem of a hotel.

title: Nice hotel, great location
text:
Researched a lot of hotels for our recent vacation in New York and settled on The Gotham. All of the other hotels in this price range seemed to have either dated rooms, smaller rooms, or rooms in not as nice condition. I did not regret my decision. Our room was clean, modern-looking, and was not cramped as many Manhattan hotel rooms are. The location was great, as well. It was far enough away from the craziness of Times Square, yet just a short 10 minute walk away. Grand Central Station is a 5 - 10 minute walk. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly. Would definitely stay here again.

One tip in general if you are coming to Manhattan during December...we went the 2nd week of December, which is apparently one of the busiest weeks in NYC. Had we come a week earlier or a week later we could have booked a room (not just here at The Gotham, but at any of the hotels I checked) for about half the cost as what it cost during this week.

title: hotel gotham
text:
läget är det som är bra, 5e avenyn bara runt hörnet.
här bor man om man inte har nå krav på mys, man ska bara sova där. Reception liten men dom var jätte trevliga.
ett klart 3stjärnigt hotel , läge bra , rum sisådär (fin toalett) men inget mys och "fint" hotel.

title: Kleineres Hotel in guter Lage
text: Der Empfang wie auch der Hotelpage sind sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Die Zimmer schön, gross und sauber. In 15 Gehminuten ist man beim Times Square. Wir hatten ein Zimmer in der oberen Etage gebucht. Kostet ein wenig mehr ist aber ruhiger. Würde wieder dorthin reisen.

title: Muito Bom
text: O hotel é excelente..atendimento simpático e cordial.. quarto amplo, cama confortável, localizado na beira da quinta avenida e com fácil acesso a diversos pontos turísticos. O único problema encontrado foi a conexão de internet que ficou fora do ar em diversos períodos e apresentou vários problemas no período da estadia. Mas mesmo assim o hotel é altamente recomendável!

title: Bom custo benefício
text:
Boa localização para quem quer ficar próximo as atrações noturnas. Quarto bem confortável, agradável e charmoso. Banheiro amplo e super limpo. 
O único problema que tive foi com a abertura do cofre, mas foi rapidamente resolvido.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Muy lindo hotel y lo mejor que tiene es la ubicación esta cerca de la Grand Central y cerca de Time  Esquare  ,para salir de noche y volver caminando.El restaurante que tiene el hotel es muy bueno se come muy bien la atención excelente. Con respecto a la habitación muy espaciosa por ser New York ,lo mejor la cama muuuuy cómoda enorme .El baño perfecto,grande. La atención de los empleados muy buena cuando llegamos era muy temprano ,pero se esmeraron en dejarnos entrar antes del horario ya que estábamos cansados del viaje. Cuando pedí canales de televisión en español inmediatamente nos mandaron un listado con los canales resultados me pareció muy buen gesto. Gracias por todo

title: Nice boutique hotel
text:
The Gotham hotel is a small hotel with clean and modern looking rooms. The location is very good in Midtown Manhattan. Free internet was included in the rate. The room I got was on a low floor facing the back side of the hotel. Not much of a view (basically just a big brick wall of another building). There was a constant noise coming from what I think is an aircondition system in the back of the hotel, so if you are a light sleeper then you should consider getting a room on a higher floor. 

Breakfast at the hotel seemed overpriced for what you got, but there are plenty of other nice places to eat nearby.

title: What an amazing hotel
text: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel for 5 days from the 31st October. Upon arrival we was greeted straight from our taxi by a lovely man that helped us with our cases held doors for us and just treated us with upmost care. The receptionist that checked us in again was so happy and friendly and couldn't be more welcoming. We had requested that we have a low floor as I didn't like  hights and we was placed on floor 2 which filled me with confidence that there service was going to be very good. We were offered help to our room but we declined as we could do it ourselves as there was a lift. I was very surprised with our room as I was expecting a small room but it was a fair size with everything we needed in it. The bed was very comfy and made/changed daily. The room was cleaned daily also and towels changed to. After reading lots of negative reviews about noise we soon found this is not under the control of the hotel. The noise you hear is the rubbish being collected nightly as every road is biusy during the day. I'm a light sleeper and these noises were there yes but did not effect my sleep in any way. It is expected that a city that never sleeps will have noise every minute of the day. The hotel is situated in a prime location away from big attractions but within walking distance of them all get your walking boots on we walked every were so we didn't miss any sights. Make sure you Visit Ellen stardust diner if your into Broadway it is fantastic atmosphere youtube it your be wowed. Also visit hooters food was amazing and for any man out there this would fill a dream lol.

title: NY Marathon
text:
Stayed at this hotel while in NYC for the marathon.  The hotel was very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful.  I can't imagine a better location in Midtown - short walk to 5th Ave, Grand Central Station and Times Square.

There were a couple problems with cold showers and HVAC issues, but otherwise the stay was exceptional.

Would definately return.

title: Boutique hotel in a great location
text:
I'm going to confess - this hotel caught my eye due to its name. I can confirm it has nothing to do with Batman. It is, however, a lovely little boutiquey hotel located in Midtown within easy walking distance of most Midtown attractions, and only 12 or so blocks from Central Park.

It has 24 floors and we were located on floor 23. It's my understand there are only 2 rooms on each floor as it's a narrow building, and this was quite quaint. Our room was reasonably large with a queen size bed and a balcony which did for the majority of the view face a building, but there was a bit of a view down the road.

The room was clean and tidy and no issues there. The bathroom and walk in shower were great, no problems there. 

The hotel offers free WiFi and that was a real plus.

The restaurant downstairs is a bar/restaurant which is obviously open to the public as well as guests. We had dinner there and the portions were large (as we should have expected) and the staff attentive, friendly and helpful, from reception to the waiting staff.

The only downside to the hotel was the breakfast - very disappointing. Breakfast is $29.99 to outsiders or $15 each for hotel residents. I thought we had missed breakfast based on what was on display; a couple of cereals, a little bit of fruit, scrambled egg and bacon only etc. I thought it was going to be better, had we'd known we would have gone out and not bothered (which we did every other day but we thought we'd give it a go on one day). This wasn't a dealbreaker but I think either bring the price down a few dollars or up the quantity and variety.

We enquired about a rough estimate journey back to JFJ airport and decided to go for the car service the hotel offered instead. It's a fixed price (includes trip, tolls and tip) and no need to hail a taxi or worry about the meter in traffic. We thought it was reasonable and was very practical.

All in all we really enjoyed our stay at the Gotham, the location was perfect and I'm pleased we stayed there, making a change from the 'larger' hotels.

title: Amazing Boutique Hotel
text: I stayed at this hotel for one night on a recent trip to NYC. I booked through Expedia based on previous Trip Advisor reviews. It was better than I expected! The hotel staff were incredibly helpful. They took care of booking our shuttle back to the Newark airport the next day and they even provided us an umbrella since it was pouring that day and we hadn't brought our own. The hotel is a small boutique hotel...there was probably only 6 rooms or so per floor. I didn't count. The rooms are incredibly modern and spacious. The bed was SO comfortable. The shower was clean and modern. Everything was great. We ate at the hotel restaurant that night and it was very good and reasonably priced.  I really cant say anything bad about this hotel! .Would definitely go back there again!

title: Affordable Location
text: This hotel has an amazing location - it's actually close to everything we needed to be close to. The distribution of the room is smart and the room is very comfortable and modern. My only con here was with the service in the reception - but overall, great hotel. Would be back.

title: nice boutique hotel
text: By NYC standards the room is large. Rented room through Hotwire as a 4 star and was pleased it is a small, boutique hotel- 6 rooms per floor, we were on the 4th floor.  Our balcony was dark due to being surrounded by buildings, but since we weren't expecting a balcony it was not an issue.  Employees were very nice and friendly.Things I didn't like is no coffee maker in the room nor offered in the lobby. Also (interestingly enough there are comments that are opposite to mine), the shower was terrible along with the sink faucet.  Water pressure was very weak. And lastly the bed frame is a killer on your shins.  Banged right into it and have the bruise to prove it.

title: Great hotel, great location, great staff.
text: The hotel was in an amazing location as it was just a 10 minute walk to Times Square and close to grand central station. The staff were all very polite and helpful. The restaurant served lovely food and there was great service. The rooms were clean and basic but good, the only down fall was the incredibly loud air conditioning but apart from that an outstanding stay.

title: Great small boutique hotel
text: Very clean, modern hotel with young but very pleasant, helpful staff. Check in and out swift and hassle free. Room very clean, modern and spacious. Huge comfortable bed, fridge (with usual, expensive mini bar) flat screen tv, great modern shower room, plenty of storage. Only negatives: air con very noisy and unfortunately, construction started really early right across the street (obviously not a 'fault' with the hotel though) but being on the 4th floor, it was noisy from the street. We had a teeny balcony looking onto street. A benefit though, is that there are only two rooms to each side of the building per floor, so not a lot of 'foot traffic' or noise from other guests coming and going. All in all, very happy with our stay in a great location in New York City.

title: seul point positif: l'emplacement
text: hôtel très bien situé dans le centre de NYC. fenêtre donnant sur la ventilation de l'immeuble d'en face ce qui implique un bruit insupportable nuit et jour même avec les fenêtres fermées. de plus les draps avaient une odeur très désagréable.

title: Amazing location, great new hotel. Staff was excellent.
text: Great location, close to everything. Lots of shopping and entertainment nearby.  Staff was amazing and handled all of my requests quickly.  Rooms were great with large balconies.  Rooms were also very clean.

title: Very nice in a fantastic location
text:
Very good. Hotel was clean and modern and in a very convenient location.
Bar had some great live music
This hotel is well located and staff there are very polite.
I will certainly return for my next stay in NYC

title: GREAT HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION, GREAT VIEWS
text:
I took my wife to new york for the 3rd time for 7 days and stayed at the Gotham hotel in New York right in the middle, what a place to stay. It is a small hotel copared to others but it is on 46th east avenue cannot get better location to everything. The hotel has only about 60 rooms on 22 floors, We arrived at 1-30pm so we could not get checked in till 3pm thats the rule and they stick by it so dont get upset if they dont budge. The reception staff were very freindly to my wife and myself i surpose because we were to them so if you are the grumpy one expect it back as we noticed with other people booking in.
We booked a delux queen size room with balcony but was given one on the first floor No 22 with no balcony, went to reception and pointed out that is not what we booked and they told us that all the rooms were booked and they would change us the next day which we did not mind as we had a long flight and just wanted to chill out for the rest of the day.
the bell boys were fantastic nothing was any problem to getting a cab or answering any questions you might have, i found if you are polite to them they will be polite to you.
The room they gave us the following day was 32 next floor up with a juliette balcony which was enough for us as we did not want to stay out on it all day, the bed was extremly comfortable not our queen size but our 5ft king size and the bed linen was changd at least 3 times in 1 week.
The bath room was very nice enough for any person, with the complementary soaps etc and a wonderful shower which i did like.The room had a mini bar which you paid for if you used be carefull it is expensive for the hotel mini bar bits.
If you went up to the roof floor there is a balcony with a few chairs for you to sit and admire the view and a nice view it is at night.
This hotel is so close to everything including the underground train on 42st No 5 which takes you down town and No6 brings you back, Was not impressed with china town but that might be me, you have to visit ground zero and take lots of tissues as i would defy anyone who does not have a cry even me. Go visit the museum it is a must you will see and learn so much of that day,dont be put off by the rows of people waiting to get in they are very fast.
If you are planning to visit lot of venues expect to put by at least $40 per couple per visist some are more some less so it evens out.
You can eat in there restarant for breakfast if you want and they give you a discout if you do but if you get up late and go down it can be limited, my advise is go out try Raffles on the corner of  lexington ave next to the lexington hotel we love this place some say it is costly but you only do it once so give it a try.
The restarant food is nice but expensive, you can get cheaper just look around or go internet shopping for places to eat, you must try Grand central station underground food hall as they have mexican, chinese, italian, indian,plus others and they are all put in a box were you can take away or eat there.
i knew that food and drink would be the biggest cost factor on this holiday so my budget was huge for this and drinks in new york are not cheap eather so my advise is to but what you fancy at duty free and take it with you it could save you a lot of money.
Shops well what can i say you can either afford it or you can't dont be put off go look at the $1 million dollar necklace if you cant afford you cant buy it but it is nice to see,go to bloomingdales it has something for everyone and macies is a store everyone likes.
All in all the hotel was very nice and the visit was wonderful, by the way this was our opinion not based upon any other comments made

title: Home Away From Home
text: The Gotham Hotel has become my home away from home.  Location is central to any and everywhere in the city, including Central Park, Madison and Fifth Ave. shopping, uptown, downtown, east, west and really anything you might be looking for.  Rooms are clean and roomy.  Balconies are very large offering excellent views and a wonderful place to just relax and soak in the city. Staff is exceptionally attentive as is management.  I've stayed in all parts of town many times over but the Gotham will always be my first choice!

title: Excelente ubicación y atención
text: Ubicación inmejorable, en la 46 y Fifth Avenue. Tuve la suerte de contratar por un buen precio por lo que se me hizo accesible, aunque sé que este no es un hotel barato. Muy bonita habitación, moderna, silenciosa y con un pequeño balconcito a la calle. Los empleados de recepción, súper amables y serviciales. Disfruté mucho mi estadía en este hotel y sin dudas volvería.

title: No hype. Great hotel for the price in a great location.
text: Booked with Hotwire for 4 nights and have to say this is a really great hotel. The location is right next to Grand Central (which meant my commute to Stamford, CT was a breeze) The hotel is not a luxury hotel but is extremely comfortable for a business traveler.  Wifi is free and the customer service is great.

title: Ottimo albergo....
text:
Ottimo albergo, ben posizionato per visitare il cuore di Manhattan, fornito di ogni confort.
Le camere sono ben arredate e pulite. È disponibile il servizio ristorante che sebbene non abbiamo personalmente utilizzato è sempre molto frequentato in particolare la sera. L'unico particolare da migliorare è il condizionamento in camera che risulta un po' rumoroso.

title: It's good but not great
text:
We looked at various options before sticking to our guns and booking Gotham on basis that we liked the idea of sitting out on the balcony sharing a bottle of wine at the end of the day.
