We were happy with what we got which was a Skyline on 15th floor but the room was starting to look a bit tired. 
We had a nice large room, great bed with comfortable pillows and a well fitted bathroom. That was about it though. There are no frills, no lighting on the balcony, no lights barring a desk lamp at the lounge end of the room, no coffee making facilities. And the one thing we both hated was the dirty and grubby net curtains that ran the length of the room. They should been binned years ago....or washed.

Overall it was fine but despite the use of the balcony I would suggest pretty expensive for what was on offer.

title: OK room Fantastic shower
text: This hotel is just OK.  They don't tell you that the balconies in half the rooms face a brick wall.  It can be a bit claustrophobic, but at least it has privacy.  There were no wash cloths in our room so we had to ask and they brought them up.  There is no ice machine, you have to ask.  Cable went out every afternoon.  Wine glasses were in the room the first day but not replaced the next, had to ask.  Most of the staff are very young and don't seem to have been trained.  Not very professional.  The waterfall shower however was great.

title: Dirty
text: I don't normally give bad reviews. When we checked into our room, we saw sticky mess on multiple surfaces and called to ask them to come and clean the room or else to move us. They had a cleaner come who asked us where we saw the mess/dirt and he sprayed and wiped down that particular spot. Then left. However, even the surface he "cleaned" wasn't even clean -- we only noticed when he left. Then I opened the console at the end of the bed and saw actual garbage. We called again and said that it was clear that the room hadn't been cleaned so we asked them to come back. We left the room so that they could clean it. When we returned, the garbage was gone but the sticky stuff on top of the console that they'd left from the last time was still there. Clearly they stlll hadn't properly cleaned the room. It was late and we went to bed. The next morning, we saw mould in the shower stall. We had to call yet again to have them pay attention that there was something wrong. It's a small hotel but it's not cheap. And it's not deluxe, even though we paid for an upgrade. We were in room 62 and had a "terrace" which is not something you can stand on. Ours had cigarette butts on it so I guess that's what people use it for. It's not like it's a nice view or anything either. Stay somewhere else for the money.

title: Fantastic rooms
text: Big spacious beds and great views. Bathroom was great as well. Service was quick and friendly. Nicely located and staff were happy to help hailing a cab and storing luggage. Some places like the Hilton charges for luggage storage afte check out but this was free. Would go back again in a heartbeat!

title: Excelente localização
text: Em um lugar onde normalmente os quartos são pequenos, esse hotel traz quartos amplos e muito bem decorados. Por ser uma antiga livraria, possui livros em todos os cantos que podem ser lidos pelos hospedes. A localização é perfeita, perto de tudo! Super recomendo.

title: Hotel boutique
text: Excelente custo-benefício para NYC. Localizado a meia quadra da 5th Avenue, o Gotham é um hotel boutique com quartos de tamanho médio, muito limpo e com bom banheiro. Atendimento da recepção muito qualificado e atencioso.

title: posizione strategica
text: Hotel in posizione strategica in stile assolutamente moderno. Camera spaziosa e curata. Il bagno perfettamente fornito di tutto il necessario. Particolarmente gradevole la saponetta e la crema per il corpo. Peccato che il ristorante per la colazione avesse degli orari un po' 'ballerini' . Comunque poco male, si può fare colazione ovunque probabilmente spendendo meno che in hotel se si mangia solo un muffin con il caffè. L'unico neo è stato il rumore. Direi non proprio silenzioso. Almeno la camera dove ho soggiornato io. mi avevano assegnato inizialmente una camere fronte strada, ma ho chiesto il cambio perché c'erano dei lavori in corso che sarebbero durati tutta la notte, molto gentilmente mi hanno cambiato la camera con una, meno rumorosa ma non silenziosa. peccato fosse ... fronte muro..... pazienza.... sono rimasta talmente poco in camera che l'essenziale era dormire bene in una camera confortevole e vicino al centro. Comunque lo consiglio.

title: Would stay again, no hesitation!
text: My daughter and I stayed for 2 nights recently, we stayed in room 61 on the 6th floor.  Room was clean the bed very comfy!  The room had a small balcony, which was nice.   The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The location was great close to great shopping and many nice restaurants.  We would definetly stay again at the Gotham!!!!

title: Great location
text: We stayed here not expecting anything grand but were greatly surprised, especially after being upgrade to what was a huge room ... The staff were gr8 & we thought you could not beat the location ... Would have no hesitation highly recommending The Gotham.

title: EVERYTHING WAS EXCELLENT
text: We stayed in Gotham for ten days room 231 the room was very quiet and the size was great, the bed so big and comfomrtable the staff very helpfull and polite and the location was close to everything.I would definatelly stay there again.

title: Stylish and Good Location
text: Close to 5th Avenue & shopping, as well as a host of other things. The room was quite large, compared to some hotel rooms we've been in (*cough* Hudson Hotel), with an oversize bathroom and shower, plus the room had its own balcony (room # 143, on the 14th floor). Spent a Sunday night to Monday morning, so it was quieter than usual, I would imagine than a typical weekend stay. Did not try the restaurant, nor did we partake of the breakfast buffet ($15 for hotel guests, otherwise it's $30), as there were other options nearby that were more reasonable. That said, I'd recommend it if you're looking for something close to 5th and the sights.

title: Looks better than it is.
text:
Ok. I have tried to be a as fair as possible with this review, so here goes..
We fly in from Australia and went to baggage claim to get our limo that the Gotham had organised for us, it wasn't there.. Ok, I hear you say it's not there fault the limo didn't turn up... Agreed, however the way it was handled when we got to the hotel was.  The phrase used was "Well, I didn't book it so I know nothing about that", no apology for the mix up, no I'm sorry I'll look into that for you, which after a 27 hr travel time would have been nice.  Now, onto the room.  I contacted the Gotham 2 weeks before we left (had to phone them as the email address on there website is wrong) to confirm our room.  We had booked a skyline room with a couch. After speaking to the girl in renovations I was assured that we had this room.  When we finally checked in at 2.45pm, we were given the key to our room on the 18 the floor, only to find out we had been given the wrong room, we had the skyline with a queen bed (not a king as promised) and no couch.  I went back down to see what had happened and was told that room was already booked, but we could have it tomorrow?  I agreed to this as we were staying six nights so that was ok.  
Ok, let's move onto the room.   It was very clean, and the balcony was great, with nice views down 46th st.  It's a good size, with a nice bathroom and shower, beware the bed's edges, they are sharp and both myself and my partner have cuts on our shins.   The bed is self was really comfy, with a great pillows. Now I'll move onto the TV and the aircon. The TV wasn't working when we first arrived, and when I asked someone to come and look at it, they sent someone up who promptly said "what do you want to watch TV for??"  I explained we had a long flight and I just wanted to rest,  ummm..  Yeah.  The TV was fixed but only worked about 90% of the time.  Now, the aircon.  It is really noisy, and by noisy I mean it rattles like something is loose and rubbing.  It doesn't do it on fan, only on aircon, but it does make it difficult to sleep, so after much playing around, we figured out how to make it possible to live with.  Set the fan on low, then set the temp 1 degree below the current room temp, then the aircon kicks in and out, still noisy but bearable.    I'll now explain why I had to put up with this aircon, as you may remember we where going to move rooms!?, well we didn't do this because they are doing road works out the front of the hotel... All night... At 3am a worker with a grinder was cutting into the road..  Yay...  So we decided to stay on the 18 the floor instead of moving to the 10th floor were the couch room was.   I was also told that they will be doing this until next year....  So go for a room at the back of the hotel if you don't care about the view and want to sleep.
We did have room service one night, it was nice but for $70 you can do so much better anywhere on Madison ave. 
Hotel wifi was good and easy to use, having a safe in the room was good as well.
The Gotham is a hotel with great potential, I think the thing letting it down was the attitude of - I'm not doing that until you complain about it- which to be fair wasn't the case with all the staff, Joanna at front desk was great, and one of the door men ( his name escapes me) was really helpful and even got my a partner a free hot chocolate when she had a craving for it.
So would I stay here again... Probably not, the hotel itself is really nice and in a great location, just the staff, and the organisation let it down.  So if you don't care about service, and just want something nice to stay in, in a good central location, then this is the hotel for you.  If you want service with a smile, and people who will go that extra mile, stay somewhere else.

title: Charmant Hôtel
text: Nous avons passé 4 nuits du 3 au 7 août 2014 dans ce charmant hôtel. Le personnel est très agréable. L'hôtel est bien situé à deux pas de la 5éme avenue. les chambres sont confortables et pas bruyantes, ce qui est un plus en plein centre de New-York ! Il n'y a pas beaucoup de choix pour le petit déjeuner, dommage.

title: centrale -wifi gratuito
text:
L'hotel è buono. 
è pulito, gli addetti alla reception sono cortesi e sanno consigliare dei buoni posti per mangiare. 
ci sono delle prese elettriche vicino ai comodini, molto comode (sembra che nel viaggio che abbiamo fatto non sono scontate le prese della corrente vicino ai comodini). 
nella doccia l'acqua tendeva a rimanere stagna.
per il resto la vista dava sulla strada, comunque avevamo un grattacielo di fronte quindi la vista era annullata. balcone profondo circa 30 centimetri, non so come mai l'hanno progettato cosi, ci si cammina appena.

title: New York Style Without Breaking The Bank
text:
We were in town for family reasons, not necessarily as tourists, so were not interested in splurging as we might for an official vacation.  Compared with other hotels this one seemed "reasonable" (nothing in NY is cheap!), so we booked it.  I was afraid that we might be in for a room that felt tired or slightly seedy... and was certain it would be the size of a closet.  I was thrilled to discover that it was none of those things.  It was clean, had a modern feel and it's own private balcony -- which, to be honest, was not the most inviting of spaces as it was surrounded by the brick walls of neighboring buildings and all the NYC street noise.  But none of that noise was audible in our room.

We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant, but it looked to be classy, as did the lobby.

The location is one block from Grand Central.  And practically all the sights you want to see are walkable from the front door if you'd rather go on foot.

All-in-all we had a very comfortable stay.

title: Gotham Hotel - Superb
text: I would like to recommend if anyone is heading to New York to stay at The Gotham hotel.  Perfect location, perfect staff, very accommodating and their customer service is one of the best iv experienced

title: Boa localização
text: Hotel bem localizado, próximo à Quinta Avenida com várias opções de restaurantes nas redondezas. O Staff foi impecável, sempre solícitos a ajudar. Camas super confortáveis, banheiro amplo e muito limpo. Único inconveniente foi o chuveiro com pouca pressão de água.

title: Ottimo
text: Ottimo per la posizione, per la stanza, per il letto, per il balcone. Mi è piaciuto tutto. Dimensioni a misura umane e non come capita spesso a New York, di bambini. Perfetto per andare nei posti più glamour di questa grande, unica città. Consigliato se trovate un'offerta come il sottoscritto

title: Bonne situation, standard moyen
text:
Très bien situé entre Madison et la 5th ave, a 3 streets au dessus de la gare centrale. 
-Situation 4,5/5
-Le Personnel 4,5/5
-Propreté 2,5 /5 ( quelques longs cheveux oubliés sur les meubles et la salle de bain)
-Confort 3/5 ( coffre fort verrouillé à mon arrivé, pas possible de le libérer, pas de bloc note, de stylo, bref plus du détail mais c est quand même le standard) Grand lit confortable et propre bien sur. La chambre avec version balcon n a aucun intérêt sauf à vous garantir d avoir les chambres à l'avant du bâtiment et en hauteur 15eme et plus ... Jusqu'au 24 eme.
- rapport qualité/prix: 3/5
- charme: c est un hôtel standard, ce n'est pas l'atout de l hôtel

title: Hotel en pleno centro
text:
la habitación tiene todo lo necesario para que estés cómodo, una gran ducha, los empleados muy  agradables y te ayudaban en lo que necesitaras, tuvimos un retraso con el vuelo y nos pudieron añadir una noche(pagandola) pero perdiendo la otra noche, porque decían que cogimos una oferta y no se podía cambiar sin pagar.

Lo malo que en la calle estaban en obras, y daba igual que fueran las 3 de la mañana que se ponían a taladrar y te despertaban

title: Over rated
text: The property was well located but the room we got was not what I was expecting. Huge yellow wall stain put me off right away. The bathroom was nice, good shower. I noticed that they did not clean the room thoroughly each day...dust remained, glasses we used for water unwashed,  etc. Our room was in the back of the building.....not a pretty sight.

title: A pleasant suprise!
text: Just spent a night in NYC at the Gotham Hotel on 46th Street. What a little gem this hotel is! The rooms although not the largest, have all the amenities you would hope. Terrific king size beds, very modern bathroom and quiet! The restaurant/bar attracts many locals and is a good spot for an evening cocktail, specially on Tuesdays when the have live jazz. Finally, the staff is truly outstanding. After I departed, I realized I had left a package in my room. I called and it was sent via Fedex overnight to me......AWSOME! A place to stay agin.

title: Not worth it.
text:
I arrive quite late, and am given the «Penthouse»; ie large-ish top floor room, which is extremely hot. AC at full blast barely noticeable, and it’s 5 am before it’s below 25°C and I’m able to sleep. Bed is nice and soft. Wine fridge filled with champagne and prosecco is not turnd on. With the heat in the room I assume the content is spoiled. Very weak water pressure in shower.
Only one of the two elevators go to the top floor. The reasons vary wildly depending on who I ask. Of course, the one i need is never the one that arrives at ground floor, so I have to walk the last flight of service stairs. Strangely, both elevators come up to top when called.

Truly awful breakfast is $20 with taxes at half price for hotel guests. Stale small bagels, tasteless scrambled eggs, leathery, lukewarm  potato. Jams. And that's it…

Need to print some tickets, sent to "business centre" where the pc takes forever downloading and installing updates, failing, and then I give up. Staff at front desk wonderfully helpful.

Severely overpriced, will not choose again.

title: Great Hotel
text:
I stayed here for one night while on a recent business trip. I found the hotel room to be large (apparently larger than average for NYC), very clean with a nice 'minimalist' style - and a great shower.
The room had a small balcony but it looked straight out onto other buildings and was near a noisy air conditioning unit so I never used it.
The staff were friendly and courteous and i would certainly stay here again if I am in New York.

title: Place to shower and sleep; NO hospitality at all, despite looking good!
text:
Initially...an impressive, small boutique hotel with a slick entrance and foyer of white marble. 

Rooms are attractive and minimalist ...with lovely bathrooms. This is where it all ends, as there is little else provided for the "hospitality"or other needs of visitors to NYC?

This hotel appears to have no desire to attend to the "hospitality needs" of its guests. 

( I gleaned the impression that management had minimal or possible no experience, in actually running a hotel, professionally staffing one...or addressing the needs of guests, be they business travellers or tourists.)

My request for an area map was returned with a very blunt " we do not have one!"  Unprofessional and rude receptionist, who was more interested in talking about her social life with a friend who had dropped by, than assisting paying guests....who were waiting!

No information/brochures is/was provided in the room. NO city or TV guide either....or list of attractions, restaurants, shows etc etc in the neighbourhood.

Information on the hotel itself was provided (in-room)... on a "dog-eared" pages, roughly pinned together...with no index; too difficult to bother reading! Not even in a plastic cover! 
( One gained the impression this was quickly "printed off" at the last minute...and thrown in the room!)

The Gotham Hotel is out of touch with guests' requirements.

They did, however, provide a few hard-cover books in the room,  which was a nice "touch" ....but as a business traveller (and also a tourist) these were useless, as I had no time to read them! 
( Like so many other guests, I imagine!?)

There is a restaurant within the hotel, though given the lack of hospitality at the hotel, I naturally assumed that this also would prove a disappointing experience ...so I ate breakfast elsewhere and never ate any meals there.

Two, young men, friendly (though also "unprofessional" in behaviour), seemed always to be on hand to open the doors of this small hotel...which seemed an odd allocation of staff, given the lack of hospitality elsewhere. 

On checking out, I was served by a lovely and polite receptionist who was apologetic when I conveyed my disappointment in my stay. 

My booked taxi (on my departure) was taken by another person, due to the incompetence of one of the "bellboys" ... so I found myself hailing my own cab to get to the airport.

I later ( twice) needed to spend a few nights in NYC...on this same trip, and chose another hotel, less than half the (outrageous) price that I paid at The Gotham Hotel and enjoyed a far superior stay!

The Gotham Hotel is NOT all it appears to be, sadly!  You can do a lot, lot better in NYC and at half the price...or maybe less!

title: Never Again
text: I was injured at the Gotham by a piece of metal that was in the padding of the bed. All I asked was for help to get to a minor medical and asked them to pay for the shot. They refused any help, manager was very rude and accused me of jabbing a piece of metal in my back. I never asked for any room compensation. I just needed help to find a place to go and get a tetanus. No no no.. She just stood shaking her head. No one ever said they were sorry it happened or offered any sympathy. Cheaper hotels would at least offer an apology and help locate and give directions to a medical facility, not the Gotham Hotel. Stay here at your own risk. The piece of metal was in a removable pad on the bed that by the way had someone else's dried blood on it, someone did come and change the dirty pad. Not a nice place.

title: Checking out the City and then a day at Belmont
text: Lots of fun! Took Amtrak round trip from upstate. Found a nice hotel using TA. Walked, ate and drank at several places on Saturday and on Sunday we took the LI RR to Belmont. A very easy ride. The train leaves about a half hour after the last race, which is good, too. Brings you right to Penn to catch your Amtrak train home.

title: Époustouflant
text: Je vous recommande vivement cet hôtel ou nous avons passe une semaine idéale. Le personnel est très attentionné, la propreté de l hôtel est parfaite, les chambres confortables ( super literie) et la salle de bain juste parfaite. Rien à redire sur cet hôtel sont l emplacement est ideal, proche de tous les lieux incontournables de Manhattan. Merci à tout le personnel , et  c'est sur, nous reviendrons dans cet hôtel qui a nois yeux est juste parfait!!!

title: Amazing property
text: What an amazing property!  Great location, staff was amazing and the balcony off of our room was breathtaking. No matter what the view there is no way you can't enjoy sitting out on your balcony listening to the sounds below!! Can't stop recommending this hotel!

title: Gotham Hotel misrepresented the room
text: I booked a room in June that sounded just like one I'd stayed in at this hotel in March...sitting area w/couch, terrace, high ceilings. I got a room that was only a bit bigger than the bed.  When I complained and asked where the sitting area was, I was told it's the small chair in the corner. The terrace was 3x3'. Beware this hotel and their bait and switch.

title: Good Location
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights.  We were on the 3rd floor at rear although it had a balcony there was no view but the room was just for sleeping in. Nice clean modern spacious room lovely bathroom which huge shower. room had a very well stocked bar but disappointed  that there were no tea/coffee making facilities but there was a coffee shop and a dunkin donut shop next door which was handy.  Huge bed which was sooo comfortable.
Aircon and safe included but air con was noisy. Only other little niggle was that there was only a couple of clothes hangers.
Hotel fairly central easy walk to most attractions with 5th Avenue one side and Madison other.
Hotel Staff  were polite but girl in donut shop next door just didn't want to be there even though we went in each day she was not friendly.
Easy to get to from airport we got a yellow cab fixed price $52 but if you go a train its less than a 10 min walk.
Hotel offers you a car to airport for around $80 but we left at 3.45am and got a cab on 5th Avenue quite easily.
Would recommend as a hotel in a central location but if returning would go to different hotel to be in a different area - not because i didn't like hotel
We found it good value as we booked this as a package and we were travelling onto Barbados and we also  got a free night

title: Wonderful hotel in a fantastic location!
text: We stayed at the Gotham in May 2014. Right from the word go we were impressed. The staff were so polite and welcoming, the rooms are gorgeous (especially if you have one with a view on the front!) and they come with your own private balcony. They are a finished to a lovely standard and the quality of everything in this place is high. The hotel is in a very nice part of town and is only a ten minute walk from Grand Central station if you're coming into the City by train, or bus from the airport (the buses drop off right at GC). All in all a wonderful stay and we will always be booking the Gotham Hotel when we stay in NYC, thank you!

title: Modern luxurious Midtown Hotel
text: Modern, clean , fresh, luxurious with generous sized room and bathroom.  No city noise at all in rooms at the back of the hotel.  Free WiFi available.  The staff were excellent, friendly and very courteous.  The location was great on 46th East, just off 5th Avenue and close to a number of New York attractions.

title: Good location, but nothing special elsewise
text:
Biggest plus of the hotel is its location near 5th in midtown. All the usual tourist spots are in walking distance. At night sourroundings are a little bit bleak and lifeless, but that's a general midtown issue i guess. 
We stayed in a Deluxe King room. The room was ok, but nothing special. More on the smallish side (even for NYC). The tiny tiny french balcony facing the street was a nice touch tough.
Bathroom was small with a dumb layout which made it even smaller in perception. Workmanship was poor. The shower itself was very good though. Nice bath amenities.
Housekeeping was average, we have been to much cleaner hotels. 
Biggest minus was the service and the lobby/reception set-up (or better non set-up). Personnel ranged from indifferent to downright rude - if you found some, which was difficult itself. 

We have been to New York multiple times, but this was the first time, we wouldn't recommend a hotel. It's okish, but very bad value for your money, as it is way too expensive.

title: Hotel très bien situé
text:
De retour de notre voyage dans un très joli hôtel idéalement situé en plein cœur de Manhattan entre la 5th avenue et Madison Avenue.  Proche station de métro et Gregory's coffee en bas de l'hôtel (pratique pour le petit déjeuner ). 
C'est un hotel un peu cosy mais très agréable, différent des autres chaînes hôtelières. 
Nous avions une chambre skyline avec un canapé et une table de salon. Nous avions demandé une chambre côté rue et non côté cour pour bénéficier d'une plus belle vue. Avec la terrasse c'était excellent ! 
La salle de bain est très jolie aussi.
Chaque jour la chambre était nettoyée. 
Le lit est très confortable et très grand (king size), c'est très appréciable après une grosse journée de marche.
Aucun reproche à faire. Je vous recommande vivement cet hôtel.

title: Localização Fantastica
text:
Hotel boutique com atendimento personalizado e localizaçāo fantástica. f
Staff sempre atencioso para nos ajudar. Localização fantástica, próxima à Quinta Avenida. Recebi encomendas solicitadas pela internet nenhum custo adicional.

title: Well priced and excellent location
text: We spent a week at the Gotham and found the service and amenities excellent.  The hotel is in a fabulous location in easy walking distance of Times Square, Rockafella, Grand Central and of course it's just off 5th and Madison.  The bed was huge.  We had a balcony with no view and probably wouldn't choose this again as we didn't use it.  The bathroom was well presented.  The television was also large.  There is a mechanical hum from outside which actually improved our sleep as it blocked out the buzz of Manhattan.  My husband is a very light sleeper and found that he had excellent sleep at the Gotham.  We did not try the breakfast or the restaurant as the rest of Manhattan was on our doorstep!

title: An oasis of calm in the midst of NYC
text:
From the moment of arrival to the time we left we were in great hands at the Gotham Hotel.

With a fantastic central location in Mathatten, the hotel was a perfect place for our tourist holiday.
Close to 5th Ave and only a couple of blocks from Time Square and Grand Central Station. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel.

The hotel itself was a tastefully decorated, modern, boutique hotel (which was formerly a library). The rooms were a good size, with a very comfortable bed, 42" cable TV in each room and great shower room amenities included.

------

Our Stay...

On arrival we were greeted by the very friendly night porter Allan. 
He came and helped us with our luggage from the cab, explained where everything was in the hotel as well as checking us in swiftly with no delays or problems.
Over the course of our stay he was very helpful and informative about NYC transportation and attraction location, as well as just being a very friendly person to chat too.

During our stay we also met and struck up a friendship with Rey and Hemel, who worked during the day.
These two colourful characters always greeted us with a smile and friendly conversation. They were keen to ensure that our stay was everything we wanted it to be, and it was!
When it came to the end of our stay they assisted us in our return travel to the airport, booked us a cab and made our travel arrangements for us so we had nothing to worry about.

I would strongly recommend the Gotham Hotel for anyone wanting a plush hotel in the heart of Manhatten.

title: Not as advertised
text:
We booked a one night stay in a "Skyline Suite With Terrace" for the night of May 25, which was during Memorial Day weekend.  The suite is described as having a king-sized bed and a good sized terrace and the photos on the website show a loveseat, coffee table, occasional char, desk and desk chair, and the king-sized bed.  Our confirmation email verified the room type including the king-sized bed.  

Check-in was fine except that the website-advertised glass of wine at check-in was never offered -- actually, we would have very much appreciated some cold still or sparkling water at check-in.  Our room did indeed have a wonderful, spacious terrace overlooking 46th St., but that was all that was as promised.  In fact, when we got into the room I called the front desk because I thought an error had happened in that it was so small, with no sitting area and a smaller bed.  The staff member kind of mumbled something about our room being on a higher floor and therefore smaller.  We had to get going to meet some out-of-town friends so we dumped our bags and left.

Upon returning in the evening we inspected the room more completely and the bed was most definitely not a king-sized bed.  The shades on the windows were dusty and some had stains on them.  The bathroom was outfitted with beautiful tiles and fixtures but was totally impractical.  You had to step into the shower to turn it on, resulting in unwelcome cold water -- plus the shower door leaked.  You couldn't wash your hands at the bathroom sink without first closing the bathroom door as it obstructed the sink when it was open.  That evening I made another call to the front desk about the bed size, and while there was acknowledgement about the level of suite we reserved there was also some side-stepping about why we got the room we got and were recommended to talk to management in the morning.  We forgot toothbrushes and asked for them and the front desk promised someone would bring some.  We waited a half hour.  It took another call to get someone to bring up two toothbrushes in crushed boxes.  One aspect we did like about the room was that there was a fridge that wasn't crammed with mini-bar offerings so that we could put our own bottles of water in there, even though there were a few beverages for purchase already there.

In the morning I filled out the form left in our room asking for our feedback (the form actually had stains on it!) and I listed out all of our issues, including my email address.  Upon check-out we talked with a manager who said that we indeed did not get a king room and that we got something called a "California Queen?" and refunded us $30, apologizing for the housekeeping issues.  

We loved the terrace, but the cleanliness issues, the design problems, not getting the size bed that we had confirmed, the fact that our room was soooo not what was pictured,and  the non-responsiveness of the staff made us not want to return again.  Plus, as of this writing it has been two weeks and there has been no email response to all of the issues I wrote for the general manager (not the manager who refunded us the $30), which is disappointing as well.  The website for this hotel makes it look beautiful and elegant and indicates a pride in personal service, but our experience just doesn't match up with what was advertised on many levels.  In fact, if it weren't for our nice terrace, I would have given this place two stars for not being transparent.

title: Great location, mediocre hotel.
text:
The receptionist wasn't overly enthusiastic when checking us in, which after a long flight would have been nice, there was no welcome glass of wine as written in the hotel information & no offer of taking our luggage to our room.

The room was a great size for a New York hotel which was a nice surprise but the balcony was very disappointing, it was very small, faced a brick wall & was over the air conditioning units which were very noisy. We went to reception and asked to change rooms but we're told we could only move if we paid an extra $30 per night & if we didn't there was nothing she could do. We were very disappointed with this but didn't see why we should pay more than we had already.

The bed was very comfortable and we slept well throughout our stay we even got used to the noise of the air con units but never used the balcony (even though it was very warm) as it was very dark and dingy as well as noisy. We had booked this hotel because of the balcony so we were very disappointed that it wasn't a nice place to sit & relax after a hectic day in the city.

The tickle of water from the bathroom sink tap was a joke, it was so slow & not much water came out.

The air con wasn't working properly so the room was quite stuffy.

The safe wasn't secured to anything & the balcony door didn't lock.

The room wasn't the cleanest, it was dusty & while I was checking around to make sure I'd packed all our belongings I found a pair of shoes underneath a chair that didn't belong to us - obviously the room hadn't been cleaned properly otherwise they'd have been found by the cleaner!

On the plus side the hotel is in a great location, it's near all the main attractions, this was our 6th visit to New York and our first and last stay at the Gotham Hotel.

title: Great experience!
text: I stay at the Gotham on June 5th for the first time.  This was business related as I worked late and needed a place overnight.  The hotel is in a great location in Midtown.  The room was small but very clean and beautifully done.  Bed was very comfortable.  I checked in at about 11:15pm and was out of there at 7am so not able to give any additional information.  The check in was very fast and the person at the desk very helpful.

title: Feels just like home
text: The Gotham hotel was recomended by my cousin in a last minute advice. The rooms are very modern and cozi. A lot of space to place the luggage and impecable cleaningness.Great Bathroom and well lighten atmosphere. The Staff was very objective and there was always Donaldo to fullfill our needs.Outstanding neighbourhood with Barnes and Noble at the corner, meaning great breakfast at Starbucks. We have nice promenades nearby and everything we might need right away, including dinner, soghtseeing or eletronics. Reserv in advance.

title: Bello centrale ma attenti al piano che vi assegnano
text: Premesso che visto che andavo a NY per festeggiare il mio 30'  ho prenotato la bellezza di 6 mesi prima con la richiesta più volte fatta di avere una vista sulla strada. Morale della favola mi danno il sesto piano di un palazzo che ne ha 26 con bellissima vista MURO in un imbuto perché la vista era su un cortile interno. Non riuscivo a capire se fosse notte giorno..che tempo facesse. Con tutte le finestre chiuse c'era un rumore di turbine...guai a provare ad effettuare una chiamata sul balconcino! Sembrava di stare sotto un aereo in partenza!da un 4* mi aspettavo un set un po' più fornito invece solo uno schampetto un bagno doccia e una cremina.... Dulcis in fundo 500 dollari di cauzioni che mi sembrano tantini. Posizione ottima perché ad un passo dalla stazione centrale e Times square

title: Viaggio di nozze
text: L'hotel si presenta nel cuore di new jork ben centrato nella grande mela, da fuori ha una struttura sporgente all'entrata troverete un buona accoglienza( anche qualcuno che sa' l'italiano) le stanze sono essenziali, niente di entusiasmante ma sicuramente consigliabile sia per coppie che per single.ambiente pulito.

title: our xmas in new york
text:
Great little find from our travel agent... having stayed in NYC   previously we found this hotel  very refreshing from the major chains. and only a couple of  blocks  away from times square.
staff  were very friendly and helpful during our stay. we were attracted to the fact that we had access to  balcony... an unusual treat in NY, although not used to max in December !, but had great views over the city. our room was very comfortable, great bed, clean bathroom , TV, safe and mini bar, but if your expecting a city view from your balcony, you need to stipulate this form the off. We requested a quiet  and we got this at the back of hotel which had view of the car park but access to shared balcony was ok for us at this time of year. 
 very good bar/restaurant within hotel, although would say that times were limited for early /late drop ins.
Overall good hotel, not cheap but good location to explore NYC.

title: Great Hotel!!!
text: My parents stayed at the Gotham Hotel last week and they can highly recomemnd this hotel to everybody. The hotel is very good located. Really in the heart of New York. Very close to Broadway, 5th Avenue and other important sights! The suff were very friendly and always very helpful. The rooms are very big and very modern. My parents are planning already their next trip to New York and they will definitely stay there next time again!

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: I think it's one of the best 4-star hotels in Manhattan. What I like the most is the size of the rooms - they are really big, especially for NYC. Go for the one with a terrace, you will love it. Rooms and bathrooms are also modern, which I really appreciate. The hotel does not have a real lobby and lacks some other facilities but if you are staying couple of nights only you won't really care about it. Customer service is great. Cosmetics provided in the bathroom are of high quality. Among the downsides I could only think about average view (but come on, it's Manhattan), and a small lobby. Probably because the hotel is new there are a lot of good deals on different booking sites and I would definitely recommend it as it is great value for money.

title: Un Hotel super bien ubicado en N York
text: El Hotel es impecable, las habitaciones amplias, todo moderno, Somier amplio tipo king, baño amplio , tiene todo lo necesario. Son pocas habitaciones por piso. El personal de recepcion es amable, alguno habla español,,y destaco, la ubicacion, FANTASTICA, estas en la 46 street y casi la 5ta Avenida,,,lo cual es maravilloso. Tambien tiene un Bar de muy buen nivel que habre hasta tarde en la noche.

title: Destacar el trato de sus empleados y la maravillosa ubicación del hotel
text:
Estamos encantados con la elección The Gotham hotel. Ubicación excelente y el trato de todos sus empleados, MARAVILLOSOS!!!!!! se desviven por ayudarte en todo momento.
En especial destacar al chico que te recibe cuando llegas al hotel que se llama REY, un sol,cualquier problema, duda o cosa que necesites el siempre esta hay para ayudarte y nunca le falta una sonrisa y a la chica de recepción que se llama SARA.
Decir que el resto del personal es un encanto también, siempre están dispuestos para lo que necesites.
Las habitaciones son amplias y muy cómodas (disponen de ducha en cabina grande y las camas son enormes), la limpieza es buena y la ubicación del hotel excelente.
Solo nos queda darles las gracias por el trato recibido y desearles lo mejor .
Gracias por ayudarnos y hacernos las vacaciones mas cómodas
 REY TE QUEREMOS, ERES ESTUPENDO 
UN GRAN ABRAZO PARA TODOS  de Paula y Miguel.

title: Ottima scelta
text: Hotel da consigliare in posizione centralissima. Come nostra richiesta la ns camera affacciava sulla 46th. Camera spaziosa, bagno ampio e doccia degna di chiamarsi tale!! Personale cortese, disponibile e attento. Al ns arrivo ci hanno offerto una bottiglia di spumante e dolcetti cheescake eccezionali. Unico appunto e' che le camere sono poco insonorizzate, si sentiva spesso parlare sul corridoio e il rumore della strada.

title: fantastico!
text: il Gotham è stato il primo hotel di una lunga serie, in un viaggio on the road negli Stati Uniti. Hotel molto bello, personale efficiente e cortese (nonostante la nostra scarsa conoscenza della lingua), letto comodissimo (il king size è, in generale, una bella esperienza di sonno!). La colazione non era il massimo - considerato il costo potete farne a meno e mangiare nei dintorni - ma la vista era spettacolare! Avevamo una stanza che si affacciava sullo sky line, una meraviglia.. La posizione è ottimale, a due passi dalla 5th Avenue. Straconsigliato!

title: Excellent location for midtown NYC
text: Great reasonably priced hotel in the middle of midtown, conveniently located for Grand Central station, rockerfella, 5th Ave, Chrysler building, Empire State Building, Times Square, etc. Staff were very helpful and friendly. We had a street facing room which was noisy but expected in the middle of NYC. Lots of places to eat breakfast. The Red Flame was popular. There are no tea/coffee facilities in the room and beware of the sharp corners on the bed (which is huge), apart from that we would definitely go back to the Gotham!

title: Convenient and comfy
text: Great location in the heart of Midtown, steps from Fifth Avenue and the bustle of Times Square..  My room was very large - especially for NYC where it usually feels like you are sleeping in an expensive shoebox.  The room also had a tiny terrace - with no view, but the chance to get fresh air was a treat.  I especially liked that there were only 4 rooms on my floor.  Although every room was occupied, I never heard my neighbors.  The staff was superb.  Everyone was helpful, friendly and made me feel like I was at home.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Muito bem localizado
text: O hotel certamente está em local que propicia fácil deslocamento por toda a cidade. Limpo, moderno e silencioso. Alguns pequenos detalhes como banheiro sem tomada (eu procurei e não achei nenhuma) e chuveiro com pouca pressão de água ficaram a desejar. Até porque é um lindo e amplo banheiro. Há livros interessantes espalhados pelo quarto que estão a venda.

title: “Excellent location!”
text: I would stay at the hotel again. Having welcoming staff (specially Rey doorman) and a great location was a great way to spend my birthday. The rooms were modern and comfortable--perfect for the solo traveler. It within walking distance to Time Square and Broadway Overall it was a great hotel.

title: Très bon établissement
text: Etablissement moderne aux tarifs raisonnables (en s'y prenant à l'avance) pour sa situation idéale en plein Manhattan. A 10 minutes à pied du MoMA, du Rockefeller Center et de différentes stations de Metro donnant accès aux lignes B, D,E, F, M, 4, 5, 6, 7, S, ce qui permet de rayonner facilement. Les chambres sont bien équipées et le personnel courtois (mais sans plus). Le buffet petit déjeuner (en option) est complet. A recommander les yeux fermés.

title: Can't wait to come back!
text:
We read horrible reviews about hotels in New York so we were a bit apprehensive in choosing a hotel for our first trip to New York. The Gotham Hotel was a pleasant surprise! The hotel staff was amazing (especially Donaldo), the room was large (compared to the what we read online about what to expect in New York), we had private balcony and a terrace for the floor. The location was perfect as well.

I have a few criticisms but not based on the level of service or quality of the hotel. The bed frame is wooden with corners. With less than 18 inches of space around the bed, we both hit our shins. My husband tripped in the middle of the night once and his shins will probably scar. The shower, while spacious, was not designed properly. You have to step into the shower to turn on the water and you end up getting wet with cold water. 

On our last day, we checked out of the hotel at 12 noon but our flight wasn't until 7:00pm. We went to lunch, did some shopping and ended up back at the hotel wanting to hang out in the restaurant. The waiter was rude and pretentious. He took my glass of tea off the table without asking me and told me he was required to serve it to me. We ordered an appetizer so that we were not just sitting in the restaurant without ordering. At one point, I was checking on the pasta I bought from Little Italy in my lunch bag. The waiter came over and looked at was I was doing as if I was up to something. It was very awkward and uncomfortable.

That being said, these items will not influence my decision to return to the Gotham Hotel. The hotel staff, service, quality and location was beyond my expectations. We look forward to visiting again and staying at the Gotham.

title: Great location.
text:
Stayed here for 16 nights and enjoyed my stay. Got an emediate upgrade to a room om the 22nd floor which was lovley, quiet and spacious. The staff were great especially the doormen and Rey especially. 
Would defintley recommend this hotel.

title: Perfect
text: Just got back from spending 7 nights at the Gotham hotel. Are we are so happy about everything. The room was very clean and big, the bed was wonderful after a hole day of walking. The staff is so helpful and kind. The location is perfect. This was our first trip to NY and when we come back we will stay at this hotel. LOVE IT !

title: Love this hotel
text: Did not book this hotel based on location (just reviews and price) but couldn't really have been better. Right near Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue.. a great base to walk around Manhattan. Excellent customer service. Modern, clean rooms. Very comfy beds and powerful shower. Glad they provided a hairdryer as my UK one worked rubbish (due to voltage differences). Would definitely stay here again!

title: Not a review of a stay, per se...
text: But of their fantastic customer service! I recently had a situation where my reservation was not cancelled properly and reached out to the Director of Sales, Mike, who took care of me.  I appreciate their patience and great customer service.  And as always, LOVE the hotel!

title: Fantastic location
text:
Just got back from spending 6 nights at the Gotham. Can't wait to stay there again

The location is perfect for all tourist activities and walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller centre, Empire State and Central Park.

I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Room was modern and clean
text: This room was gotten on day of traveling and we got it through Hotels tonight. It was modern and clean. The bed was comfy but the sheets were very course. Almost scratchy. We were given a complimentary glass of wine which we exchanged for beer. The bathrooms were modern and a nice size shower. I would definitely recommend but try to get discounted.

title: Great boutique hotel in a convenient location
text: Just back from a 5 night stay at The Gotham in New York...we had a room at the back of the building, which meant no view, but it was quieter than being at the front due to construction and normal city noise in the morning. The bed was fantastic...luxurious king-size bed that was like sleeping on a cloud. Had drinks and 1 dinner at the restaurant downstairs, Tenpenny, and thoroughly enjoyed both. As mentioned in many other reviews, this hotel is located close to Time Square, Rockafeller Plaza, shopping along 5th Ave and subway stations, including Grand Central. All of the staff were pleasant and helpful. We would definitely stay here on future trips to NYC.

title: Unimpressed
text: Rooms all along the interior are extremely loud because of the hvac system right outside. I asked to be switched to a different room but upon entering that one, it was in complete disarray, complete with the tv and bed sheets strewn on the floor. Perhaps work was being done in there, but how does the hotel not know that and assign the room to a guest?  I was given a third room that was just as loud as the first, and just gave up at that point.  At checkout they were completely indifferent to the problems, and a later email expressing my disappointment went completely ignored. Oh, they also placed two credit holds on my card for a one night stay, which after a week still have not been released. Bad experience, bad customer service, bad hotel.

title: Ottima posizione, bell'albergo
text:
Siamo stati una settimana a New York in viaggio di nozze e abbiamo soggiornato al Gotham Hotel.
Posizione fantastica e comoda a tutto anche a piedi: si trova tra la 5° e la 46° strada, a 2 passi dall'Empire State, Rockfeller Center e Times Square.

Bell'hotel, pulito, elegante, camera con letto King Size. La camera affacciava sul lato cortile e il balcone era subito sopra ad un condizionatore molto rumoroso; abbiamo chiesto di spostarci di camera e ci hanno accontentati.
Personale molto gentile, c'è addirittura una receptionist che parla italiano.

title: Gut und praktisch für einen kurzen NY Aufenthalt
text:
Gute Lage in Manhattan. Bei offenem Fenster (ich hatte das Skyline Zimmer mit einer kleinen Terrasse) etwas laut aber das ist eben NY. Dafür ist alles schnell erreichbar - egal ob man auf Dienstreise ist und schnell die Metro Station erreichen muss oder auf Städte-Trip ist. 
Das Zimmer war sauber und nicht klein für NY Verhältnisse. 
Das Personal empfand ich als sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend. 
Es gibt im Hotel keine Frühstücksmöglichkeit dafür aber gleich gegenüber oder auch neben dem Hotel kann man sich Kaffee und Bagels holen oder vor Ort essen.

title: Ubicación y diseño en quinta avenida
text: A un paso de la quinta avenida. Muy bien situado. Hotel minimalista con buen diseño. Habitaciones muy amplias, cama muy cómoda. Una buena opción para visitar Nueva York y sobre todo para ir de tiendas. El desayuno algo escaso. El precio muy bueno.

title: Excelente localização
text:
Hotel boutique muito confortável com  excelente localização (ao lado da "Little Brazil") no coração de Manhattan pertinho de tudo !!! Atendimento muito cordial !!!
Os quartos são modernos e bem equipados e apesar da localização do hotel são bem silenciosos...

title: 隠れ家ホテル
text: ４６ｔｈ ５ｔｈ ave.という本当に便利な立地。ホテルだと一瞬気づかない外観ですが、中はシンプル＆清潔で部屋の広さも一人なら十分です。バスタブはないですが、シャワーはお湯の出もよく使いやすい。ただし洗面台は小さいのであまりいろいろものは置けません。私が気に入った点はクローゼットが大きいことで持ってきた洋服が全てかけられるところ。あとは外出から帰ってくるたびに冷たいワインやお水で迎えてくれるところです。１階のレストランでも夕食を取りましたが、なかなかいい雰囲気で味もよかったです。

title: Fantastic Location. Lovely Stay
text:
We, a couple in our late 20's, stayed at The Gotham for 5 nights in wintery January weather and it was a fantastic base to explore the city. The location of the hotel is excellent. Right on 5th Avenue and moments from the Rockefeller centre, although, because it is located on a quieter side street you feel a little tucked away from the relentless hustle & bustle that New York is famous for.

We flew to JFK & then took the subway to 51st and Lexington Avenue on the E line. It was less than a ten minute walk (even with heavy suitcases) to the hotel, and because of New York’s grid system, very easy to find. 

First impressions were good. The hotel has a nice covered entranceway with potted trees and fairy lights, and the doorman was very polite. At check in we were offered a glass of wine and given a room on the 23rd floor, which is the second top floor. There are only 2 rooms on this floor, as well as a large communal balcony to the front of the building with fantastic views! Our room had a great big comfy bed, a lovely contemporary bathroom with a rainfall shower (very nice!) and a small (big enough for a table & chair) balcony which faced the back of the building. The decor was clean and bright and warm, very inviting after a day walking about in the cold. Because the hotel used to be a bookshop there were little piles of books placed around the room on shelves. I thought this was a lovely; it's these touches that give the hotel something special - a personality.

For the five nights we stayed all the staff were very welcoming, happy to give directions and chat to us. 

We didn't use the onsite restaurant - tenpenny, although it looked very inviting it was rather pricy, and you are at no end of wonderful eateries, because this is New York!! We did eat at some lovely places, one cheap & cheerful, but very tasty place was Uncle Paul’s pizza, just around the corner. We found this on our first night and it was the perfect slightly jetlagged quick & easy meal. We got a cheese pizza and a salad & ate it in the room with a bottle of wine & then slept for about ten hours! There's also a pharmacy on the next block and a grocery store a couple of streets away.

Gregory's Bakery is located right next door to the hotel, and is consistently rated one of the top coffee shops in NYC. And, oh my word, are the reviewers right!! We ate here every morning, everything was the best I have ever had, best croissant, best muffin, and best baked apple fritters nom nom!! The coffee was great and the staff were lovely and friendly. There's a big glass window in the back of the shop that looks into the bakery kitchen. It was really nice to sit & watch them making the thing you're eating, knowing its all day fresh & made on site. I would come all the way back to NYC just for this bakery.

There were a couple of things that I wanted to mention in the negatives column, firstly the noise in the room, and on the balcony from all the air conditioning units on neighbouring buildings was very loud, however after the first night we didn't really notice it. And being at the back of the hotel we didn't get a lot of street noise. The only other issue we had was that my husband managed to lock himself outside on the balcony in our room, but the handyman came right up & let him back in and apologised for the issue (a broken handle on the door). He wasn't able to fix it as the part needed to be ordered, so we just made sure we didn't close the door of the balcony whilst one of us was outside. 

The location of this hotel is really its best selling point. We walked everywhere. It was only 10-15 mins to Times Square, central park and the empire state building. There are a number of tube stops within a 5-10 min walk and it's close to central station. We walked to Penn Station with our bags after checking out and it only took 20-25 mins.

I think this hotel suits couples best, it's got a warm and contemporary vibe, but I would recommend this to any age group. We got a fantastic deal on this hotel. I think it was about £80 ($130) a night. It was definitely worth that and quite a bit more! We would book this hotel next time we're in NYC.

title: Ótima localização, confortável, mas falta treinamento dos funcionários
text: O quarto do hotel é espaçoso, se tratando de NYC. Hotel muito novo, limpo, confortável. Fiquei num quarto com cama king, era muito confortável! A parte ruim foram os funcionários. Uma camareira não respeitou por duas vezes o aviso de não perturbe e entrou no quarto, incomodando. No check out, a funcionária foi muito indelicada e impaciente. Eu paguei as diárias no check in. Quando fui fazer check out, ela me pediu o cartão de crédito e eu expliquei que ja tinha pago, mas ela continuou pedindo o cartão, falando cada vez mais rápido, sem se importar em prestar atenção no que eu dizia. Eu tive que repetir várias vezes que já havia pago. E ela repetia: VIsa, Visa! Me tratando como uma ignorante. Foi muito, muito desagradável! Quando você trabalha com turismo, tem que saber lidar com estrangeiros. E olha que eu já morei nos EUA, não sou mais fluente, mas consigo me virar bem no inglês. Uma pessoa que não soubesse, teria sido cobrada em dobro.

title: главное достоинство - месторасположение
text:
Находится очень удобно для пешеходных прогулок по городу. Минималистичный дизайн, чистота, номера небольшие, но комфортные. Ресторан в отеле впечатлил только своими высокими ценами, завтракали out. 
Наличие балкона радовало курящих друзей, которые с опаской ехали в Америку, наслушавшись рассказов про драконовские запреты курения. 

Рекомендую для проживания людям, которые останавливаются в НЮ на несколько дней, т.к. в принципе недешевое удовольствие.

title: Great little place, terrific location (street noise)
text:
This place is in a terrific location. The place itself is modern, clean, well maintained and very comfortable. Would totally go back. Great staff. The TV in our room wasn't working and they sent someone up immediately who fixed it, very friendly. The showers were beautiful but a little weak ('rain' style fixture, not great if you have long hair!). 
Our only problem was the street noise in the morning (garbage trucks?). Our room overlooked 46th street and there seemed to be a steady stream of loud trucks which started around 6 am or earlier - so if you are a light sleeper, and don't need to wake up early - ask for a room on another side and maybe that will help. (this is why I rated sleep quality lower, but the bed was comfy) Overall a great hotel.

title: Otimo Hotel
text: Hotel com ótima localização, limpo, moderno e com uma vantagem que poucos tem quarto com sacada e possibilidade de abertura de janela para pequena varanda. Recepção do hotel foi ótima, dando dicas e uma otima recepção. Vale a pena tb o cafe da amanha e o delicioso iogurte grego servido no cafe. Que nao consigo encontrar em lugar algum no BR

title: Straordinario!
text:
Ho trascorso in questa struttura 3 indimenticabili notti. Avevamo prenotato una camera superior, che contrariamente alle strutture centrali di New York, era una camera bellissima e ampia dotata di balconcinco e due finestre dietro al letto, molto luminosa. Bagno con doccia immensa e ottimamente pulito! E' situato a pochi passi da Rockfeller center e Times Square.
Non abbiamo utilizzato la ristorazione perchè a colazione avevamo trovato un'ottima panetteria dove facevano la nostra imancabile "colazione italiana" (o quasi). Forse si trova anche qualche hotel vicino a prezzi più economici ma io ci ritornerei mille volte...che dire: consigliatissimo!!
